reviews.review: expensive. Worked out at over £20 each to visit the observation level. Good souveniers reasonably priced.There is a really good shinto temple en route worth a visit.

Great View but Pricey Cover. The Tokyo Tower had great views of the city and was fun to see all the Halloween decorations but probably pricey since you only spend 15-30 mins on the observation decks. It would have been nice if the admission also included access to the aquarium.

Cool place. I went there and visited tokyo tower as well as 'One Piece Museum' i was full of excitement since it is during halloween. Girls there are attached too much with the cartoon characters. And they looked sexy in the customs they wore.

Pretty neat. Really nice views of Tokyo from both the top and middle stop. Also nice place to get souvenirs especially for us as we only had a short layover. Only complaint is what they charge to go up to the observation decks but not surprising.
Tokyo Tower. Big beautiful Tower that reminds you of the Eifel Tower in France... Has a great tourist attraction such as One Piece too

Good fun. It's cheaper than Tokyo skytree but about half size but you get same results. The deck does feel old from inside the windows and fittings but you can climb stairs to go further up for free once you are at the deck I think about 1000 steps.
Good fun and atmosphere.
Visit to Tokyo Tower. Visited Tokyo Tower on Monday, Oct 10th. Being holiday in Japan on 10th Oct, there was huge rush so couldn't go to the top.
Tokyo tower. There are several stores inside the tower. Is possible to go up paying a fee. If you don't want to go up you can take amazing pictures

beautiful at anytime. fine day or rainy day, day light time or nighttime
you will be sure to enjoy for view of central tokyo

Amazing!!. Fantastic view of Tokyo!!
A little crowded on the ground floor but after the ride up it was worth the crowd. Educational landmark diagram shown above each view. 360 view of the city is great as was the staff and the see through window in the floor. I was too scared to walk over it. Worth the visit.

A different view to the Skytree - go at night!. The friends I went to see the Tokyo Tower with said they thought it was a budget Skytree, but I disagree - the Skytree is impressive and it is its own sort of enjoyment to look down on everything, but the Tokyo Tower is about the same level as the skyline in every direction, so you get to see skyscrapers, lights and traffic all around.I recommend going at night - we arrived in the afternoon and spend a couple of hours on the observation deck, into night time - the lights and were fantastic! Spent a good while taking long-exposure photos of nearby highways and such.Tokyo Tower and Skytree both have their place, I highly recommend visiting both.

Light up at night. I think Tokyo Tower is more beautiful than the Eiffel Tower (and fewer sketchy people at the bottom trying to sell counterfeit watches to boot)Views from the top are nothing special, but on a clear day I think you might be able to see Mount FujiBest views of Tokyo Tower are from Shiba Koen Park. Go there at night with a can of Asahi and enjoy the lighting up at sunset. Romantic to the max.

Great place for all who like to see the city from a height. The structure is an Eiffel Tower-inspired lattice tower that is painted white and international orange.The two-story Main Observatory is at 150 metres, while the smaller Observatory is at a height of 249.6 metres.Excellent lighting and must visit at day-night to see the beauty of the city.
Eiffel Tower in Toyko. Good place to have a great overview of Tokyo ,amazing to see what it in the city . The shops are the bottom are expensive

Visit at night for city lights panorama. This was our last stop of the day on our guided tour of the city because our hotel was nearby. Visiting at night is a spectacular experience with 360 degree views of the city. My wife was especially enamored of a colored Ferris Wheel in the distance that changed designs and colors as it rotated. This is one of the memorable highlights of a visit to Tokyo.

Good views but quite expensive. Good views of the night skyline of Tokyo but I think the price is too high. It would be nicer if there was a bigger discount for students as some of our friends decided not to go up

Good place to visit at night. For 900 yen to the main observatory, I think it was worth visiting. my family and I went there at around 8pm and there was no queue going up to the tower so it was rather pleasant. The night view was excellent. There was a coffee shop there where we could sit and relaxed a bit. We had quite a good time.

Very cool view!. My boyfriend is a huge one pieace fan, so naturally we had to go to the tokyo tower. ( one pieace is a famous anime ) they have two/three floors that is just a one pieace experience with photo options, restaurants and interactive games. They even have a show with all the characters from the show. You don't have to be a fan of the anime to fully enjoy the experience. I believe that you can do the whole experience in 2.5 hours, IF the tower and experience isn't too crowded. You have the options of gout chasing a double ticket to go up to the tokyo tower and one pieace experience or you can just go up to the tower.When you go up to the tower, I recommending timing it out so you can take some photos with the daylight and watching the city turn into lights. We went during a weekday, which is probably why we could do the whole experience in 3.5 hours

Must do in tokyo. Sky tree was amazing. Worth the money a day the views are spectacular. I went there at night. I guess going there at sunset would be prime time but I wouldn't hesitate to go back there to see the view during daylight. Staff were friendly and helpful, even saved me money by advising me to not use the tourist ticket (no booking no line wait but more expensive) because there was no line. Highly recommend

Tokyo Tower. Tokyo Tower, You can go from train station you only need to walked a little bit far but you enjoy. You eat along the so many restaurant to buy food. Try to taste the Tokyo Banana inside the tower its yummy, and souviners inside to buy.

Amazing!. We walked here from our hotel in Shinagawa on a Saturday morning. The city was very quiet and took us about 40 minutes to walk there with our daughter in her pram. Easy to find as it is enormous so just head towards the tower! We arrived at 920 and as the tower opens at 9am it was still very quiet. Good cafes and souvenirs and the staff are so friendly and helpful. We stayed about an hour and once we were leaving it began to get quite busy with many buses arriving. I recommend going early. We can also see the tower from our room at night which is a beautiful sight. The tower is very easy to get around with a pram. The tower aquarium is more like a fish store so I wouldnt bother with that.

Good City View - Very Weather Dependant. Sounds an obvious point but the downside with this attraction as with all city towers is the fact that it is totally weather dependant. It was a fairly nice day with a bit of cloud when we visited but we could not see Mount Fuji (a star attraction!) although we had seen it from our hotel room in the distance on previous days. The service was very friendly and it's always good to get a 360 degree view of a city to get your bearings. The glass floor viewing panels are a great idea but we could only go to the 150ft viewing gallery. Apparently a higher one is under construction

A must see attraction in Tokyo.. Tokyo Tower is a landmark in Tokyo. It's more impressive at night when it is lit up. There is a lot of shopping on the lower level. It's a great place to buy Japanese souvenirs. If you pay to go to the observation deck, make sure you go on a clear day. It has a great view of Tokyo. There is a shrine at the top of the tower where you can buy an ema in the shape of the Tokyo Tower.

Visit on your birthday... We went the day before my girlfriends birthday and noticed a sign saying to let them know if it was the day before, on or day after your birthday. You then get a sticker to wear and the super friendly staff all say happy birthday to you as you go around plus get to choose something free off a list (we had a pancake from out the front) great views from up there, didn't pay for the top view but still great views from the first and cheaper deck. Didn't take any pictures on my phone so can't upload with the review but got some brilliant ones on my camera.

A must to see! Tokyo view. You can see all over Tokyo from here and if the weather is nice , cleared sky, it's also able to see Fuji mountain from here Worth to spend money for going up to 250m of the tower, The view was amazing The provided spacial gifts for your birthday also! Ramen (noodles) there was so delicious ;)
Less people. This is my 3rd time visiting Tokyo Tower. Due to new Tokyo Sky tree was built, more people go there but this is still land mark of Tokyo.

Efficient service and staff. Couldn't believe that Tokyo had a copy of the Eiffel tower, only 13 metres taller than the one in Paris. It really didn't look that big from our hotel room. When we arrived there was no queuing and we were soon in a rapid lift up to the observation deck. There was no option to climb steps, the only way up was by elevator. The views from the top were pretty good, with Mount Fuji visible in the distance. The Sky tree may be a higher tower, but was probably busier.

Amazing views at night... . Visited for the views and was not disappointed. Two observations desks, plenty of shops and restaurants onsite. Top deck was closed so suggest checking before you go if you want to go right to the top. Worth a visit regardless and not expensive...

A sight to see. My daughter lives and works here in Tokyo and is within a 10 minute walk to the tower . I could view it from her balcony. The night view is awesome as it is lite up like a Christmas tree. I did not go to the top but if you looking for a view it would be a must . Little gift shop and awesome ice cream outside downstairs . A must see

OKAY view from the top. This beautiful Tokyo tower has a nice view from far but I paid to check out the tower, it wasn't as nice as I expected. The only thing that I liked it's the journey going up with the lift that you could enjoy the structure. Otherwise, the top view is just another view from any tall buildings.
Landmark to visit. This is definitely worth going, not just as a landmark to visit but also for the great city views, quite accessible to go to.
a great site to visit. amazing shops under the tower within your budget for gift items and shirts. overlooking Tokyo. great view from above. a must visit

Very nice visit to Tokyo Tower on our last day there.. It is a worthwhile visit on a clear day. You get a great view of Tokyo and you are helped to identify all the major sights. From there, we even located a church!

Fun. I thought the location is in the city center like other towers in other countries. But you need to walk through the hill(?) from the station to get there.
But it's worth it. The view of the city is beautiful. Especially from the highest deck

Viewed from our room at the price tower. Very cool to wake up and see this beautiful landmark right outside of our hotel.
If this is any way a stop on your trip, check out the prince town right across the garden.

Good Views. I was able to walk here after a few cocktails at the Hard Rock. The very top floor is closed for construction but the middle oversee atom deck is open. Great views all the way around, there is a cafe up there so you can relax and wait for the sunset and see all the lights come in the city. Downstairs there are shops, restaurants and gift shops for all your tourist souvenirs.

Go up to the top and look at the view!. So I heard this place is the 2nd tallest building in the world.... and boy isn't it beautiful!With attractions such as the aquarium and lots and lots of food, make sure you know what you want to eat when you visit this place as the food smells so lovely!As you walk to the top you will learn about the history of the area and a mini touted model of how the tower was built and future renovations.I've been to Tokyo tower twice and I must say it's always busy and you also will need a day as there's just many back to back shops you can buy your gifts to bring back home! There's also a hello kitty shop that's themed around Tokyo tower which is handy for your little ones to remember but let me just warn you, it's not cheap.

Very nice way to kill an hour or two. From the outside you'd never guess at everything hiding inside the building. It's very nice inside and there's plenty to eat and do besides take in the views. Of course the views are heavily dependent on the weather and sadly for us it was very misty. Personally I preferred the lower level from the main platform as it felt more like you were in the city than above it. All the staff are very friendly and helpful.

Check this one off the list!. Specular structure and an opportunity for great photos. We ended up enjoying a food and drink festival happening at the foot of the tower when we visited. The festival definitely made the trip to the tower worth it. Marked down because it is a bit of a "tourist trap."

Amazing Views! . From the outside, looks like japan's equivalent of the Eiffel Tower. Once at the top, you are able to view the breathtaking city of Tokyo in a full 360°. Seriously recommend doing this at night, that is when the full Beauty and colour of this city can be seen. They even have glass bottom windows to see how high you really are. I dare you to try and walk over them whilst looking down!

Fun Tokyo Icon. The Tokyo Tower is an icon of the city of Tokyo. Here's how vising works (on your own, not a tour.)You pay at the base for an elevator ride to the 1/2 way point. I did not experience any line to go up. You walk around, looking out huge windows, on the middle observation deck. If you wish to go to the top, you must purchase your tickets on the middle deck and take another elevator up. I did not do this, and stayed in the first deck.There is a tourist shop in the center of the room. There you may purchase Tokyo Tower themed souvenirs. Note that they sell post cards (and stamps) and if you mail the card from the middle deck, the cards receive a special postage stamp.Famous landmarks are pointed out and labeled at various windows, including Mt. Fuji (which is not always visible, and was not the day we went.)Overall, this was a cool observation deck. Visitors get an impressive, sprawling view of the city. And their system of purchasing halfway first was logical. I can't say this is the best observation deck Tokyo has to offer, but it's charming and if you have time, I recommend it.The ground floor of the tower is filled with shops selling traditional Japanese objects, to food and beverages.

A great view of Tokyo!. We were on a tour and this was one stop. The tower itself is impressive but the view is amazing. Every direction shows buildings forever. It is a fun spot with several shops. We did not go to top but 5 th level.
Good.. Its what you exspect from a tall building. We waited for it to become night so it all lit up and it was a lot better.
Too bad the top floor was being renovated. The view from the tower was amazing. I'm sure if the top floor was operating, we would have enjoyed even more.

You go up, you come down...depends on your idea of fun. It was OK, but looks better from a distance, all lit up nicely. There are better structures to go up for a great view of Tokyo, but since the whole dayout this was all paid for by one of my adult students, I shouldn't grumble :)

All The Way To The Top. So after the Eiffel Tower experience I was looking to go to the top here. It didn't disappoint. From the temple on the main level and glass walkover to the cramped circular viewing area at the top, the views were incredible. Highly recommended stop on the tour of Tokyo just for the view.
Nice . Good place to see. Must visit. You can see japan's progressive architectures. Japan is well organized city
Not a real Japanese type, but a major landmark. Not a must in Japan. But you might want to have a check mark for this place as a major attraction in Tokyo.

Great view, best at night. We went on a Saturday evening and it was not busy. Cost is quite reasonable. Great view from the tower over the skyline of Tokyo. The lights on the tower didn't come on until 6:30 pm so make sure you're there after that time for the most exciting view of the actual tower.

Tokyo tower day trip. This tour was very informative about Japan history, Tokyo tower , the tea ceremony, was different than the ones I had before !...we went to an old house where we were welcome by a beautiful pp dress in kimonos....we had to follow a few rules , this was the best tea experience I ever had ... lunch was amazing at the chinzanso hotel, we visited the gardens in this hotel , very very well taking care off!..the boat ⛵️ ride then the Asakusa temple .. one of the Tokyo's oldest Buddhist temple , it is a full day tour and our tour guide was very very knowledgeable about Tokyo's history, her English was perfectly!

Expensive Long Lines. The Tokyo Tower is very cool, but would I do it again? No...The lines were long the entrance fee was expensive. Yes the views were good, but next time I would find a bar in a very tall building with large windows.

Like Eiffel Tower. The tower is very much like Eiffel Tower. It provides you a very nice view of Tokyo from up high. You cannot see anything in bad weather, especially when it is foggy. Other than that I found it very expensive to go up. If you go there make sure yoy go in a day with good weather anf clear sky.

Good 360 View. You do get good views from the main observation deck. The highest deck is closed for renovations from 3 October for a while. But it was all the floors of shops to get out that put me off it a bit.

As good as the Skytree?. The Tokyo Tower may seem like a knock-off Eiffel Tower. It may even seem like the inferior option when you look at the Tokyo SkyTree. However, the Tokyo Tower is in my opinion a must-do.It's not as tall as the SkyTree, but that's a good thing. SkyTree is also worth a visit but it's views are from such a height that they almost resemble those seen from a plane. Meanwhile, the Tokyo Tower offers a slightly closer to Earth view which really allows you to appreciate the scope of the city. The views are less expansive but no less breathtaking. I'd recommend going up the tower about an hour before sunset and staying up there to see the sun disappear behind the buildings. It seems the tower has recently been acquired by the group who own One Piece (the animated show). This doesn't mean much to me, but didn't subtract from the overall experience. If you're a fan of the show, I'm sure you'll enjoy this even more.When you're done on the observation deck, be sure to visit the Crepe store just outside at the base of the tower for a delicious, cheesecake-filled crepe!

Get on top of Tokyo. A very distinctive part of Tokyo's landscape & a great place to get a 360-degree view of the surrounding cityscape (especially on your first day there). Lots of souvenir shops at its base for buying that special memento.

Wow!. The Skytree was on my husband's "bucket list" so we went on our first night in Tokyo. It was easy to get there on the train and we arrived just after sunset. Although a rainy time of year the rain had cleared and we had a wonderful view of the city. I don't know what the view would look like during the day, but night time was spectacular. If your goal is to see Mt Fuji, be aware that it is often obscured by cloud at this time of the year.

They actually made a lookout interesting. After the crushing disappointment of Eureka Tower (look kids there's Melbourne! Look how high up we are! Anything else? Well...no, that's it really. Anyone want a coffee?) I didn't expect a lot from Tokyo Tower (anyone for sushi?). But those intrepid Japanese have crafted a superb tourist attraction with a Costco sized gift shop, impressive light show, baffling sperm shaped mascots and a stand up comedy act on the main floor. Granted I didn't understand the Godzilla merchandise connection, and the 'lookdown windows' were stunningly mediocre (geez even my 2 year old jumped up and down on them with disdain) but we lingered a lot longer than expected and enjoyed the experience.
Great view at night . Only got the view at night from the 150m high platform. It's pretty good and give you an idea on how huge is Tokyo.

View ok, little too much touristic. Interesting spot of history, well organized with 150 m view of Tokyo and sorroundings. Little too much of obvious touristtrapping for shopping. More interesting the temples nearby.No big deal.

Very nice city views at night. We were at Tokio Tower yesterday and enjoy ver much the views at 150 and 250 mts.I think Tokio Sky Tree is better but for my second visit to Tokio I decided to go to Tokio Tower

Inspired by Eiffel Tower, but all Tokyo. Love the glass floor on the highest point of the spire. Look between your feet and see the ground hundreds of metres below. Two observation levels, the top deck is best with fewer people. Plenty of signs. Went during the day and was clear. Night would be excellent too, but plenty of places (like bars) where you can do that. Tag team with Skytree across town to get thrilling perspective of Tokyo.
Glad I finally went up here. Good views on a clear day. Recommend going on a weekday evening to see the sunset so you get both day and night views and also see the city lights!

Good place as expected . This tower looks like an oversized orange traffic cone and is pretty high although not as high as the Sky Tree tower in Tokyo. The best part was the observatory but also the horror experience which was at the basement under the tower. It was horrifyingly scary and enjoyable.
Great! . I visited Tokyo Tower and I loved it! The view is magnificent. A must visit in Tokyo either day or night.

Good to visit if in the area. Worth a visit in the area. Good views from the main observatory (price is ¥900) or you can choose to go higher for an additional cost but you have to queue separate for that from main observatory.360 views of Tokyo but consider the time of day you plan to visit if you want to take photos as the sun can over expose photos. Lots of opportunities to buy souvenirs from the various outlets in the tower.
Out with friends. This wasn't worth the trip as the glare on the Windows make it difficult to take a good photo at night. Just stay on the ground and experience Tokyo first hand.

Nice view of Tokyo. It used to be the tallest tower in city until Tokyo sky tree was finished. The tower is inspired by the Eiffel tower. You can see as far as Mount Fuji on clear day. However, it is not the best view of Tokyo as you cannot see the tower itself
Tokyo from the top. At night is the best moment to be on top of Tokyo. The view is literally mesmerising and to get all the way to the top isn't very expensive!
Birthday surprise. If you visit here for your birthday, you will get a surprise gift from the information center. Make sure you bring your original ID, not the copy of it.

Tokyo Tower. Tokyo Tower is great to see at night as it is lit up and when staying in the area is a landmark that helps you find your way around. The observatory levels give a 360 view of Tokyo and you can look down on the street level through glass panels in the floor. There are also some good souvenir stores and on the lowest one a great shop for teenagers, but it doesn't open until 10am.
Good view. Walk from subway to tokyo tower . There are two steps for sightseeing. Classic style of tower. But a bit comment is unclear mirror

Nice. Good view....nice place and many markets and souvenirs.
900 yens to take elevator until floor 15.
Definitely it is a beautiful one in Tokyo to visit, impressive on the night.
breaktaking place. it's a nice place, very easy to go and locate the area. there's an entrance fee to the viewing deck.

Good views but similar to metropolitan builfing. We went to this tower as part of a one day Tokyo tour. Even though the views were very nice, and the tour guide explained a lot about the buildings and surrounds, it was a very similar experience with the helpful volunteers at the metropolitan building where you can go for free.

A Eiffel Tower Mimic. The Tokyo Tower has long hours and is worth visiting especially after dark for a great night time view of Tokyo. For 900 Yen you can ride the elevator to the Main Observatory Deck. In addition to great view, there are also clear floor spots so you can also look down. Tokyo Tower was the highest point in Tokyo until the Sky Tower was built. It is still worth visiting.

Terrific landmark of Tokyo. We have been lucky to live by the tower over the years and frequently take guests to the observation decks either 150 meters or 250 meters high. In October of 2016, the 250 meter deck will be closed for approximately 10 months. Before the Sky Tower, this was one of the best places to go but we still like it. It's been around nearly 60 years and has a resemblance to the Eiffel tower. This is a good visit for anyone who is a tourist and even for some of us who come back regularly.

Day visit at Tokyo Tower. This is my second time to tokyo tower so i went there in the afternoon. Nice view, cooling place to visit and take beautiful photo. The best time to visit will be around 5pm so that you can take some nice view then continue to view the night view of tokyo.
better than sky tree!. I have always liked this tower, less crowded although it's older, but it has a much more personal feel to it
Loved the view. In a busy city where there is so much to see visiting the Tokyo Tower is worth your precious time. The architecture , the view.

Best view at night, from the under. If you can, go there at night. The lighting is stunning. And it is best to view it from a bit far or under, and it's free. No need to pay and go up cause once you are inside, how can you view the tower itself?

Great place whilst in Tokyo. A great view and easy to navigate. We enjoyed the location and view on a hot day. There is also some good souvenir shops at the bottom which are good value as there is not many others in Tokyo.

Red rocket. A beautiful red rocket shaped tower, built after ww2 and inspired by the Eiffel Tower. Beautiful 360• views from the top and also great images of the red structure.In order to enjoy views more, It may be advisable to climb it after a few days in Tokyo, once you are a bit familiar of the citys geography and neighborhoods. Recommended activity

Amazing view. It's design is based on the Eiffel Tower . Tokyo Tower is famous observation deck in Tokyo. It is a great spot from which to view the city.It is most striking attraction when viewed at night.

Reminiscent of Eiffel Tower. You can certainly see the Tower from various vantage points as you travel through Tokyo. It is also close to a famous Shogun palace and shrine, and is included in most 1 to 3 day tours of Tokyo.

Fun, but it's not necessary to go to the top. While you certainly get a good view of the city from a variety of angles, going to the first level is just fine enough, with the second level requiring a wait in a line for fairly similar views.

Great Views. This tower is great to get a snapshot of how big Tokyo actually is. Our guide pointed out where Mt Fuji may be but couldn't see it from there as the weather was bad but very interesting. Lots of shops downstairs to buy souvenirs etc.

Beautiful city views. Even though the day we visited it was quite overcast we were still able to see this very impressive city. Unfortunately Mt Fuji was not visible but still plenty of opportunities for great photos. We visited on a public holiday so was quite busy, however again this was not really an issue as everywhere we have been is Japan has a large number of people!

Seeing postcard view for real! . It took a bit of time to queue before you could reach the elevator.Glass floor/ window that you could look down and see the amazing red structure of the tower. Best time to visit would be late afternoon, we had a coffee at the cafe and waited for the sun to set and the magic hour view was breathtakingly beautiful.

Tokyo's Version Of The Eiffel Tower. It is now getting fairly old and has been replaced by a much bigger tower across town but if you are in the area which is quite close to Ginza it is worth a walk to and a look around. There are some interesting temples and gardens close by. At night it is still brightly lit.
It's high but not the highest. Grand old landmark near the Ginza,worth the trip,we enjoyed the views.Its not Paris but it's a nice landmark.
Just amazing place. This is a must see in Tokyo, we went here after dinner, the view from rooftop was stunning and breaktaking over the city. Tokyo by night was so lovely

A raining day, but itself is not super surprising. . I would say the Shanghai oriental tower looks better. The fog today just blocks all the view. But service is quite nice. Like all the sighting seeing place, always ended up into souvenir shops after the observatory section.

tokyo tower spot picture . if you want to take good picture with the whole tower, come to akabanebashi station.
also, one piece meseum is very great inside the tokyo tower.
Near the Kimiyacho station, you can find udon / ramen mini resto that afforadble and taste good.

great view. Lovely attraction , we had a great time visiting it. It was very easy to get to. very well organised and there is a bar and gift shop in the tower. It contains two levels so you can also go right up the top.

best view in the world. Tokyo tower hast the greatest view in the world and if u go there I recommend that u don't go in weekends coz the line will be long and it will take a time to reach the to floor so if u want u can go there before opening time by 30 or 40 min the line wont be long to the ticket counter and u will have the best time there and don't forget to take ur camera with u its worth it opening hours 9AM–11PM

Tourist Trap...better viewed from afar..... Save your money and enjoy this iconic radio tower from the many high rise buildings around. Filled with tacky trinket shops and overrun with bus loads of tourists you will find it much more pleasant to view from a distance.

Worth the price of admission. Loved the view of the city at night-definitely suggest going to the first platform for viewing the city lights. I'm not sure that I'd go again to the next level up, but no matter, this is definitely worth it.

A more closer Map View. It is nice to go during sunset and night time to see the lights of Tokyo. More crowded than Tokyo Sky Tree. A must visit also in Tokyo. Hard to find, not much signs when we walk to Tokyo Tower. And the Rail Station was far, it was hard for us since we have a kid.

Just another tower. After you have been many different type of towers in the world. Tokyo tower is no better than the others. The cost is still on the high side. The scene is not so nice on a cloudy day for our trip. I am sure that it is better on a sunny day!At least you do not have to wait like Sky tree!

Less line and price but I prefer skytree. The place is really nice, pretty views and more affordable than Skytree. Don't regret at all and I would recommend you to do it. At least at night. Not far from the metro

Good place to visit with family.. The Tokyo Tower is a place frequented by families and one sees a lot of tourists also. the trip up to the tower is very well organised and the lifts are swift. There are no eateries there and one can have some food when the trip is over.

Nice view, but that's about it. Like a lot of famous attractions abroad I felt an obligation to see this, even if it's not my cup of tea.The most enjoyable part for me was the journey to the tower. There are some nice parks and shrines on the way and it was nice to take a slow walk through the area.The tower itself is impressive and striking with its bright orange colour. Standing beneath it was a great moment, as it's a landmark I've always seen pop up in movies and on TV.The line for tickets was small. I'm guessing this was in part due to it being a week day, and in part because the (taller) Tokyo skytree is now the more popular tower. I paid for the the main level. There is another level above it but I decided the extra cost wasn't worth it, as I wasn't terribly enthusiastic about going up the tower anyway. The lift takes you up to your level, which the operator will help you find depending on the ticket purchased. The view is alright, but it's really just concrete jungle as far as the eye can see. I'm told that on a clear day you can see Fuji, but it wasn't visible on this particular day. I'm not hugely fussed on views anyway so I found it a bit boring, and I was over it after 5 mins. The floor windows are cool. You can see how far off the ground you are, but the mesh and what not blocks the view a bit.I explored the other levels on the way down. One of them had a lot of Godzilla memorabilia on display. I'm not sure if this was a special event at the time or whether it's always there, but I found it to be pretty interesting.All in all I'm glad I can say I've done it, but it wasn't thrilling. It certainly didn't make me want to go and see Tokyo skytree. Not a bad thing, as imagine it would be more of the same, more expensive, and a lot more crowded.

Icon of Tokyo. This tower is one of the icon in Tokyo.I visit this place close to 9pm in evening and there are still a lot of people around.However the queue to buy ticket is not as bad as people mentioned.The ticket in ground floor is only for the 1st observation deck.To buy to 2nd (highest) observation deck, it needs to be done in 1st observation deck and the queue is long.The view on top is very good to see all massive buildings in Tokyo.My most favorite view is the overview of the bridge to the sea.There are a lot of gift that can be bought in 1st observation deck.It is a MUST place to go in Tokyo.
Nice visit. Nice view from the observation decks. We only went during the day, and only to the first level, but it was fun either way. There's a nice little park outside of it.

Tokyo Tower. You see it in the post card, you have to see it in actual. This red tower makes an outstanding background for your photos. Go to the top level to get a great view and we managed to catch Mount Fuji on that day. Less crowded than the Tokyo Skytree.

Tower of Fun. Arrived after walking from the close hotel. It's not hard to miss, especially from Minato Prefecture. Arrived at the ticket booth with price for lower viewing point, special viewing point, both of them which we got at the price of ¥1600 or the One Piece Viewing if you're a fan of that Anime. After easy purchase, we were greeted and went up the first elevator. On the lower viewing there's a gift shop and photo booth which offers to do your picture with theirs which you can buy (¥1300) and a picture of it on one of your cameras. The special viewing is a smaller elevator to a smaller room but massive view, and on a clear day get a free distant viewing of Mount Fuji. We made our way down and down the stairs of the floors we missed and found the glass floor panels with a near by restaurant and then a whole floor of souvenirs and food retailers. It is cheapest in comparison to the sky tree. An amazing experience and a good price to have a look at the city and maybe even Mount Fuji on a very clear day. Highly Recommended if you don't want to do both towers in Tokyo!
Nice afternoon stroll. Went with my parents, nice day! much cheaper than the Tokyo Skytree and similar experience (with maybe less people)

It's Tokyo Tower!. The Tokyo Tower is a must see for all visitors. I personally prefer the night view as sometimes, they offer different color light-ups.Best spot to take a good shot is outside the parking area, before you go down the hill.

When in Roppongi put this on your list!!. Great views...very reasonable price ...I think @ $8 each!! We didn't pay for the upper level so I'm not sure if we missed much. We had recently been to the Burj Khalifa & the Eiffel Tower and my wife was a little bored of looking down at rooftops...LOL.

Heart of tokyo. Nice view that symbolise the heart of tokyo. We went there in the evening, the lighting was amazing. There was an onepiece museum and also a ghost house that you can visit with entrancr fee.

Tokyo Tower. Very nice symbol of Tokyo. Better to visit it at night due to its beautiful illumination. Views from top are great but not worth to pay for it. Yo can visit Goverment building and get better views for free

A good place to see the city. The Tokyo Tower provides a great location to see the city. You can see the Zojoji temple really well. There is a bit of information on the tower inside. However, for the iconic Tokyo photos that have this red tower in them, you'll have to go somewhere else!
Visit Tokyo Tower, Japan. This is my second time to Tokyo with my daughter. We visited Tokyo Tower. Awesome view from the top. Great place and enjoyed it very much

A great place to visit. This is a great way to see Tokyo from above and maybe get your bearings. There is even a glass floor, lookdown window, if you want an interesting view to below. At night it is lite up and well worth a photo.

Imposing but not overwhelming. I have been to many towers offering 360 views of the city, but Tokyo Tower has to be the best. The grounds are clean, access to the top 2 floors is comfortable, less convenient with large crowds. I was there in Autumn and Winter and temperatures were just right inside the tower. We even saw Mt Fuji through the city haze. The look down window did not frighten the children. This is clearly a 10/10 trip.
A funny place. A mix between Eiffel Tower and San Francisco bridge... red tower with a really good (and expensive) sightseeing.You can walk around it and see it and it's architecture.

Great view over Tokyo. Enjoy a great view over Tokyo!There is also a store with One piece items for fans and a One piece theme park. The attractions in the theme park are not really interesting but worthwile a visit for real One Piece Fans. There is also a restaurant at the Ground floor which serves dishes with One Piece Decor

Best during Night. Once a very popular spot for Tokyo views, it has now been replaced by a lot of places having better views. But the charm of Tokyo Tower remains forever. Although , I would not recommend going up the tower, it's worth going close to it after sunset when the tower lights are on.
Amazing Views!. Great place to visit. Inexpensive with incredible views of Tokyo and the surrounding area. Easy to access from the Metro and withing reach from other must see places in Tokyo.
On a clear day, lots to see. It's not the Eiffel tower but there are some interesting things to learn and lots of views. There are plenty of shops on the way down too.

Best views of Tokyo. This is the second time we've visited the Tokyo Tower and this return was probably even better than the first time.The views are amazing and the tower is right in the heart of the city so you really can see 360 degree views of Tokyo.It was quieter (which made it better as less contention for space) than our first time and possibly this is due to the popularity of Skytree. We had visited Skytree too but found it too overcrowded and rather far out of the city.For us the only way to really see Tokyo from above is the Tokyo Tower, still very much a true icon of the city and a wonderful place to visit.
It's Not Bad. Went, saw a nice sight or two, took some photos and left to do many other things in this wonderful city, it looks nice! Give it a go!

From bottom to top and bottom. Tokyo Tower is at the Akabanebashi Station, the Pink line. There are plenty of souvenir shops and restaurants around inside the tower. There is a food court with Pizza-La Express Pizza & Cafe Handmade Pizza, Ramen noodles, Pink dot. Premium Waffles and Desserts, MOS Burger. Pizza and Fries from the Pizza-La Express Pizza & Cafe Handmade Pizza are fantastic. Waffles from the Pink dot. is also wonderful.Tickets for the tower is at level 1, outside the entrance. Where there is a Highball Garden Cafe at the left side and a Wind Chime path on the right side.

Great even on a cloudy day. We went up the tower on our last day in Japan. It was cloudy and rainy (typhoon season) and supposedly the visibility was poor. We went up anyway and it was great! Really good views of a lot of the city. No Mount Fuji but that's ok. The ride up was a challenge for me as I am not good with heights but the elevator is not a glass one and it takes probably less than 30 seconds to get up to to first level. You don't feel it either - no stomach lurching. The views. Wow. Tokyo is huge!

So this is how large Tokyo is!. Visited tower as part of a bus tour. Arrived around 4pm it had been raining heavy earlier but had cleared up by the time we reached 350m. There are four large lifts holding approx 40/50 people depicting the 4 seasons, the journey took a minute. The views are spectacular and you can see how dense a city Tokyo is. Unfortunately the mist and rain came so the distance you should have seen to the mountains was obliterated. There are the usual gift shops and cafes but not much seating. Also photographer to take staged pictures. On the lower floors many shops selling clothes, fancy goods and food. Well worth a visit. Finally there was a further viewing area above but that was an extra price 350m was enough for me.
Interesting. Tokyo tower is interesting to visit and see. The tower is old now and isn't in the heart of the city really but a bit out of the way. It looks like the Eiffel Tower

Lovely. We went there around 7pm. We purchased the Tokyo Tower / One piece Amusement park bundle. The one pice amusement park is locate don the 3rd floor. We rode a separate elevator for this. After that we went up to the main observation deck. The view at night is lovely. Be sure to go to the 2nd level, where there is a transparent floor to view the skeleton of the tower. :)

Average tower with average lights.. Cool to see, one of those musts while in Tokyo I think, but not very interesting. It would have been cool to go up it, but i personally thought it was quite expensive. I think seeing it at night is the best time

A fun few hours at the tower. It is easy to get to on the metro; the cost is only about 10 USD, and offers a great view of the city. The Sky Tree further out is newer - but this is the retro monument of Tokyo and worth a visit!

Japan's version of the Eiffel Tower. Inspired by the Eiffel Tower in Paris, Japan's orange and white version is pretty neat. You pay one fee to go up to the Observatory, and then another fee to go to the Special Observatory. The view can be a little hazy; when we went we weren't able to see Mount Fuji. But there is a helpful printout of the skyline and buildings of interest to help orient you, if you are interested in seeing those things. The main observatory has a "look down window", a plate of glass you can stand on and see from your shoes all the way to the ground. While not as tall as the flashy Skytree, the Tokyo Tower is still an important part of Tokyo and has a really cute little mascot too. Go early in the morning or at night to avoid the crowds.

Interesting "old skool" attraction in Tokyo. Visited with the family on a Sunday morning at about 11. It was not as crowded as we expected, and the tower was (like most things in Tokyo) are extremely well kept and hid its age very well.Picked up 2 pretty cool souvenirs from the shop at the lower observation deck and waited whilst my family visited the upper deck. Worth a visit if you have not been there before, being an iconic attraction of "old skool" Tokyo.

Trip up the skeleton. The tower is situated right in the center on the city. The view from top is brilliant. And the experience to go up the skeleton in the lift is awesome. Scares you for a moment. Odaiba, skytree are visible from the top.In the evening the place is pretty crowded. At night and early in the morning there is absolutely no one around. If you want to just sit around and gaze at the beauty of it thats the best time to go!!

Scenic View Steel Tower . I enjoyed it , to know that it's the worlds tallest self supported steel tower and it's 13 meters taller than the Eiffel Tower was surprising to me . I have visited Eiffel Tower before and I did not know that . Of course now in Japan the Tokyo Skytree is the tallest now but I was told that the Tokyo Tower serves as a broadcast antenna also . That's cool. The view from the main observatory deck is spectacular and you would enjoy it . They also have a glass panel floor which you can stand and that cools too . The day I was there the whether was so good and view was nice .Plenty of souvenir as usual but the day I was there they had a beer garden so after the waking around we enjoyed nice cool bears and some great snacks. It's nice place to visit and experience .

Early Friday afternoon, no wait. We really enjoyed this view, even with a bit of haze. We had heard that foreign passports get head of line privileges, but the line was nearly nonexistent around noon on a Friday so we didn't need to worry about it. Very pleased especially relative to Mori tower where we tried twice only to find an 80-90 minute wait. Enjoy!
Not Very Exciting. We visited this site as part of a tour group. We were not impressed. The view from our hotel was better, and the place was full of a bunch of little shops and restaurants.
Worth visiting despite loosing some sheen. The lighting is great and it is worth going up as provides a great view of inner Tokyo. The lighting pattern changes every day which is worth a look.

Similar to other towers in the World. This is similar to efiel tower ,burj khalifa petronas tower.It was build long ago.The view from the top is awesome.one can have majestic view of the city.They have installed touch screen where u can touch to see any spot it will explain and saw u the pictures in big view.

Eiffel tower? No, it is Tokyo tower!. It is known that Tokyo tower was constructed alike to Eiffel tower in Paris.In deed it is look alike, but inside of Tokyo tower is much more Japanese by havingLarge space of souvenir shop, museum with the theme of popular manga story and so on. It is charged to go up to observatory but just visiting souvenir shop or café inside of the tower is free admission, so someone like me, scared of highs can enjoy munching “kawaii” ice cream at Baskin Robbins.

60's Perspective of Japanese Futurism. A little rundown compared to the new and ultramodern Tokyo Sky Tree, Tokyo Tower still propogates its original message: the modern and developing post-war Japan of the 60s. Taller than the Eiffel tower, it has been the symbol of Tokyo until recently. Much less foot traffic than its shinier competitor, the Sky Tree. There is some old anime/godzilla genre figures on the top floor of the observation deck. Do not miss the mysterious baseball found on top of the communications tower.

Tokyo tower. We did a full day tour and our first stop was the Tokyo tower, there were not many people at the time we went so that made it easy for us enjoy the view and had enough time to take pictures and buy souvenirs.

At the viewing level before you know it. Clear day and amazing views...
from cemeteries through to mountains, all can be seen from this site. Love the viewing floor❤️

Asia's Eiffel Tower. It's pretty cool because it really is comparable to being in Paris. There's a movie theatre, plenty of restaurants and an aquarium (I believe) in the place, so could be a good time for a full night out. We actually went to a haunted house in the basement that happened to be there, and any haunted house that's around in August is already terrifying in my eyes.
Not bad. Tokyo tower is a sight to see when in Tokyo but unfortunately you cannot see it well from afar and up close it is very hard to visualise or take photo with. A no e sight non the less.

Great views. Had a wonderful view of the city. I went to both decks and thought it was well worth the extra money to go right to the top. I went late afternoon so got the daylight and night views - just stunning. There are a few easy flights of stairs to walk up between the decks so may not be suitable to everyone. There wasn't any waiting around for the lifts.

The Eiffel Tower in Japan. It's a really neat building. We went at sunset and were able to see the sun setting behind Mt. Fuji. At the base of the tower, they sell crepes which was really unexpected and neat.

Top of the tower. This is my second visit here. I have gone up to the second observation deck but the cloud had made the view less than perfect. It is getting old compare to the other tower across the town. Beware of line up when coming down from the 2nd deck. The tower is about 10 minutes walk from the subway station and you will have to walk up the hill to get there.

333 metres. Although maybe not as popular since the Sky Tree opened, you can still get good views of Tokyo and beyond from the Tokyo Tower. An easy height to remember of 333 metres, apparently it is the world's tallest self-supporting steel tower. Worth a visit and inexpensive.

Really worth a visit to see Tokyo from above.. My first day in Tokyo, and I thought it would be a good idea to get my bearings by seeing it from above. It is definitely worth it, as the views from the top are magnificent.
Great views. We visited the Tokyo Tower observation deck as part of a city tour. The views from the observation deck are impressive. Tokyo Tower is well-maintained and has some nice souvenir shops.
Nice view. It's worth it to paying some etra money for a higher floor, there are less tourists and more peace. If you will be in one of the floors of the concert it will be a great time.

Must see. We have been to Tokyo Tower before but this time we had visited the Skytree also. We went in November and virtually had no queue's. Night time Tokyo was spectacular and the tower is better situated than the Skytree.

If you've seen the Eiffel, not much to see here.. Think of the Eiffel Tower, just taller and prettier. You can go up inside it but expect to queue for around half an hour. There is a small shopping arcade in the base of the tower selling souvenirs.
Best to visit after dark, or at sunset, to appreciate the lights.

Not for a cloudy/rainy day. If you already have seen the Tokyo view from either Roppongi Hills or Skytree then I wouldn't recommend coming here because its basically the same thing. If you have been to either one of these 3 then the rest is pretty much been there done that.its not cheap 800yen to go half way up and 800yen more to go the rest of the way up. i went on a semi cloudy day and couldn't not see much, also it was quite crowded because it was a weekend and with that many people you cant really enjoy the view anywaysIf you really want to go here though, I would recommend going daytime when there is excellent weather conditions or maybe at night to see the beautiful Tokyo city lights.And maybe choose weekdays hoping there are less people.Otherwise I wouldn't bother.
Great place. Beautiful tower, historical too, make sure you read its history! easy to get to, the view are nice, pay a visit :)
Smaller crowd than Skytree. We got in quickly due to smaller crowd than the Skytree. This tower is so beautiful at night. You have a nice view of Tokyo lights from the observatory.
Great view. Its nice for pictures and a quick night visit as there are not much to see there.you xan eat and drink but its pricey.if you get organised you maybe can see more
Great 360 panoramic view of Tokyo. Great place to see panoramic of Tokyo simply from the central area, not too far from public transportation access... Level satisfaction 7/10
Tokyo tower. Visited in Jan with 2 kids, was a great outing, great to learn all about the historical elements of Japan, Tokyo.

The Asian Eiffel😎. Interesting and fascinating 360 view of the city. Not as high or imposing as Eiffel but do make time to appreciate Tokyo Tower. I am touched by the existence of a small shrine thanking the divine.. It humbles me to realise that amidst all the technology advancement, recognising the spiritual side of life is the one that touched me the most

Must-See View! . My sister and I went to Tokyo Tower together and loved it! I'm sure the view is lovely during the day, but I highly recommend going in the evening. It was STUNNING! Of course, the lights are dimmed in order to limit glare on the windows, so this can make it a bit of a challenge when taking photos. That might be irritating if you feel like "why do it if you can't post it?" But I think it's a wonderful place to be in the moment. It's on the pricey side, but to me it was worth it. I live in the U.S. and it may be years before I am able to go back, but the memories will stay with me until then.

Retro tower beauty. Viewing towers are synonymous with most major cities these days but few can boast they have the retro beauty of the Tokyo Tower - its one of my favourites, especially lit up at night. We only went to the main observatory level, pity you have to cough up more yen to go right to the top, but we didnt feel short changed - the views are stunning on a clear day and give you a great perspective over the city to get your bearings so we never felt the need to go any higher!There is a One Piece mini theme park here also for Anime fans, although we thought it was expensive for a family of four to get in.

too expensive. A symbol of Tokyo but I don't know if is the perfect place to see Tokyo from above. 900 yen for the first observatory, plus other 700 for the second, I think is too much. Personally I liked the most the Tokyo skyline from the island of Odaiba

Best viewing tower. We love Tokyo tower. The views are amazing and we went in the evening again for our second visit so queues were non existent and our trip up was quick and painless.The views are so beautiful from Tokyo tower and the tower itself is also very beautiful. I would 100% recommend a visit here while in Tokyo.Staff are very helpful and friendly and they have a lovely gift shop. Also other souvenirs on sale under the tower as well as restaurants and a food court.
Tokyo Tower. We visit Tokyo tower at night so we can see the tower light up with red light.A lot of bus with tourist fill the parking area, so did the Pokemon hunters

Excellent view, especially after dark. The Tokyo Tower is a great place to get some good views and a great impression of how large Tokyo actually is.Even from the lower platforms you get a decent view, but like with all towers the grand gem is the view from the top platform.The lower platforms have quite a few shops and attractions so it is a place to visit should you have bad weather on the outside.Just keep in mind that the lines to get in here can be loooong, especially around the evenings when it is getting dark (due to the great views of the city lights in the evenings) and also on hot days (due to the fact that the observations platforms are all air conditioned). Standing in line in the summer heat isn't actually too bad as they always remember to keep those small vapor dispensers over the lines to keep things cool.So check the conditions, set aside some time for standing in line and enjoying the views from the platforms and don't forget to bring a camera. The Tokyo Tower is worth the visit!
Good view and perfect design inside. beatyful place . very good views of the city inside its designed like you are on the sky and a lot of stars near you

Great vantage point of the city. We came by midday/midweek so the crowd was minimal. The panoramic views of the city from the 2nd level was wonderful. Somewhat steep price (you can get great views from any of the high-rise hotels), but the structure itself was very impressive.
Just go up and see for yourslf. Although might not be as popular as the Eiffel tower, it's certainly worth the climb. The view of Tokyo's skyline is unforgettable.

Nice View. It's a view spot that you can overook Tokyo city.A special observation tower(250m) is 700 yen for adult. There are a lot of souvenir shops on the second floor.I came here in the daytime, I wanna do again at night.

Beautiful at night. When we went to Tokyo Tower, we had already been to Sky Tree the day before and we were worried it would be disappointing to see them in that order. But while we saw Sky Tree and its view by day, we saw Tokyo Tower at night. And it was really beautiful. Both from below and from the top. Definitely worth the trip.

A MUST!. I think all the people need to go to the Tokyo Tower if they are in Tokyo.
In the Night the view from the observation decks is amazing!

Oldtime must visit. Even though nowadays people go to the newer simbolic skyliner, Sky Tree, it has been always a great spot to view and visit.
So many survenior shops on 1 and 2 floor. It's good for family and those who like Tokyo.
One of Tokyo's most famous land marks. Great land mark in Tokyo. We went up to the main observation deck. We saw great views and there was even a radio host, and dancers performing.

Tokyo is cool as long as you don't visit it during a typhoon. Very cool world metropolis... Lots to visit and do, but don't come here for tourism during any rainy season... Most of the interesting stuff is outside: amusement park around the Tokyo Dome (which is just one big 'ol baseball stadium), the waterfront, lots of parks, etc.
Great Tower and Worth the Price. Went here today before sunset to finally see the tower. It is 900 Yen to enter and it is worth the price of admission. Was able to view the city quite well up top.

2nd Tallest structure in Japan at 1092 feet, and stunning at nighttime. Only the Tokyo Skytree tower is taller than the Tokyo tower. this landmark, built in 1958, is a great way to get your self oriented when walking through the city. It sort of looks a little like the Eiffel Tower in Paris!

Nice to visit. Nice in the night.
The ticket is 900 yen, and it worth the money.
Have some resturants inside and outside.

A great view of the city. We were making stops along the green yamanote line. We stopped at the hamamatsucho station and walked to Tokyo tower. It was about a 15-20 minute walk. We did both levels (150 and 250 meter platforms) and had amazing views from both. My kids loved getting to go up the elevators and seeing the views out towards Mt. Fuji. Similar to going up in the Sears tower in Chicago or the Eifel Tower in Paris. Worth a visit!

Outstanding view. Best time to visit is late evening the view of Tokyo is stunning. Quite expensive, particularly if you take the 'optional extra' higher floor, but value for money. Easily accessible by MTR. Amusing and fascinating 'video show' of window cleaners superimposed on high level Windows.
Tokyo Tower. Definitely worth a visit. Went on a guided tour during the day then went back at night for a spectacular view of Tokyo by night. Don't miss it.
Fantastic views. Fabulous views here. Found yet another temple nearby on the way back to the station but this time with tons of Japanese Cicada and butterflies
Execellent. If in Tokyo, its worth going to this Tower. It is obviously not as tall as the Buj Khalifa - but do remember it was built in 1958.

Great Downtown View!. While the Tokyo Skytree is significantly higher and more modern, there's a certain beauty that the Tokyo Tower has that makes it stand out in the world of tall structures. Viewing it through the branches of cherry blossoms makes for some excellent photos, and the views from inside gives you a great view of downtown Tokyo that no other building can match!

Tokyo sky tree. Visited Tokyo tower in August. Thought it was walking distance, turned out to be further than expected - but nice to look at the city as you walked to it. Not tok bad waiting times when I went, but saw the lines getting bigger as I left. Lots of tourist shops and some rip off prices-just be careful where you buy because they expect tourists there and jack up the prices a bit. The price to go up the tower was reasonable. You have to buy a second ticket to go to the top when at the first level, but even together the price was reasonable.

Towering Experience. Visited the Skytree first which is newer, taller and more modern in what it contains BUT I much preferred my visit to the Tokyo Tower. Maybe it's just nostalgia, buts it's age, and what it represents, adds to the whole experience. The walk through the Temple gardens, immediately below, offer a calming, relaxing and pleasurable pre, and post visit, addition to the day out.

Nice view of Tokyo espeically at night. If you gazing the city landscape from an observatory then you'll going to the top of Tokyo Tower. It gets expensive to go to the very top but, to me, it's worth it. There's a Mos Burger inside and I always enjoy their food.

One Piece and Great Views!. As fan of the anime One Piece, Tokyo Tower was great to visit as it had its own OP shop and theme park. That in itself was an enjoyable experience but for those who don't care for that, the views from the upper decks of the tower are amazing. We visited at night and it was a wonderful experience. Although it is not as high as Tokyo Skytree, it is a lot less crowded.

Go to the top. This was a really cool little experience. Like any tower, you go up and get to see the surrounding area. I definitely recommend going to the very top if you can. You can see even farther but that is really the extent of it. The middle floor has the glass bottom spots you can stand on. It was a cool little experience to be able to do that. They also have a nice gift shop up there and some photo opportunities. Worth it if you like towers. They also have one of those nice crepe places all around Tokyo right at the base of the tower along with several other gift shops. Worth a peek around after you finish the tower. There is also a very cool temple right next to the tower that is open to the public.
Great Place to visit. Amazing place it is bigger than Eiffel Tower and has 1st Observatory on 150 mtrs and another 250 mtrs. Nice place to visit.

Looks amazing but just too expensive for the like of me.. It's looks amazing but took me a while to find its as big as it is lol. On getting there I really enjoyed viewing it was go fun not much to do in the near area as it's in the business district. The price was just way too much for me but wish I could have gone in.
Just ok. Its a neat replica of the Eiffel Tower with some nice views of Tokyo. This was part of an all day tour and doesn't require a lot of time.

Beautiful view. The Tokyo Tower at first glance during the daytime looks cool but at nighttime the view it offers you of the surrounding area is breathtaking. You can see the city all lit up at night and even see as far as the giant ferris wheel in Yokohama and the Rainbow Bridge! Cool bonus cause the lit up beautifully at night too. It also has a especial observation deck and the One Piece attraction.

Looks great, at night.. In daylight this Tower is anything but pretty, but that totally changes at night. Impressive building. We didn't go up since we went up the top of Tokyo skytree the night before.

Tokyo one piece Tower. We went to Tokyo Tower for the One Piece theme park and it did not disappoint. It was so much fun for us all (a family of five) even though only my youngest brother is fan of the anime we all had a good time. After the one piece part we went on to check out the observation deck. The view overlooking Tokyo was quite nice.

Just like a Disney ride; exit through the gift store. We were staying nearby and decided to walk to the tower. It was beautiful, like a touch of Paris in Tokyo. We caught the lift to the observation deck and the view was wonderful. Lots of red lights, everywhere. The Rainbow Bridge stood out as a unique feature. When we decided it was time to go, the lift deposited us in the obligatory gift shop level. Lots of "stuff" which we by passed.

Must visit in Tokyo. Iconic. . Although it has been replaced by Tokyo Skytree as the tallest building, I still think it's a must to pay it a visit. I like Tokyo tower's day view more compared to it's night view. Paid ¥900 to go up to the main observatory to have a view of Tokyo. It's interesting to be able to recognize and point out sites you've explored around Tokyo tower. We lingered around Tokyo tower till sunset time to catch the sunset view as well as Tokyo's night view. It was breath-taking to watch the sun going down and Tokyo goes from light to night.

Tokyo Tower. Tokyo Tower looks a little bit like the Eiffel tower and offers a good opportunity to get an overlook onto the greater Tokyo area. Getting to the top is not that cheap and you have the choice to only go up to the first platform or up to the very top.On a good day, you will have a great view on a lot of places that you might have visited before. Not sure if Mt Fuji could be seen from here although the direction is shown.

Kitsch with a view. A past-its-prime landmark in the city with a fun, funky vibe -- you feel compelled to grab your "tacky" souvenir here (like in Paris grabbing an Eiffel tower with a thermometer on it) at the large gift shop. A great spot for kids. The views are terrific and the immediate area is quite charming with residences, stores, and restaurants.

Best to view at night. Sure Tokyo is an awesome city, but the night view when all lights are lit is the best. Different from most cities I've been. A pity it is not like in Australia, where you can climb to the top, but it's really great and organized.

Great View of beautiful Tokyo but a bit Pricey going to both levels. I liked the experience very much. Tokyo is a beautiful city with beautiful buildings and highrises. The only problem is with the lighting on the second level. It was too light at night and it was hard to take photos because of light reflection also if you want to get on both levels (there are two levels open to public) you have to pay for the first level then there take another ticket for the second level. But anyway I loved the experience.

Ten photos isn't enough to cover this city. Certainly one of the World's greatest city's. From the Emperors Palace to the Giza shopping district, the Tsukiji Fish Market, the Theater district, the temples and the entertainment options, Tokoyo truly has it all.
great view of the city!. |I like this better than sky tree, the location is more convenient and much cheaper. me and my husband enjoyed sippinh champagne while watching ovaer the city

Tokyo Tower - More than just an elevator ride. The view from the top of the Tokyo Tower is awesome. You can see so many things from this perspective. There are English signs pointing out spot of interest along the various horizons. Take a tour book to really understand what you are seeing. From this top view, you can see many sights that you would not see from the street. The base of the tower has several gift shops, an ice cream shop, and a cafe among others. We went first thing in the morning and there was no line. This is an spot to go when it is not raining or very overcast.
Superb. Excellent views over the city and reasonably priced, can spend a few hours here and the glass floor is for the braver of people seeing the attraction

A unique view of Tokio - an excelent experience. We went there twice /May 2008/. Once during the busiest day for attractions in Tokio - Sunday. We didnt wait for long and we didnt reserve online tickets /not avalaible that time/. There was no rush at all. The view is just amazing, shows how huge Tokio is and because of it¨s architecture I think it is MUST SEE when UR in Tokyo. Second time we went after sunset, to see night view of Tokio. I cant even say what is better - day or night view, I woud recomend to visit this tower twice as we did. A would never forget it is just breathtaking. Just wait for sunny day to get the best view.

Pretty from afar; crowded up close. Unless you plan on going up to the observation deck, is is enough to see Tokyo Tower from afar (e.g. Roppongi Hills). There is a One Piece-themed café and gift shop on the ground floor, but the waiting time for the café was rather long (~30 min). If you are a big fan of One Piece, I'd recommend a visit to Tokyo Tower even if you don't go up, but for non-fans who've already seen Tokyo from above (e.g. from Skytree), Tokyo Tower offers nothing but crowds and waiting times.

Great Fun/Excellent View. Visited here with my teenage son. We purchased our tickets and made the first 150M climb. It was fun. There were cartoons encouraging you ever 25M or so.The 150M observatory was worth the trip. Amazing views including a floor viewing below. Then purchase another ticket and go up another 100M. This was great. The later it got the easier to see Mt Fuji it was. The Panoramic picks came out amazing. I would gladly pay again for both experiences.A must do in Tokyo. It's a historic ICON.

Great view of the city. Amazing aerial view of the city. There are 3 options for the tickets. 1. Wait in the normal queue (cheapest) depending on the queue it can take an hour to reach the top.2. Express which was the option we took. 15 minutes from buying the ticket to the top. Which gives you access to the normal viewing platform which is a 360 degree view with glass floor platform. Same view as the standard just quicker too see. 3. Straight to the top above the normal viewing platform (didn't do this option as we arrived at 1pm and the view was hazy) We didn't manage to see Mt Fuji due to the haze. I believe before 10pm is best for those viewings. I would advise you e mail them and they will advise better. Seeing Mt Fuji from the tower is going to be incredible picture opportunity and not one to be missed out on.
Spectacular. Tokyo tower is considered a 'must visit' attraction in Tokyo. The view from the tower is spectacular but the place is very crowded.

Exciting. 2 view platforms, where you have to pay extra to get to the highest one. Go to the highest one. The view is fantastic and really lets you see, how big Tokyo is. The service is great and everyone is helpful and even speaks english. Recommendable and it is a must see in Tokyo.

An amazing engineering design. It's worth to visit Tokyo tower and have bird's eye view on Tokyo city. A great engineering design. Make sure you are in the right queue to the top, because it's great to note that Japanese are giving priority to foreign travelers, so you can access the tower faster.
Worth the time for some really nice views. Stopped here as part of a half day tour. The views were great and having s guide point out special buildings was very helpful

Tokyo . Steel beams in white and orange of the Tokyo Tower stand out with its 333 meters high. Note that attraction of various parts of the city and then change the perspective and see the city from the tower observation decks.

Worth it if you've got the time/money to spare. Tokyo tower is fun to visit, with lovely fairy lights at night and cool 'look-down' clear holes in some parts of the floor. However there are lots of buildings to view Tokyo from (Seaside Top, Mori Art Museum) and I would recommend those if you can only go to one, because then you get the view of Tokyo Tower itself!

Glimpse all of Tokyo!. Brilliant way of seeing all of Tokyo from a great height. We went late afternoon at is wasn't too busy. The elevator going up to the higher elevation was a little challenging for some of us, but we gradually became used to it. There is one little square of glass that you can stand on to get a full vantage of how far down really is!

An emerald of evening. It is so colorful in the evening. Although SkyTree absorbs most of the visitors who like to observe Tokyo landscape from the top, this tower still attracts many visitor in the evening. It looks so vibrant in the evening.

Nice walking from Tamachi station. I've always wanted to see Tokyo tower. If you are a good walker, I recommend you to walk from Tsmachi station. It takes 30mins?!? to get to Tokyo tower. The view from the street is getting incredible
Lovelly trip up the Tower. Had wanted to do the Tokyo Tower for many years and was not disappointed. Great views over the bay, Minato and all the way to the Skytree.

Best to do at night!. I had originally planned to visit during the day but my son persuaded me to defer this visit to later in the day and he was right! The Tokyo Tower is more impressive at night.The walk to Tokyo Tower was a bit uphill and when we got there, we missed the entrance. Once inside, there were eating places and stores on the lower levels to entertain before proceeding up the viewing decks/observatories.Weather is obviously a big factor. Fortunately, in March we were blessed with perfect weather and a full moon. We did both the regular and special observatory...I'm not sure the special observatory was worth the extra money but since it was a once in a lifetime opportunity, we did it anyway, especially since the weather was so good. The inside is dimly lit so it's kinda hard to get decent pics...so plan accordingly.

Breathtaking!. Beautiful 360 views of Tokyo with pictures showing all the important landmarks! Went at night and the line going up and down was ridiculously long! prepare to stand in a line that goes around and around. The stores downstairs are worth a visit as well!

Best view of Tokyo . Great view of Tokyo. Really worth it. You also have a nice mall to eat and hang out in the bottom floors of the building, and there are various activities to do there... So do not run away so fast. Make sure to ask to go up in the Summer Elevator, it is the nicest elevator. The difference of the view between the top level and 350 meter heigjr is really not a big deal. Highly recommend.
Breath taking view. It is worth a visit because it gives you the chance to really see Tokyo. It has a small gift shop so you can get last minute presents.

Definitely something to do while in Tokyo. I really liked the views. If you go there, make sure you buy a ticket for the highest observation deck. In total it would be around 1600 yen if I remember correctly. It's worth it. It wasn't crowded at all when I was there, which surprised me. I loved the fact that they had a little post office inside where you can send cards. You can buy the stamps and the cards from the souvenir shop, but make sure you have some cash with you, as you can't purchase stamps with credit card. While you're here, make sure you walk around the tower and you'll find at least two temples which you can visit. I don't remember the names though, but it's worth it to walk around the area.

It's worth the visit. I've read many reviews saying that going up on Tokyo Tower isn't worth spending 1.600 Yen (900 Yen main observation deck + 700 Yen special observation deck). I doubt that. I went there in the evening hours and there was no waiting line in front of the ticket booth and the lower elevators. In deed there was a waiting line (about 20 minutes) for the elevators going up from the main observation deck to the special observation deck. But the view from the special observation deck is stunning and worth the additional waiting time and additional price. When you go there after sunset, make sure you have a good camera that is able to take good low light pictures.Although there were many people I could still get around the deck to take good pictures of all directions.Going down back to the main observation deck means another time waiting for about 5 to 10 Minutes. On the way down from the main observation deck you pass by a café and a stage (club 333). When I went down a popular J-Pop girl group was performing on the stage so it was really crowded but a funny experience.There are several shops, attractions and restaurants on the lower levels of the tower mainly for kids and teenagers. I just bought Tokyo Bananas to eat on my way back to the hotel.

A ritual . It's a ritual to see a city tower or some very high building when are on a sightseeing tour. So we were taken to Tokyo Tower. You have to buy ticket to go to the top floor, and then buy another ticket to go higher to observatory. You can have city views from all sides, and also vertical down from a rectangular window on the floor. There are souvenir shops and interesting visuals for taking pictures

Visit during the week - midday . For short wait times be sure to visit the Tokyo tower on a weekday, during work hours. We were able to get on the elevator immediately. The view of the city is phenomenal from the observation deck.

Famous Tokyo landmark. The tower itself is nothing special but personally it is one of my most beloved spots in Tokyo due to its presence in the skyline for so long. Try going up in a clear shinny day. The shops at the base are excellent with a wide range of souvenirs and local sweets.

Panoramic of Tokyo. If you want to get a full view of Tokyo in just 20mins this will be the place to go to. But do a weather check especially during spring or winter season prior to heading there to make sure its a clear weather. The park clear Tokyo tower (Shiba-Daimon park) is good for a walk before or after the Tokyo tower visit. Restaurants on the second floor of Tokyo tower serves quick fix to your hunger.

Alot more then I was expecting . The tower is some what expensive around 2000 yen for the highst point has amazing views there is also a aqueriem that Has some unique fish but nothing to crazy there was also a one piece section witch is great if you like the show or book
Symbol of Tokyo. For me, this is the symbol of Tokyo. Much nicer than the Skytree, both from inside and outside. Climb to the top!
Nice view to the city, better at night. It is one of the Tokyo icons. It was good, especially special observatory in 250 m, would be better if the view wouldn't be through windows.
Great view. I really enjoyed the Tokyo Tower and loved the employees outfits. The view from the top was great and we enjoyed the little park with the waterfall to the left.
A bit over rated. . I like the Tokyo Tower but I think it is over rated especially if you try to compare it with the Eiffel Tower. But the nightlife in that area is good so not a total waste of time.

Tokyo Tower. It was an old structure. Worthy to visit for being the former tallest structure in town. But lately had been over taken by the telecommunication tower. A good souvenir shop on the TOP level with food court at the basement. Don''t expect too much tough.

Center of Tokyo. Use this to navigate around this lovely part of Tokyo. Streets lined with shops, temples, shrines and places to eat.
So lucky to be visiting this is area.
nice and amazing view. Nice view to see around and one piece tower was located there, which is my kids favorite. Nice burger shop there.

Good place to see all of Tokyo. We visited Tokyo Tower on a weekday in April 2016. The line to get up to the tower wasn't too bad and once upstairs we are able to take our time on the first level. The day was a bit overcast so we couldn't see all the way to Mt Fuji. We also went up to the next level. Once up there we saw a lady cleaning the windows on the outside. She was in a harness and had a bungee like rope strapped to her. The panel on the outside where she was standing weren't overly wide.
