I must admit my family and I spent most of the time we were up there just looking at her while she worked. It was a little freaky. After we came down back to the first level, there were some kids entertainment. After we left the tower we descended to a food court where we had lunch. The food court was reasonably priced. There was also a couple of souvenir shops that we were able to get a few things at. Would recommend visiting the Tower especially if you are staying in the Shiba Park area.
Nice View of Tokyo. We visited in the evening to get the best night view.This is said to be even 13m taller than Effiel Tower which amazed me.Not suggested to pay extra for top Deck.

Nice but not like the real one in Paris. It was my first trip to Tokyo so I was open to seeing everything. The Tokyo Tower looks amazing from a distance but once you get up on it you don't get the same dramatic effect as the Eiffel Tower in Paris.

Tokyo's highest tower but the view is so so. I was here in May, here are the positive and negative pointsPositive points: It is always nice to go up to a view point and see the city from above. The elevators are super fast, there is basically no queue and the view is nice. What is the most impressive is realizing that the city looks like never ending regardless of which direction you look.Negative points: As mentioned in other reviews, the placement of the tower is not super central so you won't have an incredible view, also the ticket is quite expensive.

Excellent views of the city. This is "A must do Tourist Attraction" if only to say you have done it. Apparently this is the tallest Tower in the World, not to be confused with the tallest building in the world.
On a clear day the views are truly magnificent and present a perfect photo opportunity

Wonderful city. Hi all, Tokyo is a very nice city (even very busy) and very very nice peoples, it's a wonderful city I loved her. you can find a lot of interesting things especially traditional gifts you can buy there.The Tokyo tower is a very beautiful tower and nice place, you can see most of the city from the top, also there is a glassy floor on the top yo can stand on and see everything on the ground under you, it's a little bit scary according to the tower height. by the way, the tower is same as Eiffel tower as design but higher that it. really I had very happy nice times there.

actually, a bit boring if you don't like to visit some scenic spot. yup, a bit boring. just like what you can imagine, take the lift, goes up, and then you will reach a place that you can walk around 360 degree. and as you can imagine there must be a glass window that under your foot to make you scare (of course you won't). and, finish. but in fair, it's quite interesting to my children
Tokyo Tower. Many tower options to view the city --this is my favourite and one of the cheaper options. Go at the end of the day during daylight, then wait for dusk and see the city light up!

Go at night. If you like high vantage points when traveling, then stop by here. I would go at night as there are no crowds at that time of day. The city is also pretty cool to see all lit up. One unusual thing about Tokyo is that every building has the red anti-collision lights on the roof. So it's like a sea of red lights at night. Not too pricey to get up either. Yes, it's a knock-off of the Eiffel Tower...

Japan's Eiffel Tower but without the queuing. Doesn't quite have the dramatic placement of the Eiffel Tower, it's in a very functional area with good and efficient parking. It was designed to be a TV tower first and visitor attraction second, so it's positioned to send TV signals not to be the heart of a city.However, it's so much better than the Eiffel Tower in ways that matter.- Parking and easy access- Lots of lifts that aren't confusing or so busy you wait for hours- No queues- Friendly staff that actually want you to be there- High quality shops- Great foodBasically everything the Eiffel Tower isn'tIt's not as high as the Sky Tree and doesn't quite have the views that some other famous towers do, but has great views of Tokyo and is worth a visit to see this iconic tower

So much more than a tower. From the outside it looks just like a tower, but on the inside there is so much more to experience, not only do you get incredible views, but there is a shopping arcade on the lower levels and night time attractions are held throughout the year.

Probably a must when visiting Tokyo, but expensive. Nice view over the city, but it is expensive. 900 Yen to the first observation deck and 1600 Yen to the top. Been there & done that. I do not think I will do it again.

When in Rome.... This is one of those things you should do in Tokyo just because. There are a lot of attractions around the world that give a nice aerial city view. TT delivers on that but it really isn't that high compared to other similar attractions. But it's something you probably should do at least once.

Hokey but fun!. My mother was absolutely dying to go here and I thought it was going to be ultra-touristy and boring but it was actually a lot of fun. You go through a mall which is interesting. Of course it is in fact very touristy but as an international traveler you get a speed pass through the line. The views are beautiful and really show you just how huge Tokyo is.

13 meters taller than the Eiffel. If you want to see Tokyo from above, this is a way to do it. We had a clear day so you could see for miles. I have gone up the Eiffel Tower of Paris and enjoyed the sites there. This was good too.
Go on up--it is worth it if it is clear weather.

Nice view from the top. Top of the tower offers probably the best view of the city. We visited in the evening, which was probably the best time to take pictures of the well lighted city. Decided to come down the stairs instead of the elevators, which added to the thrill.However, it doesn't compare to the Empire State Building (New York) or the Eiffel Tower (Paris).

Worth a glimpse . Hey the call it a tourist trap, I truly believe it is worth it. The panorama is breath taking and if helps you see what you want to visit in Tokyo. For instance I discover the odsiba, Tokyo marina very nice place to see in a sunny day.

nice, but nowhere near Eiffel tower. this is a masquerade of the Paris Eiffeltower. Nowhere near that interesting. For the views: go to the newer and much higher modern tokio tower. The nearby tempel is worthwhile visiting, also because of the contrasts with the environment.

Pretty view. Worth a visit if you are in Tokyo but it's quite expensive. $900 yen per adult to get to the first observation deck and then you pay further amount to walk up to the next observation deck (takes about 14 mins to walk up - no elevator)There was a light installation on the first observation deck which was nice at night, but the glass was quite scratched and it's looking a bit old, so if you want to get a good clean photo - it might be a bit hard.

Beautiful view, and not too expensive. We did only the lower level, but it is plenty high up. Not much to help you identify the buildings that you see. Be prepared to exit through three floors of shopping.

Fun family activity.. An easy walk from the Prince Park Tower hotel, we visited with our very young children and enjoyed the experience. Plenty of food and shopping available. The children enjoyed the game center and a chance to meet the quirky Tower mascots. Visit at sunset for a really beautiful experience.

Excellent views of the city. I would recommend you go here just for the views of Tokyo.We visited at night as we wanted to see the city in lights.The good thing is you get a lift to the very top, no stairs!!Definitely worth a visit

Evening Beauty!. What a classic experience it was. amazing way to end the day. We did not opt to go up till the end as we found it a little pricey but just being their was great, mall shopping was excellent, all of us enjoyed a lot of eat out out their. definitely a must visit destination in Tokyo.
Basically a waste of time unless you like towers. We took over 20 minutes in a crowded are waiting to get into the lifts, because it was a tour spent 3 minutes in the tower. Just too busy

Tokyo Tower. It has changed a bit since my last visit, the McD is gone but fotunately replaced with Mos Burger (Try the chicken burger), the stores have rearranged on the second floor but basically have the same stuff...4th floor roof game center randomly open but the children still love the place.

Visit and stay until Sunset. This is one of the "must-to-visit" places in Tokyo, there are two view floors: first at 150m height, and the second is 250m. Definitely choose 250m and buy a ticket which includes both. The elevator first stops at 150m, you can stay as long as you want, next move up to 250m, a better and more clear view. It is better to schedule as to be there to see the sunset and Tokyo at night, but in this case you loose the "look down window" view when you return back to 150m again, cuz it's dark outside and can not get good photos and selfies.

Amazing experience ! . We did some research before we reached the tower. Twilight time is recommended by the other travellers. We decided to visit the tower on the day of arrival in Tokyo. Friendly staff. Decent queue at the ticket counter. Great system to go up and down by lift. Try to to the higher level. Great experience.Highly recommended !

A must to see at night. We have visisted this after dark and it was amazing! The view reminded me of Blade runner, Mass effect, Star wars etc. A huge futuristic city.Fee: ~600 yen the first level+ ~740 yen the second (top) level

Ok I am not a tower person. I earlier wrote about my disappointment with skytree tower. This tower is lower but cheaper ($12 and up) and the view is still hazy. There are many great crowded and you so not waste your time in lines. If this is your thing, go for it!
Amazing views. Amazing views of tokyo, a bit more expensive than tokyo sky tree but you get to see more of tokyo with better skyline. I would recommend

A must-visit. The architecture alone is unmissable, even if you don't fork out the few quid it'll cost to go up. 12metres taller than the eiffel tower, and beautifully lit up at night! Views across the incredible skyline make for perfect photo opportunities.

Nothing special. This was a stop on a Princess cruise port tour. We went up to the observation platform, and there was a nice city view. Perhaps a better view at night but we went during the day. Didn't have to wait too long since we went mid-day. Not at all comparable with the actual Eiffel Tower. Glad we didn't go to any great effort to see this; but the alternative was to just stay on the ship while in port and this was a nice diversion.

Amazing view . Pretty high up! Amazing view from the top + provides many other things to do such as the one piece tower and the restaurant of course (for all those one piece fans), this was an amazing experience for me. Loads of stores to buy souvenirs too, so don't hold back on buying those one piece items!
Stunning view. Been there a bit early in the evening once the sun set the artificial sun is coming those are the well decorated of light. It is so beautiful
Good views of the city. The Tokyo Tower is slightly taller than the Eiffel Tower and was well worth a visit. Had some good views of the city and at a reasonable price.
Replica. Its just a communication tower replica of Eiffel tower , nothing to vouch about it . can go up to top in elevator to see city view and snaps.
Nice... Good place to visit if you are not afraid of heights.. Heard its beautiful at night than day time...
Curious. This small eiffel tower is really part of Tokyo ; all red and white this tower is one of the curiousity of Tokyo city center
Curious . This small eiffel tower is really part of Tokyo ; all red and white this copy of the original one is a curiousity of Tokyo city center

Amazing views of the city. Worth going for the upper observation platform, 1,600 yen per adult but be prepared to queue to get to the top. It was a bit hazy today but could still see most buildings it was just the mountains in the distance that were hidden.

Better than Skytree for families. on our first visit to Tokyo we went to the Skytree because it is the biggest, newest and best etc. To be honest it was a bit of a nightmare, massive line ups, huge crowds and not a lot to see from the top (relatively speaking, you can see the whole city but there are not too many big buildings nearby and you quickly lose perspective).This time we went to the Tokyo tower with the kids. Great experience!In comparison to the Skytree it is a reasonably priced ghost town. Cannot remember the price, but after a week in Tokyo it seemed cheap.Walked straight in, the wait for the elevator was just that, no people queuing in front of us.The view I felt was better too, the tower is in the heart of Tokyo and it feels like there is a multitude of things to see in every direction. You can see the ferris wheel at Odaiba, Shinjuku and Shibuya are clear.We went later in the evening, and had a first walk around in the daylight. We sat in the cafe for 30 minutes (tip - the coffee is the worst coffee I have had in my life - get a water) while the kids had an icecream and it went dark.then we went up to the upper observation deck and had a walk round in the dark and checked out the lights.Great experience.If you do go, try to find out when sundown is on goodle and go there 30 minutes before, get the day and night views. The shrine just down the hill was worth a visit too.

Lovely at night. I really enjoyed the views and photo opportunities. I went up to the second viewing area too. There was a live band playing in the bar when I came down that were really good, great atmosphere.
Great view of City. Would recommend this activity as your first point of call so as to understand the size of the city and take in some special locations. An early evening inspection is recommended

Fun attraction in Tokyo. I always wanted to see the Tokyo Tower, but mainly because Im a huge Godzilla fan and loved when Mothra made its cocoon on this tower in the movies. This is a fun tourist attraction with great views of the city. I wouldn't go out of my way to go see it again but do recommend it as a fun side trip if in the area.
Greta place to visit. Go there at nightfall. Amazing views, affordable, fast moving lines. Good souvenir shops at the base of the tower
Great view. Although I love the view of Tokyo tower itself from Roppongi hills, it's very nice view from the tower as well.

Tokyo Tower. This Tower is a wonderful view from the Observatory at night! Inside the Tower there are restaurants and plenty of shops for souvenirs. The view is amazing from the tower. The tower is very similar to the Efiel Tower in Paris, great place to get some awesome pictures at night.
Tokyo Tower. Nice ambience... Very family oriented. Organized crowd & restaurants all around! And the souvenirs very affordable!
Nice view at night. If you want to enjoy one of the best views of Tokyo by night then you need to come to Tokyo Tower, it is not as crowded as Tokyo Sky Tree, and it is cheaper to too.

a must see if you visit Tokyo, beautiful of a night.. Worth a visit as its one of the main sights in Tokyo. The tower itself is illuminated of an evening so I'd recommend a late night trip. A ticket to the center of the tower was around 900Yen, and to the very top was around 1600Yen. I thought the middle tier would be a decent view, and I wasn't wrong. Tokyo is a beautiful city and its worth seeing from a great height!

Great views!. We decided to go to the Tokyo Tower (which resembles the Eiffel Tower from far away). It was 900 yen per adult & 500 yen per middle/high school student (to go 150 meters). It is smaller than the Skytree, but also less crowded. It is still high enough to get great pictures from the observatory. If you go here make sure not to miss the Zojo-ji shrine nearby.

Date night while on vacation to Japan. My husband and I went up to the Tokyo Tower as part of a long time dream of ours to go all the way to the top. Lemme tell you...going all the way to the top was not worth it. If you wanna go up, pay the fee to go up but don't pay the extra fee to go all the way to the top. There was a little cafe inside the second tier and the views of Tokyo at night were fantastic.When we decided to go see what the top was all about, we were a bit disappointed. First, the line at the elevator to go up was long, and once we got to the top, it felt very crowded because the space is pretty small. The views are essentially the same. As soon as we got up, we immediately got in the line that wrapped around the top floor to go back down because the line was so long (we just looked out the windoes from the line). We wished we had just stayed on the 2nd tier. We also wish we had known this before paying to go all the way to the top, which leads me to write this review. That being said, I recommend going at night :). Happy travels!

Night visit. I read some promotion of special lighting in the summer which attracted my curiosity ! I visited it on Jul 10 around 8:30pm . We had to stand in line for 30 min to buy our tickets . Most of visitors were young couples! The lighting made the interior of the tower standout but it wasn't the attractive! Maybe I have been in too many of these type of towers in the different part of the world ! There wasn't senior ticket and no special line for senior or handicap !
Great nighttime view!. Visited my first night and got an amazing view of the night skyline. Definitely recommend to anybody.

Have a look. Not the highest tower but if you are in the area worth a look.
Easy access, No crowds the day we went.
Nice Views of Tokyo. This might not be the Eiffel Tower, but it has a beautiful design and great views of the city. A must-see when visiting Tokyo
nice looking in evening. good place to unwind -similar to paris effil tower, centrally located . we had very good views when visited in evening .

A must-see in Tokyo. This was one of the first attractions I went to while in Tokyo. If I remember correctly, it was about 800 yen to go to the top and the view was breathtaking. They had some beautiful music playing and there was light show to enhance the experience. Definitely put this on your to-do list and you won't be disappointed.

Worthwhile experience. I had a pleasant experience to this tower. I took the 250m height of observation deck and I think that it was an amazing journey. Firstly it is the meteor rain projected view on the wall. It was fascinating. Then, it was the music at the background to blend with the ambience. It is highly recommended for couples and those who wanted to go for proposal too.

Japanese Eiffel Tower. 250meter above ground to experience the great view over Tokyo.On first sight not busy but when going down have to wait longer than desired, up to 30minutes which sucks!Nevertheless worth visiting

Spectacular views. Very worthwhile doing - panoramic 360 views All the better for us, however, because a guide explained various aspects of the view and gave interesting snippets about local areas: their current and recent history - all of which gave a depth to the visual experience Souvenirs were outrageously priced, so avoid!

A Tokyo icon. Tokyo Tower is one of the must-see things we wanted to go to. Though it's not as grand as the Eiffel Tower, it's still a pretty sight to see. It's worth the trek to this area to see this tower lit up.
Views!. Go up to the top to check out amazing panoramas of Tokyo, then explore the cute shops and attractions at the bottom. Good for getting your bearings!
Wonderful corner in Tokyo. Excellent shopping and breathtaking view of Tokyo. Nice ride with the Yukamome train and really worth visiting. Go to Toyota Web place! Lot of fun.
2d time there, great experience.. There are two lanes to enter express allows you to by pass there but you pay a little more. Worth it though, the lines are long in the middle of the day.
Good views. Stayed near the tower so took the trip to the top. Well worth it. Nice views and good way to see the expanse of the city

At 333m, it is taller than the Eiffel Tower in Paris.. Opened in 1958, the Tower looks and weighs much lighter than its French counterpart. Fast elevators take you to the Main Observatory platform at 150m high (access cost 900yen) where you get a great circular view of the City of Tokyo. The Tower has special arranged events on this Main Platform arranged on a weekly basis.
Tokyo Tower, Tokyo. Tokyo Tower is a communications & observation tower. At 332.9 metres, it is the second-tallest structure in Japan. It was built in 1958.

A Taller and More Colorful Eiffel Tower. This is such an iconic location in Tokyo and at a whopping 9 meters tall than the Eiffel Tower why not go just to bite your thumb at the French? As you walk toward the location you should also enjoy the nearby temple with plenty of great picture locations and shade on a hot day.Inside there is currently a One Piece themed area which is a MUST for fans of the show. I would recommend doing this tower before you go to the Sky Tree as it cannot complete with the sheer height but the views are still great!

Best to visit during sunset! . A must go tourist attraction in Tokyo! My tip is to go to Tokyo Tower when the sun is about to set! This is the time when you get the most fantastic view of Tokyo! Don't forget to buy a ticket to go to the top point of the tower and stomp on the transparent glass on the floor! There are also some performances at the tower and also an aquarium (which I didn't visit) and when you are done, pop down to the small shopping mall below to buy some souvenirs or eat some desserts!

Tokyo's Eiffel tower. By all means, ascend this tower. Unlike its look alike in Paris, this one includes a shrine and deity to pray to, especially for an exam grade as high as the tower. You can even visit at an auspicious time with your sweetheart. After you have seen the heights and looked down the glass floor at the street way below, there is an amusement park and food court, as well as several photo opportunities. You may take more photos than the proverbial Japanese tourists do.
Fun. We went on a cloudy day, but still Great view a lot to see. The employees are very friendly and helpful. Don't forget to get a stamped key if the sky tree, very momento for only 700 yen.

Go to the top!. We went up to 250m, but you can do as cheaper option up to 150m. The elevators with windows are terrifying, especially near the top. Great hazy views to help you appreciate the sheer size of Tokyo. Worth a visit. Be prepared for the poor dressed up and chained monkey doing tricks at the bottom. Animal welfare is clearly not a big issue here.
Worth a look. The tower gives you a good 360 deg view of the area and is an interesting construction. Make sure you stand on the glass floor panels at the top and look down.

Just the average tower . The Eiffel Tower and Namsan Tower are both superior to the Tokyo tower. The ticket only takes you to the main observation deck (150m). The second deck requires a group reservation. The view is nice but the only thing to really look at is the temple.
Tokyo by night. Walked from Arca Torre Hotel to Tokyo Tower.. Magnificent view of Tokyo at night from the top of the Tower..

Cool views at night! . Very quick ride up to the top of Tokyo Tower. We went at night (around 10pm) based on the recommendations of others. Worth the trip and didn't have to wait at any point. Amazing views!

Compulsar visit to Tokyo Tower. The view from the tower is outstanding, and deserve a visit if you visit Tokyo, even if it is a business trip.It is easy to go, as there is many transport, as underground or train.

Fun way to spend an afternoon. We went on a weekday. No wait at all. There is an amazing view from the top platform. We bought the tourist photo just for fun. We are still trying to figure out the cone head looking guys. One has a bandaid????

A beacon of Light in the darkness that overlook Tokyo. Experience :-"A beacon of Light in the darkness that overlook Tokyo"Having resided in Daiba on my previous trip, sights of the Tokyo Tower were frequent, especially in the evenings when it shore ever so brightly; although I did not have a chance to pay a visit then.This time though, it was one of my designated locations - it does not disappoint. Fresh out from Hamamatsucho Station, I walked through the streets that led to a temple along the path to the Tower. It was plenty scenic with the Lights from the Tower shining through the Cherry Blossoms. For many like myself that may not yet have a chance to see the Eiffel Tower, this is probably the closest thing next to it. Apart from a glorious view from the observatory, the Tower also offers many eateries and gift shop; in particular the One Piece Tower which I did end up grabbing many souvenirs.Tips/Advice:-1) Preferred Time of Visiting? Strongly encourage to visit in the evenings.2) Admission Fee? Vicinity is free to enter but heading to Observatory Decks cost between 900-1600 yen.Wayne’s ratings (As ticked):-i) Must-GO!ii) Recommended ✔✔✔iii) Nay.. or best go as a fillerIt is short of Must-GO! from my experience due to the Observatory Decks and One Piece Tower costing quite a fair bit to enter. Definitely visit if you wish to get a good view of Tokyo's night and surroundings.PS: Thank you for reading and hope my input and photos help.

Great view of the city. If you want a great view of the city, this is it! Similar experience up on top that you would have as the Eiffel Tower...the experience on the ground however is pretty plain...if you are going to go up it, don't bother going.
Go see for yourself. I cannot find anyway to really describe this wonder. You gotta see for yourself how beautiful it is. Go as high as you can, and enjoy the views of the city.

Towering Over Tokyo. I don't normally do real touristy stuff, but we see this tower from our hotel and thought it deserved a look. We took the metro one stop and got off about 3 blocks from the tower. It's imposing as you get close and we were excited to go up.You have two choices, one to go to the observation deck and an upgrade to go the top of the tower. We went to the top!!!The elevator ride from the observation tower to the top was with the price. It's hit a bump almost at the top and you freak out. And then you arrive and take pictures and go back down. Touristy yes, but a must do. Filled with other folks doing the same.The staff are so polite and nice. The four stars is just the very basic food and gift choices. Not much to do other than look at least for me. Epic views and pay for the upgrade. Eat somewhere else.

Stunning views of Tokyo after dark. We had the most amazing views of the Tokyo Tower from our hotel room and we decided to go and visit it after dark. The Tokyo Tower was open until 11pm the night we went so we spent a couple of hours there from 9pm taking photos and enjoying the views.There was a second viewing floor just one level down from the one we started on. They had pretty blue lights switched on there.We enjoyed it more than the newer and taller skytree primarily because Tokyo buildings seem so much closer and more impressive from the Tokyo Tower.

A good way to start your Tokyo trip. This place is a great start to your Tokyo adventure as it allows you to see the whole sprawling urban jungle that is Tokyo from the all directions. On a good day (this was not one for my experience) one can see Mt. Fuji in the distance unless it's cloudy. The price is a little steep but it's Japan so probably not the most expensive cool thing you'll do here. I would suggest to do your souvenir shopping downstairs once you come down on the 3rd floor is some great and sometimes better less expensive options on Tokyo tower items. Try the the custard filled pastry down here too it's delicious. Try to avoid during cloudy days as you'll be getting mostly gray skies.

Awesome panoramic views of Tokyo. Tokyo Tower is half the size of Tokyo Skytree.There are 2 observation decks, one at 150m & other at 250m. Tickets to these are available on the ground floor. Souvenir shop on 1st floor.Offers awesome panaromic views of Tokyo. On a clear day one can see as far as Mt.Fuji.There is a glass window to look through to the bottom.Illuminated at night. Looks similar to Eiffel tower!
Not quite the same as Paris but still worth the trip. We went at night time and it was great to see it lit up. Some of the shops are a bit tacky and there isn't the best selection of places to eat.

Nice copy of the Eiffel Tower, but still worth a visit.. This tower was modeled on the Eiffel Tower and stands at 333 metres tall, and still provides some great photo opportunities from the observation deck of the Tokyo skyline. At night it is lit up and even from a distance away looks pretty spectacular.Various attractions at the bottom of the tower including The One Piece Cartoon Museum which if your a fan you must go and look round. Souvenir shops and places to grab a drink and some snacks are also available.

Totally different as I image. The view from Tokyo Tower at night is great, I am sure about that.However, below and inside it.I must say "surprise"...Basically, there are several restaurants in side, and dozens of random shop, selling toys, souvenirs etc etc.The interior was very "cheap" designed feeling. Makes me feel that after Tokyo Skytree, Tokyo government already give up updating Tokyo Tower.

Spectacular!. Took the first lift up 150m to observation deck number 1. 360 degree views . Day was fairly overcast but could still a lot . This city skyline never ends!. Then took the second lift after a couple of flights of stairs up to next deck which us 250m up. Felt like we were up in the clouds . Well worth the money. 3200 yen for 2 of us.
Great vista. What a great way to see the sprawl that is Tokyo. The tower has two levels the higher level is well worth the extra yen. Not as exciting as Eifel but, you are not in France either.

Good Views at Tokyo Tower. We took the Oedo line and exited Akabanebashi. Then, it's a 5 minute walk to Tokyo Tower. We went on a Saturday morning in June. It opens at 9am, and we got there around 9:30am and it wasn't crowded. We paid 16,000 yen each to go to the Main Observatory and Special Observatory. The Main Observatory is 150 meters high, and then, we took another elevator to go to the Special Observatory, which is 240 meters high. The views were beautiful and we're glad that we got to go up Tokyo Tower during our visit.

Better at night. Japans attempt at the Eiffel Tower! Just over half the size of the Sky Tower, the views from TT are not as spectacular but it is worth seeing at night as opposed to a day trip. Also, be sure to walk around the shopping floors as there are always cool gifts knocking about that you may not find elsewhere. Definitely worth a stroll past if you don’t decide to go up to the observation deck.

Fantastic View. We went during daytime when it just opened and it was not too busy. For the nightview gives a different perspective and would likely be worth it. See Tokyo from many floors and photo op time. Shops on lower levels for you to buy gifts. Overall a tourist spot to hit in Tokyo. Not quite the Eiffel Tower but nevertheless great panoramic views.
Nice tall tower . It's a nice tall tower in the city. It has shops below and you can get tickets to get to the top. Although, I wasn't able to go up because there were too much people (Golden Week).

Highly recommend . I really enjoyed this landmark. You get a 360 degree view of Tokyo. At night the interior observatory spaces are decorated with lights and soft music plays. It's a nice environment. The view is truly incredible. It can get crowded at times but not unreasonably so.

Fun way to see the city!. Eiffel Tower in the middle of Tokyo! Visiting Tokyo Tower is kitschy, touristy - and fun! There's lots of little booths for great souvenirs in the building below the tower, and options for food (including the ever present crepes) and the ride up the tower is fun. The highlight of course is the view - which is stunning!!! Walk around the observation deck and you can see all over Tokyo. We went in the evening, when the lights were lovely. Take the extra ride to top observation deck - looking out the elevator at the girders on your way up. It's not for those afraid of heights! But at the top you are rewarded with even more spectacular views!

5/5 you must climb the tower. We got the 1600 yen ticket to climb the tower at the halfway point and at the top.You get to see the whole city of tokyo and on a good day, you might even see mount fujijust like the other towers ive been to theres a shop, a cafe, comfort rooms and elevatorstake note there is a ONE PIECE tokyo tower section which requires a different payment.

It's the first tower, but not so big. Compared to the Sky Tree, this tower is significantly smaller, however it is the original tower in Tokyo. We got the ticket as a part of the One Piece attraction or I don't think we would have spent the money. From the outside, it is very beautiful at night and I would highly suggest timing it to be there after dark. Keep you mind, you can take plenty of pictures from the outside and not pay to ascend the tower itself.

Top of Tokyo. Tokyo tower (made famous in the first Godzilla movie) is a worthwhile trip. From the observation floor on can see central Tokyo in all 360 degrees. We were impressed on how clean the city was, but from the tower one can see that even the roofs are maintained.

The best!. It is not as high as Dubai, but due to it's construction it gives you a much better experience of height. The second deck is less spectacular even though is has a small piece of glass floor.

Nice skyline from 150m. (Or 250m.). One more oportunity in Tokyo to admire sky line for an afordable price. ¥900 adults. If you want to go to the top (250m.) you have to pay extra ¥900. Well organised parking and queue, 5min.waiting to go up on a saturday afternoon, so good for us !!

The Tokyo from the Centre. Nice view. Enchanting building but slowly being surrounded by taller buildings. Historically the is Japan's Eiffel Tower and represented Japan's eagerness to be recognised as a European equal.

Tokyo Tower Tour. We went as part of our tour through JTB Tours (Dynamic Tokyo). Great to visit with a guide and have the commentary which adds so much but for those able to navigate their own way, much more to see. You can pay extra to go to a higher vantage point. Tokyo Skytree is much higher I am told.
A must see in Tokyo!. Not much to say about this place. It speaks for itself. You MUST see this and travel up to the top if you visit Tokyo. Great pictures of the city. A must visit.

Fun for the price. Came around 6pm on a weekday and waited maybe 2 mins for the next elevator. My friends and I really enjoyed the view, and it was fun taking photos and seeing Tokyo from different angles. It wasn't that crowded, and if I wanted to get close to the glass at a certain spot, I'd usually only have to wait a minute or two for that area to clear up.My only two gripes were that a lot of the windows were pretty grimy and they used the top portion of some of the windows to project some images onto while they played kind of irritating loud music. The gift shop was kind of cute although nothing to get super excited about. They sold a lot of Tokyo tower themed merchandise, of course, like cookies, charms, postcards, etc. Overall I enjoyed my time there and feel that the price was worth it. In my opinion it's the kind of place you only have to visit once to soak up the experience.

Just another Eiffel Tower? No, it's not!. I actually live in France under or around an hour from Eiffel Tower so you might think "oh wow, this guy might as well skip this place" but no. Sure, it's based off the Eiffel Tower but it's got so much more to do in my opinion. It has a lot of shops and restaurants actually under the tower, multiple floors of shopping, even an aquarium that I didn't go to though. If you're a fan of the manga/anime One Piece, you'll find that there's an entire section dedicated to One Piece. Set with a cafe, buffet, and boutique full of One Piece. Also at the time I went, they had a yearly Milky Way illumination going on, where they light up the stairpath and bottom observatory with blue lights and it's just real beautiful. I'd say this is definitely a not-to-miss place to visit while in Tokyo.
Pretty good. Needless to say a bit of a tourist trap but still worth it, there are two levels we only did the first as you kinda get the idea.

Long way down!. We visited during the day, and there were no crowds, so went straight up in the lift. The views from the top are great, but I think I'd rather see them at night with all the lights. The perspex section on the walkway gives a good idea of the height you have climbed (if you're brave enough to stand on it!).You have no alternative but to exit via the huge merchandise/souvenir section. Beware of the sliding doors - one of our group had her hand shut in it.Another tourist attraction ticked off the list...
Just another Tower. It is Just another Tower, like many others in Big cities Around the world. Nothing really espetial there

Tokyo tower experience . Pretty easy to get tickets on the spot and no hassle of getting in. Lifts are to the top and not to the bottom (lucky we had strollers and they had to take us- otherwise stairs ). From mid point only 1 lift up and there is a bit of a queue there and back. Didn't spend much time up the top as it's pretty small space so mostly just waiting in line to go back down. Very similar to Eiffel tower (I think that's what they going for anyways). Plenty if souvenirs, which we thought were reasonably priced.

Tokyo tower. Been there, done that.. I haven't been to Tokyo tower for almost 9 years. The admission is 900yen now. Went to the main observatory, nothing much has changed.Still has the lookdown windows and the 360 degrees view of Tokyo.I was there at 4pm on a Wednesday. Very quiet, not many people.Tokyo Tower is one of the major tourist attractions in Japan but somehow it loses its charm along the years.

a long walk from Roppongi. After dining at Gonpachi in Roppongi, we opted to walk to this landmark to let the sake wear off. The tower really looks better at night. There is also this covered walk which is hung with thousands of white and candle-hued LED light strings.

Stunning. Beautiful, especially at night. Reminded me of an Eiffel Tower, just a bit smaller. A great sight to see in Tokyo. There are two levels. If you want you can go all the way up, or stop half way through. Either way you can catch some breathtaking views of the city.

Just ok.... It's a bit of a walk to the tower from the nearest stations (I'd recommend a taxi especially if you have little ones with you). Presented some nice photo ops from the outside. We visited mid-day and didn't go up being that we had already visited the Govt Bldg and Skytree.

The original in Tokyo. Decided to visit Tokyo Tower partially for nostalgia and for the views. Nostalgia in that my family and I visited the Tower back when I was seven years old, and for the views of Tokyo. Prior to the Tokyo Tower, I went to the Tokyo Skytree, which is taller and newer. But the lines were longer and the cost was more ¥2,060 versus ¥900 to go to the observation deck. Well, the views from Tokyo Tower didn't disappoint and the smaller crowds make it more memorable. To get there, I used the Toei-Asakusa line to the Daimon station, and then it's a 10-15 minutes walk to the Zōjō-ji Temple first. From there, it's another 10 minutes or so. It's not as glitzy as Skytree with its many restaurants and huge shopping mall. But It does have more character, I thought. It was a nice visit.
Eiffel Tower is much better. I personally prefer Eiffel Tower after I visited Tokyo Tower. But still, I still happy to see it when I taking the shuttle or walking around the city.

Overrated. Let me start out by saying that this is not a horrible experience, HOWEVER, I do think it is greatly overrated. A few of the detracting features of the tower include smallish windows that are tinted oddly making taking unobstructed, clear pictures a little difficult; cheesy music and bright blue lights while you are on the observation levels that are distracting; in order to get to the very top, it requires buying two separate tickets in different lines which can be a pain when it is busy; and outside lights get turned off sporadically which ruins the outside aesthetics. Overall, I would highly recommend saving yourself the lines and going to one of the fabulous observation bars or restaurants whose views are spectacular and the ambiance is much better.
Beautiful at Night .. Awesome illumination . Nice at sunset or in the evening . Def worth a visit or a walk around the area nearby ( zojoji temple ).
Great. It's a great experience for someone who doesn't suffer from acrophobia. The tower is a replica of the Eiffel Tower and gives breathtaking views of Tokyo.
Fantastic night view of the tower from our hotel lobby!. Night light reflection of the tower is amazing with rainbow projections. It is easily accessible by subway. Lots of gardens nearby.

What a view. Even though this day was a bit rainy and overcast you could see the city pretty wellThey say on a clear day you can see Fuji-san.Go to the special observatory at the top for an even better view.For the anime / manga fans there is a "One Piece" extravaganza and shop there too.Food and shopping on the ground level.

Make some great pictures !. You don't need to pay to get great shots of it, even being beneath it will make some great pictures.I really recommand seeing it when the sunset begins, it lights up with the sky and will make some great shots !

Nice romantic place.. Nice place to get a great view of the city at night. The wait in line both up and down can be a bit long and the A/C did not work very well in the area you wait to go up but once you get to the top, it is worth it. Till you have to wait to go down which took longer than going up!

Tokyo Tower - Great Views of Tokyo City. Located in Minato, at a walking distance from the Hamamatsucho station (JR Line), Daimon Station (Metro- line).It is the second tallest structure in Japan at around 334 meters height.There is an entry fee. Ideally, its best to visit during the late hours in the night at around 9.00 P.M to avoid rush, catch a glimpse of the magnificently lit Tokyo city in the night time.
Nice visit at night. Visited to eat nearby one night, so saw in daylight and then at night.Lovely setting lit up but a bit of a copy of Eiffel Tower in Paris I think!

Good view. Pretty good view. They had a clear plate of glass that you could stand on - it was scary! There is a "One Piece" exhibition. My nephew is a fan of one piece so it added to the value of going there.

Visit if you have time. As other reviewers stated, it gives you a birds eye view of Tokyo however this is all weather permitting. The day we visited clouds were low so we stayed on the lower deck to be able to see.

Excellent bird's eye view of Tokyo. Definite worth it! Especially on a sunny day - apparently you can see Mt Fuji if it is really clear. We paid an extra Y700 (adults) to access the special observatory deck. It was worth it and gives you a lot better views

Great view of Tokyo on a clear day. Lots of people (tourists mostly) in wait for entering. Pricy visit, but if you wish to have a view of Tokyo then do it.We did not go there this time - I have been there before, and my companion was not happy to go high up! So we saw it from several places in Tokyo since it dominates the view if you are in the area close to the tower.Looks from the distance as a copy of the Eiffel Tower - it is nicely illuminated at night time.

Excellent view of Great Tokyo. We visited Tokyo Tower in the middle of the week in late May, and there were hardly any queues, and plenty of time to observe the view on both observation levels. The staff were welcoming and kind, and the views phenomenal! You really get a sense of how great Tokyo is - from East to West, North to South, the city doesn't seem to have an end. Tokyo Tower also have a large souvenir section with all sorts of exciting goods, as well as some of the finest looking lavatories I've seen in all of Tokyo.It really felt like an exclusive experience, and well worth the ticket price.
Great views . Tokyo tower has great views over Tokyo. I felt sick looking up from it on the ground but from above I was fine. I also like how's it's designed like the Eiffel Tower.
Go there. A great look at the Great Tokyo region and the surroundings are also worth the trip. You will like this I am sure...

Japan's iconic Tower. We went there around 4pm, just in time to see the city before dark and before the city lights and the tower itself was lit. While walking to the tower, I can’t help but take a lot of photos just to get the perfect angle of the picturesque tower in front of me. Since we were there late afternoon, the lines to the ticketing counter were manageable already with just a little less than 15min. Of course, it's not just the city that has magnificent light. Even the tower itself is very gorgeous at night. The observation area has tall glass windows offering a 360-degree panoramic view of the Tokyo skyline. This breathtaking views made me speechless! This is indeed a worthwhile activity when you're in Japan.
Great views of course. Be prepared for long queues and packed lifts. If you don't mind waiting the views on a clear day are unreal

Fly cruise to Japan. Always wanted to go to Japan , but over £3000 for ten days ,not cheap , saw an advert in the paper for travelbag ,you fly to Hong Kong , pick up the ship then cruise Japan ending in Tokyo , £1400. So at that price I took my son with me and stayed four days in Tokyo total 14 days it came out , just under £3000 , so landed in Hong Kong had two days one night there , then picked up the princess cruise ship , 14 decks ,wow , sailed down to Taiwan , then over to Japan , went to four ports , then ended up in Tokyo I paid for extra two days in the capital , what an amazing city I loved Tokyo tower great view over the capital and you can see Mount Fuji , went in spring too so snow on Fuji and cherry blossom , food great people fantastic , I will go back ,

Excellent city view. This is a great place to visit to take a look at the city view. The night and day scenes are different and are both worth a visit. There are 2 ticket options depending on the final level which you are entitled to stop. There is a photobooth which is worth a short visit for a great souvenir snapshot. This majestic tower is an awesome view itself even before i stepped into the tower.
Good views. Since the sky tree had a long wait time we went to Tokyo tower. It was great. No queues. Great views! Kids loved the little floor window with a view of the base.

tourist attraction. This is one of the mail attractions in Tokyo. Looks great after the sunset and can be seen from miles away.. One can see this from any of the multistorey building. Lot of bars and retaurant around the area

Overall experience is average. Maybe I'm being too harsh, but although the Tokyo Tower is huge and dominates the skyline, I find going to this and similar other landmarks kind of a waste of time and money. You pay to sit in a huge line (which the day I went was a national holiday so it took me 3 hours) only to be taken to the top of a building, look at a view, snap a few pictures and 4 or 5 hours later you've really not accomplished much. Maybe I'm just being bitter, but I would likely not return.

Night time view of Tokyo!!. What a way to see Tokyo at night...great views of the city...not great if you dont like heights of course...but if you are brave or dont mind being so high then..go and enjoy it..really is amazing.

Terrible weather but still great!. We went on a day that it rained ALL day. Therefore the tower was pretty quiet. It was however still a great view of Tokyo. The process of getting up there was very simple and the place was very clean. There were little tourist shops both at the observation deck and at the bottom. A must do when you come to Tokyo!

holiday. loved Tokyo tower, it was a lovely clear day when we visited so got great views all round. and luckily it wasn't too busy to move around inside. we had a snack lunch at the café, average prices for food, quick service. shops if you wanted to buy thing's to remember your visit.

Great bird's eye view of the city. There's two observation decks at Tokyo Tower. The view from the top observatory gives you an awesome view of Tokyo. On a clear day, you can see Mt. Fuji. Make sure you stop by the gift shop to get your souvenir stamp of Tokyo Tower. I also like the outfit the staff are wearing. It really makes me think of the storybook "Madeline in Paris".
Simply breathtaking. It's simply breathtaking. It is absolutely wort to go up. Go for the 150 and also 250 m observatory. You will never regret.
awesome view!!. beacause of this place i feel like i fell in love in this city. Tokyo is the most amazing city i have ever visited!

Best View of Tokyo. The tokyo Tower reminds you of the Eiffel. The view from the top most observatory is breathtaking! The Eiffel is still a lot beyyer because it does hhave a charm of its own and the Tokyo tower looks a lot like a copy. Go up just for the view but!
Day trip Tokyo Tower. Good view of the surroundings. Cheaper entrance fee compared to Tokyo Skytree Tower. Zojoji Temple is 5 mins walk away. If possible go for the night visit.
Magnificent Tokyo. If visiting Tokyo the tower is a must with it's magnificent views around the city, you will be amazed at how big Tokyo is.

Worth the trip up. I am afraid of height, however the elevator heading up toward the observation deck does not make scare at all. It was very smooth, and before you know it you're there. If I had known that I would have gone all the way to the top observation deck. Go there at night, and starting on June 1st they always have a light show at the observation deck.

Good but not great . Tokyo tower or as we called Eiffel Tower in Tokyo . Good enough great views of the city . We went a night the lights where amazing Lots of souvenir to buy, lots if the normal tourist swagWasn't that much to go up and when we went the upper deck was not open Should you see it.. Yes but don't be surprise if you go "that was ok" and that's how I felt about it It wasn't that much to go up so do it Photo is from one of our hotel rooms

Fun Activity Even on Cloudy Day. Your eyes aren't fooling you-- the Eiffel Tower has come to Tokyo! Well, almost. The Tokyo Tower is higher than the one in France and is a bright RED. You pay a lot for the experience, so take your time and soak it in. Little children might be bored just looking at buildings, but the adults and teenagers will like it.
Try and go on a clear day. The tower offers a great view of the city. A Shinto shrine is located on the second floor of the Main Observatory.

A-OK. our hotel was next to the tower so we figured to give it a shot. two levels of observation deck at 150m and 250m for 1600 y (about 15 USD). the service was impeccable as usual. we went in the morning so the crowd was also minimum. the problem was, there was really nothing to see in terms of tokyo sky line. there weren't many skyscrapers and most of the city was really quit flat. in fact, we also went up to the government building (for free) and was pretty disappointed with the view.

Holiday Tokyo. We went here in the morning to view the spectacular Tokyo and yes it was, gorgeous view of Tokyo. And also we went here in the evening as well, to see a different view afar the magnificient tower. Elevators are excellentlly fast, restrooms took me forever and the whole area is jam packed with foreigners and i've got my souvenier too, it was a good holiday in Tokyo Tower, could be better. I just want to sit and enjoy the view but no seats are available.

Ok, it's no Eiffel Tower, but . . . .. Near the Roppongi Hills, the Tokyo Tower is certainly imposing if not all that graceful. Completed in 1958 and standing 333 metres high it is somewhat younger than its French rival and was built to transmit television signals. Great views though from the observation deck

Worth a visit on a clear day. The tower offers a great view of the city. We were on a tour and this was included so tickets were all organised. There really isn't much more than the view but would recommend.

Just a copy of Eiffel tower nothing special. Looks nice at night.. But nothing special.. Didn't climb up there.. You can go on top.. View is supposed to be good.. But didn't do that.. Saw it from a little distance..

A landmark of Tokyo is still worth visiting especially at night!!. Tokyo Tower has been the landmark of Tokyo for long time. Even after the taller Tokyo SkyTree was created, the Tokyo Tower is still worth visiting especially at night, because of the beauty of the view since it's located in the center of the city, compared with the SkyTree. Lower level(250m) costs 900 yen, while higher level(350m) costs 1600 yen. It's cheaper than the Tokyo SkyTree of which lower level(350m) costs 2,060 yen and higher level(450m) costs 3,090 yen. Four subway stations are close to Tokyo Tower. From Shinjuku or Roppongi, you take Toei Subway Oedo Line to Akabanebashi station and walk 5 min from there. From Asakusa, you take Toei Asakusa Line, and from Shinagawa, you take Keikyu Line/Toei Subway Asakusa Line, to Daimon station, and walk 10 min from there. It's also 6 min walk from Toei Mita Line Onarimachi station and 7 min walk from Metro Hibiya Line Kamiyacho station.

Awesome View from Tokyo Tower. During our recent visit to Tokyo we visited the Tokyo Tower and loved it. It was a lovely clear day so we had great views of the city and beyond. We probably spent about a good hour on the observation deck checking out all the different aspects. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Tokyo.
Not bad place to be seen. Not bad place to be seen.Queue is quite long but people are just amazing.Tokyo from the Tower can be observed 360 and its really good.
Nice view . There's a nice view of the downtown area. But expect to pay more if you want to go to the higher level. So I thought that was misleading. But the view from the lower level was just fine.

Great View!. A copy of Eiffel tower, this looks more beautiful at night. You need to purchase ticket, choose between two observatory deck with higher deck offer better view at a higher price. Worth spending that kind of money, remember to check-out downward glass view (bit scary).

Nice views, well priced. Good alternative for the Skytree, which is very expensive. You can go up to the second level for about half of what the Skytree costs. Do either one or the other, no point in doing both.
Amazing night view. I visited this place at night time, and the view was awesome. It will be best if you enjoy the view while having a little drink in the tower's cafe

It's like the Eiffel tower....when you get there you are like, that was cool.. I think this beauty is much better viewed from a rooftop bar, street level, or the Skytree tower. You can walk by it and you do not really have to go in. I was not very impressed and it's no longer the tallest building so its unclear why it's such an attraction. It adds a lot to the skyline. If you have some free time or if its a part of a larger tour then it's worth seeing. Otherwise, I'd have to say walk by it. Take a few picture. But keep your money and go to Skytree instead.
Nothing special. This place will give one a view of the City....otherwise a typical visitor area with souvenir shops, some food and not much exciting here

Interesting, but too "old". Almost every big city in the world has its own high tower or building with breathtaking views. Tokyo tower offers this, but in old fashioned way. Little technology is used and it seems Tokyo Skytree has left the tower behind and is now a better (although far) option.

Must see, it´s a Tokyo landmark and worth visiting. For 7,50 EUR per person a rather cheap and nice experience of this old and beautiful structure with excellent views. The SkyTree costs twice that amount. Skinjuku´s govermnent twin towers offer even free excellent views.
Nice experience. Get on during nights. You will be able to see city lights. You are able to get city overview. Although I feel the ticket rates for this tower visit are very high.

Great view but awful lines. I went up the tower at the end o long day walking around the city with my girlfriend. It was a great view and definitely worth doing especially at night and is reasonably priced. However the extra money to go all the way to the top I wouldn't say is particularly necessary. It is only an additional 100 metres so the view isn't that much different and the line to go up and then back down just got ridiculous as the second elevator was incredibly small so this made it take a lot longer then it needed.

Check it out. Our number one must see in Tokyo was the Sky Tree. But as we were staying nearby, we were also keen to check out Toyko's original skyscraper, Japan's Eiffel Tower. Greeted by plastic models of the Tokyo Tower's two mascots named Noppon, we had to wait for the tower to open at 9am. We paid to go to the large and the main observatory 1600 yen (about $16 in May 2016). Its well worth the trip if you like towers / skyscrapers. It was hazy when we were up there but the views of Eastern Tokyo were still worth it. There is a restaurant, aquarium and some great hawker stores in Foot Town. Outside is a pleasant beer garden. Well worth a trip coupled with the Zojo-ji temple close by

Tokyo's answer to the Eiffel Tower. Picturesque structure, especially at night. Viewing platforms available, but having viewed Tokyo from the Metropolitan Building 42nd floor this would have seemed a little tame.
Worth a visit.. Not a bad spot they had live music and snack bar when I went. Good sight seeing spot. Beer garden outside for after, or before.

Sight seeing adventure . We decided to go to tokyo tower to see if the view was any different from the government building. It is a little but due to tokyos smoggy nature you really cant see that far.Definitely pay to go to the very top if you go.Try and aim for a clear day if you can.There is other things to see in the area. You can do real life mario kart near here if you bring an international drivers license look out for them on the street.

Cool view of the city . Very touristy but worth a look. Very cool sites from the top. We were there at night and could see for miles. The only downside is they pack you into a small elevator to get to the top and then charge you again for entrance to the "special" observatory.

good view and reasonable cost. It's always fun to go to the top of tall buildings or towers to see the views. Like climbing a mountain because it's here. When this was built it was the tallest tower in the world but now that Tokyo is a land of high rises you can get great views from other spots. Currently ranking at #22 in the world, in1958 it edged out the Eiffel Tower built in 1889, which it copied, by 8 meters. While not nearly as spectacular as the Eiffel Tower either, which stands like a monolith in a vast park, towering over the much lower city around it, Tokyo Tower nevertheless gets you up well enough to see the massive and endless city of skyscrapers stretched around it. Also close to the bay, you get a good view in that direction.Cheaper than the Tokyo Sky Tree, which almost doubles it in height, I have been up here 2x on two separate trips. Years ago when I stayed in Shinjuku we went to the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building there (free and higher than TT observation deck) and as it was winter the air was clear and the great Fuji-san rose majestic in the distance. But this last time when I went up it was a bit hazy, hence Fuji was invisible. Nonetheless it was cool to see my hotel below, Zojo-ji, and the city I had been exploring on foot.

Nice view of the city. Try to pick a clear day. Tokyo can get very hazy and the higher you go it doesn't get any better. We lucked out and could almost see Mt. Fugi.Got some great picture of the hotel

High up in the sky. We loved it up there, Our family was able to see Mount Fuji from the main platform and also lots of other amazing sites. This is a great little trip if you want to see Tokyo from above. Affordable and hassle free!

Great views . The Tokyo Tower is a great tourists attraction.Initially we were headed for the Tokyo Skytree. But my traveling companions thought u meant the Tokyo tower.Great views on all levels of the tower. Looking through the floor window was a novelty.

After more than 50 years this is still amuse see in Tokyo. This iconic landmark is a great way to gain perspective of this amazing city. If you go in daylight on a clear day you can spot many landmarks and the vastness of this city will amaze you.

Forget Effel tower. First things first its taller than the Eiffel tower, its brighter than the Eiffel tower and whats more its way cheaper than the Eiffel tower, and most importantly there are no pick pockets or beggars waiting for you to arrive. Go on a normal working day and there are small queues, on a clear day you can see Mt Fuji as well.
its just a landmark in Tokyo. its just a landmark in Tokyo, a place for photoshooting. however it cant compare with Paris Eiffel Tower.

First Views of Tokyo. It was a bright sunny day when we visited the tower. As it was our first day in the city, it was a good introduction to the layout of the city, including many of the sights in the distance (Mt. Fuji). It has the usual cheap souvenirs for sale, and once around the viewing platform is usually enough. The tower has been superseded by an even higher tower, but this is not in the centre of the city.

Lol...Why..? . Hey...Why would one come to Tokyo and want to see a bad replica of Eiffel tower.? This actually is a communications tower that has been converted into a Eiffel look alike. I would recommend that you don't especially plan a visit to the tower. It is not worth it. The tower is visible from almost half the city. Rappongi hills provide a great view. Can be given a miss.

Should see it. There is the main observatory level which offers a great view of surrounding Tokyo. You can go further up but then you'll need to purchase another ticket to the special observatory level for an extra 700yen.Going at sunset is recommended for some great photos.

Great view of the city!. This is a great place to visit at the start of your trip to see the whole city! You don't need too much time here, but it's definitely a standout landmark in the Tokyo skyline that is worth visiting!
its a tower (duh). in my view not really worth going to as there really isn't that much that you cant see from the taxi in passing by....
Not the Eiffel Tower. A cool tower that has a viewing area.This local landmark lights up the city and really stands out.Totally go by during the day and again at night to take pictures.

Great views. This was one location, my husband/travel partner definitely enjoyed. The views were breathe taking and the service great. Definitely worth visiting. We only spent 2 nights in Tokyo and this gave us a birds eye view of Tokyo from one location.

Great View. The view was breathtaking. You can really see so much of Tokyo. I suggest you guys to go here at night so you can see the lights. There is also a lookdown window at the floor that you can walk on. Don't worry, it's safe. One of the best places I went to!
Part of the tour. Really not worth going if it's not part of your tour. Go check out the tallest building Tokyo Skytree instead. This tower was packed with tours and school kids when I visited.

An must visit first in Tokyo. The tower is a great place to get a good lay of the land for all the rest of the things to see in Tokyo. A clear day is a big advantage. There is a separate entrance if you are happy to pay a bit more to avoid the queue, find the red carpet!
really enjoyed the tower. the views from tower are awesome. Will say I wish we had one at night, I can only imagine the views with Tokyos lights, and they have a night time light and lasar show.
Must see. Icon of Tokyo. Mayby old and looks small next to skytree but still it is stunning. Good option is go on viewing deck but not a must. In my opinion roppongi hill is better choice. I

Great view of Tokyo. I would recommend going to the Tokyo Tower when it's dark. The view of the tower itself was great, but the view from the Sky-Deck was stunning.We went up the spend our time taking pictures and enjoying the view of this fantastic city.We also had a quick dinner in the ground floor and well, it's kind of a food court surrounded by a lot of souvenir stalls. But at least, you can walk past them without being harassed to buy something.
On a good day, go. On a bad day, avoid. Nice tourist attractive with amazing views. If the weather is good, check it out. Make sure you go on both viewing platforms.
Not worth the visit. Have seen better city views during my visit to Kuala Lumpur and Sydney and the views from the observation tower was nothing to die for

great metropolitan view of tokyo!. You can view the entire Tokyo metropolitan in the sky-deck. If the weather is good, u can even see Mt Fuji from far, doesn't it sound great? Many cheap souvenirs can be found at the ground-floor souvenir stalls.

360 View. An easy walk from most places in this side of the river and city. Safe during the day or evening. Great views from the viewing decks over the whole city. Well worth the effort to go and see. Shops and eating places easily available all round the tower
Night time is a must!. Would highly recommend going to see the Tokyo Tower at night, I think it is truely stunning as it shines yellow/gold. The white/red of the daytime just isn't the same
Great views. Beautiful views, even on an overcast day. The tickets are pricey and there are probably cheaper ways to get this vantage point, but the 360 degree views are excellent.

Bird's eye view. Like the Eiffel Tower of Paris. This tower gives you a bird's eye view of the whole city. The Tokyo architecture of it's new buildings is impressive and like Paris you desire to walk among them. They sell an assortment of unnecessary gifts that are cheap and fun!
Lovely tower. Great view , well worth the visit. Not to bad for people who have a fear of height either. Gives you an insight to what Toyko looks like.

Bigger than the Eiffel Tower. Shopping here was pretty good, but the tower itself was underwhelming the day we went due to a hazy sky. The wait times to go up and down the tower can be quite long. Also, there's about 40 stairs between the main deck and the special deck before you get another elevator, so people with reduced mobility may have difficulty. All in all it didn't seem worth the money, but it was fun to visit such an iconic place and see the huge city unrolling off into all horizons.

Towering fun. Tokyo tower is taller that the Eiffel Tower. One should know this if taking a guided tour. This is a great place to visit, and on a clear day, you might get lucky & see the Mt. Fuji from here.Worth a visit if a tourist, as you get a panoramic view of the city & a glimpse of Yokohama as well. The glass floor gives you the jitters. A base ball is showcased, which was found while repairing. Interesting story.
Tokyo tower. Went for a walk to the tower and the nearby temple, to be honest didn't bother going up the tower but the walk and surrounds very pleasant.
Good view!. Before there were other attractions in this tower, now you only left to see the top view and shopping.

Great views of Tokyo, kids enjoyed it.. Tokyo Tower was walking distance from our hotel, Shiba Park. The kids enjoyed the walk there and the ride up to the viewing platform. You get great views of the city and it is not as crowded as the Sky Tree. The Tower is lit up at night so nice for photos. Kids enjoyed an icecream at the base of the tower.

Great view from a historical place. I enjoyed this tower more than the sky tree. Was less busy and just felt more like Japan than the new modern tower. Was fun searching for the street below that's shaped like the tower. You can see the sky tree from here too. Foot town was a little disappointing. Smaller than expected and each stall had almost the same things.
Red Eiffel tower of Tokyo. The line up was too long to wait to go up, but facilities around were clean and well staffed. Bathrooms were clean and line-up free!

Older but more charming!. Though much older than the taller and more trendy Tokyo Skytree, Tokyo Tower is still a charming and fun attraction in its own right, and cheaper as well. The view of the Tower from the outside is still beautiful, the steel construction set against the grey of Tokyo or the skies is still worth a look (and a snapshot).Observation deck views are great as well, and there's an added bonus of live music performers on Wednesday and Thursday nights, if you want to experience more of the charm and culture of Tokyo.Additionally the shops and restaurants at the base of the tower are great as well. The new attraction, Tokyo One Piece Tower, is definitely worth a visit for fans of anime, especially if a fan of One Piece.
Great view. A bit expensive when compared with the new Tree Tower but still good view for another area of Tokyo.
BEAUTIFUL AT NIGHT. I found that during the say there is not too much to look at. However at night is is quite beautiful to look at

Top Tokyo Tourist Attraction. Sure, it's just a tower and not even the tallest in the city, but it's a fun experience! This tower was built 69 years after the Eiffel tower (which inspired the design), and it's about 30 feet taller. Visiting after sunset is certainly preferrable, not just to see the city and tower lights, but also the art projected on the windows inside. I waited about 25 minutes in line on a March weeknight, but I imagine a busy weekend could be much longer. Schedule accordingly!

Fantastic view of city. Even on a slightly cloudy day we had a great view of the city.We went to the main viewing platform but you can go up higher for an extra cost. There is plenty of information regarding the buildings available in English.Then go down one flight and there is further information and for the brave..glass viewing windows which you can stand on and look straight down. The down lift takes you to a shopping opportunity on the way down.A must whilst in Tokyo!
It changes color after closing hour. When i arrived it was covered in red-dotted lights, when I was about to leave, the tower changes to orange-lit.

Beautiful sight at night . We only had 2 full days in Japan so we decided to go here instead of Tokyo Tree. Line was not bad when we went. I recommend going there close to sunset so you can enjoy the tower during the day and night time. The tower was stunning when it was lit up...reminded me of the Eiffel Tower. You can also get a nice view of Tokyo up on top. Definitely recommend visiting here.

Nice view of Tokyo at night. We visited in April beginning. The weather was cool and sky clear on the day we visited. The tower is easily approachable by subway.The tower gets illuminated at night and that is when you should visit. There are many food stalls at the bottom. When we went it was not much crowded. The views from the top are very nice.It is like any other tower in a big metropolis. But it is nice to visit.If you have time you can visit it is worth the money you spend.
Wonderful. Nice view from the top .... Worth the visit if you are in Tokyo. A lot of stalls/shops at the ground floor. A nice place to spend for the afternoon.
View. What a amazing view from the Tokyo Tower, I didn't know where to stand and start taking photos. Unfortunately the we were there it was cloudy, normally you can see Mt Fuji.

Iconic. Whilst in Tokyo, there is a list of at least 632 things that you must do/see/eat... I cannoteven count nor recall how many times I've been to Tokyo, but I still have not done/seen/eaten everything that's on that "must do" list! It may never be possible to accomplish all, or even half, of those goals. But one thing that is very easy and convenient and affordable is Tokyo Tower. It's one of the 10 or so most iconic images of Japan (along with Mt. Fuji, ramen, sumo, and Hello Kitty).... It's a lovely attraction, and when you're there - you can have your own personal post card made. They take your picture, and superimpose it over the backdrop of the tower, with fire works and stuff. People who rate Tokyo Tower as "terrible" are probably people who don't have much joy in their lives. You know those miserable, negative types. You might encounter some of them on your next trip. They're easy to identify, with that constant grimace of hate painted all over their faces.
Worth a visit to get the lay of the land!. Worth a visit to get the lay of the land!Fun.Cool.Not for those scared of heights.Take the glass elevator to the too-totally worth it!

Great attraction to visit. We visited Tokyo in April and the Tower was not far from our hotel, we went in the evening, there was no waiting times but we didn't go all the way to the top. We had already been to the other observatory decks and didn't see the need. Got to see Tokyo from different perspective with not being as high up. Tickets aren't expensive 900¥ (£6), extra if you want to go higher though. The area around the tower is pleasant, crepe stand outside and souvenir shops inside. Nice way to spend the evening and pick up strawberry hearts and Tokyo banana cakes.
City view at night. Much better if you can come at night. You can see beautiful light in Tokyo. Tokyo Tower have 3 lv. and each lv have different admission fee
Visit April 2016. For a panoramic view of Tokyo, although not the highest tower is still a must. Beautiful structure handicapped facilities.

Fantastic view of Tokyo. You probably know by now that visiting Japan is generally expensive. However the visit up to the viewing area of Tokyo Tower is not that expensive in comparison....$20-$30 depending on whether or not you want the express line. Once your up the top it's standing room only...literally, there is no general seating. The 360 degrees view of Tokyo are outstanding and well worth the effort. Movement up and down the tower is relatively smooth considering the number of people visiting and the staff facilitating this are very good. Yes, there is a wait but that's life. For me, this is a must do in Tokyo.
Nice View. It´s a good place to have a nice view!There are also a good place to buy gifts and take a coffee!!!

Cool and Crowded. We went to Tokyo Tower because of it's history (To be honest, we wanted to go to Tokyo Skytree) but it was fine with a 360degree view of Tokyo but it was real crowded especially when lots of Field Trips occur at once. It is not a must when you go to Tokyo.

We loved Tokyo. If you would like to see Tokyo by night, here is the best place to go in the evening. The views from the rooftop were breaktaking and very beautiful. This tower can be seen mostly everywhere in the stunning city

Good but not the best. Although Tokyo Tower gives good views over the city, this is certainly not the best place to get a nice overview. I would go to the Tokyo observatory deck or the Tokyo Skytree to really get a nice view. Tokyo Tower is a little bit too hyped and too expensive as well..

A really nice place to visit Tokyo for a morning or afternoon!. We made Tokyo Tower our first stop on a Saturday in Tokyo. It was an easy subway ride from our hotel in Ginza and the lines were not long at all. An outstanding view of Tokyo, an amazing city, and really good ice cream in the little restaurant on the lower deck!! Stopped an had lunch before we got here and then off to Shibuya for the evening!!

Great View. We had fun at the Tokyo Tower. We visited during the night so we had a great view of the city lights. You are able to stand on glass/plexi glass panels on the floor of the observation level. The tower itself looks beautiful all lit up. We were fortunate enough to be able to have dinner at Tofuya Ukai located near the base of the tower afterwards. Their gardens and grounds are just as impressive as their restaurant. It was a nice way to finish up our day of sightseeing.
Good option, but no a must. The views from the top are very nice, but it is definitely not a must in Tokyo, you can see the tower from various points of the city.

Come here to avoid the crowds at the Skytree!. To be completely honest, we can to the Tokyo Tower by mistake. As it turned out, we were wanting to go to the Skytree, but asked the concierge for directions to the Tokyo Tower (forgot there were two "towers") by mistake. And we did not originally plan to visit either tower, but it had rained the day before so the skies were clear and sunny, we decided it would be a great chance to look at the city.The view at the Tokyo Tower did not disappoint. We even saw Mt Fuji, was was really awesome! There was almost no waiting at the Tower. The whole time, I kept thinking, "where is everyone". From the Tower, we saw the Skytree and realized that's where we wanted to go. We did go, since it was such a beautiful day. There were soooo many more people at the Skytree! The regular line was going to take 40 minutes to an hour, so we paid extra for the express line, which took about 10 minutes. We did not go all the way to the top (had to pay extra). While the Skytree is very impressive, if all you want is a great view of Tokyo, you should consider the Tower instead. Shorter lines (no lines when we were there) and cheaper but still very good views. (We did not go to the top of the Skytree but did go to the top of the Tower, so we can't comment about that).

Very good views. Visited as part of our group tour. There was quite a line waiting for the lifts but the staff quickly processed the queues. The views of Tokyo were very good, but this is subject to the weather conditions at the time of your visit. There are plenty of souvenir shops and food outlets on the ground floor.

Great views. We were surprised to find we could see all the way to the bay islands. Our son enjoyed watching the planes. The lift was quite rickety, especially to the top level - nerve-wracking! The glass floor sections were good fun.

aerial view of central tokyo. A copy of Paris' eiffel tower but of course is in central tokyo... not as crowded as the Paris Eiffel tower but has lots to offer... souvenirs shops, coffee shops and observatory where you can see aerial views of tokyo from up above...Love the see through glass where you can look down through the glass... good place to visit...I think you can see mt fuji from afar too!
Beautiful scenery. A famous Tokyo tower in the Japanese drama. Finally got a chance to visit here. Like the view here especially looking the Tokyo bay.
A must visit place in Tokyo. Great views of the city from the two viewing galleries. The staff who manned the lifts were very gracious and helpful. Amazing sights of the city.

Good lay of the land on a sunny day. This was our first stop on a very sunny day in Tokyo. We had incredible views of Tokyo. Apparently, it is best to go when they first open 9am.
