There was very little wait. There were many school children and a couple of groups of tourists, but overall was easy to navigate and not crowded. The drawback for us was navigating the Tokyo metro and JR during rush hour. That was also an experience. Definitely should be a stop on the Tokyo visit.
Magnificent Tower in the heart of Tokyo!. Magnificent Tower in the heart of Tokyo! A "Must See" if you ever travel to Tokyo. Best viewed at night or twilight.

Amazing views!. If you want incredible views of Tokyo, this is the place. The attraction was flooded with tourists when we went with a three hour wait. Fortunately, the tower offered a line for foreign visitors which allowed us to skip the queue for a minimal fee.

a bit of Paris in Tokyo. Tokyo tower an icon and an engineering marvel for people to see, check it out both during the day time and evening for different views, also enjoy a panoramic view from the top. don't forget the check out the serounding neighberhoods for authentic Japanes food.

While you stay in Tokyo, you must visit here!. It's a symbol of Tokyoists. You can see all the Tokyo and perhaps Mt.Fuji. Tokyo Tower is similar to Eiffel
Tower in Paris.

Majestic view..!!. Tokyo tower provides a majestic view of tokyo at night. the tower itself is a sight from even a large distance.
last entries at 10.30 PM. so adjust timing accordingly because Minato has a lot of attractions to offer.

Nothing much to expect. I'm actually quite surprised with the fact that there's not much to see in Tokyo Tower.I always dreamed about having myself taking pictures at 'the famous' Tokyo Tower in Tokyo. And guess what?When I travelled to Japan and went to Tokyo Tower, I am so disappointed.I'm imagining green fields/parks or other interesting views under the tower, but I only found traffic lights and office buildings on its surroundings.The only thing which is interesting in this tower is that they have Tokyo One Piece Tower, the theme park for One Piece lovers.At night, the tower is not even that pretty like what I expected it to be.The lights are only in red and you couldn't take picture of it from far in a good angle since it's surrounded by buildings (unless you are on top of another building).

Great night view. The tower is not so high as skytree but if you want to see the panorama of the city it is ok. 250 m above the ground is enough to see Tokyo. There is no queues and tickets are much cheaper than on skytree tower.

Very good views. There were a lot of people here however the staff who did speak English did well keeping people moving smoothly whilst buying tickets and entering the lifts. Although Tokyo is certainly not an attractive city you do get good views and the palace area is very pleasant. The tower which is something like the Paris Eiffel was only built in 1958,
Amazing place. A very nice tourist attraction for someone visiting Tokyo, It will be nice to have a photographs for the lovely memories.

Tokyo Tower !!!✌️. Tokyo Tower is located at the Onarimon station. It has two levels. The first level you can pay 900 to go and watch. The second and the top level you can pay 1600 and watch. It's one of the best destinations in Tokyo at night.
An important part of your tokyo visit. I was there during the lunar eclipse on September 2015. Best Idea ever. Great view of Tokyo and easily accessible.
Wonderful. Love it. Middle of tokyo great view of the city. Really special place for me and My family. Go there every time im in Tokyo. It is a must when you visit Tokyo!

Great views. I went on a solo trip to Tokyo and caught a cab to the tower. The experience was nice. There is a amusement area in here as well. For 900 yen this is the perfect stop. The views are beautiful. It was windy that day so the very top was closed but still worth it. The ticket line went quick, and the elevator wait wasn't long plus the people spoke English!

THE EIFEL TOWER REPLICA. A Replica of the Paris tower built 1958 for TV,Communication and amussement,some what higher than the original 333 meters,
First five floors vAROUS OFFICES SHOPS,VIDEO GAMES,WAX MUSEUM, AND SCIENCE Museum.Two viewing trerraces,on 150 and 250 mewters,
due to public demand it will be kept as an heritage labelWith the building of the new TV Tower.this one was planned for demolishment.Anyhow

Great views and great value, gets very crowded. Our first trip on arriving to Tokyo was to the Tokyo Tower. The entry fee was very reasonable, however, the venue was extremely busy and therefore there were long waits to get around the windows and also to get back down the elevators.

It's a view.. If you are visiting and have a limited amount of time I would recommend Tokyo Skytree instead. The Tokyo tower was so crowded, and we felt like we were in a long Disneyland ride to get on the elevator. It was a tiny bit windy that day and they closed off the 2nd level so we weren't able to get up there. The structure is beautiful but again, it's a view. You g]can get better views in other cool spots in Tokyo.

Not necessarily a good choice if you don't like heights. Sadly it was a very hazy morning when we visited so the view was not a good as on a clear day. Scary point when I realised there was a glass panel in the floor so you could see all the way down! Pick a clear day to visit.

An average must-see. This may sound like a contradiction but Tokyo Tower is only an average must-see. I might be biased by the fact that I have been to quite a few similar vantage points before.In fact the city landscape has little to offer and one cannot blame the tower for that. Having said that, I did not find the organization much efficient. While I reckon the staff was trying its best to cater to a relatively big crowd during the golden week, the overall experience was not smooth at all.All in all give it a shot but only if you have time. There are many great things to discover in Tokyo!

Go very early in the morning...very peaceful!. We were on a super tight schedule so we had to make the walk early am as in 5:00 am on a Monday morning early. But it didn't just work out...it was the best time we could have chosen. No tourists, few random locals in the park. We wound up with a full hour of the tower to ourselves just wandering and taking pictures before the crowds. Walk was easy because it was so early so wasn't rushed at all. Very much enjoyed it and the tower itself really is majestic. Highly recommend even though we didn't go up in it.
Iconic must see.. Crowded but a must see in Japan. I went it was dark out and when the tower is lit its amazing. When I arrived it was lit up PURPLE and as I was leaving it was Yellow
Great trip. We went to Tokyo tower late evening.Views were fantastic, it was our favourite of all the viewing decks we went to in Tokyo.Would highly recommend.Staff friendly.

A place worth visiting. Though this place is no longer the tallest building/tower in Tokyo, I generally enjoyed the view that this place offered. Besides, the entrance fee was also cheaper than the Tokyo Skytree ;)

Fun at night and good views of city.. It costs 900yen to go the main observatory, we went after dinner on a Sunday night & didn't have to queue. The views were great but we didn't pay the extra to go up to the higher level. Very touristy as you'd expect, you can buy foods & drinks and lots of souvenirs. Sky tower or govt building apparently have better views,

Nice at night. We decided to visit the Tower at night. Got some great photos. There was a nice atmosphere there. I had no idea that there were shops and food underneath the Tower - it was quite nice to stumble across a crepe place! We didn't bother going up the Tower, just took some photos and wandered around the bottom.

Panarama Tokyo Skyline. Cost reasonable for similar towers in a big city
Access was fast Waited for less than 5 minutes after tivket purchase
Staff friendly
Goodview and fantastic photos at night
Recommended. One of the tourist spot to visit while I. Tokyo... Beautiful lights and view. Recommended for tourist to visit while in Tokyo.......

Out of date. It was good attraction some twenty years ago. Now it is not the highest, newest and most attractive tower. You can choose Town house or Tokyo Skytree. It is good to see Zojoji temple from the top. Visit only if you have enough time in Tokyo.

A place to visit... If you prefer another alternative rather than tokyo skytree, this tower is the place. It a paid attraction to go up the decks. Unfortunately cause of the strong winds during my visit there, upper deck was closed. Once on the deck, direction to locate the direction of mt fuji is shown both in kanji and english. Staffs are super friendly and polite. Love the concept of lift ladies. Do take your time once at the decks to enjoy the view. They have 'one piece' special deck. Bus are also available to reach the place but i prefer to walk from the train station, only a few minutes away. Once exit from the station, sight of the tower can be seen.

Tokyo Tower. Walk a few times around the garden of this beautiful Tower since our hotel was just walking distance. it does resemble to the Eiffel tower in Paris but it is much smaller. Nevertheless it is beautiful especially all light up at night.
night visit, best view, but too many people. night visit, best view, but too many peoplewe made about 1 hour and a half of cue to came back on ground level
Good view from the top. Its a great place to view the city and is well organised. Although we were there in peak tourist season we had little or no wait to get to the top.
Tokyo Tower. A must go place in Tokyo, you can view the whole city from the tower. My 8 year old had fun touring the area. Highly recommended one of the sight seeing in Tokyo

Great view of Tokyo at night. We went to the Tokyo Tower at night when it is all lit up on the outside. Looking out at night time Tokyo one sees the lights of the city and it is a total contrast to a day time visit. Well worth visiting in the evening we found it quite quiet with no queues.

Nice view if a little dated. Great view from the viewing deck but in all honesty probably best to view the Tokyo tower from one of the many other buildings in Tokyo as the sun sets and the glowing orang lights turn on!!! The main problem with going up the tower to view the city was you couldn't see the iconic tower itself!!!

Stunning view. My daughter one night went to see the Tokyo tower, as a friend who lives in Japan recommended to see it at night as they light up the tower. I've been here some years back but visited in the day, so having seen it in day light and now at night. I agreed if you're gong to visit please do so at night. Obviously you can't see the city that well at night but the view of Tokyo all lite up and spread out before you is breath taking.

Great views of the city. Actually walked here from our hotel in the Shiodome. Probably took 45 mins strolling. Huge gift shop. Enjoyed our visit. Staff were very friendly and there was good signage telling you what you could see from the top and some fun photo things to do at the bottom

Our Second Tower visit in Japan / Tokyo Tower. We just love to take pictures from high places, and Tokyo Tower was not the exception. Totally recommended to visit if you travel to Tokyo. They have good coffee shops in the lower floors of the tower, some souvenir shops and restaurants (including a Hello Kitty Japanese Restaurant). Tickets are not that cheap, but is worth the price.

The most distinguished monument in tokyo. With its bright beautiful orange colour and its elegant design...this beautiful tower is a must while in tokyo...dont miss seeing it at night...when its lit...a spectacular scene...this light of orange that lies between all those neat buildings

Tokyo icon . I had the afternoon and evening to myself as my husband was working so headed here to watch the sunset and the city lights taking over. Was very pleasant. Then I headed to the rooftop bar at the Andaz hotel for a wine and a look back. Was a perfect finish.
Good to go.. This tower is amazing, it is a first time to me at that time.Observation room is a must, should not missed it!

Landmark. Visiting Tokyo would not be complete without coming to this famous landmark. It's not as high as Sky Tree but also offers nice and breathtaking views. The tix was quite pricey I think. We (price for 2 persons) spend Y1800+Y1400(for upper deck). Try visiting this tower when you are having birthday, they might give you something (I forgot). The observation area is not really spacious, so expect long queue to get in, to wander around and to go down. We waited for around 30-45mins to go from lower deck to upper deck, because of the structure, they can only put 1 lift (to go up and down). In the upper deck you can see more clearly. Less people, of course coz we pay more :p. When going down the tower you can choose 'outside stairs', however due to the wind they won't allow us that time to go outside.At ground level there are lots of shops and resto/food court. Try visiting around 4:30pm then you can see this tower with blue sky then when it gets dark, pretty illumination will come out.

Great Night View from Tokyo. We decided to see this attraction during sunset/night because of Tokyo Tower's orange colors. Additionally, Tokyo Skytree is way taller than this, so I recommend seeing one attraction during the day and the other during the night. You wont' regret seeing this during the night!You can Spot Odaiba's Giant Ferris wheel and many Tokyo's landmarks. The night view of Tokyo is amazing too!Bring your camera and comfortable shoes, as you'll have to walk a few blocks before arriving, and you'll have so many souvenirs to buy that you may get tired.If you're fan of Animes, there's a special priced ticket with both Tokyo Tower + One Piece Tower pass, which we bought (around 45 dollars).Another important thing: Go see this attraction before Skytree, otherwise you might be disappointed with this one.
Great view, pricey . Visited at night. Great view especially at night where you can see the dazzling city lights around tokyo. It is a bit expensive for the entrance fee.

marvellous design by Japanese Engineers.. breath taking view from 350 meters height. It seems the tower is designed such a way that even if there is earthquake, the tower will oscillate a little but will not get damaged. Designed exclusively by Japanese technology and people.
Great views. Great views all the way around with great beer garden on the lower levels. Worth a trip to get some cracking views of the whole of Tokyo.

Nice to see. Since you are already there in tokyo.
Might as well ask the tour guide to stop there for a few minutes for photo op. Looks like a miniature eifl tower.

Excellent Tokyo View. This is a Tower that looks a lot like Aiffel Tower. It has an excellent breathtaking view to Tokyo. There is a cafe on the top, where you can have a view, of the City and get an idea of Japanish modern performerce. They could have some guidance on what you see from the Tower as they have in other similar monuments, because it is totally unguided. There is a nice adventure site inside for children mostly.

Phenomenal view of Tokyo. This is a hidden treasure! Go there at night and you will see the true beauty of Tokyo all lit up. I did not go to the second level but saw a lot from the first level. They have a screening of animals and fish on the windows. One of the highlights of my trip to Tokyo.

Great visit if you are in Tokyo!. The view was amazing and there is a nice introduction at the top of the tower to mention the headings in Tokyo. I went in the day so you can see many landmarks. Although its not as tall as the Eiffel Tower in Paris but surely a great experience if you are in the "Eastern Capital" (Tokyo literally in Japanese).
Tokyo tower. Very nice place to seen the town, fantastic view over the big town. The tower has elevator so many people can go there. Great Tokyo!! :-)

Awesome view . It was an awesome sight to see to be honest. The view was really great but it was misty/cloudy that day so we didn't get to see Mt. Fuji. We paid to go up to the topmost deck but we got to go around the 1st deck before heading all the way up. The glass floor view was really awesome but a bit scary if you're afraid of heights.

Long lines but good view. You pay for a ticket and wait in a line to go to the elevator. When you get to the observatory, you have a short period of time to see the nice view. It's kind of crowded. I felt like I was in line for most of the time but the view was worth it.

Tokyo up front with Mt. Fuji close by. Wow! What a breathtaking view! The weather was fantastic. Clear blue skies with everything to see. Tokyo in her splendid best! We are lucky to see as far as the eye can. Mount Fuji as usual was her graceful self. Tokyo is all yours up there provided the weather is great. Do some shopping too for it is pleasant experience. Most of all, visit and feel the place. Enjoy!
Fantastic experience!. The view was amazing! I took beautiful photos, I hope to comeback some time again. It's good refference for my art since I have been studying architechture lately.

Love This Place!. The Mori Art Museum in Roppongi Hills has a fantastic view of Tokyo Tower and the entire cityscape, if you're in the area absolutely check it out. You'll get a memorable snap of this tower and the scale of Tokyo for your instagram/facebook accounts, and memories that will last forever!

Must visit place in japan!!. Standing tall and firm in the minato district japan,this iconic building is one the must visit place in japan,from there we can see tokyo city.Great place to start your trip in Japan.In this tower you can buy souvenirs and others.

comedy show on the lower deck, hilarious. View was ok only. There was comedy show on the lower deck from the observatory deck. It was good! The highest deck is very crowded with long queue. We did not go up as we did not want to wait.

Nice to see a panoramic view of Tokyo. I visited in April and paid to go up to the mid level. It was nice to see just how big the city is and get a panoramic view. You could also see Mt Fuji, albeit a bit hazy. There are inexpensive touristy shops on the way out which was great to pick up souvenirs.
Cool to see. Cool to see but nothing special. Many bathrooms and places to eat. I wouldn't pay extra to go to the top it's not that much better.

Wait for Dark. This iconic tower can be seen standing above the city. During daylight hours it is not as impressive as other towers across the globe. Go at night and everything changes. The tower becomes brightly lit and quite spectacular. The staff are friendly and eager to help as are the shopkeepers on the variety of stalls on the first floor. You have to say you've been there if you're going to Tokyo.
東京タワー. 東京へ始めて来た時、工事していた。＞＜　でも、今すごい。スカイツリーより安いね。エッフェル塔より少し高い。白と赤、あの型は、日本の全て電波塔に使われるようだ。Also go to Zojoji at the Tower's foot, for a contrast of modern and traditional.
Tokyo Tower is looks like the Eiffel Tower, but it is nicer. Enjoyed visiting the tower during a Greyline Tolur of Tokyo. It is just above the Tofu Restaurant were we had the multi-course much.

Beautiful night view. We went here on our last night in Tokyo. It was amazing to pinpoint from the tower where we were the past few days. Tokyo really came alive at night. The views are amazing and if you can, go check out the special observation deck and go to the toilet there. The parfait from the tower's cafe is also not bad.
Great view . View was great, spend the extra $$$ to go to the very top. Either view (2 choices) is good though. Great view of Tokyo

Night time is the best time!. The entire tower is lit at night and is beautiful for a romantic way to end your night! Expensive as the price doesn't include the highest height, after you pay to go to up you can purchase the second ticket once up there for higher view which is about double the height. Although the the glass isn't very crystal clear and so you view is not sharp in photos, it's very romantic. The waiting to go up and down the lift for second height is a bit tiring and does take some of the spark away. The tower itself and the walk to the tower is just as romantic as it provides great photo opportunity and a nice peaceful stroll.

Must see. Not too pricey and provides an astounding view of the city, even from just the main observatory, adventurous souls can pay more for the special observatory many many more stories higher. Nice photo gallery on the ground floor of the tower being built in the 1950's, shopping and eating opportunities as well as tower first place which looked like an indoor adventure park, tickets for that cost extra and with just one 7 year old in tow we didn't fancy it, opting instead for the aquarium on the ground floor which was tranquil and interesting.Probably would not warrant a second visit but the views as stated are well worth the trip.

Very average.. I found the whole Toyko Tower visit to be very average. The views are not that great. I didn't do the Tokyo Skytree but found the view to be better from the Mori Art Museum in Roppongi PLUS you can view the art for a very similar price!
Classic sight in Tokyo. I personally think this is better than the sky tree. Beautiful at night, a golden glow to it. I think the best vantage is from the water on a dinner cruise.
GREAT VIEWS!. It rained a fair bit when we were in Tokyo so we headed for the Tower and found it a great place to spend a wet morning. Super views at a reasonable price and a cafe at the top!
Beautiful especially at night. A popular tourist spot, Tokyo Tower lets you see all of Tokyo and surrounding area. If you go at night, the city lights are mesmerizing.

Go at Sunset. Kind of long lines to buy tickets and get inside, but we were trying to catch the sunset. You pay to go halfway up which is good viewing, but the observation floors aren't very large so you sometimes have to wait for window access. We paid extra to go up to the top deck which was a little less crowded. They have maps which tell you the points of interest in the city. The best part is seeing the tower lit up at night. There are also tourist shops with reasonable pricing inside the tower.

Great view. My daughter and I were on a tour which included a trip to Tokyo Tower. There was no line, and we went right up to the top on the elevator. We were there on a clear day, and the views were amazing. After riding back down, we visited the great gift shop.
Super fun experience. We went up into the Tokyo Tower, you get a great view of the city. We didn't have to wait in line too long. It's worth checking out!

A old symbol of Tokyo. one of the 2 tower in Tokyo, It is the mroe characteristic to shot. You can approach to the tower by south, taking Oedo Line (Daimon), to see the tower from a Temple. It will be close on top if too wind. Best in a clear sunny day. Shops inside
Go there, see it, do something else. Tokyo Tower is a nice attraction and it is close to other attractions. I would recommend checking it out and promptly leaving to do something else.

good. The Tokyo tower is a communications and observation tower located in Tokyo. It is a major broadcast tower for Japanese media. This orange- white structure is the symbol of technological advancement in Japan. Inspired by the Eiffel Tower, this is the second tallest structure in Japan. The tower offers a wonderful view of Japan. There are two observation desks, which are visited by millions of people each year. Foot Town, is a building located directly under the tower, offers museums, restaurants and shops. During the day the tower looks beautiful but at night, the tower lights up increasing the beauty by a large amount. Different parts of the tower are lit up in different colours, according to the various different occasions. This tower is a must visit at night.

Best to go on a day with clear skies . Lots of shopping places and a few places to eat. We went to the second viewing level and was able to see everything. It was a bit cloudy so we didn't get to see Mt. Fuji clearly. There is also a window on the floor where you can look down which is exciting. I felt it was slightly over priced but it was a nice 360 view
Must see . Went at night, not too much people-which I like. The views were nice and the staff were very helpful. Buy a ticket and go to conservatory.

Great views, bonus One Piece Store below. We came here at 9am on a clear day. The cost to go up is cheaper than Tokyo Skytree, and the view is fantastic. We were able to see mount Fuji, as well has have a great view of central Tokyo. We paid a little extra money to go to the second observation deck. It was well worth it as there were fewer people up there with an even better view. Another nice thing was that after coming down from the second observation deck, we were allowed to wander around again on the main observation deck to enjoy the views one more time before heading down.One thing that I found out after I got there is that there is a huge shop on the first floor that is dedicated to one piece. I knew that there was a One Piece amusement park and I was hoping for a souvenir shop but I was overjoyed to see such a large shop dedicated just to One Piece. There is also a decent general anime/figure shop on the second floor that actually had very good prices compared to some of the stores we saw in Akihabara.Overall we were very happy that we chose Tokyo Tower over Tokyo Skytree.
Unbelievable sight!. One of my favorite attractions in Japan! Your trip would not be complete without going to this landmark. Amazing view of Tokyo at the top!

Beautiful views of Tokyo at night!. This is the 1st placed we visited as soon as we landed, open late with spectacular views of Tokyo. 2 observation platforms, 1 half way up and the other close to the top (different prices for each). The top special observation deck was well worth the extra price, in our opinion, just for the beautiful views and photo opportunities. A live jazz band was performing on the observation deck when we arrived and it made the experience completely magical. Look for the glass floor as well. Don't miss this attraction!
Good views. We went up just before sunset so saw the changing colours going into the night. As it was cherry blossom time you could easily see the trees. Good to get an overall perspective of Tokyo

View from Tokyo Tower during daytime . As a tourist, we wanted to go to either Toyko Skytree or Tokyo Tower. We picked Tokyo Tower and we were right. Although the tower was built earlier than Skytree, the red tower looks so nice, and not so crowded. Can take your own time taking pictures and enjoy the view. On good days, might be able to see Mt Fuji. After visit, pick up some souvenirs and buy Tokyo bananas for your family and friends.

Must For Tokyo Trip Itinerary. This is a certified Tokyo landmark . It provides different outlook day and night. Small fee to go up the top . Nice photo op seeing the city below . Souvenirs to buy abound . But , just a suggestion , how about designating a place where we can take pictures with the tower in its entirety? Just like the Trocadero station where the Eiffel is seen in its glorious beauty. I hope the government or tourism heads would look into that aspect.

Great view and open late. Was a great attraction and open late till 10pm. It has great views on Tokyo and a nice gift shop and extra higher deck you can view for an extra fare.It is a big queue to go in the lift to the tower took about 20 minutes but it's not too bad but they could've done with more than one lift open.

Better options but spectacular at night. For a bird's eye view of Tokyo, Tokyo Tower has now been surpassed by higher options that get over the upward creep of the skyline but it makes for a great picture at night.

Towering over Tokyo. This tower is amazing. It overlooks Tokyo and at night it is lit up and looks beautiful. The line to go uo the tower was about an hour when we went. It is quite expensive too but that is like most cities. There were lots of activities going on there, a robot exhibition, magic show and lots of restaurants. Some amazing views.
One time visit. Ok you can visit once but u cant compare effiel with Tokyo tower..both are different and unique and obviously Effiel is heaven..

A great thing to view. At night time this building looks even better. A great Tokyo edifice. Possibly better and cheaper buildings to climb, but the best part is if you can view it from your hotel window.
Not cheap but worth it. You can have an excellent view when arriving at one of two platforms visitors can get to.Good place for taking photos.

Great view! If not super crowded or cloudy!. This place can get swamped so go early, on a clear day, if you can! The elevators are gorgeous but if it's busy, you'll be crammed in without any elbow space much less the ablity to turn around. Despite the crowds, the staff are efficient and the area is very clean. You'll be able to get a great view of the city providing the weather cooperates. There's, of course, a gift shop, snack (soft serve) area, a few photo props in addition to the view.

Very expensive . Worth having a look at for sure but don't pay to go up to the observation deck. Costs around $20 to go to the first level and then they charge you again to go higher. Is a good sight at nighttime because it's all lit up.

Gigantic Tokyo Tower. We just briefly visit this sightseeing spot after dinner as it is near our hotel. Nevertheless, the light up tower is very spectacular even if you take a photo from the ground floor! Worth visit!

No better than any of the other world towers. You can get views as good from other buildings in Tokyo. I suggest that after you get dropped-off at the main observation deck take the stairs down one level to where the cafe is. The viewing area is exactly the same 360 degrees, but far less crowsdd and there are also windows that look straight down.
Well worth a visit. Stunning panoramic views from the viewing platforms over the whole of Tokyo. Definitely worth a visit.

Aging symbol of post-war Tokyo. We couldn't resist to go and see Tokyo Tower on our first night in Tokyo as we were staying in the Minato area. On a closer inspection, this 58 year old looks a bit dated. I think it must have lost admirers to the younger and much taller Skytree. Anyway, it has a good observation deck. Recommended if you have nothing else to do.
Tokyo's "light" tower. Tokyo Tower is made of prefab steel and only weighs 4000 tons. one of the world;s famous tower and second tallest structure in Tokyo.

So fun! Great views of Tokyo. We really loved our visit to Tokyo Tower. It gives you a beautiful view of the city, which is bigger than it seems!Worthwhile to pay to go to the highest level, there are less people and you can admire the city in a more serene environment.

Another Eiffel tower . At first glance it will look exactly as Eiffel tower, very beautiful tower which has two level of having panoramic view of entire Tokyo. It is must see if you are visiting Tokyo

See Tokyo at night !. If you have the time visit the Tokyo tower. It's not cheap but not expensive either (only if you want to go all the way up). We wen't at night and the view is breathtaking. Im sure during the day you can get a nice view of the citiy with Fuji mount in the background too. If you like walking you can get great places to eat in the surrounding areas.

Dynamic Tour Tokyo. This tour was quite good. It started off a bit chaotic at the meeting point Keio Plaza Hotel which is a meeting point for various other tours. So we had to be sorted into tours then transported by bus be prepared to use the 3rd seat (it is a little seat which swings out from a main seat which sits in the aisle)to bus depot which was where we picked up a more comfortable coach. From there to the Tokyo tower - it was a good view of Tokyo - same ideas as the Eiffel Tower The Japanese tea ceremony was very traditional - lovely The imperial gardens was a bit disappointing as all views from a distanceLunch was good value at the Hotel Chinzanso Tokyo was on Japanese hot stone - this the highlight for us Then onto the cruise on Sumida River - ordinary nothing spectacular The onto the Sensoji Temple - combination markets & temple. If you don't want to shop then not much more to do. The temple is beautiful. There are plenty of street foods available. They drop you off at railway station, for us it was Tokyo station with instructions to back to your accommodation. We chose to take a cab which from Tokyo station to Shinjuku was 2500yen. Our tour guide was lovely and made sure everyone was enjoying itValue for money I felt.

Well worth visiting. We visited the Tower as one of those must do things to do in Tokyo. We went in the evening when the tower was all lit up. There was not much of a queue so we were quickly up the tower. The views even at night are stunning and the glass floor was great fun. It was great and the tower is very iconic.It was value for money.

Wait for the sunset!. The Tokyo Tower is a nice way to spend a couple of hours at leisure. Buy your ticket and go up to the main observatory in time for the sunset. Get a cup of coffee and cake at the cafe, and grab a spot on the benches facing west - it won't disappoint! The sun goes down with beautiful colors, and little by little the lights go on all over the city... You can get great pictures! After you've had enough, you may buy the add-on ticket to go up to the special observatory (250m). It is not necessary... The description on the flyer oversold it (it is only a much smaller observatory deck with some colored lights), but we enjoyed it anyway - the view was better than expected.

Famous Attraction In Tokyo . I know Tokyo Tower is very famous in Japan. But if you have visited Eiffel Tower....then you would most likely feel that Tokyo Tower wasn't that impressive as Eiffel Tower. Eiffel Tower was magnificent even day and night !!!!We actually went to the top to see the city view. It was okay.....maybe because it was day time. Maybe night view will be better. Well, at least we visited Tokyo tower...One of Japan Famous Attraction !!!!

Absolutely Amazing. Before going I heard that it is best to go of an evening to look at the wonderful views that it gives if Tokyo when it it lit up. They were not wrong. The views are remarkable and just awe inspiring when you look out and realise that there are 35 million people living in thia city and up to 250,000 tourists on any one day.Tokyo lit up of the evening was the redeeming feature of my trip to Tokyo

Its bigger than the one in paris!. Yes its bigger then the Paris one, but its just as expensive! To be honest i think i prefer the Effiel tower as you have the option on walking up and enjoying the venture, But if you're visiting Tokyo.. its a must

famous attraction. We visited Tokyo Tower by Nov 2015. We came by night time and still a lot of tourists. We queue around 20 min to buy entrance tickets and observation deck ticket. The price is acceptable.The city view from the deck is extremely stunning especially at night. The decoration itself of the deck also very romantic and match to the Christmas season. Recommend to every traveler coming to Tokyo.

Look Down Window. Tokyo tower is the signature landmark of Tokyo city. The view from the top is fantastic. A must go to familiarize yourself from the city .You have to try the experience of standing or walking in the sky! At the Main Observatory, there is a “Look Down Window” where you can look down at the ground from the height of 145 m. Challenge yourself to do that!

Worth The Stop when in Tokyo!. This was the first stop on a city tour we were on and we were afraid that haze might be an issue. It was not, We had a great view of the whole city. If Mt. Fugi had been visible it would have been awesome, Still it was fun to go to the tower for the view, The elevator is set up so you go up one level, walk up a level, then take the elevator, then walk up a level and then take the elevator. Not bad, but just to let people know there are some steps, There were four of us and two were college students and we all liked it. It is not the Eiffel Tower but it does not claim to be either, Enjoy it!

Go here to see all of Tokyo. It costs 1000/person to go up to the middle part of the tower. I went during the day and the sight was breathless. When you get to the middle section, they have a café and a little photo shoot type thing where you can pay to get a photo taken. There's the option of taking an elevator and/or stairs. We took the stairs. It was about 600 steps. But then we took the elevator down. LOL.

Formerly the Tallest Tower in Tokyo but Still has its Charm. Although the Tokyo Tower has been dethroned as the tallest tower in Tokyo, it is still worth the visit for its impressive views. Check weather report to make sure you get clear skies.

Nice view. Nice view from the middle deck. The view from the very top was better. Overall it was nice to get the view but there was no outdoor viewing platform and due to glare from the lights inside it was impossible to get a good picture of the city (we went up at night). Good view but I wouldn't recommend if you plan on taking pictures.

Nice view, but not a must to go up. It's not a must to go up the tower as the height is not comparable to Paris' Eiffel Tower. However, good to visit the area and take pictures around the vicinity. It is about 5-8 minutes by foot from Toei Oedo Line Akabanebashi Station. I would recommend to visit the tower at night.

cool, good view, bit overpriced. some others recommend going to the free government building for the same view, and I would probably agree. the view is astounding, but this is basically a huge well appointed tourist trap (well duh). Was not expecting everything to cost $10 bucks. Took our pictures and left.

Historic landmark. A communications and observation tower, the tower opened in 1958. Owned by Nippon Television City Corp., it's approximately 1,000 feet high, 16 floors, but with four elevators. Inspired by the Eiffel Tower, it's the second tallest structure in Japan. It's a huge tourist attraction, and there's a wonderful museum and gift shop located at the base of the tower. If you have time, check it out.
Panoramic Views. Even though this has been replaced by the Tokyo Sky-Tree as the broadcast tower for Tokyo, the observation deck offers excellent panoramic views of the city.
Panoramic City Views. The Tokyo Tower is a must see for any visitor in Tokyo. While it has been replaced by the Tokyo Sky-Tree as the broadcast tower, it still offers magnificent views of the city.
Great View Of Tokyo. Go all the way to the highest level for the best views and best photo opportunities. You will not be disappointed.

A must do in Tokyo. The views from the top of Tokyo Tower are fantastic , on a clear day you can see everything , even great views of Mount Fuji , plus plenty of shops to buy souvenirs or get something to eat

Mist visit icon. Easy to get to from Hamamatsucho station on the JR line (for anyone travelling with a JR pass - highly recommended by the way if you intend on doing alot of travelling). Looks brilliant at night. Not too expensive to get up there but yes you must pay- we thought we could take the 600 stairs for free instead of the elevator but you can't, must purchase a ticket. View is wonderful, our day was a bit cloudy but still worth it. The ONLY tourist souvenir shop I found in the entire of Tokyo was at this tower. I'm talking about magnets and keyring etc all that stuff that says 'japan' or 'tokyo' on it o could not for the life of me find anywhere but here. Definitely worth a visit.
icons of tokyo. It is just like you visit Paris, you need to to Effiel tower...so Tokyo Tower is just an icon you need to see....Nothing much up there to see but i do like the souvenir shop.....

360 View of Amazing City. The tower has two separate floors for observation. Both floors offer fantastic panoramic views of the city. We were fortunate enough to go on a day that was sunny and clear, so we saw everything (except Mt. Fuji) including the cherry blossoms that were in full bloom. The price to go up is very reasonable. There are fantastic souvenir shops and cafe's on the lower levels. The area around the tower is also a fun place to walk around and sightsee.

Great night visit. We arriver about 7 on a Friday evening. No lines, bought tickets, straight to the lift, no lines. Up to the first viewing level. Did a slow lap and bought tickets for the high viewing. Had a 5 min wait for the ticket booth to open and were second in line. Walked some steps to the lift and had a 15 minute wait. The views from the top were fantastic. Found the prices in the ground level shops a bit pricey but they turned out to cheaper than elsewhere in the city. We had clear views but in the rain the next day the tower was lost in the mist.

Higher and less crowded than the Eiffel tower. This is a fun activity in Tokyo. The tower offers comfortable enclosed views of the city. Supposedly on a clear day Mt. Fuji can be seen. We had no such luck but we did get a grnd look at Tokyo Bay.
Impressive. At night the tower looks beautiful lite up very impressive. We did not go up the tower but we did pass by it on the bus.
Brilliant. Good value and great views. Also a great landmark. I really enjoyed walking in the area at night and seeing the reflection of the tower in the glass buildings.

something good. Tokyo Tower is a symbol of this great city, next to the park and temple Zozoji, the tower rises above the large buildings. Inside the building there are plenty of souvenir shops where you can do some shopping and also some restaurants to eat something good price. We got ahsta the first viewpoint which is free and already offers a good view, but did not want to pay the price to climb above all because we found it too expensive, you will have a better view and free from MTG building (metropolitan goverment) Shinjuku

You need to go higher even then. So it's not free. And the half way point it isn't even that good see. The higher view was ok but to pay extra was abit ok a joke for what you get was a higher view of the same thing

Great Views, Restaurants, Sovenirs n made in Japan products cum biscuits.. Worth a visit but take note of the hefty entrance fee for Express Entry to the Tower for tourists; 5500¥ per pax! However if u have time, go on line but u need to go during specified date n time. Else go to the normal counter n when we were there, the q is at least 1 hour long b4 us. Unless it is a clear day, not worth to go right up to the tower as blurred vision. We went on a weekday yet the crowd so bet to go early n leave when the crowd sets in!
Tokyo Tower. Honestly, I only went here to be able to say I did. View was nice, but with the sky tree I have to wonder if it'll be torn down or not.

Pretty fun!. We had a god time going up to the middle level and eating lunch. The views of the city were spectacular and the food was surprisingly reasonably priced. I would definitely do it again and have recommended it to friends visiting Tokyo.

Great views, well thought out attraction. Go early or late to avoid queues. Long long queues.There was no time pressure to wander round and each view was well documented. I loved the interactive maps that zoom into highlighted areas so you can mach the view to the information - very clever

Good for views. Enjoyed a pleasant afternoon/evening watching the day change to evening to give a daylight view and a view of the city lights. Great places for eating around the Tower and just enjoy the experience of being in Tokyo.

Amazing views and fun around the Tower. Around the Tower there are a lot of pop up style restaurants that serve all kinds of Japaneese food. Had Tuna sashimi from a fish they cut up in front of my eyes! You can choose by walking to the top or to go by elevator. I bought a ticket to the 150th floor! The views over Tokyo are amazing! You can also look DOWN through a glass hole in the floor….It was very quiet though crowded in the Tower but it was well worth going there. There is a nice gift shop on the 150th floor as well. I do recommend a visit to Tokyo Tower when in Tokyo.
Neat. I stumbled upon it walking back from a meeting to my hotel (InterCon Tokyo Bay). Perhaps the blue sky and sun, with the Cherry Blossoms out, made it much more appealing.
Easy to get to . Great little tower in the city, close to a Buddhist temple and east to get to if your looking for something to do. Really liked the Animae park inside of the tower.
Great for views cool building. I went during the day so didnt see any night view. Its a must for all travelers, Tower itself looks spectacular up close.
Great views of Tokyo and fun for the kids.. We Stayed just near the Tower. the kids enjoyed the viewing platform. Other sights close by and subway and train station close as well.

A classic spot, you cannot go to Tokyo and skip it.. It might not have the glamour of eiffel tower but it is a worthy spot to visit if you have so time to spare in Tokyo. The views are excellent. Go to the second observatory to enjoy the whole experience.

The Signature of Tokyo. This is a must visit place. If you can't get time, see it from the Roponggi Hills. The view is much better and less crowded. In some days, you might be able to see the tower and the full moon next to each other
Most beautiful ever!!!. Every word isn't enoug to explain this feeling when I looked "Tokyo Tower".It's so Incredibly beautiful,stylish,coooooool!!

Nice visit at night. Great place for a wonderful view of Tokyo at night!Although there are 2 different floors to go, there are not a many activities to be done apart from enjoying the view. It is very nice if you like contemplating landscapes with your better half!

You will be amaze if you go night time.. A bit of a long walk from the train station. but as you go near, you will get excited of how beautiful the tower is. We are not able to go up but still it is a picture perfect and worth the visit. Best to visit at night for the tower is well lighted.

Family trip to Tokyo tower. A very good place to visit. yesterday visited with family view from tower is beautiful
Popular tourist place for more than fifty years
Still constructed transport access is also good
Must go there
Nice view. Pretty cool place to get a birds eye view of Tokyo. Not too expensive or crowded mid week... Easy to get to on the subway. Worth the trip.

Halfway up is plenty. Bigger than the Eiffel Tower and seem more massive, maybe it's the color! No need to spend 1600 yen ($14) to go to the top. I spent 900 yen ($8) and the view was just fine. A word of caution,
The vendors around the tower, are giving nothing away, a beer was $6.00

First look at Tokyo from above. The first experience of seeing a true metropolis at night from above in my life. When I stepped out of the elevator of the lower observatory level, I had to laugh for a few seconds I was so amazed. Even though I am still a bit careful of concrete jungles and I like nature much more. So considering that my feelings were mingled but still I liked it, it's a great place to watch Tokyo for a while. And nicely lit up from the outside (as a tower, the French counterpart is better).
lovely place to visit in evenings. Tokyo tower is by far the best place to visit during evening time when illumination in complete. we visited the place during day time as well.
What a view. Well worth a trip you can see just how densely populate, such an amazing views. So organised,the Japanese are so polite.

Great view . We were only at the frist deck at 150 meter, but you get a great view from there. The queue to the second deck was very long. We came at night time, so we got to see the lights of the Tokyo skyline. If you should choose one tower, I think Skytree is better.
What a view. It was a great view from up there. You can see the whole city. Unfortunately, it was raining when took this tour. It was still great to visit.
memorable view of Tokyo. You can not miss this landmark if you are a fan of Japanese drama. Especially experience the view of night.
Classic attraction showing it's age. The shopping centre, food court and area surrounding the attraction are outdated but still well maintained.
Save your $$. Unless you are avid photography and you want photos of the sunset, GO. I would spend my $$ on other things like the Eiffel Tower.

Great views of Tokyo. Really enjoyed my visit to Tokyo Tower, has great views all over Tokyo and you get to see the sheer scale of the city. On the day we went we could just see Mt Fuji. The price up the tower was quite reasonable and it is defiantly worth while paying the extra $8AUD to go to the top.
interesting. nice place if you bring kids.The kids will enjoy the ride and the view from the top.there are many souvinier shops which are a bit pricy though.

Great view. It is also great to see a city from an aerial perspective. This proved true with the Tokyo Tower. Wished we had gone here the days that we could see Mount Fuji but, we were scheduled to go on a tour so we waited. Nice to see the rest of the city though. The staff was really nice and wore these cute little uniforms. There were several places on the floor where you could look down thru a clear portion of the floor. They are not very large so be sure to look for them.

Meh, it's ok. The tower itself is cool, however it is expensive to go up to the observation deck and there isn't much to see. Perhaps on a clear day you could see Fuji and that might be worth it. When we went it was hazy and I didn't find the skyline all that impressive. It's felt very bladerunner. We tried to stay until sunset but the clouds were too thick. Seeing the tower lit up at night, from a distance was cool though.

Nice landmark for photo ops. Amazing at night! The tokyo tower offers amazing photos when lit up at night, the park in front of it makes it even better for photos.Great way to kick off your japan trip
Mega structure within the city. I get to enjoy the 360° view of Tokyo. Very accessible from the train station and friendly to tourists
Great for photos. Great for photos especially at night time when is lit up. We couldn't go inside but great for photos at night time and not too busy.

Good views. Good views from the top but what else would you expect from way up there?Pricey ride up the elevator and crowded gallery with over zealous selfie takers. Takes a while to do the full circle of all the views.Go if you're in the vicinity. Otherwise there are other attractions that would probably be a better use of your time there, like even a walk in the neighborhood to take in the local way of life.

Seeing it from far is more beautiful . I visited Tokyo tower many times as my house is near Tokyo tower but more than that I like watch it from fan away.Especially at night the view is vey beautiful and adding light at night make it amazing.

Omnipresent landmark. We followed it from afar as we made our way to it, visited the temple nearby first and then took the back roads till we were at the Tower itself. Nice view especially if there is a clear sky, makes for a good background for selfies :). Ticket a bit expensive 900 yen for 150m and 1600yen for 250m, but worth it if it is the first panoramic view place you visit.Also food shops nearby where they filed a tuna fish live, made for a good show.
Superb view from the top, Visit in Evening. Lights just add to its beauty, It was an memorable experience. View from the top is incredible. You have to go to Tokyo tower if you are visiting Tokyo.

Very nice view!. I have to say that I was lucky since there was no line to wait. The view was really nice! And also the staff were very nice. Too bad that I wasn't able to see the mountain Fuji from the tower.

Fun! . Was a bit of a trek to get there but definitely worth it. Went in September 2015 when they had One Piece on as an attraction which was what lead us to go. Was amazing! The views themselves are breathtaking. If you can go at night, definitely worth doing to see the city below all lit up.

The Best Tower. Esthetically much better than Skytree and has the name of the city. I have visited the tower many times and is essentially the centre-point for the tourist. A must visit place. This is modelled on Eiffel Tower in paris but they got the height a bit wrong and it is taller by 33ft.

Impressive. Originally, we were not planning to visit Tokyo Tower, and we're okay just seeing it from afar. We had some time to kill one night and were near, so we decided to go, and I'm glad we did!It's an iconic sight. We didn't go up, as we had done another (and supposedly better) observation deck. Even just walking around the area and taking it in was pleasant enough.

Must visit in Tokyo- Brilliant View. The pride of Tokyo, the city view from the Tokyo tower is a sight to behold. Closely resembles the Eiffel tower of Paris. Try to visit on a not so cold/cloudy day to enjoy the view.

Sunset over Tokyo. Spent a wonderful three hours at the top of Tokyo Tower. We picked a spot overlooking the city as the sun began to set. I would recommend finding a good place to stand early on as it does get rather crowded during sunset. However it was breathtaking to witness and seeing the city light up in the dark was truly awesome. They have a cute photo opportunity with a plushie tokyo tower and a nice bar/cafe. A must when visiting Tokyo.

A must see in Tokyo. I love Japan especially Tokyo people can walk and bike anytime of the day. The people are so freindly. This is one of the stunning view and place to visit in Tokyo at night you would even feel that you are in Paris as it is a replica of it here in Asia. After heading here in this place there are various restaurant that cater to most visitors.
Stunning view. Really stunning view, you have to go to special observatory to have a better look and that will cost you only 700 yen, and 500 yen for children.

Ersatz Eiffel but not heaps to see. Went up the tower as part of a trip. As another reviewer has pointed out the view is no better than the top of many hotels and other public buildings. It is also subject to frequent cloudy weather. Mount Fuji is not always on view. Not unhappy to have done the tower, but would not have gone out of my way.

Not as Good as the Eiffel Tower Paris. The view of the tower at night is spectacular. There are souvenir shops at the bottom and the top of the tower. The views are good and they say you can see Mt Fuji on a clear day - in March this was not possible and we could only see the outskirts of the city.

Like a red Eiffel Tower. An iconic structure within Tokyo - rather like a red Eiffel Tower. The observation deck is not all that high, and when we were there (March), Tokyo was overcast, so we didn't expect good views.It was pretty busy too (a Saturday morning), and a lot of kids were around waiting to go up.You can get there by Tokyo Metro and Japan Rail lines to very different stations, and follow the signs within the station for the correct exit. Once you've walked a while, you'll see it, for obvious reasons.

Good from far, far from good. . We decided to check out the tower after reading reviews that it was nice to see at night. We arrived and took a few photographs from a distance. That was about it. Didn't go up the tower. I think the sky tower is much better for a view

Classic Tokyo spot. Great view over Tokyo for cheap. You pay 1600 JPY and they take you up to the observatory platform but for additional 700JPY you can get to the top. Do it!There are other places where you can get a similar view for free, but this one - especially if you're not going to the SkyTree - is a must.

Nice to look down the city. After taking boat on sumidea river, we walked from hamamatsucho, which took 15-20min, to the tower. My friend's birthday was the day before, they gave him a special ticket with some coupons you can use at the shops in the tower. Pity it was cloudy, but we was able to see as far as Yokohama. They say you can see Mt.Fuji on clear days. Elevator takes you up, but you can try going up 600 steps if it's not too windy.
great view of tokyo. worth it, go at night and even if it is expensive youll get the best view of tokyo and the tower is wonderful to look at.
toyko Tower. this was a great way to see how large Tokyo is. the view from the Tower was great . you can see so far on a clear day

A Nice View Over Tokyo. Despite having seen a few city skylines from high towers, Tokyo is still impressive, and the Tokyo Tower is one of the best spots to view the city, both during day and night. It is not something you absolutely cannot miss, but an iconic landmark for a reason nonetheless.

A must go attraction !. A must go attraction while visiting Tokyo!Amazing views of the whole city! Spectacular! We went there on a tour on our first day in Tokyo and loved it. There's a lot of souvenir shops on the first floor as well.
An attraction that looks best at a distance. Certainly a clear day, you have breathtaking views of a gigantic large Tokyo.Different price levels for how high you want to go up.
well worth a visit. this was a great way to see the size of Tokyo and highlights some of the main landmarks. Great view - well worth the visit
Not the most exciting sight. Tokyo is many wonderful things but I wouldn't consider it beautiful. Looking at it from above just wasn't that exciting to me.
Touristy but. If you're in the area why not. Its lit up at night, looks like the Eiffel tower only way smaller. I wouldn't go out of my way to see it but its worth a look.
Easy to manage everything in English - great afternoon out. Easy to manage everything in English - great afternoon out. Make sure you go to the very top. Not big queues but a good spot

Depends on the season & weather. Seemed like a must-see for visiting Tokyo. It was OK, but the view from the observation floor was about the same as the view from my hotel room, so I'm not sure it was worth it. Seeing the tower was nice, but you don't have to pay to see it from the outside. I also think the weather is very important. I happened to be there on a rainy day, where the clouds prevented you from seeing very much. The tour guide said that this was typical for early March. Maybe the view would have been much more impressive at a different time of year.
Average Sightseeing. Cannot go untill the top level because of the big wind! So we went to the mid level.Not so good sightseeing, and dont have good souvenir not like eiffel in Paris.

Never got tired of visiting this tower. Excellent night views of Tokyo from this place. The lower observatory is good enough if you don't want to pay the upper observatory price. The nearest subway stations are Akanebashi and Kamiyacho.
Tokyo Tower in the evening. Total waste of money - entrance fee is ridiculous. You can see the tower for free and it looks best at night. Admire it from a distance.
nice. nice place to take picture, excellent surrounding, the temple near tower was great, we saw some ceremony there
Great. Great views of Tokyo we went in the day on my girlfriend birthday she got a little birthday pack and free ice cream, the staff were very friendly here

A look over Tokyo. Tokyo tower is an iconic location; it is a Paris Eiffel tower inspired construction.
From here you can literally see the entire city of Tokyo and beyond.
It rivals with the more modern Sky Tree but it think it wins for charm. It's an older construction certainly a symbol of Japan economic boom of the 50s and after.

Highly recomended. Tokyo Tower has a good view of Tokyo City at the observation deck and a beautiful toilet. The lights in the toilet made it look nice, it makes you feel like you are in outer space, it was the nicest toilet I have used in my life. The lift going up the tower was very nice as the lights were very special and it kept changing colours. There was also a piece of glass to look down from the tower, it was scary. There were also computer games for young children to play, I wanted to play but unfortunately I cannot read Japanese. There were beautiful lights almost everywhere inside the tower. The way they used the lights to decorate the place made it extremely nice and serene. They even made a normal stairs look very nice by putting lights. Tokyo Tower would be a nice place to visit and I would recommend it and go again.Ethan Kor (12 y.o.)
Great views of Tokyo. Its well worth the visit, we went during the day but realised it would be even better if you went at dusk when the city lights came on.

Worth a visit. I visited the Tokyo Tower during a 24 hour visit to Tokyo with work. There are some great views from the highest viewing platform. 1600 Yen to go to the top platform which is 250 metres.
Great but scary . I'm not good with heights so I was trying not to freak out the whole time I was up there. But they really are great views all around the city.

Good views around Tokyo. Tokyo tower gives good views around the city. Although there are taller buildings, it is a nice tourist attraction as it contains details on directions and locations of other attractions as well

Worth the visit. One of the things we did in tokyo one evening was to take a trishaw ride through the city to tokyo tower. The experience riding through tokyo traffic on the way to the tower was wonderful and our guide, took the trouble to explain things to us and to make turns into side roads to allow us some wonderful photo opportunities. The tower itself afforded magnificent views and there are tonnes of eateries and restaurants so all in all it made for a very nice evening out

Eiffel in Tokyo. I went here on my day 4 in Tokyo. I was in rushing because I couldn't completely visit my targeted places. Too much too soon and the next day have to catch flight back to Kuala Lumpur. Oooo...I get off from Akabanebashi Subway Station, then walk to the tower about 20mins. It's a broadcasting tower. With 333m high you can enjoy a view of the entire city of Tokyo. Of course it is not free, entrance for main observatory area is 900 Yen. From here you just can walk to the next attraction, Zojoji Temple. Definitely satisfied

NIce tower.. clean. Everytime we travel, must not miss to explorer the tOwer, the view is very nice, need to purchase the ticket, although quite expensive but worth the experience. best to go at Night but so many people. HAve a lot of level to shopping the souvenir. Pls prepare more money. Credit card accepted, pls try the Tokyo Tower Waffle is a must try.

Wonderful . This is the best thing I love in Tokyo. It is really really beautiful. Yes it is a copy of Eiffel Tower but I find it much more cute than Eiffel. And it is much more convenient and enjoyable that the new tower of Tokyo, Sky Tree.If you are in Tokyo and have been to Shibuya and Shinjuku, now it is time to go to Tokyo Tower and then to the Zojoji Temple just next to it.

A Romantic Place and Evergreen Icon of Tokyo. For 90's generation, especially who loves Japanese culture, Tokyo Tower plays an important roles. It appeared in many dramas and anime. Tokyo Tower depicting Japanese romance for us.Despite Tokyo Skytree has bigger attention to nowadays tourist, I would prefer Tokyo Tower for its history. And not to forget the baseball mistery in it. Overall, it's a must visit spot in Tokyo!
great views of tokyo skyline. we arrived a little late so most of the shops are closed. went all the way up which had great views of the city.

Beware the Asian King Kong . Remember? He fought with the giant robot King Kong in one of those awesome 60's Japanese scifi movies...they battled to the death from the main observation deck. Why do i bring this up? Well, there was a display of the models from this movie a few years ago but I did not see it recently. It was a great exhibit! This famed tower has held up well and is so iconic that you should do it before the shiny new Tokyo Skytree.

Tokyo Tower may have lost its luster due to Skytree, but they manage to make things exciting with new attractions. Tokyo Tower is one of the most recognized towers in the world. Now the second-tallest structure in Japan (#1 is Tokyo Skytree), Tokyo Tower functioned as a communications and observation tower.Built in 1958 and did its job of broadcasting radio signals, unfortunately when Japan transitioned to digital television, the height was not good enough to support complete terrestrial digital broadcasting and so, Tokyo Skytree was built for that purpose and was made public back in 2012.As the main revenue source for Tokyo tower was antenna leasing and tourism, and for decades, many paying to take photos from the main observatory and the special observatory, with many flocking to Tokyo Skytree, many wondered what would happen to Tokyo Tower.Fortunately, Tokyo Tower managed to bring in tourists with the same observatories but also with the addition of the "One Piece" Tokyo Tower (Tokyo One Piece Tower) attraction.The special observatory is 250m (9:00-22:00 which costs 1,600 yen for HS students and older and includes both observatories, 1000 yen for JR HS students and 800 yen for four years and older) and the main observatory is 150m (9:00-22:00 and costs 900 yen for HS students and older, 500 yen for elementary students and 400 yen for four years of age and older).For the Tokyo One Piece Tower, price is 3900 yen (HS students and older), 3500 yen for JR HS students, 2000 yen for elementary school and 1900 yen for four-years old and older.First floor is the lobby and aquarium plus restaurants. Second floor is the cafe and restaurants + Souvenir Shop. Third floor is the Official Shop, Lovespo Tokyo and where to purchase tickets for Tokyo One Piece Tower and fourth and fifth floor is now occupied by Tokyo One Piece Tower.As for the observatories, you can get really cool shots of the skyline. For me, it was great to visit and compare my father's 1972 photos with my photos of how things look today and how much the area has changed.Tokyo One Piece Tower is great for those who enjoy the "One Piece" manga and anime series.And I also enjoyed the areas that showcased the history of the building of Tokyo Tower.Overall, Tokyo Tower is still a happening place to visit and not as crowded as Tokyo Skytree. Also, make this a trip of going to Tokyo Tower and then across the street to Zozoji Temple.Recommended!

Wow, great view. Recommendation-if you are a visiting non-citizen to Japan you can get expedited access a side entrance at the base of the tower, just show your passport for immediate access, do not purchase in advance if you don't need to.Great shopping/mall at base of tower, many, many options. Almost too many.

If you fall in love with someone.... Must visit!Many couples were kissing and hugging in the dark side at the first observatory, while I visited.If you are solo, you wouldn't go there.The ticket is too expensive(Standard fee ¥900) to watch someone making loves!

Great even if you don't go up.... My advice is visit at night time. It's spectacular under the orange lighting. Even if you don't make the decision to go up to the viewing platform, it's a great place to walk around and capture some photos under the night sky. For something different you could go to the bar on the 33/F of the Prince Park Tower and you get a great view of the tower at night.

Great views mostly unobstructed. Compared to other observation decks in the city, Tokyo Tower has nicely unobstructed views despite it's lower observation deck being comparatively close to the ground. It's also quite a treat to see it glowing in the distance at night.

Nice View. I recommend arriving here before sunset and staying until it becomes dark outside to make full use of the observation deck. The queues to go to the upper observation deck were too long so I did not bother with this. Some bright lights inside the observation deck made it hard to get a good photo without getting some reflection and the windows were not very clear (some sort of scratches or smudges giving a fuzzy look). I recommend the Tokyo Skytree as an alternative if you are only visiting one tower.

Excellent view, a must to visit.. If you are in Tokyo, and the weather is nice and sunny, don´t forget to visit the Tokyo Tower. Amazing view all around, a great opportunity to see Tokyo from a different perspective, and to take some nice photos too.
Tokyo Tower is an icon though old. Tokyo Tower is an icon though no longer popular with the opening of Tokyo Sky Tree. However, it 's still a must see for tourist
great at night. I'm bless to live in the area of Tokyo Tower, so i pretty much enjoy the view daily. I must say i prefer night view with great lighting instead of during the day.

A major beacon for Tokyo. Whilst it has been ostensibly eclipsed in grandeur by its bigger sibling, Tokyo Skytree, Tokyo Tower still holds a lot of charm.It's my first stop every time I visit Tokyo. It's nice to seat in one of the available benches on the lower deck, and having a decent view of the surrounding Tokyo sky.There's also some semi-decent shopping and food to be found at Foot Town (building beneath Tokyo Tower).Altogether, visiting Tokyo Tower can be a quaint, evocative experience. For my wife and I, it holds many good memories from our past visits. Nevertheless, it'll still be our first stop in Tokyo for our subsequent trips to Japan.
A small eiffel tower! . It Was strange to see something similar to eiffel tower in the Middlesbrough of Tokyo ... It gives you a Good impression...and it is very close to a small Buddha temple !

Mount Fugi sunset view amazing. Went up the the tower just as the sun was setting, from the outside it looks exactly like Eiffel Tower except it is red and white painted We didn't go all the way up, but the view of Mount Fuji when the sun was setting was unbelievable Worth a visit but would recommend the skytree tower

One of Tokyo's landmarks. During the day, it may seem its just a tower, but at night, it will be lit, and you will see its true beauty. To have a perfect shot though is a bit tricky, since when you are near the tower, its hard to frame the entire tower hehe.There's a souvenir shop below it, but its an uphill climb if your on foot. There are scheduled bus trips going to and from.If you're in Tokyo, drop by and you won't be disappointed.
Perfect day and night . A spectacular view of Tokyo, we went up at 5pm so could see the view in both daylight and night. Make sure to get a crepe at the bottom entrance as well, they're delicious!

A Tower. You have to make abit effort taking the subway to reach here for nothing much, but just a metallic tower.Night view around from the city is the background of the tower itself. You will feel you miss something while you havnt make a visit in your Tokyo trip, and afterall then you realise is just a Tower...

YES! Mount Fuji view!. We've been to Japan for nearly three weeks last year travelling around and exploring the beauty of the country and didn't see the Mt. Fuji once in that time. So viewing the Mt Fuji came as a really nice surprise when we arrived at the first platform of the Tokyo tower this time. All in all, you have a great view over the city and should consider going here if the weather is fine. :)

Rather loney. This place has a sad feel, sort of like it was forgotten. Interesting building from the outside but not really worth the trip as its not near any other tourist sites. SkyTree is better if you want to see a tower in Tokyo. I'd say this place has a limited future as a tourist attraction.

New Years Eve 2016. We went there for New Years Eve because it was close to where we were staying and seemed like a good option. Took a cab and then walked up a steep hill. The tower is beautiful at night. We were hoping for fireworks, but there were not any .just lots of people hanging out and a big balloon release at midnight. Do not miss the temple only about a block away . That was an experience with all the crowds and the monks chanting. Then they rang a huge bell 108 times to ward off the evil sports in the new year.
Prodigious tower. A remarkable tower with prodigious design. It is one of the places that I liked the most during all my trip to Japan.
Fantastic view. I highly recommend this Tower , it has a Fantastic view great coffee shop , plenty of things to do inside.

Good value for a great view of the city and beyond. There are 2 options for a tower attraction in Tokyo and we chose the older Tokyo Tower due to its convenient location. Being in the centre of the high buildings it has a view in all directions. The Skytree is higher but a little away from the centre. The costs per person were quite good we thought (Yen 900 each for main observatory Yen 700 each for the higher special observatory). We went on a Japanese public holiday expecting long queues, but we made it to the top in around 30 minutes and competed the whole experience in about 1 hour.

Nice view but wouldn't pay for it separately. Got to visit this attraction as part of an organized Gray Line tour. It allowed a very nice view of the city as well as Mt Fuji given the clarity of the day. I would not, however, pay to visit this site separately. If part of a tour, I say "go for it". Otherwise, you can pass and not feel slighted.
Great view of Tokyo especially at night.. We visited Tokyo Tower at night and really enjoyed the 360° view of the city. Definitely a great place to see the city from above.
mini eiffel. Went up to the 250m observatory deck, paid extra and the view is just an ok. Not amazing but it's an experience. I enjoyed looking AT the tower more than looking FROM the tower.
Beautiful tower. The tower and lights standout in the night and is really beautiful. When I went to the tower, I find that the shops within the tower should be relook into to bring more life to it.

Worthwhile for all ages. Worth the 900 yen entry fee, and no need to go to second station. Probably a 1 hour activity unless you want to souvenir shop...then you have another 2 levels of fun? Excellent italian at Tango just across from the exit. Very reasonable prices for the quality, alcoholic drink and a main around 3200 yen.

Wonderful virw. The key to this view is to wait for a clear day. The tower looks a little out of place with its surroundings but it is part of the city. If you want a photo of the tower you need to go to another building to get a good shot. Worth a visit.

A Worthwhile Experience . When in Tokyo it is an interesting experience visiting Tokyo Tower. I would compare it to visiting the Empire State Building or Rockefeller Center. Basically, it is a huge tower that allows you to see Tokyo in a different view. I recommend visiting, but having a guide with you makes the visit more meaningful as you understand what you are looking at. Try to arrange a visit here as a part of a tour.
Beautiful at night. The tower really stands out from other buildings. It is like Eiffel Tower but Japan's very own. Good for romantic dates.

Amazing view. Incredible view but it's better to have a picture of the Tokyo tower from other buildings surrounding. In the 3rd floor there's the one piece museum and in the 2nd ATM and lots of nice souvenirs

Valentine's evening at Tokyo Tower . We had a short time to do some sightseeing in Tokyo having left our luggage in lockers at the airport. We decided we just had time for Tokyo tower and a meal before getting back to the airport. It was dark when we arrived so the photos weren't great but we were amazed at the great panoramic views from the top! It was valentine's day and it was a popular choice for couples who were getting their photos taken with the tower in the background. There was a winter festival theme with fairy lights and pine trees which looked very pretty for everyone's photos. It was a great way to spend the evening. There was a cafe at the top serving food and drink and there was a singer entertaining the diners. Apparently there are often live bands here at weekends and not only valentine's day. We considered this to be good value for money at Y900 each.

Fantastic View of The City!!. Tokyo Tower offers an amazing from of the city from a very nice part of town. at the base there is a very nice flower garden with many vibrant colors in the shape of the tower, perfect for picture taking. people visiting can decide to go up to the lower observation deck and from there choose to go up to the second observation deck. In my opinion i think its much better to go up to the very top, you will get the greatest view of the city and will even be able to see, the much larger, Tokyo Skytree. From the Observation Deck's you can see all sorts of parks, shrines, and gardens around the base of the tower.

Sight worth seeing. It's good to go early before the crowds. One of the places worth visiting whilst in Tokyo. Simply got on a train from Akasaka Mitsuke station and it was about 3 stops then approx. 9 minute walk.

Great view!. There are 2 levels which you can visit at Tokyo tower. We went in a group and visited the first level. It was fun to see entire Tokyo from up there. The most memorable part is the glass screen through which you may see deep down till the ground. At the first floor, tourists are greeted politely and they may even get themselves clicked in traditional Japanese dress for free! I will always remember the warm hospitality of the people there. Thank you!!
Great views. On a clear day you can see Mt. Fuji and beautiful views of the city. Reasonably priced and easy access in the center of Tokyo.
Highlight. Certainly one of the highlights in Tokyo, - a must have seen.Offers great overview to Tokyo and the skyscraper landscape.

Tokyo Tower is Iconic. Although the Sky Tree is much taller than the Tokyo Tower, I think the Tokyo Tower has a nice ambiance to it. The Glass elevator is pretty cool to ride up, pick a clear day so that the view is much nicer and you could possibly see Mt. Fuji. Located a short walk from Hamamatsucho station on the Yamanote line, it is easily accessible. The Zojoji Shrine which is a family shrine for the Tokugawa Family is near the base of the Tower, next to the Tokyo Prince Hotel.
VERY NICE. Didn´t go up but the tower view is very beautiful. Nice place and neighborhood to walk arround. Many attractions arround.
Pretty Cool. Very cool experience to ride the elevator to the top of the observation deck. It was a bit of a cloudy day when we went, but you still can get a very good panoramic view of Tokyo.
Iconic Tokyo. Yes, the skytree is indubitably taller - but it just doesn't have the same charm or romance as this lovely old dame. Great coffee place also inside

Love the view so much !. I visited Tokyo tower twice. I enjoyed this place so much. You don't really have to go up to the tower, as this tower in red color that you can take so many photos from different angles and timings. If you visit the tower during autumn, the colors of the trees nearby is fantastic that will be the most amazing view you would see from the top of the tower.

Spectacular Views. Had to visit this Tokyo landmark and did so a night when it was light up with its winter colours. Offers spectacular views of Tokyo. However, as with any attraction, there are souvenir shops which unfortunately sell "junk".Certainly worth a visit

Light under the Rain. My brother and I went on a rainy evening but it did nothing to dampen the lovely sight of the Tower in all its shining glory. We went in January so it was still decked out in Christmas lights and they had a winter-esque projector show going on in the Tower.
