The Tower has landmarks written in on the walls to show where the places are in relation to it. It's pretty neat. Would love to go back during the day with a pair of binoculars.Unfortunately, since we went late, the Aquarium was already closed so we didn't get to see that. They had a Once Piece shop on the ground floor and it had great stuff.

Kind of fun morning viewing Tokyo from the Tower. We tried all the elevated viewing items and would rate them Municipal Building Shinjuku, Tokyo Tower and Tokyo Skytree in that order. Our trip to the Skytree had weather issues. Our day at Tokyo Tower was on a clear morning. No lines and not very crowded. Our views were rather good but Mt Fuji was hard to make out. I liked that you could match the labeled photos to the view so you knew what you are looking at. They also had two glass panels in the floor so you could stand on them and look straight down. We also stopped by one night just to see the Tower lit-up at night which was rather impressive. I probably would not go a second time but it is definitely worth the visit at least once while in Tokyo. We rode the subway and when we came out of the subway the Tower was right in front of us so we only had a 3 - 4 block walk. I am not a curio shop type person but they had a lot of them in the Tower.

Good view of the Tokyo super city. Reasonable price to head up to Tokyo tower. Beautiful scenery. Cosy restaurant cafe with live band. Depending on the month you visit , lovely decoration inside tokyo tower. Cute souvenirs shop is inside tokyo tower. Well maintained . Just perfect and beautiful for all to visit .

A fun and easy site-seeing trip in central Tokyo.. Just beyond Zojoji Temple is Tokyo Tower, where for $8 a person you can view metro Tokyo from the first observation deck of the Tower. A small price to pay to achieve some perspective and some amazing views of Tokyo from above.

Majestically Iconic. Tokyo Tower is a nice place for viewing sunsets and at night vision from the decks. There are 2 observation decks that you could go. Although older and more simple than the new Tokyo Skytree, it is still a nice spot to chill and relax. On a good and nice day, you can see the Tokyo Disneyland and Mount Fuji from the observation deck. At the foor of the tower are shops selling all kinds of Tokyo Tower related goods from shirts to keychains to mugs. There are a variety of goods to see. Some cafes and restaurants are also at the foot of the tower. If you have no plans to go up the tower, you could just shop around the shops, it's still a nice experience. There is not much crowds on weekdays. But if there is a special event going on, the crowd can be large. Personally, i prefer Tokyo Tower than Tokyo Skytree because of it's simplicity and design.

Nice tower. it's a nice looking tower with lighting in the evenings, somedays it's blue. I think it's a copy of the Eiffel Tower in Paris but smaller so I wouldn't give it a 5 star, but otherwise an awesome landmark in Tokyo, without it i will be lost in the city of matchbox buildings that look the same...

Super Romantic. The most romantic place for a date in Tokyo. It won't keep your relationship alive but it will be an unforgettable day you will probably treasure. For fun go in the day. For dates go at night. The lighting is super cool!

Better viewing options in Tokyo!. I'm not going to say that an Eiffel-esque tower in the middle of an Asian City isn't special, it certainly looks the part. The view of it from a distance is refreshing and inspiring, although I was somewhat let down about it's imposition when I got closer to it.The area it is set in is a little sleepy and not as lively as other areas of Tokyo. For me, the Tokyo Tower was the main reason for visiting this area and it seemed a bit of a let down personally.For me, the best viewpoint for Tokyo is from the Government building in shinjuku. it is free, offers a 360 degree view and is in an area with more life about it.

Best 360* Views of Tokyo. On Sunday evening, we thought we'd try to catch the sunset from the 250m "Special Platform" viewing. The wait was a bit longer (30+ minutes) but worth it. The restaurant is on the 150m level and gets pretty busy around 5pm.

Awsome. A Tokyo icon, you should go at sunset and watch the night falls over Tokyo, wonderful, has two observation decks, the first one at 150 meters high, has a gift shop and coffe shop, the second observation deck at 250 meters where you will have an awsome view of Tokyo. In winter months on the back of Shinjuku area you can see Mount Fuji on clear days, amazing picture. People often compare it to the Eiffel tower, you should know that the Tokyo tower is 9 meters higher than the Eiffel Tower, one place to visit.

Go at night. All i can says it is in the shape of the famous tower in Paris, but it is seriously just a red and white radio tower. At night it does look a little better but it is no eiffel tower. Disappointing for sure.

Iconic site. This is an unused tv signal tower, since the new one was built, but it is still an iconic tourist bucket list. Remember seeing Godzilla climbing up this tower, ala King Kong! Tokyo scenery from above. Could not see Mount Fuji, weather did not cooperate. I found the gift shops a highlight, lots of souvenirs for a reasonable price. Not very crowded when we were there, Wed morning.
Food Court. The food court at the bottom was fab, easy to order and a range of foods. Great place to pick up souvenirs

Amazing view during night. I have visited this in night time, I can just say Wow!!! You will love to just watch the beauty of this tower in full light. If u r visiting japan, do visit this place alteast once☺️☺️.

Pretty Cool. I'm a little spoiled because I grew up with the CN tower but the Tokyo tower is still pretty cool.
The view at night is very nice and I would highly recommend seeing it.
I wish the glass floors were larger but again, that's only from seeing the CN tower before.
Cool spot at night.
Great at sunset.. Great views across the city across to Mt Fuji. Also has part of the floor in glass! Not worth going up to the second observation level though.

Tokyo Landmark. This is a copy of Eiffel Tower; at that period when mimicking western architectures, lifestyle, industrialisation reflects progress and development. One can get a bird's eye view of Tokyo. Evening scenery is better. Came here because we were curious how different it was compared to the one in Paris. Another cross on the list. Once is good enough. You can plan to visit Tokyo Tower along with Roppongi, all within walking distance. There is no need for paid tours. Grab a good city map and subway map to DIY.

A must for first time Tokyo visitors. You can't visit Paris and not be a good typical tourist and visit the Eiffel Tower, and you shouldn't visit Tokyo and not pay respect to Tokyo's tourists route and not visit Tokyo Tower. Keep in mind, like the Eiffel Tower visit, Tokyo Tower visit can be extremely boring or extremely fun. It just depends on who's guiding you there, and whether he/she have that rich and fun information, the rumors, the urban legends, the fun facts, and fun straight out of the box lies that can make you laugh, wonder, get excited and surprised. Unfortunately, good tour guides are mostly found by luck.

The ultimate sight . The thing everyone knows of Tokyo is the Tokyo tower. It is definitely worth a visit and you have a great view of the nearby temples and parks.Not as tall as some other observatories in Asia, but not less charming.A must see!!!
It's a MUST in Tokyo. U have to visit this place .. Panoramic view of Tokyo .. With a great surprise if you are a one piece fan .. There's a whole floor for them with game and souvenirs

Tokyo tower. I was there on a sunny day such gives a great view but I most say that the Tokyo sky tree is better than the tower, but still if you're in the area check it out. And it's also close to the Zojoji temple so you can check that out too.

Amazing views, lots of fun!. When someone suggested going to the Tower, I was like "meh." But it turned out to be an amazing experience. Great views on both levels (definitely get the ticket to the top level!), fun shopping on the base level, and fun exhibits / characters throughout. Definitely worth a visit!!
Wow. It stands tall for all to see fab view at nighttime, though. very busy difficult to sand close to view, would def recommend, a must see when in Tokyo

You can't miss it. I headed to the tower by the end of my first day in Tokyo, the sun was about to set and I had some friends traveling with me, the atmosphere is great, it provides you a great panorama of the city.

As part of a day tour, better then expected . Tokyo tour was better than initially expected.. We were lucky to go on a clear day however but the time we got up there only an outline of Mt Fuji was possible but that was ok for us as we could see it from our hotel.. Tokyo tour was pleasant and gave a good perspective of the size and areas of Tokyo.. as part of the tour few buildings were explained so I would reccomend doing it as part of a tour for that reason or doing some reading so u know what u are looking at.. I would also reccomend going early in the morning or in the evening as the smog starts to obstruct your view.. Otherwise very pleasant experience, favourite part was the viewing glass that you can stand on :P souvenir shop slightly expensive but as you would expect at a tourist attraction.. Plenty of staff around should you need any assistance and plenty of signs to direct you in the right path.. Hope this helps fellow travellers
One of Tokyo icon. I thought you can skip Tokyo Tower from your spot list must visit when you come to Tokyo. Because there is so much place that more attractive to visit than Tokyo Tower.

Pretty Cool. This is an iconic piece of the Tokyo skyline, but it's kinda pricey to go up, particularly to the top. It's really nice to stroll around the area at night, and look up at its looming presence. However, I would recommend a visit to the Tokyo Metropolitan Government building, for free views from the 45th floor observation deck, if you're trying to save money!

Go at Dusk !!!!. on our first day in Tokyo we came to the tower as it was getting dark.. we decided to have a look and it was one of our better decisions.... The view of the city was great and as it fell into darkness we were treated to a cloudless Mount Fuji on the horizon. No need to pay for the top level.. there is nothing more to see and in fact the view gets more remote...
Tokyo's "Effiel".. Check it out at night! Great picture opportunity. Another great idea, is to combine it with a trip to fish market since they are both close in vicinity.
Wayne of time . It's just a tower in the middle of a boring neighbourhood. Nothing like the version in Paris. There you have an awesome tourist area and park around it.

Went to the tower. I spent about $30 USA for me and my wife to go up to both of the levels of the tower. It is beautiful but you can save money and only go to the first level. The second level is no better than the first level. I got a room at the Prince Park Hotel and had a better view. So Save money. Go only to the first level or go get a suite at the Prince. I spent $350 USA for a suite looking over the tower and wished I never went up the tower

prominent mark of tokyo. i stay within the radius tower area so i saw from different sides. local ppl also refer it as Aka (red) tower. for me i think the tower look pretty in daylight but in night it's looks like le tour Eiffel

Tower trip. A fantastic tour up the tower on a sunny day is well worth it. A spectacular city on view. The temple in the park next to the tower is worth a visit too. This is a quiet part of the city and makes a nice break from all the hustle and bustle. Suitable for all ages.

Classic tower of Tokyo has lots of taste. What if you have one day to explore Tokyo, you may think of visiting either Tokyo Tower or Tokyo Skytree(new tower built in 2013) I'd recommend the classic Tokyo tower which is located central Tokyo. It's also near the temple which has definitely interesting story how the ancient EDO historic city had been structured. 一日だけの東京観光、東京タワーかスカイツリーか…うーどっちにしようかなぁ？？僕なら東京タワーだなぁ〜！江戸城を中心にいかに風水の考えを取り入れて街づくりが行われたのか、歴史を紐解く色々な徳川の思惑に気付く周囲の寺巡りも、趣深いライティングも本当に素敵です。是非夕方前から訪れると良いですよ(-_^)

Great view of Tokyo. Attention: If you decide to make the climb up to the Tokyo Tower observatory deck instead of taking the lift you will be given a card-sized Certificate of completion when you arrive at the deck. It's only given to those who make the climb up.The view from tokyo tower is amazing, we visited the tower around noon and the view was spectacular. There is a small shinto shrine at the observatory too.If you want a unique souvenir, purchase a tokyo tower postcard and a international stamp from the souvenir shop, and you can mail the post card from a small letterbox that's located on the observatory deck. Your postcard will be stamped with a unique tokyo tower post stamp.I paired my visit to Tokyo Tower with a visit to the One Piece attraction that's also located in Tokyo Tower, and it took half a day. Way longer than i expected, but i was glad to spend the time

Beautiful night view. Beautiful night view. There are two paid observatory deck. Personally recommend the main observatory deck at 900 yen which is sufficient. The special observatory deck which is much smaller doesnt seem to justify the additional 700 yen payable. Was expecting some open air space but all was enclosed.

Beautiful night view. I visited the Tokyo Tower at night so I got to see the signature orange illumination, which was incredibly breathtaking. There weren't as many people as I expected either. Although I did not visit the Skytree and hence cannot compare the two views, I will say that the view on the Tokyo Tower was very beautiful and definitely worth a visit. If you are not familiar with the city, I recommend going during the day, as it would be a fun activity to find the buildings marked on maps around the tower, as well as maybe see Mount Fuji, but if you enjoy lights and night views, Tokyo Tower's view is beautiful as well. The top observatory is worth the price as well, as you get to see more of the city.

A Romantic Observation Deck over Tokyo’s City lights. If the Tokyo Skytree is the World’s Tallest Tower; the Tokyo Tower would be one of the most romantic places in Japan. At night, its orange lights illuminate the structure giving more brilliance to its grandeur. Depending on your point of view, for some the main deck would be enough to adore Tokyo within what your naked eyes can see, but if you’re craving for more you could always pay extra to climb up to the 250m deck however, everything would look a lot smaller.
Fantastic Views. I went up the Tokyo Tower and saw the fantastic views of the city and the river. The illumination was nice and the view is the best at dusk when everything starts to set.

See Tokyo from the Tower. A magnificent structure built to exacting engineering standards. See Tokyo for miles around from the viewing platforms. At night, see the brilliant lights of this astounding city. Food and gift shops abound.

Very nice. My wife and i walked to the Tokyo Tower from the Hamamatsucho Terminal annexed to the World Trade Center Bldg. it was a good 10 minutes walk, walking thru the streets was an experience, the sun was up, it was cold morning, we loved it!

The Eiffel Tower of Japan easily spotted with bright orange light at night. We went to Tokyo Tower and then Zojoji Temple (just a few minutes walk from the tower) on the midnight of December 31st for a Japanese New Year’s Eve celebration – the 108 ringing of temple bells. In Japan, people believe we are born with 108 earthly desires, which are removed when the temples bells across Japan are struck 108 times. It was a nice experience as I was able to witness a different kind of New Year’s Eve celebration. Tokyo Tower is like the Eiffel Tower of Asia – easily spotted with bright orange light at night. If you have time, buy a ticket to the observatory floor which is a nice spot to view the Tokyo skyline.
Fantastic Views!. Brilliant staff, easy to get to and wonderful views of Tokyo. Definitely recommend a visit whilst in Tokyo.

Nice Views. We only went as far as the main observation deck and the views of Tokyo were great and I would highly recommend doing this at night. I felt that the main deck was high enough, no need to pay extra to go higher. It is well worth going to see and only takes a short time, it's very near the Roppongi area which has a busy nightlife.

Worth a passby. We were lucky that our hotel had a nice view of the city but in my opinion the time it takes to go up the tower and deal with the people traffic isn't worth it. However it's nice to see as you pass by it. My suggestion would be to knock it out by either passing by on the way to eat or to get a drink at Sky Lounge in the Prince Park Tower and you'll have a nice view with a relaxing drink :)
Cool looking tower within Tokyo. A 5-10 min train ride from the Imperial Palace.It reminds you of the Eiffel Tower in Paris.Great views. Really cool looking at night.

Awwwwwwwsommmmmeeee. Wow just wow Must visit if you go to tokyo Don't leave tokyo without going to the top worth every penny I mean yen .its open till late so you can leave this for the last as the view is best at night

great views but dont pay extra to go to top. best way to see the best views of Tokyo. We paid to go to the 250m tower, but in hindsight, I dont think it offered that much more. Just go to the first viewing platform (150m). Its still brilliant from that level. Obligatory gift store in tower and on ground floor. Well worth the visit

Epitome of tourist trap. It's a tower you can ride up in to either 150m or 250m. The higher you go, the more expensive it is. It was 1700yen ($17.00) to go to 250 without the "special observatory" or the souvenir miniature tower.Doesn't compare to the Eifel tower either - this is much newer and less cool.Plenty of shops to buy souvenir stuff, get your picture taken, etc. I did get come nice photos of the cityscape from up there, but Tokyo has a good deal of smog so they weren't that gorgeous.Ok to see from the outside, just know what you're going into on the inside.

It he icon of Tokyo a must do!. You cannot visit Tokyo without coming to the Tokyo tower. This iconic landmark is a must see and do when here. The observation deck is only one small part of the tower. There is several floors of shopping and a food court that you should have lunch at. Weekends the tower host local street entertainers where you can watch a monkey perform, singers sing, and dancers dance. All the entertainment is free! Yes the Skytree is the taller ,newer tower, but I prefer the original. There is a reason why tour companies still make this tower a visit.Explore it and have fun!

No firework on New Year. Me and my family went to Tokyo Tower from kawaguchiko. We were in hurry and expected to have wonderful New Year over here but when the time had counted down until New Year..there was nothing!! just balloons..so just realize that there is no firework here Lol

You can enjoy even from a distance. This is one Tokyo attraction you can actually enjoy even from a distance. We were at Roppongi Hills for a different event. You can certainly admire it from there or take a short train ride a land a couple of minutes walk to visit it in person. Not much happening the day we visited. Took photos and went back to the hotel.

Beautiful. I was at Tokyo Tower 15 years ago in the day time, and the view of the city (as far as my memory recalled was only so so...). However, this time I decided to visit during the night time, and I am surprised that the view is spectacular the brightly lighted up tower is magnificent at night!Entrance ticket is cheap and worth to go up to have an overview of Tokyo city at night.A night to remember!

Historical place.. As it is fashion to visit Tokyo Sky Tree, I was very glad to be more conservative and also visit the Tokyo Tower, build at the same time of the Atomium in Belgium in 1958. Great view from there and pleasant atmosphere on the top level.

I love Tokyo!. The Tokyo Tower is undoubtedly a classic tourist spot. The 360 degrees view of the whole Tokyo is superb!
During Christmas there is a special illumination and makes it even more memorable!

Great views, fun for everyone. Just be sure to get there early to avoid any line ups, we visited on a weekday around 9 or 10 am and there was no line. The price is a bit expensive but the views are really fantastic on a clear day. Definitely worth it to see what Tokyo really looks like from above.
We loved Tokyo Tower. We really enjoyed Tokyo Tower, especially for the little market shop within, it was great for gifts etc.

Okay. This is a nice noverlty. This high eiffel tower fake allows panorama views of the city, if you are into that. Somehow fro the location of the tower the city just does not look that interesting. The fact that this tower looks exactly like the Eiffel Tower also does not allow much authenticity. Overall I would say if his is included in a prepurchased tour than do it but otherwise dont make a special trip here

The View. The place was serene, because when we went, there weren't so many people since it was early in the morning.But we were not able to see Mt. Fuji since it was alittle foggy from afar. Brung your binoculars if you have one
Don't bother. Went at night to see the view. Very crowded, windows were dirty and smudged. Had loud music pounding and lights flashing. As if the Tokyo skyline needs more bling!

Great place for Young people. Tokyo Tower is part of our day trip and its just one stop away from Senso-ji Temple.Its shopping mall is big enough for everyone and restaurants provide a great variety of good food.

Beautiful views of Tokyo. We managed to get up to the tower on a very clear night, Views of Tokyo are beautiful, we wanted to go during the day to see Mount Fuji but we never got around to it . They have a gift shop and shopping arcade in the basement (ground floors) beneath the tower and on the middle observatory.

Want to see Tokyo from the top or One Piece Tower?. So many things inside the building. I found foodcourt, souvenir shops, etc. i paid ¥3900/person to saw Tokyo Tower (went up) and also One Piece Tower if you like it.
Beautiful Tower you must see in Tokyo. It's the most beautiful tower in Tokyo even though it's not the tallest tower in Tokyo any longer. There are many resto and souvenir shops on the ground floor.

Nice at night. Nice relaxing place to hang around towards the late evening and night time. Was driven around a few places in Tokyo as part of a tour at night and found it to be a nice relaxing place with a lot to see. Tokyo Tower is well illuminated and you can see it from a while away. Getting off there isn't much to do around it as far as I could see but I guess you don't go to a tower for the attractions outside but for the views. Not as high as we're used to these days with the Arabs competing with their petrodollars and leaving wonderful structures each bigger than the last, but still a decent size nonetheless and makes for good views.

Worth a Visit. Even though it not as high as compared to today's world record breaking towers but still it is worth one visit. The observation deck is decent, gives a good view of Tokyo. The tickets were reasonably priced.
Mount Fuji . Great view of Tokyo! You can even see Mount Fuji! The que to the top tower did take a while but is worth the wait. The price of the tickets was 1600yen.

Great view . This should not be missed if you are visiting Tokyo. Been here and top many times during my stay in Tokyo for past three years. This is more enjoyable view than skytree as you see the think skyscrapers and traffic closer.

Tokyo Tower. Going to Tokyo Tower in the week we spent there was the only paid touristy thing we did - not a must-do but worth a look if you are in the area. There are 2 platforms, one at 150m and the next at 250m.
For the views. Really enjoyed the view and gave a good perspective of Tokyo. Was not very crowded when we was there so quick to get up to 250m viewing platform with a great 360 view of the city.

View it from afar. Go to a viewing platform somewhere else and get Tokyo tower on your shot, it's not really worth trekking all the way to roppongi for. Absolutely stunning when you contrast it to its surroundings when taking a shot from a viewing platform somewhere else!

Awesome but long lines!!!. First of all, do not wear heels if you are walking around roppongi hills... Trust me! We went around 8pm on a Saturday night and there was about a 30 min wait to actually get in. You pay right before you get in and that ticket gets you to the middle of the tower. Gorgeous views at this level. Now to get to the very top of the tower you must stand in another line and pay again! Wasn't in the mood to stand in another line so I have yet to make it to the top. Also there is a One Piece shop and restaurant!
Reasonably priced. Reasonably priced tourist attraction and some great food in the building below. Queues were not too long either.
Awesome view!. A must visit place when in Tokyo..Been here with my wife on 2013.Visit at night is the best when the lights is up.Worth visiting!
A visit to Tokyo Tower. If u want to see Tokyo from a different angle, this place is a must. U can see the whole of Tokyo from the observation deck.

Tacky but worth a look. Tokyo Tower is an Eiffel Tower wannabe, and it's a little cringeworthy. However, it is very pretty at night time and worth a look from the outside. The Metropolitan Offices would probably give you a better high level panoramic view though (and they're free!)Tokyo Tower was a bit of a trek to get to from the train (especially JR line) though. :(
A great view of Tokyo!. Its similar to Eiffel Tower, but the smaller version. The glass window on the floor was fun, you can see all the way down through.

Great place. This was really organized and wonderful. No problems at all. From the subway, it's a little hard to figure out how to walk to the entrance so do your homework first. During a clear day you can see Mount Fuji. Bathrooms are located at every level.

Amazing views. We visited Tokyo Tower as part of a day-tour of Tokyo. We had stunning views of Tokyo, and Mt Fuji in the distance, apparently we were very lucky to have such views in early December. Worth the trip on a clear day!

A site to cross of the list, but not a must. Went here in the afternoon. An semi impressive tower, lots of tourist.I think it's worth s visit to cross it off the list of things to do in Japan , but if you're pressed for time idea skip this.
Magnificent view. We were on Tokyo Tower Dec 20. A very clear day with a great sight. The recommendation is to go to the special observation deck.
famous tower in the world. famous tower in the world easy to go there by train. inside tower sometime have exhibition such as one piece theme park

Nice place to go but not a must. It is a nice place and interesting to see from the bottom the construction.To go up to the viewing platform is no a must. Better go to Roppongi Hills Tower (higher, better view).

Amazing views of Tokyo . Lovely couple of hours out and seeing the views of Tokyo, reasonably priced however constantly very busy so make time for queuing. Would of been a tad better if they had more than one little square of glass to see below.
Just the panoramic view.. Deserves the visit cause of the view but you have many other similar options. Very commercial and nothing new. Near by you can visit a beautiful temple.

Beautiful at night. The Tokyo Tower is nice for a visit but don't expect it to be as big or majestic as the Eiffel Tower.
We went there both in the day and night. It was completely different at night due to the lighting and illuminations. It was more beautiful at night.
ABSOLUTELY TO TRY. We had the fortune to have a Japanese friend as guide and we went there also by ourselves, the view is great and lots of places for dining and shopping....

Eiffel Tower of Tokyo. Every cities have its' own land mark/symbol. Tokyo Tower is for Tokyo. It reminds me of Eiffel Tower, and true enough its' construction was inspired from Eiffel Tower (that what I have been informed). Is it a must visit place or not, it is very much depend on individual. It is just a tower which one could go up to observatory level (or even higher, to a special level with extra fee) and could have a bird eye view of Tokyo and surrounding (could even see Mount Fuji, provided has a clear sky). Otherwise if visiting a land mark place is a must to complete one visit, than visiting Tokyo Tower is a must.Beside as observatory tower, there also shops and restaurant there. One could get japanese souvenir stuffs there and also official tokyo tower mementos.It is said the tower is painted in 'international orange' colour. It does showed its' unique colour especially at nite.
Tokyo Tower. Just took nice pictures around the area and the time we were there the entrance is closed since it's Christmas Holidays.
Unbelievable Sight Seeing experience. It'll worth every buck. Trust me. Shops, Dinning, and a wponderful scenery on top, at the Summit of Tokyo itself!
Cool. Cool place,but for me it was not one of my favourite places in Tokyo.I recomend to visit it as the last thing,there others great places to see there.

A Symbol of Tokyo. Whether you think it's beautiful or not, the tower is a symbol of Tokyo even if a higher tower exists.As well as the view of the day and night, you can enjoy the thrill when you see the ground through the floor made of glass.Souvenir shops in the lower floors look cheep though, I like to show Noppon Brothers, weird mascots of the tower, to my friends.

spent a day there. To me, Tokyo is Tokyo tower, not Skytree. The tickets here are cheaper and there are more activities to be done. My sister and I started with the haunted house. It's a private haunted house experience so you can adjust the creepiness and stop whenever you want. There were 3 levels, we picked level 2. Be sure to get the discount if you bought the tower ticket itself.We spent 2 hours on the first level. There is a nice cafe there with soft cream. We were lucky to watch a free jazz show there. We've made key chains with our names and the date on them. Piece of advice, take many photos before the sunsets. There is a see-through, glass, floor panel. It's a great photo spot. They also take your photo professionally with your own camera for free. My sister bought a printed copy for 1000 Yen. We decided to go to the top after sunset. It was a great move. We got to see the Ferris Wheel lit. Toilets are clean. No Halal food though, so Muslims, take a snack with you.For One Piece fans, there is a HUGE place for you to go crazy there.Overall, a great experience. Don't go on rainy or cloudy days.

Ok for a look. Not bad for a view of the city. Went up to the first viewing level but the line was too long to go up to the next level so we just had a look around from there. There was a cool window you can stand on to look straight down. You can see a lot from the middle section. Even mt fuji on a clear day apparently. Not when we went.

View of Tokyo from 150m - 250m!. Went to Tokyo Tower during the day. Nice view to see Tokyo from up there. They also have markers for places like where to see Mt. Fuji, Shibuya, etc on the 150m level. They also have a lookout window on this level.Additional fee may be charged when you want to go up to the 250m level. Nicer view up there! The 250m level is smaller than the 150m so it might be crowded. Still, nicer view on the 250m!

A beautiful Tower needs more space to be viewed. Located in a rather tight location makes the Tower less amazing. It needs a big location to accommodate this huge Tower. Even when standing close by, you hardly catch a beautiful, clear picture of the Tower especially when the weather is bad. The inside has nothing special , more emptiness than expected. I was rather disappointed, so did not make an attempt to go up higher since the weather was foggy too.The Eiffel Tower would win more scores than..........
Worth a visit. If your in the area it's defiantly worth a visit just to see the views. There wasn't a long wait either.

Night view was perfect . I went there at early Nov 2014, I didn't go up to the tower but the night view of the tower was sooooo good, and there is a park around there which we see red leaves as well:) I think it nicer to go at night.

Must see attraction, especially at night. The Tower offers panoramic views from the top--worth it for all the first-time Tokyo visitors. What's even more worth it is coming to see the tower at night, when it's all light up. Perfect photo opps from the outside with no need to go in. The tower resembles Eiffel Tower although it's missing some of the Parisian charm.

Stunning Backdrop. Tokyo tower provides an amazing backdrop from many areas of the city.I lie how it lights up at night and they also change the colour of it. Makes for a very romantic walk around the area at night.

Go at night!. After seeing this tower in the day, I didn't think it was anything too special. However, after passing by it at night, I have a different opinion! It was so beautiful and had a few activities/Christmas decor and pictures/food trucks around the bottom when we were there at night. We were there in December so it was pretty cold, but it was neat to see. We decided not to go to the observatory, but just being around it was a good experience. Check out the park nearby with temple if going during the day!
Looks great. Its a nice place to visit. Its not as tall as Eiffel but has its own beauty and charm. Nearby there's a huge market for shopping. Some really nice souvenirs can be shopped from there.
Nothing Special. We went as part of a tour, so I am not sure what the admission was, but the view was ok. Would not go out of my way for this one.

An elevated view of Tokyo and possibly Mt Fuji as well. Provides a good view of the city and if you are lucky you will be able to see Mt Fuji in the distance. Got many souvenirs shops at the lower floors.
360 degrees Tokyo skyline. The brightly lit Tokyo Tower was stunning at night. And the acquarium projections made it so magical for the kids. Better if you can visit both day and night time.

Tokyo's answer to the Eiffel Tower. An impressive piece of engineering, the views from the top are great (although there are lots of great views available in Tokyo (Skytree, Roppongi Hills etc) and at night, it's lit up wuth beautiful light combos - worth a visit even if you don't want to go up it.

Disappointed of the location . We visited on end Oct, the tower only a few LED purple light during the night, but not the full gold or others color light-up, what a disappointment.10 minutes walking distance from Subway Station, only when we reached down the Tower we can saw it as the Tower was blocked by the building around it.We didn't enter into the building for the view, just walk around & photo shot the outlook, around the tower got nothing others than Zojoji Temple. There were no place for a good photograph, under the Tower was a outdoor carpark.13 meters taller than its model, the Eiffel Tower which we had visited it before Tokyo Tower. Eiffel Tower doesn't blocked by any building, you able to see the Tower everywhere around it, you can have many great photo shots or sit on the big field land next to the Tower to relax your feet & mind.Not attractive at all, not worth during our visited! Definitely will not go back!Thanks for the vote if you found this helpful :D

Best Attraction . Tokyo Tower got its romantic and history. No matter day time visit or night time visit you can have a great view of the city. The environment nearby are keeping to its original. A place must go when you come to Tokyo.

Excellent View. Excellent View of the City and accessible easily by public transport, reasonable price of the visit. The Tower looks colorful & traditional tower model. With lightning in the night it is even more beautiful.

Good thing to do. It was a fun place to go. Fee is 900Y for the lower, main level, and 1600Y for the higher one.We did the main level and it was a good view. You can upgrade when you get up there if you decide you want to go higher.

Not something to write home about. visited the tower after reading great reviews on TripAdviser. Maybe it's nice if you have kids and feel you MUST spend money on tourist-traps. The view isn't great (Tokyo isn't so nice from above) and there are soon many other things to do in Tokyo. This should be last.

Cool views - go early to beat the rush. The views from here were great, and I managed to beat the crowds by arriving at 9:00 a.m. sharp. By 9:20, there were mobs of people pouring out of the lifts.My only complaint is that the glass is coated with a plasticky substance, so the pictures you get may not be as clear as you'd like.

There are more things inside!. Tokyo Tower is massive. I went there to take a picture but in the end I decided to go inside the tower. There are a lot of shops that you can get the souvenirs from, and they're in a good price. There are also restaurants inside that you can sit down and chill.

Amazing. I have always wanted to see this tower after hearing tales of it as a young boy from my Dad who had visited with work.I was so please when I finally got to see it and while yes, it is not the tallest in Tokyo and yes, people will say it's a red and white Eiffel Tower, to me, this was an unbelievable day and great to go up and look over the sprawling Tokyo below.Well worth a visit

Worth it. Go early and there's nobody there. The views were phenomenal. Make sure you go all the way to the top, as you can buy a ticket to the main area which isn't the top. The top is where it's worth it, I didn't love the main floor.

Nice Ride. That was a nice nice ride. It cost very little, about 5 dollars and inside there is everything you need to spend a couple of full hours. The box-building at its botto looks very bad, but it gives the chance to have many shops inside.The view is really really good. And there is no queue as everyone is at the skytree.

Looks amazing from Park Hotel. a bit similar look with Eiffel Tower. It was look more beautiful from far. Nothing much special at the bottom of the tower. We had more beautiful city view from our hotel room.

Used to be Landmark of Tokyo. Tokyo Tower used to be the landmark of Tokyo until Tokyo Skytree was completed in 2010. In spite of that, it is still the best one to me. Located at southern side of Tokyo, it really stands out of the skyline around that area. It doesn't have as many visitors as Tokyo Skytree has though. * To come here, take Toei Subway Oedo Line to Akabanebashi Station. There is still a long walk ahead though.
Bring you girlfriend here. You can simply win every girl's heart just by taking her here. The spectacular view will make you feel so high

Tourist Trap. Seriously? You need to wait 2 hours to ride the elevator? 1600 Yen for half way up and 2600 Yen for the full ride. So crowded and so expensive. The picture on TA is as good as you will get . Not worth the expense or headache of going there.
Good views of the city. The tower offers good views of the city. It can get pretty crowded on weekends, so if you have a stroller or wheelchair, you will feel it.

Looked amazing at night. I didn't go up the tower but went to see it.It looks absolutely incredible at night. It has to be the best lit/ more lit attraction I have ever seen.Don't miss it at least for a look. I went a day the sky was blue. Looked amazing
Spectacular views. Great views of city at dusk. Lots of photo opps. Very little waiting in lines even though many people here on Sunday.

Amazing view of Tokyo. This is a great place to see Tokyo from above. There two or three different levels to go up and the higher you go the more you see. There is a restaurant on the first level with plenty of seating. This is not a very crowded attraction because there are newer place to see Tokyo from higher heights but is still well worth seeing. It is a copy of the Eifel Tower just smaller. Looks great at night.

Paris in Tokyo. I've never been to paris, but Tokyo tower is just as nice. At the very top the view is is amazing. I suggest you go during the day and night. On a clear day you can see the Rainbow bridge. Japan is place you can keep coming back to every year and Tokyo tower is a must!

Tokyo Tower. The view from the tower is spectacular. The city itself is so clean compared to other major metropolitans so you will be able to see very far. the surrounding area also has a beautiful park and there is a temple that is a must see within walking distance.

Great at Night. We were not planning to come here after visiting ten years ago so when we walked by in the night after dinner at Miyabi in Roppongi, the night lights of the place attracted us to enter. It was worth a visit and the night lights were beautiful. I guess the visitorship might have fallen after Skytree opened but I think they both have their merits. I recommend a night visit

I suggest visiting at dusk. I suggest visiting at dusk to see what the city looks liks both at daytime and at night. The real show begins at night though. The tower itself, as well as the entire city looks fantastic with their glimmering lights. Plus points to this place for not being too crowdy (I visited in June), so you get to snap photos at any angle of the 360 panoramic view. There are sitting areas at the viewing deck so you can take your time and relax.

That other tower. Tokyo Tower from my understanding used to be the tallest structure in Tokyo until Skytree came along. Regardless, Tokyo Tower offers a different view of the city and also has some activities and places within.Again, the people are very courteous and helpful as is the case in almost any area of Japan, considering I know VERY little Japanese. The view here offers something different and unfortunately I wasn't able to stay here for the sunset and when the lights coming on, but I did marvel at everything around.There are different levels of viewing, and as mentioned, there are events or activities that might be going on at the time of visit. There was a One Piece exhibit of some sort going on that I was unable to attend.At night, it looks beautiful in person and up close I would imagine even more so, but was only able to see it from afar. If I could recommend this place, I would say come here first, then to Skytree.

Another good point for Tokyo sightseeing. Tokyo tower gives you a different view than skytree since this one is located to the south of Tokyo and Skytree is located at the north-east of Tokyo. It is very good to seeing the city from the sky.

Short and sweet. It was a quick trip to the observation deck. Something different wt the see through glass below the tower. There are few souvenir shops upstairs and downstairs the tower. You can sit for a cup of coffee at the observation deck level.

Things to do in Tokyo | Amazing Night lights at Tokyo Tower. I had been a lot of times in Tokyo, and it was my first time that I went up into the top of the Tokyo Tower, the views are fantastic, incredible and so beautiful! The price is good, because in Tokyo almost everything is so expensive, sometimes the Tower has a lot of people in there, I think, the best time to go there is between 6:00pm and 8:00pm, because the locals are working yet, after that, locals and tourists get together in the Tower, and it's becomes impossible to see anything!

Great views on a clear day. We visited the Tokyo Tower in the morning as part of a bus tour and went to the first level observation deck (not all the way to the top). It was a little overcast the day we went, but we did get a nice 360-degree view of the city. One feature that we found interesting was the "floor windows" - you can look DOWN from the observation and see the cars on the street below.

Lovely place to see Tokyo. Tokyo Tower is the place you need to go when you are in Tokyo like Eiffel Tower when you are in Paris!I went there around 5 time during all my travel in Tokyo and it's always a pleasure to go there again the view always change depending on the weather and you can see Fuji san if you are lucky.

Tokyo view. We were lucky to visit Tokyo tower in morning as well as in evening. Definitely, the experience in evening is much more enchanting. However, in morning you can have a view of the distant Mount Fiji and look down from the glass floor to let you heart skip a beat. In night the view of lighten up city, rainbow tower and Tokyo's sky scrappers, is amazing.

Incredible 360 views. Though I would've loved to have spent more time there, the experience is one I would definitely recommend. We visited during the morning, so we thought we'd be battling crowds but were surprised to find there weren't many at all. The lower floors have stacks of souvenir and market stalls to browse, be careful as it's easy to get disorientated to where the exits are! Lots of fun to be had.
Better at night. At daytime it's not impressive as the archtictural structure is not stunning. At night, all lit-up, it changes and shows its best.

Night visit!. We bought a wrong ticket. We intended to buy a ticket up to the main observatory but ended up we bought tokyo one piece tower + main observatory which cost us ¥4800 for adult. Luckily, we enjoyed playing at one piece tower. On the 1st floor, there are a lot of souvenir shops. Price is cheap too and about the same as outside. We love the glass floor view. Made me shaky! Should come at night. I love how they decorated with starlight theme.

Glass floor. Our 12 year old was very keen to go up the top and stand on the section of glass where you can look all the way down.It was worth it!He loved the experience and we all enjoyed the 360 degree panorama of Tokyo. Afterwards we had an enjoyable meal in the food hall, and did some great souvenir shopping. Despite being a major tourist destination, the shopping here was better and no more expensive than any other market or shopping destination.Recommended.
Tokyo iconic tower. A must see for any tourist. Great photo opportunity. Nice during the day spectacular by night. We were lucky enough to have this landmark standing tall out our hotel window.
Nice view. Poor substitute for the Eiffel tower, and there are better options in the city. Stop on the jump on jump off bus
Great view. That was the first time I saw the Tokyo tower and in the evenings it is fantastic, in particular if the sky is clear and one can take clear photos!

Awesome View. First very well decorated for Christmas. Amazing view of the complete town of Tokyo. There are also many souvenir shops inside - on the entry floors.I'd highly recommend spending some time at Tokyo Tower.
Incredible panoramic views. It is well worth going up as far as you can for the views across Tokyo. We timed it so we were there just as the sun set.

Tokyo Tower! A must see tourist attraction!. We visited Tokyo Tower, the second tallest structure in Tokyo! It is also a TV Station, that acts as a tourist destination. The Tokyo Tower is 333 meters tall, and there are two viewing decks, the main deck, and the special deck. To enter the deck, there is two fees available. Y900 for the main deck only, and Y1,600 for the special deck. They also have a spectacular show at 5:30 pm and 8:30 pm. You can go there either morning or night!
tokyo tower. Japanese are very proud of this structure it dos give a good view and gives you a good photo opportunity of the high rise skyline

Oh my.... Been there with friends. This place is really cool.For the ones that just arrived in Tokyo, I really recommend the visit.No matter if you are alone, in couple for a romantic moment, a photography addict or simply a traveller, everyone will find some great view up there. Everything is well organized, clean and for an affordable price.Thanks a lot Tokyo!

Amazing city sightseeing. With two stops, you can explore Tokyo from 150m (900 ¥, ~8 USD) and 250m (700 ¥, ~6 USD) in height. The view from both stops is amazing. Interesting the transparent floor that gives you the idea to fall :). On the basement you can find a lot of shops for buying souvenirs.

Landmark of Tokyo. Been there evening time, the light up is superb ! Lights is the Tower change every moments with different of colors. You can spend lot of time there for One piece items if you are a One Piece FANS . All sort of cookies, chocolate and Tokyo souvenir can be found here. Go around 19:00 and there is LIVE singing at the observation deck.You can have a drink, enjoy spectacular view & listen to music wow marvelous !
Great views by day, great photos by night. We came to the observation deck during the daytime, and took pictures at night. At night it is beautifully lit. Very well decorated for Christmas.
view from tokyo tower. Amazing view of the complete town of tokyo. However the cost of the ticket is too expensive, especially if you want to go to the top level.

I didn't really like the tower until... ONE PIECE. I used to live in Tokyo and honestly I only kind of check out tokyo tower. I didn't really give it a chance. I travelled a lot and I thought one tower was the same as another. Then, they got a one piece area. Oh my lord. It is One Piece Mecca. The place has a great one piece store, restaurant, and cafe in addition to the attraction. Also, the viewing floor is decent. There's a nami casino (not a real casino), Sogeking shooting area, Franky Hentai Gatcha , Franky cola restaurant, Sanji buffet restaurant, mini games, zoro vs kuma game. Really. It's just so much fun. I am a little biased because this has been one of my favourite cartoons since I was young. The one piece live action show was GREAT. In addition to this, there are also a number of souvenir shops and restaurants. This is definitely a must do for one piece fans.
Beautiful view!. We went all the way to the top. It was cloudy so we did not get to see Mt Fuji, however, we did get to see a beautiful sunset as well as Tokyo.
Fantastic. Great thing to do in Tokyo. You get great views of the skyline on a clear day! The observation deck is 150m up which isn't that high but high enough and for ¥900 it's totally worth it!
Just relax trip. This is second time came to Japan. I was in the tower I looking for the buy ticket counter but I don't know where is the counter?

Tired. Maybe high level views are getting to a bit ho hum but the Tower seemed a bit tired and yesteryear. It had been a long standing tourist draw in Tokyo and is worth the nostalgia but don't expect much bang for your buck.

Nice!. After a walk in the busy Roppongi area you'll find the Tokyo Tower in the more quiet embassy area. It lights up and offers a good photo op. Do you have to see it? No, probably not. We only went there on our fifth visit to Tokyo. It's nice to have seen it as well as the identic Eiffel tower in Paris!

Nice view. Visited at night. Enjoyed seeing it lit up nicely and christmas decorations downstairs before entering. Beautiful views of Tokyo can be seen from the lower level. I didn't feel it necessary to pay for visiting the upper level.

Awesome views from 150m above ground. We took a super fast lift to the observation deck which is 150m above ground. There views were awesome. You could experience the busy streets and the packed buildings standing tall around the tower.This is marvelous and it shown you the view of a modern and packed city.

Awesome from outside and from the top. You just cannot miss the Tokyo tower ! Especially at night when the fully light tower is visible from most of Tokyo. Its simply majestic. The view from the top is breathtaking and you get to see the entire Tokyo city.

Cool Attraction. If you're in the area, check this out. I've been twice now, on two different visits. You get some cool views of the city, but that's about it. If you have been up in other towers in Tokyo, and your short on time, I wouldn't prioritize this.

Beautiful views!. The view is so beautiful!!! I only went 150m up and it was amazing, I didn't even need to go up to the highest level. You can see amzing views of the city and the mountains. I got some beautiful photos of the sunset. Very crowed but worth it.

Tokyo Tower. amazing Tokyo tower !i visited the tower at day light, make sure before you visit that there is good visibility.the tower looks like small Eiffel tower, and it was use as communication antenna.the tower is very pretty from the outside and the inside, there is super fast elevator that take you to the top observition level, you get amazing 360 view of tokyo, and there are also amazing see through flower in some of the areas.

Magnificent Tower. We came on a drizzling night. The majestic tower standing tall and mighty, easily spotted once you step out of the subway exit. Nearby walking distance. Lighted orange color tower was especially charming and beautiful in the gloomy cold night. Didn't go up the tower as it's cloudy weather, cannot see much of Tokyo, Shop around the souvenir shops and had dinner in the vicinity. Worth going to take a glimpse of the tower and go see panoramic view (with entrance fee) of Tokyo on clear weather.

Amazing Views of the City!. Amazing views of all sides of the city. The cost is a little pricey, but certainly worth it. A must visit while in Tokyo. The staff is professional and friendly. The premises are very clean and organized.

Don't miss this. We took a few hours one morning to go up to the Tokyo Tower. We only went to the lower landing - just my teenage son went up to the very top one. He said it wasn't worth the extra money - the view is already spectacular from the main viewing floor. You can't appreciate how huge Tokyo is until you see it from the tower. There are also many souvenir shops inside - on the entry floors.

Excellent hotel! . This hotel was very nice! Located in Minato right next to Tokyo tower. Behind the hotel is a beautiful garden to walk through and take amazing photos. My room was very up to date with a view of Tokyo tower. The staff very helpful and speak pretty good English. Only down side was the sky bar on the top floor was a little expensive.
I prefer Tokyo tower!. I climbed up to the top once like 10 years ago, but i like looking up from the outside. it's beautiful orange light in the dark. symbol of Tokyo city!

Godzilla was here!. I made sure to visit this site during a trip to Tokyo after seeing it since I was a child in Godzilla films. It didn't disappoint with amazing views of the city. The night I went they had an extremely talented live singer and a laser show on the view glass that projected over the city. I'd highly recommend spending some time at Tokyo Tower.
Must Do !!. Much more impressive than Tokyo Tower, SuperFast Elevator, little wait and AWESOME panoramic View..Decent Snacks and affordable Souvenirs.

Not attractive at morning . It is better to visit the tower at sunset or evening to have some photos, it needs little waking if using metro to get there , it can be managed to visit some nearby attractions .

Impressive view at night. Tokyo Tower itself is not a beauty at day so if you want to go there, go at night or almost night. There are 2 options for the viewing deck, the other one is not that high which is what we took (as it is cheaper). It has a nice view of Tokyo but you cannot take decent panorama shot of the city since there are rails/divider (not sure about the case in the higher deck).One thing that i like is the snow globe!!! They have a nice one at 1200¥. No need to go up (and pay) to buy the snowglobe as there is a shop at 3rd floor.If you can afford the highest deck, go for it. I bet the view is much nicer up there. :)

Fabulous views!. The Tokyo Tower looks a little garish in comparison to it's French cousin (this is due to the aviation laws), so I was a little skeptical on approach. The line up for tickets wasn't long at all, and in no time I was through the lobby and in the elevator headed for the main observatory level.For all there were a lot of people on the main level, it was spacious and didn't seem crowded. The views from the 360° windows were quite impressive, affording a panoramic view of the city. It was fun to finally work up the courage to stand on the 'lookdown' window - which felt a lot higher than 150m!I then bought a ticket to take the elevator to the special observatory, a further 100m up. The lineup for this elevator was long, and it took about 20 minutes of waiting before boarding to ascend. This was mainly down to the fact that the upper level is significantly smaller than the main level. It was worth the wait. The views were stunning, and I was able to get a better appreciation of the size of the city. I had originally only set out for the Tower as I saw it was within walking distance from my hotel, and hadn't been on my 'to do' list. I'm glad my wanderings took me there though! My only regret is that I didn't return for an evening visit, I imagine the views are differently, though equally stunning with the city illuminated.

Nice to see but make sure to climb. Tokyo Tower is the heart of the city, visible from just about everywhere. It has a close resemblance to the Eiffel Tower but with a distinctly Japanese feel to it, surrounded by relatively quiet parks, giving you the chance to disconnect. Nice photo-op.

Old style tower with great views. A bit of a walk from any metro station but worth a visit. As you would expect, it has tremendous views of the city and one of those glass floors that scares the hell out of you. The cafe is a bit shabby but provides a nice respite. I didn't realise that the Zojoji Temple is only a short walk away and this contains many interesting sculptures, trees planted by US presidents and a beautiful temple

Nice views all around. The best aspects of the Tokyo Tower are its historical value and amazing views. The tower has a long history as it was once the tallest structure in Tokyo, a symbol of Japan's technology of the day.Most city tours include the Tokyo Tower. The ascent is done in groups and you can spend as little or as long time as you want depending on what time your bus leaves. The views from the tower are quite spectacular on a clear day. There isn't a direct elevator to the top. You need to go up some levels first then take another elevator to the top. There are souvenirs galore available and a few eateries on the bottom level. On a not so crowded day, you could see everything in under an hour but usually 1-2 hours is sufficient.

OK if in the area. To be fair the day I visited it was a very wet, grey Autumn day with very poor views. Therefore not the greatest day to be looking at landmarks from a tower. Did this as part of a tour and was good to get an understanding of the layout of the surrounding area. Probably best to visit on an evening or on a clear day.

Iconic landmark of Tokyo but quite expensive tickets. Nice iconic landmark in Tokyo but with tickets selling for 150 usd was too expensive for us to try. I live in Dubai and the burj khalifa tower ( tallest tower in the world) tickets are only 1/4th the price. We bought souvenirs though from the 2nd floor shop which is quite nice.

A nice view to the city. Tokyo tower if located in the city center. It gives you nice views. Even if you don't go up to the observation deck is a nice place to visit at take some photos to the building.
Majestic Tower. We visited this tower just because it was close to our hotel. Didn't get to go to the top. There's a lovely garden next to the tower. Took a lot of beautiful photos there

visit night time. Make sure you visit night time it as a different vibe and make sure you first visit tokyo tower before you go to sky tree this is a retro attraction so no comparable to high or style when it comes to sky tree but if you consider the age tokyo tower did a great job and has its own pride and glory time

A view from a Tower. If you want a "view" of downtown, Tokyo tower is the place. Tokyo tower is located in central Tokyo, giving you a strategic view of Tokyo from within. There are 2 observation levels here, one at 150m and the other at 250m. The view is starkly different. You can see Rainbow bridge, Tokyo Skytree and the Imperial palace ftom here. Night view is even better with all the skyscrapers lighted up. Dont miss the look thru glass that will offer you a view to the bottom.

Awesome !. Offers the best view over Tokyo, magnificent as the Eiffel tower, almost same height, bit different style and size. The lights are making it unbelievable to see at night. No restaurant in the tower and only two levels to go up to. About 17 CDN $ to go to the second level, well worth it.

Interesting landmark. Interesting landmark of Tokyo. Two floors of retail shopping at the bottom and an observation deck at 150m. Nice view of the surrounding area. Suggestion: visit Tokyo Tower first BEFORE the Sky tree.
Lovely evening walk from our hotel. Tokyo Tower was just as good as the Sky Tree and the ice cream treats available for sale below were great too. Great photo opportunities.

Legendary tokyo tower!. Got so curious on this since i have read about this red tower in many japanese manga since i was a kid. It's basically a worthed to visit place, where you can see the sexy city lights from the height. There're many shops on lower level too where you can buy the famous tokyo banana (which also can be found in many tokyo train stations), the souvernir shop, and tokyo tower shaped food. I personally tried the tokyo tower shaped taiyaki, and it tasted so good: milky, soft and moist....

Touristy, but amazing views. Yes, it's schlocky, but we lucked out on a rainy day with decent visibility and no lines. It's a good way to get your bearings in a land of skyscrapers. Plus, the French crepe stand outside at the foot of the tower is every bit as good as crepes we had in Paris at the Ferris wheel. It was adorable to see the school kids there on field trip, too.

Very interesting, best viewed at night. In the morning, the viewing deck was packed with people and it was quite hot since the sun was already up. I suggest coming here at night so you can see it in its lighted glory. The highlight for me here was getting to try the Tower Taiyaki and those Hello Kitty Tokyo Tower medal/keychain things.

Japan ripps off France. Yes, it's true. Tokyo Tower is just a copy of the Eiffel tower. Safe your money and don't bother going to the top. It's a tourist trap. There are better views to be had, and for cheaper. FYI, Tokyo is not a very pretty city to look at anyways. See this landmark from a distance, as that what it's built for. Ride the monorail and you'll get a good view.
Nice but not so exciting as SkyTree. If you have a choice visit rather Tokyo SkyTree, which is really an impressive monument. Tokyo tower not so existing.

Best Viewed at Night. The orange and white lights of Tokyo Tower--built to be slightly higher than the Eiffel Tower--are really spectacular. If you have time to walk through Shiba Koen in the evening, you will see Tokyo Tower in all its brilliant majesty.

Great views of Tokyo. We decided to do this attraction at night and were not disappointed. Brilliant 360 degree views of Tokyo and all for a reasonable price (about $17 per person). Coming close to Christmas they also had holograms on the windows simulating snowflakes which was pretty neat. We used the top observation deck also which gave further breathtaking views. Several shops and food places at the base of the tower and a short walk from the subway and a 15 min walk from Hamamatsucho station. Well worth checking out - particularly if you only have a short stay or limited time in Tokyo.
Godd views of Tokyo. Worth a visit although you have to pay. On a clear day you get a superb view of Tokyo. We only went to first viewing level which I felt was sufficient. Extrat to go to top.

A bit of a hike, but worth it. On our visit, there were no lines at all and the view over Tokyo was impressive. You just have to walk quite a bit, since Roppongi is a bit poorly located when it comes to the subway lines.The price was ok and the staff friendly. I recommend this place ovet Skytree.

Views are surprising if not spectacular. Visitng early on an October Saturday I was able to walk straight in, no queue for tickets or the lifts to the first observation deck. Even at this level you get a fair view out over the city, which whilst interesting enough in my opinion is not one of the more picturesque cities in the world, however the view over the modern sprawl provides and interesting difference to similar vantage points elsewhere.There was a short 5-10 minute wait for the lift to the top, be warned that you can see out the sides of the lift, one of the passengers on the way up found this a challenge.Space up top is more than I expected but the queue for the return lift even on a relatively quiet day took up much of it. I would have liked a little more information on the tower itself beyond the basics but as a big tall place to go lookout across the city it did the job well.Oh and a great crepe place down near the entrance!
Pretty at night. I would just enjoy from the outside and not pay to go inside. The lights light up really pretty and makes an excellent landmark at night for helping you to find your way
One of a place to visit. The view is nice. You can take photos below or pay to go up. However the shops there are not tax free. Visit once in a lifetime is good enough.
see Tokio from the top by night. I was here at night and enjoyed viewing the city at mostly clear air including. Great view at Rainbow bridge. Disney fireworks was visible but small, of course.

Okay views, pretty over-rated. For the price you pay, the views were alright but the windows weren't that clean. The extra level pass we bought didn't seem the best value - took ages to wait for another lift to the top level and ages again to come back down. To be honest, the views were nicer from the outside to the impressive structure!

A Must if You Are Visiting Japan. Take the metro to the tower, getting off at the Akabanebashi station. From there is it a 15 minutes walk - up hill, but the Tower can easily been seen as you come out of the metro station.The cost of entry is £9 and there are places to eat and drink, there are bathroom facilities and there is a souvenir shop.There are 2 stages as you go up the tower by elevator, both with spectacular views. Everything is very clean and there are multiple guides who help with the elevator - they are dressed as if they are going to a wedding, beautiful suits, shoes, hats and even white gloves.The staff have excellent control of the numbers of people entering the attraction at every stage and it is professional in every way.Enjoy
Looks great during the night. Looks great during the night. Easy to find after getting out of the metro. From UN building you can take nice pictures

Great Family Attraction. The Tokyo Tower is well worth the visit. It is in the Minato district and an easy walk from the metro or your hotel depending on where you are staying.The views from the Tower extend all the way to Fuji San and present some excellent photo opportunities depending on your cameras ability to navigate glass.

Heart of japan. My great experience in Tokyo. There is two level you can reach to see the view of Tokyo, you will need to pay extra to visit the highest lever. In my opinion Tokyo Tower are heart of japan. Amazing view Great for Photographs. It is very romantic. Café on the observation floor where you can sit and enjoy the view.

Just enjoy it for what it is!. Even if you don't want to visit for the view, just visit for the experience. You enjoy it more if you stop comparing it to the Eiffel Tower. Despite the similarity I don't think it was the intention of the designers to 'compete' with the Eiffel Tower so just enjoy it for what it is. We went on a Monday night at 9pm and it took all of two minutes to line up and buy tickets. There are lots of eateries between Tokyo Tower and Hamamatsucho station so perhaps eat first and then visit the tower to avoid crowds. If you go between now and Christmas there is a beautiful Christmas display at the foot of the tower.

Beautiful in the nighttime. I went to a lot of Towers in many countries in the past . The massive steal constructions which is also quit old has some charm and own character , even it looks a little bit lik the Paris tower. I have to say this one is one off my favourites. We went at the nighttime , which is for myself the best time to go up and see the city from the top. I did not went to the second floor, just the first one. There's still a lot to see.

Great views and less crowded. Still definitely worth a stop. Despite the construction of the new Sky Tree about double this towers height this place is now spared the crowds but still commands excellent views of Tokyo. Very little waiting time to board the lifts with a cafe at the top of the tower as well as uninterrupted views around the city. There is a large shopping complex beneath the tower. It is easily reached in walking distance from Hamamatsucho Station on the Yamanote Line meaning it is covered by the JR rail pass.

A Taste of Paris in Tokyo. The tower, which sits on a little bit of a hill in a central part of southern downtown Tokyo, allows you experience just how vast the urban sprawl of Tokyo is. Going up to the very top level is a little bit more expensive than the main viewing area but the main viewing area is still a great view. I went at night and we got to walk right onto the elevator.
The Landmark of Tokyo. A must visit place every time I have been in Tokyo. It is always the symbol of Tokyo looking nice even day time or night time
Been here thrice. View was awesome and the cafe plus the live band are actually awesome! Don't forget to get a souvenir!

A BIT OF HISTORY WITH A VIEW. Neat view from the top although not as good since the 'Sky Tree' was built. Tokyo Tower was built in 1958 modelled after Paris's Eiffel Tower. Its orange colour makes it very distinctive at the Tokyo skyline.

Good views. Excellent views of Tokyo (weather - dependent) and the queue to get to the top wasn't bad on a Saturday. The shops at the bottom liked pretty average and rather touristy, although I didn't purchase anything. There is also a section dedicated to an animé show that you can pay extra to go to, but I'm afraid I didn't visit. The 'glass floor' was incredibly average. If you do go, definitely go to the top section, the views are significantly better
Great experience. Went to the tower for sunset- amazing view of TokyoPlenty happening at the bottom of the tower- heaps of food options and tourist shops

Overview of Tokyo at Tokyo Tower. Tokyo Tower is a major landmark in Tokyo. It was built in 1958 and is modeled after the Eiffel tower in Paris. It is characteristically orange in color. If you go to the top observation deck you get a good view of the entire city. We visited on a slightly cloudy day and still enjoyed the view. It is worth a visit and is a good way to get oriented to the city.

Great views but at night the lights make it difficult to get good photos. Decided to go up late at night just before closing when it was quiet and we could see the city lit up. Lovely views on a clear night but as the tower is lit up on the outside it was practically impossible to get a good photo as the light reflected off the glass. The tiny square of glass floor up the top was hardly worth including.

A must visit in Tokyo. This is a must visit. Enjoy the ascent to the top most with birds eye views of the city . Staff in colorful uniforms to add appeal to the colored tower. After the visit enjoy buying miniature Tokyo tower souvenirs and some unique food items. At the lowermost before you exit are several low cost shops, but take note they only accept cash.
Worth a Visit. Good views of Tokyo city centre and areas to the south. Huge range of souvenirs in the extensive gift shop.

Great View Obviously - Enjoyed it !!. Had a cloudyish day to visit but didn't realise it was a public holiday that day so crowds were large but we still managed an hour or so here and got the obligatory photos that everyone chases. If lucky you will see Mt Fuji...

Good nighttime views. Went on a Wednesday night at about 10pm, zero queue and went straight up. Good views of the Tokyo skyline at night, always reminds me of Blade Runner! Doesn't seem too much else in the immediate area but worth a trip, it's good value, although the SKYTREE does beat it in the overall experience I found. It's still very charming.

A wonderful view. Tokyo Tower is located slightly further away than you would expect, to get out here we had to take a couple of different trains, and then a bit of a walk to get to its location.It was a very cheap admission price, however it costs extra to go to the highest peak - which we personally did. We travelled here during the day and unfortunately, did not see it at night. It is definitely recommended to go here as there is magnificent views, you can slightly see Mount Fuji if it's a clear day, however due to how cold it was (End of January, Beginning of February) the sky was quite foggy so it made it a little more difficult and also.. it is very far away and so don't go here just to see mount Fuji.There are platforms that you can look down to see how high up you are, it is a very surreal experience. I personally found that by the highest level, I had gotten a bit over the sight. I was able to acknowledge how amazing it was, however it got very repetitive. In the highest viewing point, it was really warm, I felt a bit dizzy and was nearly having an altitude nose-bleed (so ensure if you are prone to this, you don't go too high).Overall the experience was great and I would definitely recommend paying the extra yen to go higher, the gift shops were beautiful and the staff were friendly. May not come back as there isn't much more to do there, but would recommend it to others.

Decent views and worth it. Not as pricey as the SkyTree or tall but the views are the same, clear day you can see Fuji and the queues aren't as bad if you go early enough. Feels a bit dated but decent enough, and observation decks were clean and not jammed with people.

Nice views, nice location, friendly people. You may feel being in Paris when you arrive at the Tower. However, this tower is slightly taller, easier to access and there are very friendly people everywhere. Maybe it was because we visited the Tower on a quiet day. Now people waiting in line, the highest deck was therefore easy to reach and was not packed with people. The views are fantastic and if you are lucky you can see Mount Fuji, on a clear day.On several levels you'll find restaurants, shops and things to do for young and old.When it gets dark outside, the Tower lights up, which is a beautiful sight.

It has definitely changed in 50 years!. I was 8 last time I came. This time the bathrooms were far better! I'm terrified of heights, but since the levels were enclosed, I was able to enjoy every minute. What a great way to see Tokyo!

Worth a visit on a clear day. Since the Tokyo Tower is such an iconic landmark, you can't not visit it when in Tokyo. I would highly advise to go on a clear day so you can get the best view of the city and the mountains in the distance (you can see Mt. Fuji from the upper viewing deck).

OK for the views only. Tokyo Tower is worth visting for the views, it is near a temple and a large grassy area decorated with hundreds of colored handmade pinwheels. There are two options for the Tower, one to half way up and the other all the way to the top . The view is pretty much the same for both but on the sky deck or top deck you do get uninterupted views of the city, probaly best viewed at night so you see the full lights of tokyo.

Worth going to - make sure to check out the toilets. We went during Halloween - so they had a nice photo op there. The lookout windows are good - find the two larger ones and spend the $ to do to the higher level

Good City Views. Tokyo Tower sits near a temple and a large grassy area decorated with hundreds of colorful handmade pinwheels. There are two admissions for Tokyo Tower, one a little higher than mid-way and the other goes all the way to the top for an added charge. The view is pretty much the same for both, so it's not really necessary to go all the way to the top. As with most towers like this you have a 360 view, and a map points out the landmarks, even Tokyo Disneyland which is too far away to see, but at least we learned which direction it's in. There are windows in the floor and at first we were scared to step on them. there is also a restaurant and a gift shop at the top.

Perfect view over Tokyo. The Tokyo Tower is a must!A very friendly staff welcomes you and the view is just breathtaking.There are 2 heights. One on 150 meters and the higher one is 250 meters. Try both, it's worth it!
Great views. Worth visiting at night to see all the city lights. Reasonable price for entry and no line at about 7.30pm on Wednesday evening.

Personally, the best! Here's why:. I think Tokyo Tower is probably the best modern tourist attraction in Tokyo. It's 1800 decadent architecture, the night lights that lights it up, visible from every corner of the city. It's not pretencious, not the tollest tower. I think it has a stronger personality than SkyTree. I really like it. I like watching it at night and I like the fact i can see it from anywhere in Tokyo.

One time visit is worth for Tokyo Tower. Tokyo tower is beautiful in evening and you can take the ticket to visit observation deck. From observation deck you can different corners of Japan.Now sky tree is higher than Tokyo tower so you can visit any of them.

Would not bother with this again.. You do get to see the city sprawl, but not worth the effort especially if the weather is cloudy or hazy. We had good weather, but the smog/haze meant you could not see a lot.

Good for evening. Tokyo sky tree is the highest tower in japan. However, in my personal opinion, Tokyo tower is much better for see. Especially, in evening, the sunset light makes beautiful color on tokyo tower. If you will go there around sun set, you can see the lighting up of tokyo tower. Basically, the light up color is red. However, in several social context, the tower makes different colors. If you are lucky then you can see different color of tokyo tower

Worth a visit!!. We stayed just behind the tower and decided to go there on our first day in Tokyo to find our bearings. It was clean, cheap and very professional. Fantastic views with educational pictures everywhere.

Great view across Tokyo. Easy to access from a number of stations, great views across Tokyo. Have to pay extra for top observation area. Remember to collect your rubber stamp for visiting - great for kids

Come at day and night !. Only planned to visit the Tokyo tower at daytime but after taking pics from the World Trade Centre Observatory at Sunset we decided to go there again at night. So beutiful and definitely brings back the memories when visit the Paris Eiffel Tower few years back. Didnt go to the observatory deck on Tokyo tower but just underneath it would be good enough ! Must go and take pics for day and night time ! Come around sunset if schedule is too tight !
