Great Views of Tokyo. Visited the Tokyo tower during the day and really enjoyed the views. I paid a little extra to visit the higher level and feel that was worth the additional charge. We got there around 10:30am on a Friday and were glad we did not get there any later since there were some very large groups that showed up.All in all, I think this is a wroth visiting attraction. Probably beautiful at night.
Disappointed. the views were ok , the windows were dirty . I would have expected better . It was also rather crowded on a Sunday afternoon.
The symbol of the country. Good location and unseen in Japan, and not expensive for the ticket fee, easy to go there, by Subways, open everydays
Spectacular in Passing. To date I have only driven by what has become a major feature and a noted landmark.It certainly stands and a wonderful sight at night when it is lit up

Classis time frozen look -out tower. Fantastic views of central Tokyo and areas beyond. It's not the Sky Tree but i like the closer views of central Tokyo and the Bay. The lack of crazy crowds (vs. Sky Tree) is also very nice. I love how beautifully lighted the tower is night after night. The tower is absolute a Tokyo landmark one should not miss.

If you are there - why not. Well the view is quite nice, but very expensive to get up. The building it self is an even uglier eiffel tower. If you are close by go check it out, if not - nothing missed.
Miniature Eiffel Tower in Tokyo. Great views of Tokyo even though Tokyo Tower now plays second fiddle to the Tokyo Skytree. What more is there to say?
Beautiful views. Beautiful views of Tokyo from the viewing deck. The lobby of the tower is elegant and the whole structure itself, its a marvel.Recommended a place to visit in Tokyo.

Tokyo Tower. Tokyo Tower is based on the Eiffel tower and has standard (150 m high) and extended (250 m) viewing decks (which costs extra). Good views over Tokyo and best viewed at night where you can see spectacular the city lights. Go in early evening just as sunsets for good view with your significant other. It got fairly crowded later in the evening. At the base has a small aquarium (overpriced), some shops and restaurants. About a 10 minute walk from metro station so be prepared for that, but the night views u[ to the tower make it a pleasure.
Great for Photographs!. A city highlight, it is a great photographic subject against the skyline, which although interesting is fairly uniform.
Miniature Eiffel Tower. Good view of the Tokyo skyline, but not the Eiffel.. worth a short trip if you have the time, but there are so many things to do in Tokyo, I wouldnt make time only for it..

The tallest artificial structure in Japan. Tokyo Tower , at 332.5 metres (1,091 ft), it is the second tallest artificial structure in Japan. Completed in the year 1958 as a symbol for Japan’s rebirth as a major economic power. Can ascend to the main observatory at 150 meters and the special observatory at 250 meters to get a bird’s eye view of Tokyo. We got there via Subway :Toei Subway :- Oedo Line – Akabanebashi Station. Exit Akabanebashi Gate. 5min walk
Easy to get to and view don't disappoint. It was a bit of a process getting up to the top but the views definitely do not disappoint. Very cool spot.

Simbol of Tokyo!. I was born and grow up in Tokyo.Went to Tokyo Tower many times in my childfood.Some years ago, another sky building named Sky Tree was build, and many tourists visit there.But for me, Tokyo Tower is the best and simbol of Tokyo. The shapes and color is so beautiful!Both sunny daytime and nightime are good to go.

Expensive but worth it..iconic of Tokyo. Been to Tokyo at least 8 times. Finanlly diecided to pay a visit to Tokyo iconic tower and is not disapointted. Middle section cost 900 yen, can pay additional 700 yen for the top deck. I recommend to go all the way up as the view is so much better. Do visit during good weather so that you could see far. No time limit so you could stay for as long as you wish.
A great way to start in Tokyo. We started our visit to Japan at the Tokyo Tower. It provides an excellent overview of the Tokyo skyline and is helpful in orienting yourself to the locale.
Disappointing. Tokyo Tower is higher than the Eiffel Tower, but Tokyo is not Paris. One can view the whole city, but the sight is only of streets, cars and some of the waterways
Interesting Attraction. While we did not spend the time to go to the top of the tower it was interesting to photograph on the beautiful weather day that we were there.
Sight Seeing. Really good fun to see Tokyo from here. Good to ge later in the afternoon and watch Tokyo turned in to night.
Tokyo Towe. Tokyo Tower is a communications and observation tower located in the Shiba-koen district of Minato. Tokyo Tower is called light because it weighs only
Good skyline views. Although not as tall as the Sky Tree it is also not as crowded. Certainly worth an hour or two to get a nice perspective of the city skyline.

Top view!. Amazing view. I love heights and seeing city scapes from above and this is definitely one of my favourite spots. Night time is best so you can see Tokyo lit up. It is very romantic with lots of proposals and people on dates. Sensational life to the top and lots of cute pressies to buy. If you are lucky you will see Mt.Fuji!

great way to view the city. This was a very touristy spot, as to be expected. We braved the tourist epicenter to have the opportunity to see Mt. Fuji in all her glory. We paid a little extra and went the International speed ahead route as the lines at 10am were horrendous. I definitely recommend doing this, just be sure to have your passports. The day was a beautiful one and you could see for miles when on the 350 meter floor. The interactive maps added a nice touch so that you could get an idea of what you were looking at/for. At 11:30 we still could not see Mt Fuji as the clouds in the distance hindered our view. Sooo we elected to pay another 1030 yen each to go up another 150 meters (Another line too) Ok, so cool to say you did it but soo not necessary. If you do go you will see pillars with numbers on them. Mt Fuji happens to be between 8 and 9 if that is your particular interest. Unfortunately, we left without the sighting... but DID see it from our hotel room that night, go figure! The lines were the only reason I gave this a 3.

Tokyo Tower. I really enjoyed my experience. It is a pretty structure, like the Eiffel Tower just orange and white instead.It's pretty at night and to me there wasn't as many tourists as at the Skytree.

Most enjoyable. Enjoyed it immensely. Beautifully ordered in the Japanese way. We were quickly whisked to both levels. The views are outstanding. The cost was reasonable. We leftmost satisfied. Well worth a visit in my book.
So So. Great view of the city, but the souviners seemed cheap. I was with a tour group, and literally had 10 minutes. Had I had another 10; I may have had a better experience
Great landmark to view city from. This TV tower in central Tokyo is a great location to go view the city, it is an interesting structure bot due to its design not for anybody with a fear of heights
wow.. awesome..incredible feat of engineering..just awesome..must see while visiting Tokyo..spend time there..
Pretty from far. Lovely view during the day and during night- it is a true landmark in Tokyo. The view is great from the top and the area surrounding the tower is also very nice

Great views depending on weather!. There are two towers in Tokyo and both are worth a visit. The Tokyo tower is the older of the two and is on the hop on hop off bus route so easy to get to. There are two levels to visit if you want with the upper level an additional fee. On the day we only went to the lower level as there were clouds and haze but still had plenty to see.If you only have time to visit one then I would suggest the Skytree as it has other activities within the complex and is more modern, however Tokyo Tower is still worth the visit.
Good view of Tokyo. Visited as part of a morning tour of Tokyo. Good view of Tokyo from the observation deck and there is a small gift shop. On the lower floors are a larger souvenir shop & toilets.

If you like towers this works. This is not a spectacular, don't miss tourist place. It's a spot to see Tokyo from a high point and as an added bonus, you get to shop! If you really want to see Tokyo from a tower that has some class try the Tokyo Sky Tree.

Best seen from the ground at night. This tower is best seen from the ground when it's orange and red are all lit up at night.The base looks like the Eiffel Tower....but don't get too excited. It's a communications tower and serves a purpose. It could also be seen as an eyesore as well as an attraction.Avoid the roppongi area before, after and during visiting this attraction. For more info see my roppongi review.

Just another tower.... The Tokyo Tower has nothing different from other similar towers in cities around the world. Certainly panoramic views are nice, according to the different altitudes you can reach there, but nothing more... Nevertheless, it is true that you can always find something new or typical of the city by climbing the towers. So , I think the Tokyo Tower deserves a short visit ...
Great views across the city!. Easy to reach via the underground. Great views from the observation floor. Café on the observation floor where you can sit and enjoy the view.
Excellent View - Recommend Going on Wednesday Night. I recommend checking it out on a Wednesday night for the free shows. There are also a number of food spots and souvenir places there.

Excellent view, not very much money . We couldn't decide between going here or going up the sky tree and we decided to go here. It was really good with shops and cafes etc in. I actually preferred this to the sky tree!
view of the City. The vistas are good however it was very cloudy/misty the day I was there. Very commercialised, too many shops that you have to go through to exit the venue.

Go at night. This is a place you absolutely want to visit at night. It is 10 times nicer in the evening light up. I would also highly recommend going to a restaurant for dinner near there to take advantage of the view. Nice placeto walk around as well in the evening as a couple. It is kind of the essence of modern Tokyo.

Beautiful City Lights. Our hotel was a five minute walk away and we were planning on going during the day , but after all the sites we visited during the week it was left until our last night in Tokyo. So we walked over and paid our fees and went up only to the first level, the second level was much higher , but this level was good enough. The city lights were spectacular and we took many photos of the city doing a 360 of the entire city. My family and I loved it and it was a great ending to our Tokyo trip.

Looks more like a communications tower on the outside! . This looks more like a communications tower than anything else!It has a very tourist focused shopping centre below the tower itself with a food hall that has various options. We didn't go up the tower itself as we were also headed to Tokyo Skytree on the same day which seems like it would be more impressive and is another tall viewing point of Tokyo.

Outstanding View. The famous Tokyo Tower is outstanding. I love the view all over the city. And I love taking pictures on the spot. The staffs allow you to take pictures on your phone, and it costs you around $1300 to print out the pictures with fabulous frame.

Good views, good value. Staying close to the tower we walked down in the evening to catch some views of Tokyo at night. A replica of its more famous sibling in Paris the tower is now being overshadowed by the new guy in town, the Tokyo Skytree, and is becoming lost in the skyline amongst the skyscrapers. But it is still worth a visit.Brilliantly lit it is impressive from the ground. We arrived about 7:00 and there were no queues. We just went to the lower observatory which was 900 yen each. It is an additional 500 for the higher level. Most of the other visitors were younger than us. This is obviously one of the places to bring your girl at night in Tokyo! By the time we came out it was getting busy downstairs.The views are nice, particularly at night with the city lit up. You can get a snack or a drink at the cafe. It ain't the Burg Khalifa but it is worth the visit.

Landmark you need to visit. Okay let's make it clear, it is that kind of landmark you have no other choice but to visit. There is two level you can reach to see the view of Tokyo, you will need to pay extra to visit the highest lever. It's a okay touristic spot, you qe be bombarded with souvenirs, but that's part of the deal. You can also visit at night which is in my opinion the best option if you don't go with kids. It is super family friendly.
View of Tokyo. At night the problem is the view is not as good as in the morning. But the skyline at night is amazing. We were there and ate in a restaurant there while enjoying the view.
Photo place!. We went there just for taking some photos! Anyway, dont miss the photo! The Tokyo Tower was really nice background!

Good views. We visited this place on Saturday and it was extremely crowded. The Tokyo Tower offers great views of the city. It would be a great place to visit on a clear day and is not very expensive.
Nice Views. Tokyo Tower has amazing views and if you like One Piece, they have a fantastic amusement park located in the tower.
The line is too long. Nice place, but we have to wait pretty long to go to special floor and not so much thing can be done upside.
Nice view. Very nice view to Tokyo. The tower is nicely lightened in the night for us a sign that we are "home".

You can see the city. It was a former television tower and now houses an observation deck. Its views are amazing and you can see for miles in every direction. If you are from the United States, it is similar to the john hancock building in chicago. Very nice views for pictures. Out tour guide took us around and pointed out buildings around the city, very entertaining.

Real nice view of the city. It's very high, so you get a really nice view of the city. Try to purchase your ticket early in the morning because if you go in the afteroon there's a good chance you have to wait a few hours before you may actually go up.
Fantastic views. Has go be done if you are in Tokyo,the vkews from the top are fantastic,easy to get to by bus or train,not dear,and shops,food outlets there as well.
Awesome view. Awesome view. If you wanna see Tokyo from above go there you even can see at a bright day Mt. Fuji. Sky Tree is one of the buildings you can barely see in the back.
Beautiful at night!. We booked a hotel close by so that we could experience this at night and weren't dissapointed! Worth a trip in the evening and also give the crepe place a go for dessert :)

Amazing view. I went there for the night view. I was there several years ago for the day view. Both views are impressive, but require nice weather. When I was there for the night view, there were not many people which was good. Should try to spend an adequate time to enjoy the view because not cheap. You have to pay again to go to the highest level. The view is more relevant if you know what you are looking at. Although there are signs telling you what the view is of, it would pass over a foreigner unless you have lived here. Nevertheless, it is an amazing sight to see.

Complete cahos!. Don't lose your time and money! Unless you know for sure it's a clear day and Mount Fuji is visible. It's is complete chaos over there. If you really have to go, make sure to go to the foreigners desk.

I recommend this if you have the time. Worth going all the way to the top! The elevator ride is great, with windows to look out as you climb. You can spend as long as you want on each level and take pictures in 360 degrees.
A tower, not much else. Its a tower. Not much to see or do here. Its orange and white so that planes can see it and was built to aid reception because of all the high rise blocks.

Go to the top, first stop not enough. The Tokyo tower is a very nice experience but please go up to the top.
Basically you have to buy first ticket to middle level (Main Observatory 900Yen) and then once there another ticket (Special Observatory 700Yen).
The day was not very clear therefore I didn't appreciate too much.

The Eiffel Tower of Japan, great views of the area.. Well organized lines for taking tourists to the middle viewing floor. On the day we visited the stairways were closed so climbing to the top was not possible. Great for taking pictures - 360 degree views.
Bottom floor has a lot of food vendor stalls as well as many stalls selling various items to visitors.

Tokyo's most iconic tower. You've probably seen Tokyo Tower in a number of animes or movies set in Japan. Pretty much that makes it a must see when visiting Tokyo! It's also a great alternative to the Eiffel Tower if you haven't been.The views are great from the top of the tower but I think the area in general is great! There are a lot of great restaurants and places to see. Also they often change the light up color of the tower so the illumination is a beautiful sight at night.

Great view but a lot of glare. Personally I preferred the Sky tree tower as a whole experience. We did the Tokyo tower at night and it's beautiful outside but the inside has a lot of problems with reflection and glare when you try and look out of the windows.

A great view. If you are into architecture and stuffs, you will find this place amazing.. Just by looking how the base holds the tower together, it is just beautiful.. Anyway, go during sunny day and your picture will be good..

Worth the views at night. The Tokyo tower is basically the Eiffel of Japan. It's pretty at night time with all the lights lit up. You pay a fee to go to the first observation deck which has a little gift shop and refreshments place. Then you can pay extra to go up a bit further. This is not worth it. The view looks pretty much the same and there is nothing up on the next floor except the view. We were very disappointed by the second floor. Worth doing the main observation deck. Don't bother going up to the second unless you super want to see things just that tiny bit smaller.

Featrured frequently in Manga and Anime.. Not a very exciting tower in its self, but due to it being featured in many many manga's and anime's its a very nice place to go to. It has some quite interesting shops and a nice atmosphere.I never went up to the lookout deck.

Fantastic view at night, in & away from Tower. Well, it's a signature of Tokyo, so one should go visit. I find the night scenery of the Tower far more enchanting than a day visit. Especially on the scheduled Saturday night time display between 8pm to 10pm. The Diamond Veil lights add a big dash of romance. I suggest a night visit.

Worth doing but not amazing. Worth going, you pay a set fee to go to the first level then after that there is an option to pay a bit more to go right to the top, which we did. You may as well after going to visit the tower, the view is better but not amazingly. They have worked hard to have other features which make it more than just a view. The bar is also very cheap, only 300¥ for a beer with a great view, you will pay x10 for that view in other Tokyo bars! Worth doing.
Worth the price of admission. Arrived at the Toyko Station and walked the approximately 4 miles to this sight. The sights and sounds of Toyko at dusk were enthralling.

A must when visiting Tokyo. Went on a saturday mid morning. There wasn't much if a crowd which was a bonus.Got the ticket for the first platform didn't see much point going up on the second for the extra price. There is a cafe there but the food was better at the food court on one of the ground floors.The views were amazing and the park and zojo ji emple to walk through on your way to and from shibakoen station were also worth a visit.

Fantastic view!. Easy to reach via rail, once there you have to pay a small fee to enter and up you go. Once you've reach the first observation deck you'll find lots of little shops to find the perfect gift and of course...the views!The tower gives you a wonderful 360 of the city and provides tons of great photo opportunities, even on overcast days. It's highly recommended.

Japanese "Eiffel Tower". The japanese "Eiffel Tower". imposing in the middle of the city and a superb view on the upper floors. Time up to 17h.not expensive and worth the visit.the gardens that provide access are care and also worth a visit.

Great experience. Visited here with a group of school students doing a bus tour, great stop for us, we went to the observation deck and the view of Tokyo was wonderful, our guide explained a lot about the different areas we could see and while up there most of the students were able to buy a coin souvenier of the tower and then put their names on it and the date we were there, so a great way to remember the trip.

A nice view but get there early.... I visited the Tokyo tower to see what the fuss was about and was pleasantly surprised. The Tower is in great condition and well kept (like most things in Japan). I got here right when they opened and had the chance to visit the various levels without much wait. By the time I left the crowds were pouring in and there was a wait to make it to the higher levels. Get here early if you can. On a nice day you can see Mt Fuji.

The tower is different, but views are similar. The tower is red and patterned after the eifel tower. Many shops located inside including a variety of Japaneese restaurants. Not really worth a special trip, but tour copanies love to take people there. there is a fee to go up.

Amazing view from the tower. Great place to see the whole of Tokyo. Best time to visit is just before sunset so you get the day view, sunset and night view. Tokyo night view is mesmerising. A must go if you're in Tokyo!
A nice view but nothing special. A nice view , but you can the same one from your hotel. No regret , but there are more interesting things to see in Tokyo.

Interesting. We took a tour of Tokyo, and Tokyo Tower was one of the stops. I think that if I had to choose one place that typified modern Tokyo, this would be it. It is a much smaller version of the Eiffel Tower in Paris , but appeals to the Japanese. We were greeted by Girls wearing uniforms and ushered to the elevator and whisked t the top. the view was nice. Probably the most fascinating thing to us was this was our first taste of Halloween in Japan. There was a huge display with rusty gates and a pumpkinheaded giant, among other things, and the a rack of costumes for families who wanted a photo op. Halloween is a great time for a party in Japan. Parades, displays events: Remarkable!

For a view of City of Lights. The construction is old, but it's impossible to believe it! The structure has withstand earthquakes for Years and still stands stand strong. Directly go to the second level.take a good camera / phone which can capture low light photos as from top its really difficult to get a proper shot of the city.When you ar on the 2nd level, you would be able to see a tall structure with continuously LED light flow in patters, that's the tower which is taller than Tokyo tower and you can stand around at 400 mtr on that Tower. It's called as Sky Tree Tower.The cafe on the ground floor has amazing collection of local Japanese beer and whiskey, which one can enjoy seeing the sheer height of the Tokyo TowerCheck on weather if you ar going during day time, if everything is clear you might be just lucky to view Mt.Fuji from Tokyo Tower!

One time Visit to Tokyo Tower is worth. Tokyo tower is good and you can go to observation deck but ticket will be needed for same. Try to reach there in evening so that you can enjoy the lights. You can see the city in night which is awesome.
Amazing view to Tokyo from the hight of bird's flight. One of the symbols of Tokyo! Very good organised trip to tower: a lot of souvenirs shops, cafes and so on. Strongly recommended!

Took the stairs up this iconic tower. Every Saturday one's allowed to ascend via the stairs (normal admission fees apply). The climb is easy for anybody who's normally fit, but it does get one's pulse and sweat levels up, especially on a hot day. The view of the park and city is really nice, although far from as breathtaking as that from many of the other towers and high-rises Tokyo has to offer. We stayed at the adjacent Tokyo Prince Hotel, so a visit here was a no-brainer.

It's beautiful at night.. We went there around 8pm and there were few people around and no queue. It actually closes at 11pm (entry till 10.30) so you can make it the last stop before retiring to accommodation. Also, its very romantic... a little awkward to go with friends -.-Dont miss standing on the glass window a floor down from the main observation deck.You don't have to book a ticket in advance, just pay on site.

Pretty but doesn't compare to Eiffel. First off, I didn't have time to go up. I'm sure the view would have been spectacular. I mostly am knocking the Tokyo tower because I understand it to be equivalent to the Eiffel Tower (certainly looks the part), except that it is randomly situated in a business/apartment area of town. This is in contrast to the Parisian version, which is surrounded by magnificent gardens and parks. A bit of a let down, although the lighting at night gave a nice visual display.

Charming, especially at night. Even though Tokyo Tower is not as high up as the newer Sky Tree or recently opened Roppongi City View, it still has a lot of charm, especially at night. I'd advise to only visit the first deck though, because besides a somehow claustrophobic and scary elevator ride, the view from the upper deck is not much different. In the evening the exit floor is lit up with hundreds of led lights which make for nice pictures. It's probably better to visit Tokyo Tower in the week as the weekends tend to attract bigger crowds.

Tokyo Tower. Have been to Tokyo Tower a few times - have got the best view of the city from the top of the tower. In shape, it is a miniature of Eiffel tower. It is great view to see even the tower in the evening with full of lights. Don't miss this place while roaming around in Tokyo
Great views of the city to get your bearings. Breath taking views of the city. Be sure and stand on the glass floor. If you like towers, this one is great.

A little tower. I've got this feeling, the tower is very small. Maybe we are used to the Tour Eiffel in Paris. Hubby grew up watching Tour Eiffel from the window of his home in Paris. Yes, comparing with the Tour Eiffel, this one is miniature, I remember just walking around one leg of the Tour Eiffel takes quite some time. This one is exactly a copy of our Eiffel Tower. we got off the subway and watched it from far, very nice when lighten up in the dark sky, when we got closer, we found it smaller. And it's too late to go up it almost shut , so we just stayed around and had dinner in the food court there.

Iconic place, so you should visit. A visit to Tokyo and you tell people you have not gone to Tokyo Tower? tsk tsk.Of course you should make a trip there and marvel at the Japanese landscape from this aerial view. See how they have managed to interspersed urban and greenery so well.I would prefer a day view instead of a night view.
Must visit when in Tokyo. Though not the tallest in Tokyo anymore, this still is an amazing place to visit. At night the tower lights up, a definite place to visit at any time.
Amazing Views! A Must See!. This was an Amazing Sight. We went with a Tour Group and the leader was just Graet on explaining everything to us all. This is a Must See!

Tokyo's Eiffel tower with wonderful views.. We saw the sunset from this tower, and it was magnificent, the reds and oranges seemed magnified from up where we were watching. If you are staying in Tokyo this is the must see attraction to view the city and the surrounding area. Unfortunately the weather was unsettled while we were here so our distance viewing was not that great, but I understand on a good clear day one can see Mt. Fuji. The Good: Great Views and the city lights at nightThe Bad: Can have wait times to get up to the topThe Ugly: nopeOn the scuba bubble scale of 1 to 10, I give this tower 9 bubbles

The Frenchy red Tower. Ok, you visit the tower because it's must to do but so many office tower have a lot of restaurant on top with the same view and you don't need to spend this money despite I did it.

Nice city views. We ended our (half) day trip walking tour at the Tokyo Tower, pay a fee to go up to the main observation level, then pay again at that level to go to the high platform - which there is quite a queue you only see after you pay - and queue again for the elevator down, so some queuing but the wait times weren't terrible.

don't miss. we went to the first stop, there are 2 floors to see. on the second floor you can drink coffee and watch the view.on 7 pm there is live radio broadcast, you can ask for a song to be played.did not understand a word but the crowd seemed excited
What a view!. Visit here just before sunset and you will be amazed... the view across the city and to Mt Fuji is breathtaking as the sun sets and the lists of the city come on...

A must do . Visiting Tokyo tower was a great experience. We went to the special observatory. Go on a clear day. Go early. We were there around 10 and had direct access. When we came down there was a long line to get up. Many shops and cafes. We walked down. It was a nice experience.

Astounding Tokyo views and a great landmark to assist in navigaton. The views of Tokyo Tower are iconic from almost everywhere in the area. We used the tower as an on foot navigation reference. The views of the tower from Zojoji and Shiba Koen were amazing. My friend/ coworker and I spent part of an evening from the paid observation decks. We also went to the wax museum within the tower, which was - needless to say- a unique and entertaining experience. The views from the observation platform were beyond amazing, at night. A must see, even for a fee. Many vendors and some street performers- some with monkeys abound at Tokyo Tower, on the weekends. I got to enjoy the red bean ice cream and enjoyed the atmosphere. The crowds are astounding, but not overwhelming. Definitely a pleasant place to visit, even with the commercial souvenir shops, which have the typical charming Japanese air about them. Enjoy yourself and open your mind for some astounding views of Tokyo.

Night View of Tokyo Tower. . First time actually to go into the Tokyo Tower although I have seen it on Several occasions. Decided to pay the Yen 900 for the main observation deck only. This give us excellent views of Tokyo, Tokyo Harbor etc. The pictures were good as we had a clear night. Really enjoyed the experience.

Very Cool Building. Sort of like the Eiffel tower but red. Just as grand to look at, particularly at night when it lights up.
There are floors of souvenirs, an aquarian and a an One Piece Theme Park. Easy to get to with a number of subway stations nearby and signs directing you to it.

Tried and true Tokyo landmark.. Having been here some 34 years ago not much has really changed, apart from the view. The tower itself is charming and certainly worth seeing if you have the time. If you go at dusk a view from one side allows you to see the shape of the tower made out in the layout of the roads below made visible by the light of the streetlights and cars.
Excellent views of Tokyo. Quite an experience. Very crowded though, but the views of Tokyo is quite stunning. Enjoyable family outing

Nice 360 degree view of Tokyo. 1600 Yens including the elevator ride to the very top at the time I went. Not as high as Sky tree but the location of the Tokyo Tower is more central. Wait was rather long (10-15 min) for the number of people to go all the way to the top considering there was no more than 30 people ahead of us but still less crowded than the skytree.Pick a clear day for the best view. Mount Fuji can be seen on clear days. Night time probably best otherwise. Not much to expect other than a 360 view of the city. Other than that, the tower has a few glass floor sections you can play with trying to scare yourself.
Spectacular views. Some spectacular views from the top of this tower. Windows in the floor to look through. Souvenir shops, eateries and more.
It was OK. It was ok, I spent about 2 hrs there and it was alot!!.. nothing too spectacular... it was nice to see all of ToKyoto in one place

2nd best next to sky tree. nice view of Tokyo from the topmost deck - we intended to see sky tree but due to the very long lines and queue, we decided to see Tokyo tower instead. Ir was great and good choice as we were on a tight schedule!

NOT that great. Its only ok, but we didn't go inside as price were not worth the entry.We only stay outside. but the walk to this was more rewarding, as their was an area of street of small authentic restaurants. I had the best vending order machine ramen ever here.

Awesome view!. I went there in the late afternoon and the view is magnificient, in any direction you look you will not see an end of skyskrapers! I stayed fro the sunset and until it got dark, and i must say by night the view is even more awesome with all the lights from the city. Though i would not recommend goinig there when it already just got dark, when is was leaving there was a huge queue waiting to got in. Just one thing was missing: Binoculars

Favourite place in Tokyo. Tokyo Tower is the starting point for my love of Japan. Besides the landmark illumination, it is also lit up in different colour themes these days. Plenty of souvenirs for sale inside the foot town.
Surprised me. Been here many times but always skipped the tower as I incorrectly presumed it would be a dud. Nice sorely to walk around at night. The lights are very atmospheric.

Just like any other skyscrapers. Night view was amazing of course. I went for a night view back in 2012. Normally you wouldn't go back for a 2nd time. But Recently in April I went back to Tokyo Tower. Because of the newly opened One Piece Theme park in tokyo tower. I had a greaaaaat time there. Though the attractions inside are all in japanese, so if you don't have your basic japanese, I doubt you would understand what's going in. I got a nice picture with human Luffy though :)

Nice view of city from here. This tower is quite close to our hotel, the Park Prince Tokyo Tower, and provides a nice city view. It's not the city's tallest structure by a long shot (that belongs to another pricier tower I am told) but this one is closer to city center and readily accessible by metro system.
Check it out, the view is worth it. Its just like a red and white Eiffel Tower in the middle of the city. Wonderful views and the lines moved quickly
Nice view. Choose a sunny day to visit Tokyo tower... in the sunset time: there' a great view! And try One piece bar, they have funny coffee!

We were there during typhoon. It happened that we are in Tokyo during two typhoons so the view was limited. Going to the observation deck was very orderly and fast. The staff was very cheerful and friendly.

Tokyo tower is worth a visit. An inexpensive tourist attraction that was very well organised with helpful attendants and even though we visited on a wet day the views were spectacular. There was even a cool jazz trio playing on a lower level with some of the best sounds I have heard in a long time. Popular with locals also. Souvenir shops on several levels not really worth the bother.

Not worth the money to go up, get an amazing view at the hotel across the street!. The Tokyo Tower was on our list of must see when we were in Japan, but after careful reading and suggestion from our guide book, we decided to skip paying the 2,000 JY per person, and went and had a delicious afternoon cocktails and sweets at the top floor bar in the neighboring hotel! Seriously, go to The Prince Park Tokyo Tower and head all the way up to the bar. Enjoy the seats right next to the window, not only see the Tokyo Tower, but also an amazing view of the city.

Cliche but must do. When you first arrive you pay around ¥900 to go to the main deck upstairs. There's 360° view of Tokyo on all 3 floors of the main deck. There's a cafe where you can relax and look outside at the view. On the bottom floor there's also glass on the floor so you can look down at ground level (see my photo), which is really cool. If pay an extra ~¥700 to go to the top floor, which is the best place to take pictures of the city view. It was cloudy/drizzling when we went so upstairs was the best photo spot compared to the main deck. There's around a 5-10min wait to go up, but nothing too long and it's worth the short wait. If you're looking for a panoramic view of the city, I recommend the Tokyo Sky Tree because it's a lot taller than the Tokyo Tower so it has a better view.

A Must do when in Tokyo. We had so much fun! Everyone could see Mt. Fuji but me, I just couldn't see it so that was frustrating. I'm very skittish of heights but this was fine and I didn't freak out at all.
Good to see. Great to visit the Tokyo tower, especially when it's illuminated. Queue was very quick and there is a huge shop on the ground floor which is interesting but expensive.
great view of Tokyo area. Great view of the city plus shops and food places galore..... first we walked past an historical temple then up too the tower

A great view of Tokyo. We were on a day trip so had limited time. Like all older city towers has higher neighbours now although they are not too close. Our day had some cloud and distant rain but there is still a spectacular view over the city. More English signage would be helpful. Lots of shops to buy the usual souvenirs.

Go there only at night and if the weather is fine.. Went there mainly because we had a free entry from the JCB card. The day we visited was very cloudy and everything looked pretty dull. The view must have been so beautiful at night and if the weather was fine. They said you could even see Mount Fuji if the weather was clear.

Great Site to See. Went here our first night in Tokyo, we walked from our hotel the New Sanno only to find that it was literally 3 miles away not the 1.5 that we were told. If you walk it just be prepared and war comfortable sees. It's a huge sight and although I wish it wasn't painted red and white it doesn't take a way from it's massive presence. I still like the Effiel tower better even if this is taller. Tours are available for over 100000 Yen so over $100 bucks I didn't think it was worth it but to each their own. Still a sight to see in Tokyo!

Disappointed that we took a taxi for this. I was actually kind of (okay, pretty) disappointed in this attraction. It is probably my own fault for not having researched it sufficiently. The lighting on it at night was disappointing. It seemed mismatched and not very attractive. There were definitely not any twinkling lights. It also seemed like because of its location and proximity to other buildings, there were no good places to go to get a good view of it and photograph. I'm guessing a lot of these I've seen online were taken from inside a building nearby. I didn't think it was worth the cost of the cab ride we took over there to see it. Wouldn't make it a stop on my next trip.

Good View. We went there to see the Tokyo Bay Fireworks in August. The line for tickets was fairly long but went fast. We did not go to the top observation deck and some of the lower fireworks were blocked. The fireworks were long (80 minutes), we left without watching the finale. We did enjoy the Tokyo night view. We had a nice surprise to find that a tourist organization was there and let some of us tried out Kimonos free.

Beautiful the night illuminated. The Tokyo tower is opened every day from 9am to 11pm. The night the spectacle is very nice when the Tower is illuminated. It might look like a garish Eiffel Tower rip-off, but it remains a symbol of the city’s post World War II rebirth. At 333 meters and finished in 1958, Tokyo Tower is 13 meters taller than the French tower that inspired its design. You can go up to the main observation deck at 150 meters; there’s another deck at 250 meters.Fees to paid for both decks. I advise to go the night, great pictures to do.

Thrilling experience. Great experience, nevertheless with the new Tokyo SkyTree, the Tokyo Tower lose lot of its former exclusivity, but if you lift up to the Observation Deck, you can have a very thrilling experience, remember that the Tower swings.

Great Attraction. We enjoyed a panorama of Tokyo for a small fee. This attraction is a must see. You could see Tokyo from various angles. And when it is sunny and clear, you could even have a chance to see Mount Fuji. There is also a small food court and a shopping center, where you could purchase some souvenirs at decent prices. We had a fun time mingling with the local merchants and travellers from various countries.

The excellent and elegant construction of one tower in Tokyo. When we were in Ropongi Dori district, in the evening hours, we suddenly perceived in distance from the main artery of Roppongi, a beautifully lighted edifice, that is, the Tokyo Tower. It is located in Shiba -koen, Minato ward. It is much alike as the Eiffel Tower in Paris. We decided to approach the tower. From the place we spotted it, it wasn't so far. Naturally we could have had the metro ride, but instead chose the pleasant stroll to the foot of lattice structure.It is about 333 metres high construction, and serves as communication and observation tower. The tower has got two levels, from whom You can look at the Tokyo, below. We entered the tower, went to second level and enjoyed in very nice view.
Must visit twice, day and night.. A must visit attraction when in Tokyo, well located, curtious staff which is the norm all over Japan, beautiful during the day and magnificent at night.
Must visit when in Tokyo. We visited the tower twice, it was few meters from our hotel, well organized tour, very clean , the view from the upper deck was spectacular

Awesome view of Tokyo. The Tokyo tower is a great place to visit to get a complete view of the city, including Odaiba, the sky tower and all districts such as shibuya,ueno...It is worth going on the second level, to get an amazing view!In addition, even though it may look crowded it is very well organised and you do not queue at all!
Nice view.. Nice view of the city. There are two levels. We paid a bit extra to go to the higher level. We took a subway and walked a bit. Nice neighborhood.

Interesting Visit. The view is nothing exceptional but worth a visit. You should try and go early as possible because it does tend get busy and crowded and I would suggest going the morning. the view will be better and it was not as crowded.

Good view if weather is right.. We actually went twice, once on our own, then the next day on a tour. On our first visit the weather was quite good, so we went to the higher station. The view was good, but at that stage we were not sufficiently orientated to make the best of it. It was a Sunday afternoon and the towers was very busy with young Japanese.On the next day, with the tour it was much quieter,, and an excellent guide made it much more worthwhile, but the weather was not as good.I would go again in really good weather.

Old But Gold. It might be my personal preference, but I found a few Japanese people mastering with me. Despite Skytree looking brand new and everything, Tokyo Tower is still the one that tugs my heart towards what represents Tokyo city. The day and night view is vastly different so it is encourage to go during late evening, and get a good glimpse of the red orange look of the tower. The good thing about it is that, the queue is manageable and not as insane as Skytree. Seriously, I have no idea why Japanese like queues. The food at the observatory deck is not too pricey, so take light dinner there is fine too. Be sure to to when there's still light outside, so you may have a chance to view Mt Fuji ( if you're lucky) I was there bitting away my delicious sandwhich, looking at Mt Fuji as it slowly disappears in the sunset. During night view, there's one angle from the tower, where you can see lines of street lights resembling the alphabet "A". It sort of looks like another Tokyo Tower lying on ground. Good luck if you found that ;)Enjoy
Classic landmark. A classic Tokyo landmark. Similar structure to Paris' Eiffel Tower. Didn't go up it, but it looks grande from a distance.
Great Views. I really enjoyed the The Tokyo Tower. I feel like although the views aren't as good as the Skytree it's a better and more photographic structure. In my opinion a must do.

Lovely views, good to get your bearings. Tokyo Tower was the first stop I made in Tokyo. It is an impressively tall feat, not too expensive to go up and up there you will be able to see the city in all its glory - stretching as far as the eye can see. In the rarest occasions - if the air is clear enough - you can even see Mount Fuji towering over the horizon.Also happy: the lower floors offer a variety of Japanese food and snacks to munch on.

Still a great place to visit, even though the Sky Tree has now opened. Just another tower, you might say. But, Tokyo Tower is still a must-visit place in Tokyo, even though Sky Tree has opened. First and foremost, there's One Piece Tokyo Tower (not sure how long it will stay opened, though) -- if you love anime, especially One Piece, you don't want to miss it. It's a fun multi-story indoor theme park for all One Piece fans. In addition, at the lowest floor of the tower (?), you will find a big, actually, a HUGE, store that's all One Piece, nothing else. Just make sure you bring a big bag with you, though.
Great views of Tokyo.. This Tokyo landmark, which looks like a misplaced Eiffel Tower, is worth a visit. From the top you get great views of the city and, on a clear day, you can see Mount Fuji.

Worth the trip and great view of the city. Tokyo Tower is no longer the tallest building in Tokyo as the Skytree has taken over. It does have more character than the Skytree and is based on the Eiffel Tower in Paris design. As the japanese were keen to point out - it is actually taller than the Eiffel Tower! The view platform up the tower (which you have to pay for to get to) is well worth the trip as you get panoramic views of the city. Parts of the viewing platform floor are made of glass so you can stand on these spots suspended in the air looking at the traffic rushing by below! When you're through with viewing return to the ground floor and enjoy the fast food restaurant village. We chose the Ramen Quick outlet where you load your money into a machine and press buttons for what you want. You are then given a pager which tells you when your ramen is ready for collection. Yen 1,030 for the two of us (about £6). Fantastic value.

Great view. I went here Monday night the 24th with my family, the cost was reasonable for 2 adults and a child. At the the photo opportunities are beautiful. I recommend probably doing a trip both day and night for the different view. We went to the main deck. There are little gift shops to purchase souvenirs and a lovely lights walk through at the front. The building at the base also consists of restaurants and shops.

Great to look at from a distance.. Tokyo Tower has been a symbol of Tokyo for decades. It is great to look at from a distance, but as an observatory, it is not up to par with newer observatories such as the Tokyo City View and Sky Tree.

Amazing tower at night!!. Clearly inspired by the eiffel tower, yet the Tokyo Tower has a distinctly Japanese feel to it. Located pretty central in the city near roppongi, the tower has an imposing presence over the city. The trip to the viewing deck costs 900 yen but there is always a long queue, so go there with plenty of time to enjoy the views athough I think the best way to appreciate it from the ground at night.

Nice to visit but fails in comparison to Tokyo Sky Tree. Having landed early in the AM and checking in we decided we would use the afternoon to head to Tokyo Tower as it was on the list of things to see and do of my youngest son. The weather was pretty much overcast but the city was still visible. We only went to the 1st viewing deck as we planned to go to the top of the much taller Sky Tree later on our visit and it was a good call. Whilst the Tokyo Tower is a well known icon of the Tokyo skyline it fails into comparison after visiting the Tokyo Sky Tree. If you are planning on going up to a viewing deck and only have time to visit one of the towers then this is not it. The only advantage I found was that the windows of the viewing deck at the Tokyo Tower are larger and better for taking shots of the city-scape. It is still nice to visit but if you have already been to the Sky Tree you may feel somewhat disappointed, although at the time we were impressed. Suggest taking photos from the ground and saving your vertigo and cash for the other tower.

Top of the world. I am in Japan for official purpose. I had the opportunity to vist Tokyo tower, which was 15 minutes walking distance from my office(Shika-koen). Upon reaching tokyo tower, i purchased ticket(900 yen) for main observatory (150m). Upon reaching the main observatory, you can purchase ticket for special observatory(250m)
Average at Best. Just like any other observation deck. Views are good but nothing spectacular. Spend your time and money some place else.
Tokyo Tower. This is a must see place if you are in Tokyo, experiencing the city at night is Awesome! The view is fantastic as well as the facilities as well.

Good - especially if you go on live music nights.. Nice views and well signposted. A good opportunity to get a good view from not too high - you can still see the life. The 2nd floor down from the lift is another floor that often has live music - the night we went it had a great atmosphere. On the road from the subway, before turning left up to the tower is a low key open fronted bar, with paper lanters over the door. Eat/drink there. It has a great atmosphere, great food and is very reasonably priced.

Great view of Tokyo. Great view of Tokyo, tall enough to see every part of Tokyo, and not be too bothered by the fog that you would get if it is too high. A little underwhelming though. If you've been to the Eiffel Tower and Taipei 101, combine the two experience together and you get this. Sort of.

Tokyo at its best, from the top!. See the best of Tokyo on top of Tokyo Tower.Visit the tower during the day and see the spread of city to the farthest. It has a viewing dock which shows the whole of Tokyo in an amazing 360 degree view. A must visit during your stay at Tokyo. You can eat, spend time with family and friends on top of the tower.
Worth the Trip. Tokyo tower is less crowded then Skytree. The view may not be as impressive as Skytree but worth the visit night or day.

Cool Tower Worth a Visit. Tokyo Tower is by far the nunmber one thing to see in Roppongi and is great for visitors of all ages. You pay a small fee to either walk or take an elevator to the top which has a great view of the entire city. There's also a guiness book of world records museum in the tower and a few other cool attractions perfect for kids. I really enjoyed my visit and recommend it to anyone staying in the area to stop by for a few hours.

Tower with a view.. When I was here in 1985 I never thought I'd be visiting here with my son. It's still 1 of the top places to visit in Tokyo. There are 2 observation decks on the tower both have fees and a commanding panoramic view of the city and nearby landmarks. There is more than just a great view so expect to spend a few hours visiting the tower. There was a band playing on the night we visited, live band with a view!

Quite Boring. Alright, first of all, let me get this straight. This is taller than the Eiffel Tower, but NOWHERE as impressive. We didn't even go up, when we saw it, we sighed in disappointment. Really, not worth going there. The paint on it is also pretty strange, the designers made it look like a construction tower, with the red and white paint.
city landmark. Visited way back over a year, never had opportunity to get closest as possible at Tokyo Tower but seeing close by the area still looks so amazing. beautiful!

Great view with lots of lines. This attraction has mastered the art of lines. It has amazing views at both the fist and second level. If you are going to the first level then pay to go to the second. Lots of great picture opportunities. Go at sunset or just after for lots of fireworks!

Landmark in the city. Smack in the city centre Tokyo Tower looks on as a sturdy landmark. It's a great directional guide if you are lost in the city. It is located nearby a famous temple as well...pretty much a 2-in-1 visitor destination.

Better than the tower in Paris.. Considering this was modeled after that other smaller and heavier tower in Paris, I preferred this tower. There are no rip-off artists or other unsavory characters as you see in Paris, and the whole area is much cleaner looking and smelling compared to the urine smell you get in Paris.

Breathtaking 360 view of Tokyo from the 22 floor.. Bought the View and Art gallery ticket.
Certainly world class.
Timed it just after sunset.
Worthwhile.
Tokyo icon. We didn't manage to go onto the top of Tokyo Tower but it was worth the trip to go down to Tokyo Tower to see it from near sight. It is actually a radio station tower.
Worth a visit if you like tall buildings. Although I enjoyed Tokyo Tower, I still think that Tokyo Skytree does it better - additional activities for kids etc

Great view . Tokyo tower was pretty close to our hotel so we went twice. The second time around we decided to go up and check out the view. As it was nighttime we didn't regret paying the 900 yens fee. This is however the price to go to the midlevel observation deck. If you wanna go higher there is an additional charge. The coffee shop situated one floor down the mid level is a great place to have drinks while enjoying the view but it is quite overpriced so we went to a bar in the area instead. If you are afraid of heights but still want to see Tokyo ' s skyline this could be ideal.

A Tour Eiffel stripped of its majesty. Nice looking from far apart, it is particularly nice for a photo in front of the local temple in the park of Minato. Once reached the bottom of the tower, it is apparent that this is like a Tour Eiffel stripped of its majesty.

Nice at Night. I came to Tokyo Tower on my last night, but decided not to spend the money to go up. I came in the evening hours, and it was a bit crowded. The little cafes and shops are okay, I picked up a few last-minute souvenirs. When I left, it was dark and the tower was lit up - a very nice sight. A few blocks away is an observatory that you can visit for half the price of going up in the tower - and the view is from higher up!
Very good :) . Beautiful view, I recommmend to go there before sunset, so you can enjoy day and night Tokyo too :) price was good and I didn't have to wait too long :)
Good way to orientate yourself!. Great start to our week in Tokyo. Allowed us to get everything in perspective . Good facilities and easy to get to. Take binoculars with you!

Tokyo Tower.. Prior to going up this most impressive tower is the beautifully landscaped gardens.Then up we go to the top, WOW, what a magnificent view, 360%, really demonstrates how MASSIVE this city is !!!!!.Lovely little snack bar and a gift shop ( of course lol ).We had a lovely clear and sunny day so it was a great experience.Must visit whilst in Tokyo.

The most liberating experience of my life. I visited here with a fear of heights and I was terrified. I bought the package where you visit the main observatory and the highest. I went just as the sun was about to set so I had the most incredible views imaginable - the sun set where Mt. Fuji was and it was a tear-jerking experience. I forgot all about my fear of height and spent so much time just walking around taking lots of photos. Going to the highest point was a little scary as you are in a small elevator with lots of people. There is a voice in Japanese and English that tells you the elevator will jerk at one point and is normal, but I still freaked out!The views at the top were even more incredible than the main deck. The lit up city in the distance was an experience in itself. I would recommend this to anyone - a must.

Not many people visiting. Visited around 3PM, there weren't many people going to the observatory. Something I liked, as I was able to appreciate the views more. Was not able to see Mt Fuji sadly.There's a One Piece theme park inside the tower, but did not enter. I just checked out their Mugiwara store and bought some souvenirs.

Two visits. I suggest one go to Tokyo tower twice, once during the day and the other at night when it is lit up impressively. It is no longer the tallest tower in Tokyo. That distinction now goes to the Skytree. But this functioning radio tower is still worth a few minutes of your time.

Great views of Tokyo. If you want to see all of Tokyo and all the way to Mt Fuji, this is the attraction for you.The views are great from either of the two viewing platforms, but the upper deck provides the best overall views. If you can afford it, is worth going to the upper level floors.

Better then Empire State Building. Everything is very well organized and it was not crowded with people. We were there before noon. I recommend going there with a tour guide because it adds much to the experience. Do not forget to check out the look down windows.

Best time when it is Dusky . I went there at about 5 pm. I felt it was the best time in summer. You can take pics with daylight as well as night landscape after a few minutes. There is also a temple nearby.

Outstanding views of Tokyo. Really cool thing to do in Tokyo. The tower is 333 meters; the newer one is 634 meters. The old one--reviewed here--was built in 1958 and taller than the Eiffel Tower, or so they say. We were there last year and the Eiffel Tower seems taller, but who are we to argue?Anyway, this is totally worth the trip. The price of admission is reasonable and you get absolutely phenomenal 360 views of the entire city. Really interesting to see the incredible population density. There's are reasonably good gift shop on the way out that actually has some pretty good prices. At the top there are assorted things to keep the kids busy. And there is a bar or restaurant, did not really stop to check it out. I highly recommend this stop for your itinerary of things to do in Tokyo.

A must. Tokyo Tower was the first thing my family and I did having arrived from the airport and it was a fantastic way to start our two week holiday in Japan. I highly recommend going all the way to the top. Although you need to pay extra it's affordable and worth it. Sadly we didn't have clear skies because you can see Mt Fuji (rumour has it). We had a quick drink on level two - With such a fab view of the city. Definitely worth it.

Second rate Eiffell Tower. Not too far out, some good bars and restaurants nearby. We weren't queuing for too long, we took the option of doing the main observatory it was a little expensive for what it is
On top of the Workd. Great views from the top of this tower across the skyline of Tokyo. Gracious and courteous staff and relaxed atmsphere.
Amazing Views . Tokyo Tower was an awesome experience! The views from the top are magnificent! Definitely worth a visit

A must if in Tokyo!. We visited here on 6th August. No queues at either the bottom or for going to top level. Cost 1600yen to go to the top. To my mind, the view was better than the Skytree due to location to the south of the city centre with good sea views. Lots of commercial outlets at the bottom to eat or buy cheap t-shirts. Avoid the aquarium - very very small.

Worth a visit, not the best.. We visited the Tokyo tower because it is a major local landmark. It was pretty good, but to be honest you can get better views from the Metropolitan Government Office or the Skytree. There is not much else to do in the surrounding district and it kind of felt like this area has been forgotten a little bit in favour of other newer areas in Tokyo.

Beautiful View!. I've seen the Tokyo Tower plenty of times from a distance but this time around I actually visited as we stayed right across from there. I went to the 1st and 2nd tier, didn't check out the top since I was with some elders. Beautiful view all around, must check out if you're out there!

Stunning. I've always wanted to visit Tokyo tower and finally got the opportunity when we visited Tokyo this year. We had a gorgeous view of it from our hotel room and made our actual visit during the evening, so we had stunning night views of Tokyo from the tower. Although the Skytree might be a more recent engineering feat, Tokyo Tower will remain for me a favourite symbol of modern Japan. The tower stays open until quite late, which we thought was convenient as we had a busy schedule during the day. We thought the fee was very reasonable and all of the staff were helpful and attentive. Even though we went near closing time, there was still a cafe which was open so we were able to buy drinks and snacks. A really enjoyable visit!

Nice view. It's a tower with an expensive entrance free but a good view. Not much else to say. I think it would benefit from signage outside saying how close the closest subway station was and which direction to walk in to find the different subway stations.

Good view . If you take it all the way to the top its fairly high and you get a good view over the city.The entrance fee is a bit expensive, so if you don't fancy high outposts its probably not for you.

Stellar Views. I went up during the day and the views are incredible - I do think that maybe going up at night provide a better view with the skyline but didn't have a chance. There are different tiers of tickets with the most expensive going to the very top observation deck with is worthwhile - bring a good camera!

Choose a Nice Day..... Once the tallest building in Japan, with its 333 meters high and 2 observation decks, its a great place to admire Tokyo from above. The price its not that expensive with tickets for the first deck around 8 USD and 12 USD including the second one. The main reason why most of the tourist go up its for the chance of seeing Mount Fuji from the top but the chances are small with all the pollution and the lack of clear skies in Tokyo. Still, there is always hope....

Amazing views!. Tokyo Tower was a great visit with spectacular views! We only went to the main observation deck since it was cheaper (900 yen per person) and not as tall as the special observatory. There is a small gift shop at the observation deck and some souvenir coin machines as well. When you go down one level to the down elevators, there is a Club 333 restaurant/lounge area. A jazz duo was playing and blue lights illuminated the night scene. There are also 2 lookdown windows at this level if you are brave enough to peek at a straight shot down under your feet. More gift shops greet you as you exit the down elevator. Definitely worth visiting.

Tokyo's Belle. A must-do and very easy-to-do landmark in the Minato area of Tokyo. Stunning from the inside (breathtaking views from the observation deck) and out (your constant companion peaking though the Tokyo Skyline).

Nice views. I can compare my experience to visiting formerly " Sears Tower" in Chicago. Nothing extraordinary but nice point visiting Tokyo. The best is to save it for the end of your Tokyo tour , so you can see parts of the city you visited - but from different perspective. There is no fee for entering it , but of course elevator to "sky view" is paid.

On a clear day, you can see forever!. Once you get to the top level, the views are simply stunning! You could see almost all of Tokyo spread under your feet. I think the night scene would be even more beautiful, which unfortunately we did not get a chance to visit. Try the "Tokyo Bananas" from the shops on the first floor if you get a chance. It is mashed bananas wrapped in a sponge cake and mouded to look like a banana!
Tower. In roppongi area. You will find it. I going to hard rock cafe tokyo. And after that going straight to reach it.

You can not miss this thing around central tokyo, especially at night. Beautiful in the night sky, colorful beacon that shined so I could find my way around tokyo. Reminds me how the french and Japanese somehow culturally are not that divergent.... go figure.

Beautiful view. What a beautiful site to visit. There are three options available for this Tower. Price for first observation level is $9/ea using the elevator. From the first level, you can purchase another ticket to the top level for another $7. Or you can chose the walking the stair option (both for up and down) which around 600 steps.

Fun to visit - short walk from Kamiyacho subway station. It was a nice place to visit. The Main deck was open - the special deck (upper) was not open. Wonderful Panoramic views of Tokyo by night. The line up around 730-8PM was not too long and the place wasn't crowded. They have a lower floor with glass floors to step on and see through - if you dare. It is worth the 900 Yen (JPY).They had a live band playing on the main deckThere are restrooms, shops and snack bars on the main deck and lots of shopping on the ground floor.

Tokyo Tourist stop!. Nice experience, a fun tourist stop. Summer views are a bit cloudy/foggy, but it's a must when coming to Tokyo. Make sure to stop on the floor under the observation deck to see the glass floor (it's small, you can easily miss it).

Perfect for an evening view. We went there around 9pm in the evening.... Excellent view over the whole city, at the mid level (approx 150m up (500ft), you have one of the hottest radio stations sending live from the tower.... excellent viewpoints... and places where you stand on glass 150m above surfact.... The last a bit scary... If you're in Tokyo this must be on the list...

Great view and picture opportunities . If you come here at night and are able to get to the top- the view of the city is marvelous and if you have a decent camera you can get some great nightlight pics of Tokyo and this is also a great first date spot as it presents a romantic atmosphere because of the lights and sounds of the city
Amazing views of Tokyo. There are 2 decks one at 350 m and one at 450 m from where you can have an amazing 360 degree views of Tokyo city . Highly recommended

We liked City View observation deck at Roppongi better. If given the choice between Tokyo Tower & Mori Tower at Roppongi, definitely save your time & money and go to the City View experience at Mori. Better views, shorter wait.

A great way to get an overview of the City. We had a lot of fun going up the Tower. It wasn't a particularly clear day but it was the first thing we did and it gave us a great overview of the City landscape. A quick tip - at ground zero you pay to get to the middle and then at the middle you pay a bit more if you want to get to the top viewing level. Costs are relatively inexpensive for both stages and I really enjoyed the going the extra 100 metres or so.

Amazing. I went at night. I couldn't get a ticket to the top and was in a foul mood. Then I got to the first platform grumpy. I looked out of the window and was amazed. Then they let us down a level into an intimate blue lit floor that was beyond my vocabulary to describe. It was just a special experience and I will treasure the memories forever.

visit at evening. nice place to enjoy 3-4 hours of day , bt u hav to stand in a que for going to highest level on both while going up and returning down from there. We went on weekend so waited for 30-40 mins for our turn to come. Do enjoy food at foodcourt on 2nd floor i loved pizza of la-pizza. You can also do some shopping for souvenir of tokyo tower. there was also one monkey show just outside main entrance we enjoyed.
Tokyo Tower. even though we couldn't go to the 2nd observation deck because of the wind, the view from the 1st observation deck was amazing.

Amazing experience. The experience to Tokyo Tower was phenomenon . I visited Tokyo tower with my partner, initially we were under the impression that its just a tower which provide a great view of Tokyo but when we have arrived they also had an exhibition on the animation 'One Piece' which wasn't advertise on the English website as it is only available if you select Japanese. (http://www.tokyotower.co.jp/hot_topics/index.cgi?tno=2336) If you are a 'One Piece' fan this tower is a MUST visit. The exhibition was VERY unique and a VERY hands-on experience. I won't spoil the fun by giving out all the information so you'll have to see it to believe it. Me & my partner spent nearly 6 hours purely on the exhibition without the actual visit to the observation deck (We only spent about 30 minutes at the observation deck....) The only cons to the exhibition was ... Cost .... 3900 Yen per person to see the exhibition but I guess its all worth it in the end..... Enjoy! :)

Panoramic Views of Tokyo. We had a fairly clear day in July, so we could see a bare Mount Fuji in the distance. The humidity of summer makes it a much hazier view of the mountains and sea than you would expect if you came on a clear winter day. I recommend coming when it opens at 9:00am. You avoid crowds and Fuji tends to cloud/over later in the day. Vendors were helpful and food courts were very good (but food wasn't cheap).

Worth the effort. Several queues especially at the top thin last stage of the tower. Worth the patience as the views over Tokyo were excellent. The facilities seemed very good although to much merchandise
Great view. The landmark of Tokyo. You must see this. Very much like the Effiel Tower in Paris. But it has its on beauty.
Tokoy. One spectacular view from top seeing all four corners of Tokyo city. If you want to see the city in a hurry this is the place to be.

Go if near-by. The tower gives a decent all round view of the city. With all the high rise hotels you can get good views from your hotel as we have. For a free and better view go to the Government Build in Shinjuku.
Not great but doesn't suck. It does kinda look like an eiffel tower wannabe, but it does stand on its own as well. I would suggest you to skip this tower if you don't have spare time in Tokyo.

Paris. Paris in Tokyo.
Well worth the novelty of Eiffel Tower effect in Tokyo. Queues not as bad as we expected. Don't waste time on the outside area, get straight in, but Ickes and go. Leave the locals to hang about.

A great time. The Tokyo Tower was a great time for us. The view of the whole city is quite phenomenal. The shops are great and there is quite a bit to learn about the city and tower as well. Be sure to eat in that area, as there is a nice, compact variety of places to eat.

Great views. Despite reviewers saying this is an Effiel Tower wannabe its a wonderful way to see Tokyo. I personally like the red and white paint. At night it looks wonderful. Plus it houses the newly installed One Piece attraction. Although I paid for the top viewing gallery I personally didn't think it gave me a better view. Close up its a wonderful piece of engineering.

We saw Mt Fuji !. Great view on our first day in Tokyo. We even saw the top of Mt Fuji, which is rare from here apparently. Good place and not too crowded. Nice shops and food outlets underneath and walking distance to our hotel in Shiba Park.

Nice view on a clear day. We visited the Tokyo Tower a nice day and had a nice view of the City. Unfortunately the highest ramp was closed so we had to view from the first ramp. It's ok if you haven't been there but otherwise I Think Sky Tree is more interesting.

Visit if you're nearby, but don't make a trip of it.. The views from the top of the tower were pretty spectacular, but it's not really that much higher than our hotel room was and there wasn't much more for us to do (I think that there was an aquarium downstairs, but we left before seeing it).I'd say to stop here if you're nearby, but I wouldn't take a trip across town to see it.

walk to the Tokyo Tower by 15mint. i like place best location easy exit to anywhere by train. many shop for eat and drink . many pub for drinking and many shop open until 4am / 5am for eating . have lawson shop near by hotel just walk 2 mint . feel free also can have a cup coffee in starbucks by walk 5 mint . beside hotel have standing sushi bar also nice the food in there .
Tokyo Tower--Meh. view is nice. Too expensive. Don't bother on a cloudy day, but easy to get in and out. Nice way to get oriented in the city.
Amazing view from plexiglass floor. Love to see underneath through a plexiglass floor on top of the tower. Plenty of souvenir and snack shops downstairs

An absolute must see at night!. We decided to visit the tower after dark and I'm so glad we did. The view across Tokyo at night is breathtaking, and well worth the 900 yen it cost us to go up the tower. It was extra to visit the special viewing level but we didn't feel it was necessary. There was viewing spread over two floors, with look down windows on the lower floors. It was run very smoothly, and the second floor contained a variety of restaurants and stalls to buy souvenirs.I believe there is also an aquarium here but we didn't visit it at the time.If you are going to visit, I would really recommend you do so at night.
A must-do. One of the must-dos for a trip to Tokyo. Go on a clear day and even Mount Fuji is visible. Great fun.
Nice. Nice visit. It was raining my entire trip but we were still able to see fairly far out from the tower.Easy walk from train station even in the light rain.
Amazing views . Amazing views all over Tokyo from the top of the tower - I loved this experience and enjoyed seeing all the landmarks around Tokyo. Loved looking through the glass floor!

Great for tourists. We had a nice time in the tower, there was something more upstairs I think maybe a restaurant but it was closed at the time we visited which was a shame but im sure it would be a lovely place to dine with such a view.Also try to pick a sunny day as we went on an overcast day and the view is so extensive that the cloud / fog hampered the wonderful 360° viewing.

Exterior appreication is enough. There are many places could spend a morning or afternoon in Tokyo but not Tokyo tower. Yes, it is one of the landmark and the beauty is all on outside. Once you are in and you realized the age of this place should due for renovation. Don't bother to pay for the ride and get on the top as the restaurant on top of Prince hotel will be better.

Must gooooo...... I definitely recommend go to visit Tokyo tower ! Great view , amazing place to take beautiful picture and shop gifts . There are the possibility to see an aquarium with Asian species
really worth it?. good with kids or for people that live in rural areas or on a day you can see mount fuji but is it worth the wait to just to see the urban sprawl from a higher floor?

Beautiful views over Tokyo. The Tokyo Tower provides some of the most beautiful views of Tokyo and its surrounding suburbs. You can see for miles, even Mt. Fuji on clear days, as well as views of the Rainbow Bridge and even planes landing at the airport. There are great views from both the first floor and second floor observation levels. It only costs 1600 yen (approx $17 AUD) to visit both levels, but if you're on a very tight budget level one is sufficient for the beautiful views. Easily accessible via the Tokyo subway, catch the Oedo Line and get off at Akabanebashi. From there it's only about a five minute walk to the tower.

Iconic. Have visited Tokyo several times and never made it to the Tokyo Tower as I thought it was touristy. Finally spared some time to make a trip there and it was worthwhile. This is the icon of Tokyo! It's a place for every age. I visited on a weekend and there were quite many people - most Japanese families. Although I don't understand Japanese, could tell from their facial expression and gestures that the Tokyo Tower means something to them. Quite an interesting experience.

A great landmark. Not sure what I was expecting though it does offer a good view on a clear day of Tokyo.I would not recommend spending the money if it is anything but crystal clear. Here's a interesting fact though. The restrooms are amazing! I've never seen public restrooms so clean and well designed. (See photos) The sink offers water soap and hand drying all in one. The stalls are spacious and have the same bubbly music as the women's facility's.It is my hope that the U.S. Will take notice and start doing the same.I'm sure this is not the review anyone was looking for but it hold some pleasant observations. The tower does have all the same stuff as any tourist attraction, other than the mascot is an interesting shape...go see it you'll know what I mean.

Not as big as the Eiffel Tower. It looks like the Eiffel Tower in Paris – France, but smaller and not as magnificent. But, on the other hand you get good view over the vast city and if the ear is clear and not too cloudy you can see the famous mountain Fuji-san.

Excellent views. Like the glass elevators for the views as you ascended the tower. The views (we went at dusk and stayed until dark) were spectacular. Well worth the visit up to the upper part of the tower.

High Tower with great town view. Tokyo Tower (東京タワー Tōkyō tawā?) is a communications and observation tower located in the Shiba-koen district of Minato, Tokyo, Japan. At 332.9 metres (1,092 ft), it is the second-tallest structure in Japan. The structure is an Eiffel Tower-inspired lattice tower that is painted white and international orange to comply with air safety regulations.Built in 1958, the tower's main sources of revenue are tourism and antenna leasing. Over 150 million people have visited the tower since its opening. FootTown, a four-story building located directly under the tower, houses museums, restaurants and shops. Departing from there, guests can visit two observation decks. The two-story Main Observatory is located at 150 metres (490 ft), while the smaller Special Observatory reaches a height of 249.6 metres (819 ft).FootTown's third and fourth floors house several tourist attractions. The third floor is home to the Guinness World Records Museum Tokyo, a museum that houses life-size figures, photo panels and memorabilia depicting interesting records that have been authenticated by the Guinness Book.[26] The Tokyo Tower Wax Museum, opened in 1970, displays wax figures imported from London where they were made.The figures on display range from pop culture icons such as The Beatles to religious figures such as Jesus Christ. A hologram gallery named the Gallery DeLux, a lounge and a few specialty stores are also located on this floor. Tokyo Tower's Trick Art Gallery is located on the building's fourth and final floor. This gallery displays optical illusions, including paintings and objects that visitors can interact with.On the roof of the FootTown building is a small amusement park that contains several small rides and hosts live performances for children.
