On weekends and holidays, visitors can use the roof to access the tower's outside stairwell. At approximately 660 steps, the stairwell is an alternative to the tower's elevators and leads directly to the Main Observatory.

A fun place to visit. We visited on a rather cloudy, showery day in early March, so distant views were not too great, I also understand that you get better views from the Roppongi Hills Mori Tower. It was fun though to get a bird's eye view of the area; the tower was built in an area full of old temples & cemeteries so it seemed that every time you looked down you were looking at yet another cemetery. In the foyer 2 clowns were entertaining a load of local kids, they were such good fun our tour guide had a job rounding our group up!

Agreat way to do a 360 degree view of Tokyo. We went here on a group tour and really enjoyed it. It was a clear day which provided us great views of the city. I was fun watching people look down from the small glass windows located on the observation deck floor. Of course plenty of souvenir and food shopping opportunities on levels 2 & 3.

Things You Have To Do in Tokyo. I am a little bit disappointed when I was visiting Tokyo Tower, not because of the tower itself, but because of the weather. It was raining season and the city was so cloudy so I just couldn't capture any good photos from the top of the tower. But so far, if you get a chance to visit Tokyo for the first time, visiting the Tokyo Tower is a must!!!
so romantic!. whether staring from the outside or being there up above meters high the ground... you will fall in love with this landmark. very romantic to spend the night with someone very special.
Cheap and beautiful. Much cheaper than the SkyTree but still you see all Tokyo and less scary. You can climb to 150 or 250 meters.

Mesmerising views and a great experience. This may not look like Eiffel when go to its base. . Like the gardens it's missing.. but when you will look up.. you will skip a beat..There is a train station near world trade center, start your walk from there in the evening and you will see the sky lit up and the tower's shadow on the streets and buildings as you walk towards it. This is another great experience which adds excitement to your walk. Every step you take towards this tower you realize that you are gonna experience some greatness... some richness.. and the moment you reach to its base, it's worth the walk.You then buy the ticket to the top station, it's costly but trust me it's worth it. You then enter the tower, there are some restaurants, some shops to look around and some other attractions. But at this point you are only excited for you turn to step into the elevator. The mesmerization restarts when you step out of the elevator on the first floor. On your right is a band and a coffee shop. Take a sip, listen to good music, with great views of the city. There are some souvenir shops as well.. a little overly priced but look around at what altitude you are standing. It's worth it... but don't get carried away there... ;)Take a walk around look at the well lit up and fast running city. But if you will arrive here in the evening before its dark you can witness a completely different and a beautiful city.From there you go to the top floor, the elevator and the ride is scary but too exciting... :) from here uih actually get the feeling of being on top if the world... everything looks too small still it's a great feeling.This u s a place where you have to go by yorself to experience what I have shared and what I can only experience but couldn't share..I hope you all will have a great time exploring the facts and history of the tower too.A must visit place if you are in Tokyo..

perfect view. on a clear january morning, there is nothing like a 360 degree panoramic view of Tokyo from atop the Tokyo Tower. We arrived early morning on Sunday so the queue wasn't that long. Fuji san was clearly visible too. I would strongly recommend this.

Beautiful Views!. My son and husband went up to the observation deck and the view was amazing! It's not necessary to pay extra to go to the very top, the first stop is all you need. There are many souvenir shops on the second floor of the hotel. The observation deck is not wheelchair accessible.

Good view but nothing like the Eiffel tower. As you visit the Tokyo Tower, there are many signs that keep comparing it to the Eiffel Tower in paris (it is taller, it is lighter, etc.). We were lucky it was a sunny day and got to enjoy the view. It was supposed to be a crowded day (Saturday in July) but it was nothing like visiting the Eiffel Tower: almost no wait to get up to the observation deck and minor wait to get to the full height at the "special deck". It was enjoyable overall. Special mention of a couple places where the floor is glass and you can stand on it to see below.

First Date Kind of Place. This place is great, nothing quite as extravagant as other towers, especially because it stands in the shadows of its younger brother, the Skytree, but still easy to find, a cheap visit. 16$ CAD to go to the very top for two people. It was a great way to get a look at another side of Tokyo, and a great place to scope out where to take a beautiful significant other for a first date. The main lobby is interesting and has a lot of "one piece" memorabilia store merchandise and cafe space. The next level is interesting as it offers tourists a place to sit have a coffee or beer while looking at the grandiose Cityscape. The cafe out looking Tokyo also has a coffeehouse stage under some bright blue led lights that make it look it like a starry night sky.Prices in the coffeehouse are not heap but not exclusive to the insanely rich.

Very nice view. It was a very nice place and a must visit destination in Tokyo. Although now the people and tourist in Tokyo would prefer to visit Tokyo Skytree but I believe Tokyo Tower is still a place to visit.The view from the observatory was really nice. Staffs were friendly. Not really crowded and you do not have to be in a long queue when it comes to getting the elevator up to the observatory as well as for taking the souvenir photos.Food court was clean and offer various choices of food (eg Japanese food as well as Western food).Overall, a must visit place in Tokyo.

Worth going all the way up. This tower provides a very nice view of Tokyo. I went to the special observatory deck which is higher than the main one and it is lit with christmas lights and the view from up there is spectacular. Check the weather in advance and try to go when the sky is clear. I prefer night time because of all the bright lights in the city but during the day it is also nice. There is also an aquarium on the first floor that I recommend. Going to the Tokyo Tower is worth it because of the history and the central view of the city. It is so iconic there is even an emoji for it!

I don't get it. It is a radio tower. They designed it like the Eiffel Tower in Paris, but it is painted orange and white like a traditional tower anywhere else in the world. It is lit up nicely at night, but it is a bit oversold for me. If you happen to be where you can take a quick glance then do it, but I would not go out of your way.
Looks great at night :). We were walking by it at night. Very well and nicely lit. You can take some great pictures :) Zojoji temple is nearby, a very nice one too.

Very nice view and more.. I was able to visit Tokyo Tower last May and didn't fail to amaze me. I purchased 3 tickets for the Entrance, Special Observatory and for the One Piece Tokyo Tower it cost me around $100 but that is a money I never regret spending. I was able to appreciate Tokyo more with the nice view from the special observatory. Very classy feel. Staff are very polite and always tries hard to speak in English. And as a fan of Anime I was really enjoyed one piece area and buying stuff in Mugiwara store.
Visit at day and night. Go here twice, you will get different experiences daytime and after dark. Good view of Tokyo including Rainbow bridge.

Tokyo View from Sky Tower. If the weather is fine.. The sky is clear... It is a great time to visit Tokyo Sky tower.Tips : Before you buy the ticket.. Please ask the concierge or the customer service the view from above.If the sky is clear we can see Tokyo but if it is cloudy.. No point to pay and get up as the price is not cheap.Beside Tokyo tower, you can also visit the aquarium.And there are many restaurants to enjoy while waiting for the sky to turn out clear.Hope this can help.

What a view from the top!. What a spectacular view up at the tower. Although it not the world-renowned Eiffel Tower in Paris, but it was quite an impressive tower. At the top, you were able to see a vast area of Tokyo, both close and afar.

Beautiful Tower at Night. Nice View of the city at night. Nice selection of food outlets on the 2nd level. It started raining heavily and although the shop selling umbrellas was closing, the owner was kind enough to allow us to purchase an umbrella.

Nice place to for couple or Friends . Visited Tokyo tower multiple times but first time with daughter.Tokyo tower was not only tallest structure in Tokyo but it has historically emotions attached.Tokyo tower has 2 observatories and both are paid. Lower observatory has restaurant and small temple.Upper observatory is cramped and cannot accommodate more people.Bottom of tower full of food court, shop and wax museum.You can find lot of souvenirs with Tokyo tower image.This visit I could go upas to over crowded due to year end rush.Must visit. Recommend.
Exploring Tokyo . It is a stunning beauty to see the Tokyo tower!You can have the hop on hop off bus to see all what Tokyo has to offer.Greatly enjoyed by the kids.

Must visit when the weather is nice!. They should offer a foul weather discount. We could barely see the top of the tower the fog was so thick. Limited time, so we went up anyway and of course could see very little. It's probably very nice on a clear day.
Tokyo Tower. Good landmark but if you want a good view, save your money and go inside one of the local sky rises.
Mini Eiffel Tower. Don't miss it . I used to see from my office window. I call it Mini Eiffel Tower. But trust me its not mini at all. It big.

Great place to get a view over Tokyo. We visited Tokyo Tower on a clear sunny day, so we got a great 360 view of Tokyo. No queues, but even though it'd been, I think it would have been worth the wait, and the enterance fee.

Tokyo Tower. I visited Tokyo Tower during my second night in Japan. I was already fascinated by the bright lights of Tokyo, but to get a 360 degree view of Tokyo from the Observation Deck was even more amazing. On any given night, you can see families, couples, or friends overlooking all that is Tokyo. Even the locals are still amazed when looking out to Tokyo. Visiting during the daytime is great also, but visiting during the night will provide a full satisfying experience.

Fun place to visit!!. We had a great visit here! Elevators take you up and you walk in a 360 to see various areas of Tokyo. Our Grayline Tour guide was awesome and told us a lot about the area as we mover around the tower. There is a cool spot where there is a viewing window on the floor: you can look down and take some great pictures. There are plenty of places to shop for souvenirs in the towe.Gray Line Tours is super- consider taking one! The bus was very comfortable, tour guide knowedegable. Very comfortable and well worth the tour cost. All fees for visiting sites included in the overall cost.

Fun when you are at the top. Well, it is quite cool but now that we have Skytree, it is difficult to compete.The best of the tower is when you are at the top as it balances, it gives you the impression to be on a boat.However, if you have only few days in Tokyo, do not go, you can live without that.

Elevated view of the center. Nice view of the Center. However no longer that important since the Skytree opened. It is nice for taking "Selfies" and to share with friends. Within easy Walking distance to other sightseeng hotspots.

Nice atmosphere and great view. Tokyo Tower is a really nice place to chill and just enjoy the view. Although it is a little expensive, I feel that it is worth it.Would recommended travelers to really visit this place!! Especially couples as this place is super romantic too!!

Great If You Lke Visiting Towers. If you are a 'towerholic' and must visit the famous towers of the world, here is another one for you. There are cheaper options in Tokyo, however it has its appeal. The fact that it is like the Eiffel Tower is somewhat interesting, and the views are very good from the observation area. There is a café and souvenir shop of the observation level, and of course, plenty more at ground level. The glass platforms are certainly interesting for the children (and brave adults) to stand on and look downwards. If you have an hour and happy to pay the entry cost, add this to your list of attractions in Tokyo.

Must see! . Went here during New Year's Eve and it was pretty packed. Gorgeous view of Tokyo but then again it offers similar view elsewhere where you don't need to pay any entrance fee. Best time to visit is during night time where the tower lights up. Basement of the tower sells knick knacks at a slightly higher price since it's catered more for tourist.
Fun. Enjoyable. Lots of activity at the tower. Takes a long time with crowds to get up and down, but great views. Live entertainment some nights. Club 333

Boring.... I'm not sure what all the hype is about, it's 1600 yen to get to the 250m viewing platform and I'm not really sure what the hype was about.Personally I thought the view was pretty boring from the top, the first level was enough for me but I guess it depends what you're into. It's double the fee to go into the aquarium /arcade there. There's cafes and some shopping but not really worth the trip.Maybe night time would be nicer.

Landmark. We went to go visit the tower but the lineup was very long and they stated that it would atleast be 2-3 hour lineup to get to the observation deck. So we just took pics of the tower from the outside. Tip buy your tickets online and you can skip the lineups.

Dont miss this!. As a landmark in the modern city of Tokyo, this tower deserve to visit, either just to take pictures in the vicinity, or even go up to the high tower, while enjoying views of the city of Tokyo.Ticket price depends on the height you want, for adults ranging from 900 yen to 1600 yen.

If you're in the area. If you're in the area go see it. It's very nice and resembles the Eiffel tower in Paris. Though it is NOT a copy, we were sternly told, hehe :P Considering this used to be the tallest building made us wonder how terrifyingly huge Sky Tree had to be :P

Spectacular view at night!. Went on a weekend (night) and it was packed! We were a little confused at first as the lines would snake around the entrance with timed entry sign. However as a tourist they allow you to skip the standard queue and you can access it within 5 minutes after purchasing tickets. Just have some overseas ID with you.There are several levels when you reach the top. The view is spectacular and there are interactive stations to highlight what you are looking down on. Very cool at night.

Symbol of Tokyo City. During my business trip in Tokyo, I went to Tokyo tower one night. I heard that Tokyo built very big tower named Skytree, but I prefer this one. It's like old symbol of the city. I could see many times in the movie taken there. I was happy to see it with my naked eyes. The light on the tower was very beautiful at night! I love it.

The best view of Tokyo is from the Tokyo Tower!. We visited the Tokyo Tower during the day, which means we didn't get to see all the night lights, but it was still totally worth it during the day. You can see the entire city of Tokyo, a 360 view! My favorite part of the tower were the glass windows on the floor that look straight down below the tower. It will make your palms sweat, but it was insanely cool!

Not very romantic inside.... I think it's much better to see this from outside.Tokyo tower is quite tall, iconic, and has a beautiful silhouette, then many people (including native Japanese) love this tower. I also feel very Tokyo-like.But inside, it's just a little old building. Small windows, simple cafeteria, no exciting shop… It was my first time to get into this, and felt disappointed.Of course I still like this tower. The best one in Tokyo. If you come to Japan, you can't miss it out!
Fantastic View. You can see The beautiful Tokyo at its highest. The Eiffel tower of Japan. Coffee shops and souvenir items were available inside, one of must see for its popularity.

Nice to visit at night. Great views of Tokyo, tower is very well lit up at night, looks more impressive. Easy to access and kid friendly. Nice One Piece exhibition going on, especially for fans of the series.

Great view, nothing spectacular. Having visited similar elevated view points as Eiffel Tower or Empire State you should not expect anything new. There are 2 levels of tickets and two observation platforms you may reach paying 900yen for the lower one and additional 700yen for the upper. Do not miss Zojoji Temple located very close to the Tower. This is one of the most spectacular Shrines I have ever visited. Children cementary representing unborn children of Japan, including miscarried, aborted, and stillborn children did really touch my heart.

A popular tourist attraction. This was our first time in Tokyo and we only could only stay for a few hours. So we went to one of the popular tourist attractions in Tokyo, the Tokyo Tower. This Tower was built in 1958 and is 332.9 metres high. It is the second-tallest structure in Japan. This structure reminded me of Eiffel Tower in Paris. There are two observation decks, we only went up to the150 meter one. We had a clear panoramic view of the city of Tokyo. We also went down by staircase one story lower (if you have difficulty to use the stairs, you can use the elevator). There was an area with a glass floor for people to have a view of the street. There are lots of restaurants and souvenir shops.Happy Travelling!

Fun!. We decided to do a quick detour to Tokyo Tower on our way to another location. We went during the week, so it wasn't crowded, and we had time to enjoy the view. The shop near the top was cute, but a little too high priced. The view was amazing, and we loved just being able to relax for a bit. The shops at the bottom were very fun to walk through, and we were able to buy all sorts of goodies.I'm not sure if I would need to go again, but I came back with someone who hadn't experienced before, I would come back.
Spectacular views. This is a 'must' if you are in Tokyo. Spectacular panoramic views from the observatory level. Looks amazing when it is lit up at night.

Eiffel Tower in Tokyo. It is a novel experience to go up the Eiffel tower in Tokyo and it really offers you amazing views of the city. Tokyo is very flat so it's difficult to maintain your bearings, but this tour gets you back on track.If you're scared of heights go up to the first level, but I would not advise the second lift to the top viewing point.

Over Rated -. Although you want to go up in the Tokyo Tower when visiting, it is a little disappointing to visit. We stayed approximately 45 minutes and saw all. The shops were your typical shops in an attraction such at the Tower and only maybe 3 shops. in the elevator going up, only see a quick snapshot of Tokyoo as they pack you in the elevator and you cannot turn around. Once on observation deck, if you walk around the entire floor you have seen it all in about 30 minutes. It was good to go, however, pretty touristy
Very crowded. I guess you have to do it once, but it didn't really live up to my expectations and I wouldn't bother with it again.

Over rates place. I was little but more excited before seeing this tower but when I visited this tower then I was bit disappointed, although it looks quite nice and something similar to Eiffel Tower, but from my understanding it was not over rated

an icon of tokyo. The observatory tower is a must see when in Tokyo. not far from nearest train. station about 15 mins walk. They offer telescope to se mount Fuji from the tower and there's quaint and delectable souvenir shops in the tower itself. Very beautiful well crafted tower. It can get very quiet around the area after 10pm so do take note when walking back to train station

Great view, Highball Garden below ;). It's a great landmark to visit, and it's pretty cheap to ride all the way to the top to take a photo. On a clear day, you may even be able to see Mt. Fuji! At night, the lights are quite lovely to see. I recommend coming at night and having a drink or two at the Highball Garden below.

Tokyo's Icon. Despite the recent popularity of Skytree, Tokyo Tower still appears to be the Icon of Tokyo. At night it's lit up in different colors depending on the season or current festivities. The displays and event in the lower area of the tower are constantly being recreated. There's no fee for entering the lower areas but it's also not expensive to go to the observation level. Well worth a visit (about 400 yen from memory).
Good view. Worth a visit for sure just to say you've been! You get similar views from the TMG but they're very different views so do both on a Tokyo trip!
It is Europe ?. In middle off Japan you fell like in Paris !It is not so near to metro 7 min walk !The night it is spectacular because of lighting !

The Icon of Tokyo. Tokyo Tower is constantly reinventing itself. they have seasonal events like Beer & Whiskey gardens food on the second floor and even a small fun area for the kids. souvenir shopping here is good too you really don't pay more for anything here that you would anywhere else in Tokyo, but credit cards aren't accepted by most vendors so bring Yen.

Great glass elevator ride to the top. The tower is 333 meters tall. There are two observation decks, a main observatory at 150 meters and a special observatory at 250 meters. On a clear day you can see places far away as the Tokyo Skytree and Mount Fuji. The lower floors of the tower house a wax museum, aquarium, arcade and souvenir shops

Interesting attraction if you're in the area. I went at night which was cool. The tower itself is lit and from the observatory it's possible to see the Tokyo Skytree, Rainbow Bridge and the Ferris wheel in Odaiba which themselves are lit at night. After exiting the elevator from the ground floor, there is one section of stairs that are pretty steep! I don't know if it it was worth the extra 700 yen (and the wait) to access the Special Observatory (at 250m). I also don't know if it's worth a special trip to see (my hotel happened to be near by).
Great Views. Great place to visit with stunning views over Tokyo. Queues moved quickly and the whole place as quite slick.

Fun to look at, not really to be in.. Title says it all, snagging some great photos of this iconic piece of the Tokyo skyline is a must and I love that you are able to walk right up to it for some close shots however the experience is much less enjoyable is you wish to actually go up into the tower for a view! Recommend Tokyo Skytree or Mori Tower over this today.
To light up your night!. A shining tower in Minato, a nice walk from the metro station. If you going to Skywalk as well, skip the upper deck.
Too congested and overpriced. Long lines, confusing for non japanese speaking tourists and expensive. Go for an alternative building for a good view

Nice views to get acquainted with Tokyo. We went to the Tokyo Tower on our first day in Tokyo. It was quite helpful to get an overview of the city and a first impression of the enormous size of the city. We had good views, however Mt Fuji was not visible - which is quite common.Aside from the views, there's not much else. The "glass floor" was tiny and quite a let-down.Go at the end of the day and the line-ups are almost inexistent. You don't need much time for the visit anyways.

Great Views of Tokyo. It seems every place I go there is a tower of some type. The Tokyo Tower looks similar to the Eiffel Tower though not as high. It has a very nice views of Tokyo and would likely look even better at night.

Much better view of the city than from the Sky Tree. The Tokyo Tower offers a great view of the city from a reasonable height, it isn't so crowded as on top of the Sky Tree and the admission is much cheaper. Inside you can buy souvenir coins and even make a customized engraving on them.

Clean and Properly Maintained despite its age. I love visiting towers like these and see the awe of the height from below. While most towers offer great observatories, the weather hasn't always cooperated and I haven't been lucky with that. Besides, this is not my first time to go up a tower like this. Thus, we decided not to go up to the observatory anymore but rather than appreciate the architecture from below.We did this as part of the walk while waiting to meet our friends there.

Eiffel Tour in Tokyo. Nice way to see the sights and reasonably priced (JPY 1600 to go to the top). Although it seems smaller than its parent in Paris, it is in fact 20m higher but the surrounding tall buildings makes this seem smaller. The two decks both have air con so quite comfortable to move around. Getting to the upper observatory requires the use of steps and we had a wheel chair so my daughter had to walk. The surrounding area, while nice, is not a patch on the Paris equivalent so just expect to go up and down the tower rather than spending time wondering around it.
Quite a let-down. Nothing exceptional - does not even compare remotely to the Sydney tower or the Eiffel tower...it's actually quite a let-down. Skip this one.

Several Tips here - Read this review. The view from the top of the tower is not very interesting. They have 2 observatories, the main one is quite low (150m) compared to many other spots in Tokyo... and the most interesting landmark you want to see is actually the Tokyo Tower itself, which you obviously can't see when you're in it :).So my advice is:- Go there at the end of the day, just before they light up the tower- See it first from the very near park and the interesting Zozoji temple, from there you have beautiful views of the temple and the tower- When it's getting dark, this is where the tower is the most beautiful, becoming orange and visible from afar- Move to the bottom of the Tower and take picture from there- Again, don't spend time and money to go at the top, not interesting
Tokyo view. Nice scenery and can see alot of beautiful high rise building.. It cool we can see thru the glass on the floor area.

Doesn't compare to the SkyTree. If you only have time or funds to do this or the SkyTree, pick the SkyTree. The tower is impressive to look at from the ground at night and once up there the view is good but unfortunately the glass is quite smeared and scratched and it's difficult to get good pictures. We found that we'd left quite quickly compared to SkyTree where I could've stayed staring out from all day. It's still worth a look though and cool to say we've done it.

Old-school tower in High Tech city. Tokyo Tower has some major competition from Skytree. Even if this is shorter, it has more character than Skytree. And less crowded. I spent zero minutes an evening going up the Tower and you get a nice bird's-eye view of Tokyo. I love the atmosphere and ambiance. It feels more. Skytree is larger, taller and more modern but you also have more people, more queues and longer waits. Enjoy a cup of coffee and see night fall. You will also catch.. on the proper side, how the roads will look like a "starfish" - thus making the roads look like organic. Especially at night!And from the outside - the lights makes the towert shine bright orange and you have good snacks at the base - with a great creperie just outside with a huge assortment of treats.

It's more impressive to look at the tower at night!. We fought the crowds and went up to the Tokyo Tower, lower platform. There is a great view of the city but it would have been better if there were some photo or diagram at each section labeling the important sights like famous buildings or neighborhoods, etc. Friends told me I should have gone at twilight and watched the city light up from there.
thanisorn. that great I think if you alone you must see couple aroud there and you should find someone for your life

Beautiful view not to mention the surrounding temple garden. I only went up to the first level of the tower thus going further up only cost 600 yen, as it was a bit too foggy due to heat that day. The Tokyo Tower is placed nearby the Hamamatsucho St., where I went to an arranged sumo tour afterwards. The tower is visible from the station and the road leads nearly directly up to it. Do enjoy this tower (or preferably the Tokyo Sky Tree) when in Tokyo - the temple park at the bottom of the tower is beautiful as well. I'm not into trained animals of anykind, but the Japanese people seemed to enjoy seeing the trained and dressed macacas below the tower.
Highly recommend. Can enjoy the view of Tokyo skyline from Tokyo tower. On clear sunny date can view the different parts of Tokyo. Also mount fuji can be viewed if lucky.

Impressive views. The views from the Tokyo tower is impressive. On a clear day you can see Mount Fuji. Our luck was not in too much haze. When crowded taking picture with unwanted subjects is not easy.

Fantastic Views. We paid the extra cost to go up to the higher observatory. Quick lift ride up. Needless to say the view was amazing. Plenty of great photos. There was about a 15 minute wait to get to the higher tower, but worth the weight. And the same wait to get back down. We had a coffee up the top and soaked up the view. And back down the bottom there are heaps of activities for kids and plenty of food and souvenirs. Certainly worth a visit if you have time in Tokyo.
Very nice view.. The view from Tokyo Tower is very nice. The second observatory cost 1600Y. We spent there more than 1 hour.

Lovely view. Nice view, clean, short lift queue. If you wish to go all the way up the tower you should know that you have to take a flight of stairs between the elevators. Cost all the way up 1600 yen.

see it from outside in evening. It speaks of its age, 1958. It is a nice reminder of those days, but best seen from the outside as a landmark, at night when it is nicely lighted. For a panoramc view it is better to go one of the later build hotels, Park Hyatt, for example. It is one of those objects that one does not pay too much attention too but it would be missed if it were to be removed.

Good views over Tokyo buildings. If you're looking for a place that offer good views over tokyo buildings, this is probably one of the best places to visit. It has two observation decks, the highest one offers unobstructed view until the horizon, the lowest level one gives the impression that you're just in the middle of the buildings, an amazing experience. They also have a glass floor window, where you can look straight down.

Better to look at than from.... I admit that I have never been up in the tower itself because my wife was sorely disappointed by it on her first visit to Tokyo. As we've been in and seen plenty of towers by now, I can assume this isn't the best to visit. I will say that the tower and its changing lights are quite nice to behold in the evening. We stayed at the Ritz and had a room that overlooked the tower so it's one of those landmarks that will always be burned into my mind as part of the Tokyo experience.
Tokyo Tower. Convient to access and spectacular to look at in both day and night. Short walk from Shimbashi/Shiodome metro exits

Nostalgic Landmark!. A must see and must visit if you are a fan of Japanese movies and TV series, where most of the time you will see this Tower's image in the movie! It brings back a lot of memories from movie scenes!

Nothing spectacular. If you have been to Burj Khalifa, Eiffel tower, or the Empire State building you will be disappointed. All that you see are tall concrete buildings of Tokyo. The only positive thing is the look down window in the main observatory. Walk over it, looking straight down and get dizzy. The other nice thing is the view of the tower from the ground, at night. The tower is all lit up and looks pretty. So I would suggest one comes here just before sunset, goes to the main observatory (no need to spend extra on the special observatory unless u have never been to a tall tower before), and come down to see the tower all lit up. In case u reach early visit the nearby zojoji temple or the shiba park.

Great. It is good if you are bored, you get a lovely view but it is not something to do for the whole day, max you should be there 1 hour, since there is nothing much to do, and nothing much in general in that area.

Good views. The Tokyo tower was recommended to see the views of Tokyo,however on the day we visited the haze was low which restricted the views.It is a very popular attraction and the crowds can be pretty heavy, so try to go early or late.Still worth doing.
Great views. A trip up the tower will give you great views of the city. They have built a taller tower but the Tokyo tower provided great views. High enough for my liking.

Fun place to visit.. It was a sweet place to start a tour of Tokyo. We were there on Mother's Day and the pink pointy headed tower " character" in costume gave each woman a pink carnation. It was a sweet gesture.

If you go on a clear you can see Mt. Fuji - breathtaking.. There are many high buildings with great views in Tokyo, but this one makes a nice memory. Don't know what dingy old aquarium is doing down in the lobby; doesn't add anything and should be closed.
Good view of Tokyo - on clear day?. Unfortunately it had been overcast and drizzling, so the view was not as spectacular as expected. Even so, worth a visit.
Crowded!. I would pass on this... Since our hotel room was on the 19th floor and we had dinner on the 45th floor, felt like the view I got was over rated since I had already seen it.

A view from the top. A tourist point of visit, not just foreigners but Japanese from all over. We were there not during the high season, so the crowd was manageable. Nothing beats viewing Tokyo from up high.

Tokyo icon. It will remind you of the Eiffel Tower but is surrounded by office buildings, unlike the openness in Paris which contributes to its grandeur. On the plus side, you will also not experience the crowds like Paris. There are three train stations within walking distance and you can find it if you have a good map or use Google Maps. We went at night and it was quite a nice sight all illuminated. It would have been nice to have more dining options in its vicinity. There are a couple of beer joints below only. Visit it nonetheless to say that you have seen it,

Tokyo's observation spot par excellence. Still the unrivaled spot to appreciate Tokyo from the height. It's not as tall as Tokyo Skytree, but it has the advantage of being located right in the heart of the city.

One Piece theme park was awesome. It was a lot of fun and made me feel like a kid all over again. Its more like a themed carnival with interactive games. And it's the only "One Piece" themed park, pretty cool.

Disappointing. This tower looks a lot better on pictures than in real life. The location probably got a lot to say in this matter. Unlike the Effiel tower this tower is placed amongst other buildings leaving you with the impression that its just a metal structure amongst buildings. I think its looks a lot better looking at it from a distance. Try Roppongi hill at evening looking down at the tower. If you want a city view I'd rather recommend Roppongo Hills, Tokyo Metropolitan building, Sunshine City and ofcourse Skytree.

Great views, fun experience. Not for the faint of heart, or anyone even a little bit scared of heights! I'm not remotely scared of heights and I was a little queasy looking down, and we were only half-way up. If you get up the tower, the view is remarkable! We had a full 360 view of Tokyo from halfway up the tower (definitely high enough) and even saw Mt. Fuji, which only happens a few times each year.We went up the tower as part of a tour group, and it was good fun and a great way to experience the city.There are shops and restaurants down the bottom as well, if you've got the time to spare. Not a bad place to visit overall.

Top of the town. Its a worth while visit if in Tokyo The view is amazing and its not empire state but its a view worth seeing . its not some place you will spend a few hours but if you have free time , dont know cost as it was part of a tour but main part was queuing was quick and efficient .
Great view. Frm the Tokyo tower you have a grat view on the city. Of coure it's not as high as the Skytree, but it's much cheaper and much less crowded.

great view of the lower Tokyo.. If you need to take a picture from the top view of Tokyo , this is one of the great sights. Tokyo tower is always crowded so better use morning times. its best when is not raining for some pictures.

Go there at night!!!. I got a special birthday ticket! It was discounted and got me sweet gift in one of the cafes.
Fantastic views. Live entertainment. Super!

(=^w^=). Good view! There was a One piece event but it was quite expensive so we went for the special observatory instead which included the view at 150m & 250m. Had to wait for about 30mins to get to the 250m from 150m level. There were many souvenir shops after coming down from the observatory deck. -ve: we had to take an escalator, walk 40 steps & lift to get to the 250m level from 150m level so probably people with disabilities might only be able to view from the 150m level. I'm not sure if there are any lift directly to the 250m level.

Towering views. We visited the Tokyo Tower on a city tour and found it fascinatingwith good views and an explanation from our guide. It's only when you are up above most of the city that you realise how compact the place is built. Wonderful visit.

Beautiful view on a nice day. The Tokyo Tower was one of our first stops on Tokyo, we paid to go into the observatory and were lucky enough to be there on a beautiful, clear day. You get an awesome 360 view of Tokyo. They have souvenir shops with Tokyo Tower themed merchandise, and a few food & beverage shops. We did not check out the aquarium that is supposed to be in there, but we did see a sign for it. Overall, it was an alright trip. We got a beautiful view, but learned afterwards that we could have gotten the same view elsewhere, for free.

Great views of Tokyo. Although the day was starting to get a little hazy I decided to go to Tokyo tower. It was extremely busy ! the lower floors are given over to very 'touristy' kiosks all selling pretty much the same things and a small food court. The cost of going to the top of the tower is quite expensive but the views are definitely worth it. As an experience the views are great, the souvenir shops a bit tacky and the crowds off putting but I suppose it is iconic to visit

Our Lucky Night.. After a full afternoon of shopping we decided to end our day with seeing a sunset from the Tokyo Tower and then it would be only a short walk back to our hotel , The Celestine.So glad we chose to stay on the lower deck, as after getting all our photos and taking in some amazing views, some live music began near the cafe.It was a 3 piece all girl band called MODEA doing their new CD launch, and they were quite simply FANTASTIC ! They are not a pop band at all but a very talented instrumental jazz/rock outfit comprising violin, keyboard and percussion.We stayed until the finish and were so happy that we got to hear them from such a unique landmark in Tokyo.A real bonus to our visit.
The most beautiful sight in Tokyo. There is no doubt that the most beautiful attraction in Tokyo-city is Tokyo Tower. You must visit it in day and night to feel the differences about this city.

Good view of Tokyo and Mount Fuji. Good view of Tokyo. Mount Fuji about 97 km away, seen on a clear day. This is the Japanese version of the tower in Paris, this built by Japanese steel. Therefore lighter

Best views are at night or clear blue sky. This is pretty spectacular when you have a clear blue sky backdrop or at night when it is all lit up.Didn't actually go up the tower as I've gone up several others in Yokohama and Tokyo itself but if you pay the entrance fee I'm sure you will not be disappointed.

So nice Tokyo view. So good to see Tokyo from the top 360º. I love it. One of my best places in Tokyo. Get to the top it`s a little expensive, but worth it. It`s not because it`s similar to the Eiffel in Paris, it`s because this is a good option to see the city from the top and the tower in red it`s so beautiful.

Beautiful attraction in Tokyo . Visited with friend one more time.Its 15 to 17 min by walk from Hamamatsucho station. Holidays and weekends are crowded generally but weekdays normally you can get in easily.It has 2 levels and both are paid and you need to pay additional charge to go till top level.You can buy souvenirs, food drink on first level observatory. Night view is really beautiful.At ground level there is a food court and wax museum.This is nice attraction if you are visiting Tokyo for first time.Do visit this place.

Great view!. Although quite expensive, a visit to the Tokyo Toyer viewing gallery should be in one's list of places to see. The 360 degree view from the gallery is stunning and I had a view of my hotel room at the Ritz Carlton, which was right in front! The landscape of downtown Tokyo makes for good memories in pictures. However, please avoid a trip on foggy days.

Tokyo Tower. Visited the Tower in morning before the crowds. Great time to visit. We caught the Mita Line to Onamorin station and walked a short distance to the Tower. Travel via JR Line/trains and subway is the way to go! The skies were overcast and a bit 'smoggy' on the day of our visit...but still great perspective. We only went to the main observation deck & no higher. The Tower is lit up at night and next visit we're going to go in the evening and check it out.

Nice view. It was such a good place in Tokyo. You could have some cofee and enjoy a nice Tokyo view from the top. At night, it was more beautiful when they turn on the light. I recommend everyone to visit Tokyo Tower. Don't miss!

Most Beautiful tower of Tokyo. I love the tower when i stay and travel to Tokyo. morning, after noon and night time are different looks. early morning should be warking around the Shiba park. you can find out beautirul tower.

Picturesque at night. I visited the tower at night which made for quite spectacular pictures as I walked towards it. Views were great. It's not as tall as Tokyo skytree, but I've been to both and don't feel the skytree had any significant advantage over this tower.

Fabulous views. Tokyo is the smaller brother to the Tokyo Skytree however it still has spectacular 360 degree views. We went up near sunset and it was stunning ... particularly as the Tokyo night sky started to light up. There is a shopping plaza at the bottom of the tower so more shopping opportunities (if you haven't had enough already!). By the time we got to the bottom, it was dark and the tower was lit up and it was gorgeous. A bit like a mini Eiffel Tower. A definite must see as it gives you a great perspective of how far Tokyo spreads.

Iconic tower in Tokyo. This is a must when in Toyko, the tower built based on the Eiffel Tower is a great tourist attraction to see. At night it illuminates and during the day it is just a great sight in this awesome city. Take the ride up and on a clear day you can see Mt Fuji.

Beautiful lights and amazing staff. The special diamond light up was my favourite (doesn't happen every night! be sure to check their website for dates of the special light up!). I loved the courteous and polite staff there, and the tokyo tower was easily located too. Nothing to dislike about!

Lovely view at night. . The view at night is spectacular to say the least. Tokyo looks beautiful all lit up. There was a lot of people present the night we went but everyone was fairly polite and let us in to take photos or just admire the surrounds. Like most viewing type attractions, you can stay as long as you like but after about 30 minutes you are done.

Spectacular to look FROM not AT. This is an old TV tower that has viewing platforms with spectacular views over Tokyo. There are two levels; the first is great, the next is better. It can be extremely crowded so don't go if this will make you uncomfortable. It's great to see fireworks from here in August.
A must see in Tokyo!. We visited this very famous tower in Tokyo and enjoyed the views from the top deck. It is a must see place to visit if you are in Tokyo.

Go at Sunset!. They had the One Piece thing going on when we went but we aren't fans so you can choose not to pay for that section. There's an aquarium on the ground floor which sadly wasn't great, with the animals in small empty tanks looking sad. We went to both observatories - prepare for queues and waiting times of around 20 minutes to go up and down, but the views are worth it. If on a budget/out of time, just go to the first observatory, there's not a whole lot of difference. We managed to see it in daylight and at night with all the city lights on as we went just before sunset :) Oh and the building toilets had a load of features that I didn't see in other places xD

Definitely a must go when you're in Tokyo. 2 choices of access to choose from: Standard observatory level & Special observatory level. When I was there, unfortunately the special observatory was closed........... Bought the ticket for the normal observatory and it was not that bad. The view offered was great and there are plenty of tables along the perimeter of the observation floor. There is one interesting exhibition that shows a baseball that was found at the top of the tower, it's worth a read.

Amazing old classic!. Very subjective review, cause I love japan. Amazing views and classical tower in all Japan , specially if you are a anime or manga fan. Skytree is higher but won't beat the amazing tokyo tower.Price wise, was a bit pricey but worth the ride.

Not exceptional.. Other than the fact that the tower resembles the Eifel tower a bit, there's nothing really exceptional about it.It's just a tall tower, overlooking Tokyo.Entrance for both observation decks is apx. 13US$.While not entirely lame, there are far better things to see and do in Tokyo.
Little bit of Blackpool feeling. It reminds me for Blackpool Tower, little bit smaller, but not as kitschy. Better to visit I'm good weather and when sun goes down, beautiful colours.

Good view but lots of places to get a good view in the city.. The tower itself is impressive and I did like the fact that you can see out of the lift as you are going up. The view is great although a little cloudy when I went but you can get this view in other places for free, such as some hotel bars. Was a nice thing to do and would if I had children and didn't want to visit the bars but for me a saw the same in other spots.
Busy place but great view of Tokyo. The place is quite busy and long queue to enter to the tower. Many restaurants and a few storey department stores. The tower is an amazing architecture.

Don't miss it. The Tokyo Tower is definately worth a visit as the views from the observation deck are quite breathtaking. Popular landmarks are signposted and the deck areas are wide so that even when it's busy you can still find a spot on each side for a good view.

Not really worth the while to visit. Was not very near to the subway station. Need to walk about 15 mins from Hamamatsucho station. It is typically a radio station and was modelled after the Pari Effiel tower. We took the one to the mid of the tower. And there were some souvenirs shops inside too.

Love the view while sipping coffee !. We like Tokyo's view from the tower.. We hope to see the famous Tokyo Tower Lights but it was raining when we were there , no famous lights! Well I love the yummy ice cream crepe near the tower's entrance!
Half Day sightseeing of Tokyo. Interesting tower in an orange colour. Unfortunately raining whilst we were up the tower but am sure the views are spectacular on a clearer day

See it when the sun's going down. I wouldn't go out of my way to see the Tokyo Tower but if you happen to be nearby when the suns setting and the lights are turning on its worth checking out. It's pretty ugly to see in the daytime. The views from the top are great, there's some typical tourist things to buy inside, and my kids thought it was cool to stand on the see-through floor and see all the way down.

Traditional landmark. Though it is no longer the highest tower at Tokyo after opening of Skytree, it is still one of the landmark at Tokyo which actually functions as a signal broadcasting tower. We bought admission ticket for both Main and Special (Higher height) Observatory (actually visitor can pay price difference at Main Observatory to visit Special floor). Unfortunately, the day we visited was very cloudy so we couldn't see spectacular view such as Mt. Fuji.

Nice view of the tower at night. Made a trip to the tower. Did not go up as it costed money to go up to the observatory. That being said, the view from the bottom of the tower is amazing as well. In the tower, there's a one piece tower. Not too sure what that is. But if you're a one piece fan, you could check it out. It does cost to go in though.

Nice to experience just once. Gives an okay view. The WTC building across it gives the best view of tokyo tower but its also nice to experience this. Check out the glass bottom stands. Its really nice to see this place at night as it looks like it comes to life. Don't forget to send a postcard from the top! Tokyo Best views: https://thebackpackingballerina.wordpress.com/2015/04/30/getting-the-best-views-of-tokyo/

It was okay. The tokyo tower itself was okay, not too impressive. It's very plain compared to the eiffel tower, and it's not even close to the height of the highest buildings in Taiwan or Australia.Inside, you can find restaurants that offer fine dining as well as a food court with very affordable and reasonable meals. They also have merchandise that features famous Japanese characters such as Doraemon, Hello Kitty, and One Piece.Overall a good place to visit in Tokyo since it's a known place in the city, but incomparable to "tallest buildings" in other countries.

The view is incredible.. Had the most amazing view from the top of here. There is also a glass 'floor window' that allows you to look straight done. My son jumped on this and almost gave me a heart attack. Beautiful scenery, pretty cold, but it is enclosed so you didn't feel it. You can see football matches going on on top of the roof of adjacent buildings. Not to be missed. And don't be put off by the striking orange colour of the tower, it is similar to the Tori gate colour.

Tokyo tower. Decent place to visit, but not must place to visit. First floor consists of cafe, gift shop,and ramen restaurant. The lift ticket is cheap, but honestly it's not worth going up. In fact, you are better off seeing the tower during night time from nearby cafe while enjoying your meal. if you have very limited time in japan, you won't miss that much just by looking from far away view.

It's a cell phone tower, people!. The tower is a fantastic landmark and helpful when navigating your way through Tokyo. We had a tour that included Tokyo Tower's first observation deck at 150m. It is 333m tall - they proudly boast that it's taller than it's mentor, the Eiffel Tower. The view is nice on a clear day and it's nice to get above the city to see the layout. I don't know how much it costs to go up to the observation deck on your own since it was included in our tour, but there were a lot of picture opportunities and gift shops available to browse. This is a good stop for kids as they are contained due to the elevator operators. Overall, it was a good stop, but a picture outside would be sufficient.
Great Views. We visited in around 9pm and only at the first level as the top level was closed to the public. Great 360 degree views of Tokyo.

Don't miss if visiting Tokyo. In my opinion the best picture of Tokyo Tower is from the front yard of Zojogi Temple.It gives a striking contrast between ancient and modern architecture.Zojogi Temple is on walking distance from the tower.Tokyo Tower has two observatories, the principal and the "special". They have two different rates. The principal observatory offers a wonderful view of the city. The "special" is 100 meters higher. My teens want me to tell you "it's not worth it". I actually think it was a good additional experience. Not necessarily for the view but the elevator is small, you get to see part of the tower structure and this second observatory is smaller. It creates an anxiety provoking feeling which can be a thrill. Then we went back to the main observatory (it has two floors), we had a snack and a beer.

Still the Tokyo symbol. Although double overwhelmed in height by the Tokyo sky tree, the Tokyo tower remains the Tokyo symbol. It's height is around 333 m. which is just around the height of the Eiffel tower in Paris, upon which it was modeled. Unlike the Eiffel, that height isn't that obvious since it's settled among other high rise buildings very close. You even can't see it from everywhere in the city, unlike the Eiffel again.Just like the Sky tree there are two platforms you can climb. The first is at 150 m, and the second at 250 m., separately paying. Here we did climb the second deck, and it is advisable, since it is in the city center, so you need to be higher than the surrounding buildings to get a great view.In my opinion the views from the Tokyo tower are even better than from the Sky tree, maybe just because it's downtown.Come at night when all Tokyo is lit up.

Great views of Tokyo. We went early, earlier is better because the lines are not as long. Luckily we had a nice clear day. Beautiful views.If you want to eat in the restaurant then you will need reservations.

Good views. After visiting the Tokyo Tower after the Skytree the views weren't as good. The Tokyo Tower is not as tall as the Skytree, the views were still good. The slight haze had disappeared so we were able to still see the sights quite clearly. Very easy access as the subway station is only a 5 minute walk from the tower.

A landmark in Tokyo!!. With Japan's efficient railway system, one can reach any destination provided one is willing to walk a bit from the station. The Tokyo Tower is a bit far off but because it is a well known landmark in Japan, we had to check it out. When we got there, there were makeshift food stall tents. The aroma of the newly grilled scallops was so amazing, no wonder there was a long queue! We got our tickets for the Tower, around ¥900, with an additional fee if one wanted to go up to the special higher observation deck. We were about to go up to the view deck when my teen sons spotted this One Piece Anime Store so we had to follow them. If you follow One Piece anime like they do, then you will go crazy in this store! But there was again such a long queue that we ended up without any One Piece merchandise save for the capsule toys and coin keychain/necklace the kids got from individual machines. Up on the observation deck, we got to see a 360 degree panoramic view of Tokyo and all the city lights. (Actually, you can get a good panoramic view of Tokyo as well from the Tokyo Metropolitan Gov't Authority Bldg at Shinjuku for free!) Apart from that, there were some souvenir shops with all sorts of merchandise (which you probably can get at a cheaper price elsewhere at Don Quijote or Akihabara). The kids got hungry so we decided to eat at Curry Lab on the 2nd floor, where they had the restaurants and more souvenir stands, including Hello Kitty merchandise and Tokyo Banana pastries. When we got out of Tokyo Tower, the food stalls were closed so we were disappointed not to have taste those great smelling scallops! The tower, by this time, was lit up with yellow orange lights that made for a fantastic photo op. Though the Tokyo Tower is no longer the tallest tower in Tokyo, a bit pricey and a bit far off from city center, it remains to be a must see landmark to visit if you are new to Tokyo.
Gorgeous View!. Wait until the sun has set, to visit this beautiful tower. The vibrant red color at night just lights up the city. The view from the top in the evening is gorgeous!

View to ...... Eiffel Tower eat your heart out (I know it's not Paris but ...) we were lucky enough to visit on a relative clear day - the view was amazing - chatted & admired the view over a cuppa. Worth a visit then wonder down to the Zojo-ji temple & gardens breath taking views.

Lots of fun. I really loved visiting Tokyo Tower. It was just down the street from my hotel, which made it even better.It's not as tall as the Tokyo Skytree, but you can still get a nice view of the city. At the base there is a crepe shop, which is super yummy. There are also shops you can find various knick knacks at.We did end up taking the stairs down, which was quite... illuminating? The total stairs were 550+ all the way down, and you can feel the wind blowing around you and the cool air. If you have a fear of heights (like I do), taking the stairs might not be for you, but it's still worth the experience.I would go here again, just for the stairs!

Nice place. We walked there but so many people so we just people watched & decided to wait for a sunny day & go to the taller Skytree later.
Did sedan interesting Monkey show at the base.
We walked around the park nearby watching the locals celebrating Sakura.
They do like their drink!

Nice Tower. Maybe in terms of structure, Tokyo Skytree is better, but a visit to Tokyo won't feel right if you don't visit Tokyo Tower, I've seen it in movies or anime many times and glad I finally able to see it in person. Try to visit at night, the lights definitely add more elegance to the tower. We didn't actually went up the tower but we visit the lobby, there is a store selling one piece stuffs. So happy I'm able to take picture of the tower with my new iPhone, same picture as in the world gallery haha.

Seeing is believing...Tokyo is HUGE!. Our hotel was located near the Tokyo Tower, so we walked over one afternoon. We paid to go up to the first deck "Main Observatory" and then paid extra to go to the upper deck "Special Observatory". It was a sunny day (although a little hazy). We could not see Mt. Fuji, but we could see Tokyo stretched out 360°. It really is a wonderful way to see the sheer vastness that is Tokyo. We decided to go back the next night and we were glad we did. Seeing it at night was spectacular in a different way and was less crowded. We could not see the same vastness, but it was still amazing. The Special Observatory was not open at night. There are restaurants and shops on the lower levels. There are two floors to the main observation deck. Be sure to go to both levels (lower level has the glass floor windows).

Nostalgic tower with a great view. Inspired by the Eifel tower, this tower still offers great views of the city (especially on a clear night). It isn't as tall as the new Tokyo Skytree but it is also far cheaper. There is an extra surcharge to go up to the upper deck but the view from the observation deck was already very good. There are free performances from local bands at the Club333 bar area on the lower deck before you take the lift down. I managed to catch the 8pm session. There is a food court at the base of the tower with reasonably priced food (order and pay through the vending machine, then pass your order chit to the staff who will pass you a puck that will vibrate when your food is ready) and some gift stalls as well.

A must see tourist atraction. Tokyo Tower is the kind of a must see tourist atraction. We have the Eiffel in Paris, Petronas in KL and in Tokyo, the Tokyo Tower. Staff is polite and crowds go up and down lifts in a orderly fashion. The tower's red metal construction is impressive. They have various levels for viewing the city, choose yours wisely and you will get rewarded with a great view.

Good view of the Tokyo metropolis. Easy access, efficient ticket office and friendly staff made this a very accessible place to visit. We only went to the 150 metre mark, as there are stairs to the next lift to 250 metres, and my mother couldn't make it. However views were fine, as we were lucky to get a sunny, clear morning.

Let's see the city of Tokyo. Day or night is a great time to visit this as you have a different sensation to see the whole Tokyo. Come up to the highest floor. On the way down, stop by to watch for performance. Love it

Great View on a Clear Day. The Tokyo Tower has an amazing view of downtown. The day we went it was very hazy and the view was limited. I am sure it is wonderful on a clear, sunny day. The tower has multiple observations decks for views along with restaurants, vending machines, and stores.
Nice View!. The view from the observatory was awesome! Be sure to take pictures. Also, there were lots of shops inside the tower to buy souvineers. The Tokyo Tower is a must-see.

Queues!. This attraction was within walking distance of our hotel, so we thought we'd go along. There were no queues up to the first stage, but not much of a view either, and there was quite a long queue for the lift to the second stage. Once you get out on that level, the view is good, but there is a limited amount of space before you join the queue to go back down again!
Japan's Eiffel Tower. Since it was a very windy day the topmost observatory was closed but we went to the first floor observatory. The night view of Tokyo was gorgeous.
Tokyo tower day trip. Dun miss out going to Zojoji which is just 5 min away. When i was at the temple, there is a fair. Japanese temple fairs are interesting and worth a visit.

Spectacular view. From the top floor you can reach in the Towe you can enjoy a fantastic view.
My recommendation is to go up Hal an hour before sunset, enjoy it and wait dark of the night will cover Tokyo with millions of lights, you will have two view of the city that wil,remain unforgettable !
You have to book your slot.

great tower in the middle of everything. the tower is in the midst of lots of tall buildings, you can see Fuji on a clear day and you are just above everything around you. Good views of the harbour and you can notice a lot of bits of Tokyo form here.

Great Views and Reasonable Prices too. This was our first visit to Tokyo and whilst I cannot cope with heights, the Tokyo Tower was on my tick list of things to do and see.We arrived late afternoon and quite pleasantly the queues were virtually none existent, more surprisingly were the entrance prices, unlike other towers elsewhere on the globe, the Tokyo Tower prices were affordable and you didn't feel aggrieved at paying them.There are two lift/ elevator rides to get you to the top. The first can hold about 30 people, but the second holds 10 so at busy times I guess this is the bottle neck.When you get to the top the views are fantastic, but it was a clear day when we went up! The information panels are good at explaining what you can or should be able to see, but for me it was a bit claustrophobic (please bear in mind I don't do heights though). The viewing area is fully enclosed so photo's are a bit difficult, although you can opt to walk up to the top so I guess the views would be great from the external stairs.On the way down, make sure that you take a look at the 'Sky Views' which are Perspex panels in the floor of the middle platform, there's a small one and a larger one. Also, on the way down, you get dropped off on the 3rd floor so that you can enjoy 2 floors of gift shops, this is something which irritates me and finding the way out when it is busy will be a challenge.Overall, I enjoyed the experience didn't feel cheated and am glad we went.

Views from Tokyo Tower. A must see attraction in Tokyo. Stunning views al around Tokyo. I first visited this Tower in 1992 and was excited to go up again this time , March 30 2015. A great family outing
Great View. Good Pricing. I went to this with a tour and it was spectacular. The view was amazing and the pricing was good too!I really hope to come again

I am usually not fond of heights!. But this was worth the trip. I did not know there was a cute restaurant at the first level or we would have gone early as possible and had coffee and breakfast here. The day we were there we got to see Mt. Fuji - spectacular. The elevator ride alone was worth the price. You literally float up to the top. Make sure you look at the lights in the elevator they are great.
Classic sightseeing venue. Basically a 1:1 copy of the Eiffel Tower, but now has competition by the new Skytree (?) tower and the Shinjuku city hall viewing level (free).
Nice view of Tokyo. It gives you a good view of Tokyo and it surroundings. We went to second level only, there is a glass floor, small but it will give the felling to those who like this.

Way better than the famous Eiffel Tower!. I came here before a few years back and since my gf and I are holidaying in Tokyo it would only be natural to visit a landmark of Tokyo! Needless to say I am very happy even visiting it again! The tower isn't as big as Eiffel Tower but there is way more things to do! For starters you can go up the main observatory which obviously includes good views and also some floor glass panels! Also dotted around are various things to see such as a wishing shrine, souvenir shop, cafe etc. if you wish to have an even higher view you can choose to pay a bit more and go up the special observatory area. This part is solely for views day/night. Take note that if you do go up the special observatory make sure you give them the right tickets!Then beneath the observatory areas are some floors of interaction, shopping, food court! The food court has a decent selection of foods ranging from mos burger, to baskin robins, to sushi rice bowls to ramen shops! Also on the same level has a wide selection of souvenir shops so there's plenty to pick from! And on top of that they have recently installed the awesome Tokyo one piece tower attraction!(which will be on a separate review)All in all a nice tourist spot for any visitors and with the recent inclusion of the one piece attraction all adults and children will both enjoy it!
Went and seen. Nothing special, just a red and tall tower. If you are an avid photo- taking person, challenge yourself to selfie with the tower.

great overview of tokyo. went right at opening to beat the crowds and had free reign to move around and get all the pictures i wanted.nice to appreciate the enormity of tokyo. cost was affordable - worth the money. glass floors were cool to look through

Like a painted Eiffel tower.. I didn't even know this was here prior to visiting Tokyo so it was kind of odd seeing an Eiffel tower look alike in the middle of this Asian city. Had to go and we went to both the main observatory and the top. There is a long line and really only 1 elevator going to the top so you could have a wait depending on how crowded it is when you go. I thought it was pretty cool. We went at night and the city lights were a really cool sight from up there.

Tour around Tokyo Tower. Tokyo Tower is very popular. There are two observation platforms in it: first - at 150 metres and second - at 250 metres. From these platforms you can see a central part of Tokyo. If the weather is fine, you can ever see Fuji mountain

Nice views but nothing special.... Be prepared that there is only one elevator to take you from the middle floor all the way to the top and back down. This translates into a long line coming back down which moves at a decent pace if you have someone to chat with but overall it seemed like a waste of time. If you are staying at a high rise hotel, go to the top floor and see the view that way and it is just as good.

Breathtaking Views. View are stunning from the top, even from the mid level (you can go to either, the ticket for the top level is higher than that of the mid). It is by far the best way to absorb the great city of Tokyo from one place. You might not have heard about the Tokyo Tower as much as you would have about the Empire State Building or the Eiffel Tower, but it is a great monument in its own right, just as fabulous!

Just to be able to say I went. . My son and I almost skipped this one, but I'm glad we didn't. It really does have amazing views of the Tokyo nighttime skyline. It was only 700 yen to go to the lower deck, and there was no wait at all when we went. When we first got there, I was thinking it was a bit touristy for me, but by the time we left I was glad we had visited. There are other things too do, both at the base and upstairs, but all we did was look around, and it was still worth it. The food places smelled good, and the karaoke bar at the main observation deck was packed and looked fun. The gift shops are tacky, of course, but it was a good place to get a few cheap trinkets for my younger kids.

Good views on a clear day. This gives super views over the city of Tokyo, and when it's clear, Mt Fuji in the distance. It's not too scary for those scared of heights as there is a bar to lean on so you don't look down but out, and it's worth doing.

Cheap and cool. I paid 900 yen to get to the main observatory deck, I thought that was cheap!!! It's a short walk through but for the price I believe the views you get are very nice. It's cool to say you were up there and depending on the days you get a great view from the lower deck. No need to go up all the way unless you really want to. Fun place to visit in Tokyo!
Nice view. Nice view over Tokyo, but that's really all there is to it. Entrance fee. You can buy food, coffee, cakes, souvenirs, etc.

Great views - shame you don't get to the top in one trip. Great views from the lower of the 2 observation decks which was all we had time to do. It is a bit awkward and offputting to have to pay extra and stand in line for 2 lifts to get to the top deck. However, the views are good from the lower deck - you can see all of Tokyo and out to Mount Fuji which was clear when we were there. The tower is also attractive to see from the base - lots of interesting angles and looks newly painted. Souvenir shops more than usually tacky!!

Must see at night!. the middle observation deck was amazing great views, roomy not a long wait at all. Then we decided to go to the top. Honestly it was a pretty view maybe because it was at night it looked the same as the mid observation desk only it cost 700 yen more and we waited for 45 min in a very slow line I was told it can last longer or shorter depending on when people choose to leave there is only 1 elevator that goes up and down. The gift shop and ice cream shop at the base of the tower were reasona

OK, looking a bit tired.. I think the Sky Tree is probably a better option now. The 'shopping centre' at the base of the tower is pretty shabby and having to pay twice to get to the top observation deck is cheeky.

Amazing at Night!. Went there my first night and it was soon nice! I especially love the view from my hotel room. You see the peak of it but its clear enough to know how near it is. It's like a Peek-A-Boo in the window.

Night Visit to Tokyo Tower. Been here before. Night view from the observation deck at the Tower is ok, nothing spectacular. The cost was around ¥900, which is a bit steep but doesn't break the bank account. The Tower itself looks great lit up and worth taking pictures. The shots from my iphone looked pretty good. Lots of cheap souvenir shops in the Tower to cater to souvenir hungry tourists & locals.

Tokyo Tower. Tokyo Tower is a famous landmark in Tokyo. It can be found within the Minato area, where a spectacular view of the surrounding Tokyo Bay can be seen. The Rainbow Bridge in Odaiba and the Tokyo Skytree in Sumida can be clearly seen via the tower decks. I recommend a visit at night to see a magnificent view of Tokyo night lights, and the tower itself is illuminated producing a golden yellow glow.
Don't bother. This was included as part of a Tokyo tour but got the impression it had been included to pad the tour out
Just a tower. It is just a tower. That's all.If you've seen the Eiffel tower, you'll be disappointed here.In fact, if you've seen Crystal Palace radio tower you'd be disappointed.

Mediocre experience . On our last day in Tokyo, we went to visit the Tower first thing in the morning. The best wow factor was looking at the view and taking in the last memories of this city. Just like going to the Grand Canyon, once the feeling of amazement wears off, you are done and ready to move on. It's a good one time experience but also something you can skip and spend that money elsewhere.

Is it Paris?. The Tokyo Tower was based on the design of the Eiffel Tower and so quite similar in appearance. It stands out with it's red paint and has two levels (2 separate entry fees) that can be reached with lifts. We decided to go at dusk and saw the change to an illuminated Tokyo, however due to windy condition we couldn't go to the second level. That time of the day is also suppose to be less busy.

Great view of the entire city. Good place to spend a few hrs in Tokyo. If you are a visitor to Japan, pay extra for or the priority ticket which allows you to skip the line and wait. Best viewing time is in the morning since the afternoons an get somewhat hazy.

Amazing Views. We have just gone here during the night at about 8pm and the tower is all lit up and the views over Tokyo are really amazing. Much better value that the sky tree as the tower is only 900 yen. the place has a black and white old style setting which is really nice and peaceful. Defoe worth a visit but about a 15 min walk from the nearest JR Line.

Great Panoramic View. The reason to go up is obviously for the view. The view will not disappoint. There will be signs pointing out what you are looking at from the different vantage points. Once up you will find the usual and expected gift shops, etc. But that's anywhere.
Just Like Paris. You have to see this one around dusk. Lights on but not quite dark outside. Same thing with Tower Eiffel in Paris. This one us just one of those works of art.
View. Queues horrendous to go up, two stages to the top and long waits for each. View was good, best part was seeing Mount Fuji. If short on time in Tokyo not worth a visit.

Great view of the city. Great view of all of Tokyo, you can see so far on a clear day in every direction. there is also a neat glass bottom on some parts of the tower that let you see down under you. This is a fun thing to do if you have time and are into touristy things. Not a must though.

Great View plus One Piece Tower. During this last visit to Tokyo I finally made my way to Tokyo Tower. The view is spectacular. The only downer was the prices at the gift shop. A special event was also going on at the same time which was also excellent, One Piece Tower, which made this visit awesome.
Excellent!!!. I personally feel that going up to the observation deck isn't necessary because the landmark is so beautiful it self. Must see at night if you're in tokyo!!

Well known Tokyo attraction. Plenty of eager and helpful staff keen to practise their English. Many interesting photos of the tower during and soon after its construction which allows one to be able to compare the views between then and now

Only If You Have Time. Ok first let me say I was super excited about visiting the Tokyo Tower. I have been to Paris and thought this was a copy of the original with a Japanese twist. The Eiffel Tower in Paris is 324 metres (1,063 ft) tall and feels HUGE. The Tokyo tower is 333 metres (1,093 ft) but yet does not feel so big? Not sure why but in my opinion the Eiffel Tower beats Tokyo hands down, with all of the historic grandeur that is presented on each level. I probably would not do a return visit to the Tokyo Tower.
A little bit of Paris in Tokyo. Hard to believe that this incredible structure is actually higher that the Eiffel Tower. The view is fantastic and it's absolutely worth a visit.

Even better than the Skytree. Really grateful we make time to visit the Tokyo Tower. It might not be the tallest in Tokyo now but it is really majestic when you see it directly. If you are using subway, the nearest station is Akabanebashi (Toei Oedo Line). The tower is 5 minutes walking distance from the station.Admission fee to Main observation deck (150m) is 9000 Yen. And if you want to go to Special observation deck, you need to add 700 Yen.
Great views of the city. Well worth visiting, not as high nor as busy as Tokyo's other tower, but still a landmark from long ago worth taking the time to see.

Too commercial.. I visited the Tokyo Tower a couple of years back and it was easy to get to the top and see the splendid view. Now it has become a money making waste of time. The place is more about selling you junk. You have to be there at the right time or it becomes crowned and it is impossible to get anywhere with the queues. There is a great view from the top but you need a clear day. This is about making money now. There should be one charges for a complete visit but its dragged out.
Fun finding "Paris" in Tokyo. The tower was amazing in the evening. Both the view and the tower. You should absolutely go in the evening if you have the opportunity.

Very good view. The view is very cool. You can go up to the middle of the tower and/or to the top. If you want to go to the top you have to buy a second ticket and get a second elevator. But everything is very well organized. And it worths the view. You definitely should visit it if you are in Tokyo.

Great views of Tokyo. This is a Tokyo landmark offering beautiful views over the city from two levels – an initial two-floor Main Observation Level(siting at a height of 150 m or nearly 500 ft), and then, via a small elevator, the Special Observation Level (which sits at 250 m, or roughly 800 ft). There is a reasonable fee (¥ 1600, or less than US$15) and on no occasion on visits to Tokyo did we encounter huge crowds or excessive queues. There are tourist attractions at the base, in Foot Town, such as a Guinness World Records museum, Wax Museum and Aquarium Gallery; although did not visit these. Plan to spend an hour to 90 minutes. Recommended for great views of Tokyo and its deep cultural significance (to me) as site of many legendary kaiju monster movies (Godzilla, Gamera. Mothra) ;)

Still the best tower-attraction in Tokyo. Great location and fun attractions. Although overshadowed a lot in recent months by Tokyo Skytree, for me, Tokyo Tower is still the best paid attraction of its type in the city.The tower complex contains a small arcade, an aquarium and a small amusement park on its roof. Then there's the tower itself with its wonderful views of the city.These days the queues aren't so long and they've started doing theme days (like the recent One Piece tie-in-event). Try to go in the late morning if you can, for the best combination of weather and light queues. You'll love the view.
