Amazing!. My husband and I visited Tokyo tower before we got married (2004). It has an amazing view of the city. Once you reach the top there is a transparent floor. If you are brave enough to look down and see how high you are from the ground please do, otherwise if you have fear of heights you better not move. Fun place to visit.

Great Views over Tokyo. Fare to lower platform is Yen900. There are several lifts going to this level and the que at the time went quickly. There are steps for those who like a challenge - 600 of them!Great 360 degree views of Tokyo. It is worth the fee. I imagine the view at night is great too.There is a higher 2nd level to view from. This is an additional fee you pay at the 1st level. Upon seeing the que I changed my mind and decided that the 1st level is good enough.

Not that impressive. I went t see the Tokyo tower in the afternoon and it is not as pretty as it is at night of course. In fact, I fuess it is only nice at night because of the lights on the tower, other than that, it is nothing compared to Eiffel tower in size, although it reminds you of it. I wouldn't say it is a really interesting tourist attraction to see.

Excellent Place to Visit. Tokyo Tower is a really nice place to visit for a couple of hours. The admission charge is not high and you can take the lift straight up to the observation floor where you can get great views of Tokyo city. For an additional charge you can go even further up to the 250m level. Downstairs there is a great souvenir store which is very busy but with some great merchandise, as well as restaurants and several stalls and other places to visit. I came only with my young son, but plan to come again with my wife and both kids as I feel this is a great place for kids and adults to spend some time.
Beautiful and unforgettable view. The most amazing view of Tokyo, as if one were in the sky... Not so crowded. Better to visit at night with all the glittering lights of the city.
Tokyo tower changes color at night. Day time view of the whole city is very nice,, they have nice souvenir shops in the bldg, outside tower view better at night as it changes color

Beautiful Tower!. We had the Tokyo Tower view each day from our hotel window. We decided to visit this landmark at night because it is illuminated and we thought we'd like to see Tokyo with all the lights. This beautiful tower provided us with an amazing view. The night view was beautiful. There was even a jazz performance by the area where the look down window by the floor are. Night ambience was also dreamy because of the lights in the tower. We enjoyed our visit to this landmark. The Tokyo Tower has a nostalgic charm, good shpping , food court and lots of picture opportunities.

cool tower and great to see at night or day. very modern tower, it has elevators to reach the observation deckthere is entrance fee at tokyo tower reasonable priceand there is a small transparent glass floor scarynear zojoji temple dont forget to visitnice to be inside at night can see the night view of tokyo

Good view of Tokyo. If you like skyline views of a city, then you will like Tokyo Tower. I prefer to see a temple or museum, a place or Japanese garden. We were there in the afternoon. Perhaps I would have appreciated it more if we had been there at night.
A Tokyo icon and well worth a vist. The Eiffel tower but with much better views...if your in Tokyo go see for yourself and on a clear day Mount Fuji is a sight to behold
Good. Not as tall as Tokyo Sky Tree, but still a nice place to catch an overview of Tokyo. It's quite crowded, but you will enjoy the awesomeness at top.

Good, but not Great. Tokyo Tower is one of the most iconic building in Tokyo and obviously a must do ! However, when I went, the top floor was closed. The view from the medium level is quite nice, however the Tokyo SkyTree had a breath taking view if you decide to go all the way up !
Iconic!. It's not that great, but it's a landmark of the city. Do you remember that tower that Godzilla usually rips off in his films? It's her.

Amazing views of the city. This is a brilliant place to watch the city! It also has shops and dining places below it so yo u get the best of both worlds., Also some entertainment shops like the Wax Museum, also an aquarium and we visited them all. The food is great as always!

Not worth the hype. I visited Tokyo tower late one evening. It was clear, and the view around the city was nice. Going late in the evening meant not much crowd, but, perhaps because there were fewer bodies to soak up sound, the background music was loud and distracting. The fee was a little steep compared to other attractions, and I didn't feel like I gained much from the experience. Also, they played a horrifically cheesy computer-animated video of a city fly-over with fireworks in the background that was laughably terrible. Skip the line for the video- you're missing nothing.

Beautiful at night if you can stand the wait. My wife and I visited this location during our last evening in Tokyo and while the views were spectacular, they were somewhat marred by how crowded the tower was and how long the waits were to get from the ground to the first deck and then from the first deck to the "special observation" deck at the top. All told we probably spent as much time waiting in line as we did gazing out over the spectacular cityscape (around 45m to an hour, respectively). It's certainly worth checking out if you enjoy great views and a bit of history, just be prepared for a fair amount of waiting on line.
Hazy. Didn't see much.. It was hazy, and we couldn't see very far. I am sure the views would be great if it was clear weather.

Enjoyable tower, visit on a clear day, go to the very top observation deck.. Our first visit to Tokyo. 10 minute walk from subway station. My husband and I enjoyed it. We were there shortly after it opened on a Saturday in early March. We were not sure if we'd get opportunity for Sky tree tower(my top pic). We both enjoyed no crowds. When we were leaving(about 45 minutes after we arrived), the tour buses started rolling in. We went on our first morning in Tokyo. Provided a nice overview of area at birds eye view. Adjust your expectations accordingly.It was cool to see the tower at night from our hotel..all lit up.
A must if in Tokyo. Well anybody going to Tokyo must visit Tokyo Tower at least once. My kids loved the fact that Godzilla has destroyed Tokyo Tower as well. It is so bright that it can't be missed
Great view. No queue, reasonably priced, apparently much cheaper than Skytower. Seeing Mt Fuji a bonus. Fairly easy to get to, as are most things in Tokyo.

Just stay at the bottom!. The tower is a 10min walk from the metro but we found it to be a bit of a waste of time & way too expensive for what it is or rather what it isn't - the tallest building in Tokyo...It's nicely lit up, so I'd suggest maybe visiting and taking a few pics of it from the bottom, yet the views from the top are nothing special.

Save your money and time its not that good.. We paid to go up into the tower and walk around a crowded viewing deck and had the same view as from our hotel.
Might be exciting for kids but to me it was a let down.
Meh. It's very apparent that the Tokyo Tower once was a decent tourist attraction, however they seem to have given up after the Skytree opened.

Amazing Views - But Check the Weather Before You Visit. Had a chance to walk over to the tower while staying at the Royal Park Shiodome - the walk was about 1.6 miles. The Tower is definitely worth a visit if you're in the area - great panoramic views of Tokyo. The one bit of caution I would advise would be to check the weather before you go, there are two observation areas, the main area and the upper part of the tower. During intimate weather they will close off the top area (which is what I encountered - it was raining during my visit).Access is very easy - there's a ticket booth on the bottom floor (East side on the down-slope of the parking lot). There you can purchase a ticket for the main observatory (about $3 U.S.) - once you exit the ticket area you'll walk into a lobby on the bottom floor - attendants will point you towards an elevator for a brief ride up - inside the elevator the attendant will give you a brief history of the tower.The main observatory has a cafe and there was a live band playing while I was up there. The coolest feature of the tower are several sections where the floor is glass - so you can stand with your feet floating above the ground (see pic). If you want access to the second observatory, you buy a ticket and then walk up some stairs - although like I said, due to rain and lightning they closed access while I was there.When you take the elevator down you enter a very chaotic shopping area - very busy and packed with all kinds of trinkets. There are also several more places to eat. Felt a bit claustrophobic to me so I skipped out of there fairly quickly. Outside of the tower shopping area itself, the area around the tower seemed fairy business/industrial, there didn't appear much else to see in the immediate area.But overall, the 360 view of Tokyo is pretty amazing, so it's worth a visit.

Night time delight. An interesting attraction thats best enjoyed at night with colourful views of Tokyo. At the bottom of the tower outside is a fantastic ice cream shop thats to die for, you must try.

Japanese Eiffel Tower. The Japanese are said to be the Germans of Asia (and there is probably some truth to it) and accordingly the Eiffel Tower (which was built by a German engineer) can be compared to the Tokyo Tower. But Tokyo is a huge and modern city and most importantly: The Tokyo Tower is not the highest building there anymore.

Best to visit at night time. I visited Tokyo tower during daytime. The view look nice. It was too smokey so I couldn't see mt Fuji. I think it's best to visit Tokyo tower during the night. I will go so next time. On the way down, they will stop you on level 4 to let you do shopping.

Worth the Climb. We walked up hundreds of stairs -- and thankfully were greated with a Pizza/Italian Restaurant and a glass of wine. My husband balked at eating pizza in Japan, but that was a long climb! And the pizza of course had a Japanese spin. We saw the tower at night, which was very beautiful.
Nice view. I always wanted to go to the Tokyo Tower. The view was nice, we went at dusk so we saw all the lights appear. That was nice to see. But I would not go for a second time.
Great views of Tokyo. Panoramic views to all corners of Tokyo. Worth the visit for the view. Tacky shops....but fun. Went as part of a tour; strange place to start.
Great view. Great view of Tokio. Should go day and night. Tokyo changes at night. It becomes a city of lights! We went with a Tour but most people walk from their hotels.

Very good. I really liked this tower, offers some spectacular views of the city. It's certainly one of the better city towers I've been up. You have the option to go higher up the tower for a bit more money but to be honest the standard observatory is good enough to get very good photos :)

Nice views but not overwhelming. If you have the time and its a clear day this would be a good one hour side trip in the morning before it gets crowded. The fee is approx. $18 usd to all the way to the 250 meter level, you will need to climb stairs access the second elevator that takes you to the top.Its a small elevator so the line gets long quickly.The lower levels are filled with small vendors selling every variation of the Tokyo TowerThe view for sure is interesting, however its not wildly better then some of the views from the upper floors of some of the local hotel bars.
Great for day trip. If you are looking for a quick day trip to kill some time. This is something you could do in a couple minutes.

Elder Tower. It is located at center of Tokyo, and we can enjoy Tokyo view day and night time.And there are many souvenir shops, tipical Japan and Tokyo goods can be found.But it is a little bit far from JR train station( it takes about 15 - 20 min on foot).

Comparison Skytree,Tokyo Tower and Tokyo Government office.. Skytree is tallest,newest,most expensive to climb,a little bit far from Tokyo station, may be crowded .T.Tower is taller,oldest,reasonable,nearest to Tokyo station.T.G.office is lowest (but enough for nice landscape),not new but not old,free to climb,not far but not so close to Tokyo station.My recommend is T.G. office. It has two rooms, So It would not be so crowded. It is located most West than others to look Mt. FUJI closer. Anyway FREE!!

Nice place to visit for a special view of the City. The Tokyo Tower is an interesting site to visit, because the Engineering used in the construction and is a landmark in the city. It is also higher than the Eiffel Tower in Paris by 3 meters.

Beware of the stairs!!. It is a good experience to visit the Tokyo tower ıf you would like to have a view of Tokyo from 150 or 250mts above. The Tokyo tower puts no warning that there are stairs between the lifts serving the two floors and that the people with walking difficulties may find it difficult to negotiate the stairs.

Very good way to get a "different view" of Tokyo. An easy an very nice way to get a different view of Tokyo - seeing the "giants"-buildings at you eye level or even from the top, "all in one" and panoramic. Many advise to do it in the evening, when the city is lightened up. I did exactly that and liked it a lot. The height and the lights reveale the details which are revealed in no other way.

Expensive view worth the money. It cost more than 500yen per person to go up (apologies I forgot the exact amount but it could have been as much as 900yen), however for me the money was worth well spent. On the first observation deck one has a good view of the major districts of Tokyo including a distant faint Mount Fuji (which was hidden partially in clouds on our visit). There is a souvenir shop and a small cafe and if one wants to go higher one has to buy another ticket. We couldnt go up the Skytree so Tokyo Tower it was.

Worth taking a visit to this Tokyo landmark. We decided not to go up Tokyo Tower as we had already been up many of the much taller Asian towers. We stopped by to see it from below and it was very neat to see it situated in the middle of the city, in between the other buildings. It is a unique little red tower, made for some neat pictures!

Cool. Great views from both levels. Go at night when it's lit up and you can see the lights of the city all around you. They had a band playing on the lower level near the cafe. It was nice to listen to the music and have a drink while looking out of the city.

Wonderful View: A must Visit in Tokyo. This is an Iconic Landmark of Tokyo and a must visit if you are spending time in the city.When you go up to the observation deck you get a wonderful view of the city stretching all the way to the ocean. Myself and my buddy spent a lot of time there, on the observation deck taking pictures of the city, at the outdoor small arcade, and having a teriyaki hamburger at McDonald's in the Tower. There is also a lovely park at the base of the tower with several beautiful shrines I recommend you visiting for some relaxation if you have the time during your visit.

October 2008. Liked - great views, and like the CN Tower in Toronto, you can go to the main viewing floor or you can go higher up in the tower for an additional fee. Not good if you are afraid of heights! Glass elevator in the middle of the tower. Disliked - I'm so bummed we missed the Wax Museum that was there (Closed now). It was a crazy prog rock wax museum! Where else would you find this but Japan!!

Go for twilight. We went there in late afternoon on a clear day and saw all of Tokyo bathed in golden afternoon light. Beautiful. The sun started to set which was lovely, and then at night all the lights twinkled on which was nice as well. Unfortunately some people set up their massive tripods to get photos of the sunset which means that no one else can get near the observation window. Not necessarily a bad thing about the tower, just very rude of the people doing that as most places like this people take turns at taking photos. 1600 yen to get to the higher area, which is worth it at 250m tall. Worth a visit if you have a couple days in Tokyo, as you get unparalleled views, especially of the bay!
Well worth a visit if it's a sunny day.... Looks great with the sun on the tower, so really worth a trip to take some piccies if it's a nice sunny day :-)

Tired Attraction Still Attracts. Views not as high visually and monetarily than the much newer SkyTree are found at Tokyo Tower, the iconic (and once inside tacky) Eiffel Tower lookalike opened in 1958. Peaking at 1,033 feet, the Roppongi district attraction is actually 30 feet taller than its Parisian inspiration. Reaching the main viewing level costs just $10, but at the ho-hum height of 490 feet it's worth the additional $7.50 to ascend 330 more feet to the "special observation deck."

Forgotten Tower. It should be iconic but after Tokyo Sky Tree was build, somehow people more interested to go there. Need to walk a little bit from akanebashi station. I managed to visit it at night, the view is quite stunning. However above 10 PM, seems like many lovers hangout in the park.

Worth The Effort. We stopped here on our Hato Bus tour. The red and white painted tower is based on the Eiffel Tower. It can been seen from around Tokyo, and looks impressive at night. There are lots of tourist shops and places for a snack at the bottom. We went up to 2 different levels where there are expansive views for 360 degrees. Sadly it was a bit misty so we could not see My Fuji. There are some glass floor areas where you can look down if you wish. It was okay, and we were glad we did it.
Half day tour of Tokyo. Visited on a Saturday, when you can only go up to the observation deck. It was clear and the view was beautiful. Great guide from Sunrise
Chill out at the base of Tokyo Tower. Easily accesible via train lines. The food store nearby has great variety of Japanese snacks. Cheaper to buy there.

Lovely view of Tokyo. Beautiful views of Tokyo. We arrived just before sunset and had a view of both the daytime and nigh-time skyline. Cute bistro at the top observance platform and glass windows to look down. Nice visit.

A must! . I was skeptical at first visiting such a tourist hot spot but then we decided to visit at night which I advise as the lights are a great photo moment for anyone with a camera. We bought the tickets that allow you to reach all levels of observation which cost about $15AUS and worth it! It was funny that most of the tourists were actually Japanese. Can be a little cramped in the elevators but just look at the pretty lights. The staff are exceptional as well as the souvenir shops. I highly recommend the Japanese Rice Bowls at the food court, tasty and filling- get your money's worth. Overall I would go back again especially during the day as you might get an opportunity to see Mount Fuji from the distance. As aforementioned anyone with a camera or even phone with a camera should go, it's a hot spot for a reason.
Amazing view of Tokyo skyline. Try out the mid level view (150m) to have a splendid view of Tokyo's skyline - try out in the late evening, when it is all lit up

cute. I saw the tower at night and, although it was neat to see all lit up, I would recommend to visit during the day in order to try to catch a view of Mt. Fuji. There isn't much to do inside other than look at the city lights, so it is a pretty quick visit. If you go too late in the evening, you can't go up to the highest part so pay attention to the time you visit.

Great view of Tokyo from the very top. Try to time your visit so you get both the sunset across Tokyo and then all the city lights. We paid the extra amount to get right to the top and the view was great even Mt Fuji is easily seen in the distance. The tower is not as high as the Tokyo Sky Tree and is very similar to the Eiffel Tower in design. It is nicely lit up at night with it's red colour standing out. It's definitely worth a visit.

a great visit. did this as part of a full day tour of tokyo would reccomend if only for the view to the south of tokyo bay can be done independantly but we decided to let grey line do the legwork for us

Place to visit - Scenic 360 view from the top. Suggest to visit the top to observe amazing Tokyo with panoramic scenic views. You can see Mount Fuji, Yokohama Bay Bridge and even Tokyo Disney Land. Lately this location loose its attractiveness from the tourist after newly built Tokyo Skytree. But Tokyo Tower still offers an attractive history and one can enjoy the views without worrying of mass crowded. Recommend to visit the restaurant in third level and please try Soft ice cream from "Mother Farm"- one the best in town. Our kids finished 3 cups and even wanted more...

Best views of Tokyo. I think this is a must thing to do when in Tokyo. On a clear day, it gives you the grandest view of Tokyo and its surroundings. We where fortunate to see Mount Fuji .They have look out windows on the floor. It's cool to step on it.

Good view. This tower, near from a temple. You can see nice sceenic of Tokyo here. You can buy some souvenir inside the tower. My favorite souvenir is a little tokyo tower. Not too expensive and i think you must have it because it can be a sign you ever go there.
Great scenic views. A fun place to go, but much like any other city tower I've been to. Elevator ride to the top, wonderful views, but that's about it. Gift shop available, of course.

Breathtaking views. Went on the day following a typhoon, and the views were stunning. All the smog and dust blown away, Mount Fuji very clear in the distance. We couldn't go right to the top because of the high winds, but you get a very good panorama from the main deck. Not too crowded either.Lots of shops and restaurants in the basement.

Tokyo Tower. I have had the opportunity to visit the Tokyo Tower on a few occasions. It's something I look forward to each visit. I like to walk around the tower early in the morning before it opens to get some fun photos. Once the tower opens for the you can take a ride up to the observation deck and look out over the city of Tokyo. Fun to do during the day as well as at night. Once the city lights come on it takes on a very different look as you can imagine. After my ride to the top and came back down I enjoyed an ice cream at the base. All in all its one of those attractions you should make time to see.It's a fun destination to do alone, with friends and or family. Enjoy you visit.
A must visit place in Tokyo. Visited Tokyo tower near evening. The lighting of the tower was fantastic. There were also restaurants and souvenir stores at the tower.

Tokyo tower with junk buildings. the tower is 333 meter high but dont have big expectations , what you will see from the top is all big buildings of Tokyo i think the best view was to see fuji mountion with snow on it .but its very expensive to go up to the tower i think the price should go down becouse there isnt really good service system ,The japanese staf that works has 0 English even you ask some thing you will no be able to get any answers ,well hope they upgrade until olympic
Worth it on a clear day. It's a bit cheesy, but a great way to see the layout of Tokyo. On a clear day, you can see Mt. Fuji and across the bay. Well worth the standing in line and screaming children

About Tokyo tower. I went to Tokyo tower in this new year`s first day. It`s very beautiful. It was opened in 1958. The height is 333 meters. There are many people in Tokyo tower. Every day have 300 thousand people travel there. I went there at night. The night-view is very beautiful. In Main Observatory you can see all of the Tokyo`s night view. Also Tokyo tower has a great restaurant named Rabo-Curry. It`S very delicious, but a little expensive. It`s a great place to visit.

Super views. The more I visit Tokyo, the more I keep returning to Tokyo Tower. The views help me piece things together in a way that maps do not. If it's a clear day you'll see Fuji-san. You'll also have a wait of 1-2 hours to get from the regular floor to the highest level, unless you arrive early. The good news is that there is not a large crowd at the top, so there's no trouble getting the view you want.

The Best Part is Getting There. We enjoyed the walk from the subway to the tower in the evening, but the tower itself is nothing special - you could just as well go up any tall building and look out of a window.

Great views of the city. We did a Tokyo day tour and this was one of the stops. The weather was great so we got really good views of the city. I would recommend it, I'm not sure what the cost is since we paid for the day tour. You don't need to spend much time there so you could easily fit it in with a few other sights around the city.
City view. Main observatory of the city with its 360* panoramic observatory. It's 333 m height, special observatory is at 250 m, main observatory - at 150 m. Adult ticket is 900 yen.
Breath-taking experience. We went to the tallest part of the tower and witness a breath-taking view of Japan from above. Worth the money...
Beautiful Tower. Visited the tower along with the Zojoji temple, right next to each other. Lovely area, we even took the lift to the observatory. Nice view of the city.
Terrific view at dusk. Worth it. $7 ticket to the top. Worth it. Great view. Easy taxi ride from hotel okura. Worth trying during the day for great distance city view.

Birds eye view.. Well worth a ten minute wait to go up to 350 and/or 450 metres and have a look at Tokyo. Well organized staff and quite an eery feeling with the movement of the tower. A small adventure for children and excitable women!
Eyesore and not all that special. The Tokyo Tower to me is a knockoff of the Eiffel Tower and a complete eyesore. The new Skytower is beautiful. I hope they bring this down.

amazing at night!. spent new year's eve here for the countdown. Fully packed with a lot of tourists and locals but I'm amazed with the crowd control. No fireworks though, but the tower is beautiful at night. There's a fee if you want to go up the tower for the skyline view but I did not tried it. Didn't get the chance as there were may people at the time I visited. It is a bit of a walk from the train station but its worth it as you can take good shots of the tower from afar

Excellent view of Tokyo. Some people might think "If you've seen one tower, you've seen them all." This tower totally debunks that theory. When I went to this place, the weather was clear and sunny. I could see the clear ocean and the modern buildings all around me. It was a bit pricey but totally worth it for great pictures. I wish I could have seen this place in the evening. If I go back to Tokyo, I'll definitely do that.

Like Eiffel to Paris. Well this is Tokyo’s version of Eiffel tower but maybe a bit low on entertainment level. The view depends on the day and time you are visiting as a foggy day can ruin it for you but otherwise you get a good top view of the city from up here and the downstairs have restaurants and souvenir shops for attracting tourists but can be expensive and less on product

Tokyo View. The view is amazing. It was truly worth visiting. I wanted to stay a little more but due to our tight schedule, we spent over 30mins only.Tokyo's version of Eiffel Tower. You must see Tokyo tower!

Old is Gold!. Visited the veteran on Christmas eve. The special illumination and huge number of people, especially the couples, made it more interesting. I guess TT has not lost its charm even after the presence of younger Tokyo Skytree! The view in the evening was great. But did not find anything extra going up the special observatory. And it was annoying to buy two tickets separately which was a mere wastage of time!
Look like Eifel Tower. Beautiful walking distance from our Hotel, very well organized touristic spot... many other museum and temples are located on the nears by.

See the city. This was the first time we really saw the enormity of Tokyo and it blew us away! There are many attractions within the tower as well as the views, including an aquarium, a Beatles exhibition, an oddeties exhibition and an old toys exhibition. There are also lots of stalls and food outlets. We went up to the first station/floor which seemed very high! with glass floors in places that made our stomachs go! Great. (Visited in 2009)

Nice Tower, Terrible aquarium. First of all, if you want a great view over Tokyo, Tokyo Tower is the perfect place to go. The view is really stunning! If you are going on a clear day you might see Mount Fuji from up there!If you are afraid of heights, you should close your eyes in the Elevator, it has glass doors ;)Anyways, on the Bottom of Tower you can enter an aquarium. Don't go inside there! What they are doing there is animal cruelty! Some of the fish are too small to even move around in their tanks, and the animals overall look like they are not been taken good care after. I normally love to go to aquariums, but this one is just a nightmare!
Beautiful. Little like the Eiffel Tower however you get to see some great views of Tokyo. Try and go on a clear day as you can see much more and the night view is also better if like taking pictures.

Beautiful Views. Great views of Tokyo, showing the vastness of the city and how busy it is. Visibility was a little hampered due to some misty conditions or was it smog. \where we were staying was a relativel quiet area not so many car as it was a business district and many people were on bicycles. \so we didn't seem to experience any smog.

A must see view of the city including Mount fuji.. Go at twilight so you can see the transition form day to night. You have views of the entire city including mount fuji. They have shopping, restaurants on the lower floors. It is the equivalent of the Eiffel Tower or Empire State building in NYC.

Nice view and friendly staff. This is a bit expensive for the top view but nice. The bottom of the tower have some fast food restaurant and not really worth it tourist souvenir shops. Right next to the Tower, there is a nice Temple.

Decent Views. A tourist trap. Evident from the moment you enter the tower building. Souvenirs and kitsch devoted to the tower. The views were decent enough, especially at night. However, be prepare to pay for the expensive admission fees.
Amazing Views. Great views of Tokyo. We were lucky as we had a tour guide explain a lot of the places to us. Worth a visit. You will not need long up here.

Amazing Views. We chose the observation deck for our New Years Eve destination. I loved the night view from the tower, I have on another visit gone during the day and was lucky enough to see Mt Fuji in the distance. When you are looking about it gives you an idea of how massive Tokyo is.Its not the tallest observation any more but for 900 yen I recommend going.

Cool to do - there is a price though. It's expensive abut its kinda cool to do, there are other views in the city which are better but this has the history to it.We found coming back down by the stairs (outside) was pretty cool compared to the lift.Luckily the day we were there there was a cultural festival in the car park with excellent food stands and traditional music
Lots of shops inside. A great place to spend a few hours. We bought several things from the shops to bring back home that were reasonably priced! Lots of restaurants that we did not try.

Nostalgia. My 11 year old loved the Tokyo Tower experience. Yes, it's pricey and you may have to wait, but that's Tokyo. The views are amazing, and there's a little cafe to have a break if you like. I used to live in Japan and the Tokyo Tower always had a nostalgic, romantic air (perhaps I watched too many tv dramas at the time), so I would never have been able to do the Skytree. The temple nearby is a great visit as well.

Not Paris, but Pretty Close. The tower was a great experience and we all enjoyed it...well, my nephew was not crazy about the height or the slight sway, but it is a great view! I wish it was easier to get pictures through the glass though...

Overpriced. Nice view! Make sure you go on a clear, sunny day. I made the mistake of going when it was cloudy outside. I thought this attraction was expensive to ride an elevator and look out the windows. I do appreciate the architecture and the time and effort it took to build this, but I thought this tourist attraction was average. I did feel a little motion sick after riding the elevators.

OUI OUI...wait I'm In Japan!. Tokyo tower is surprisingly terrific. I love the bright orange color and it is right in the middle of so much that when you take the ride to the top you can see it all on a clear day. There is an aquarium, museum, lots of gift shops and restaurants. You could easily spend a few hours here.

Lines too long to fet down. Yes its a beautiful view from high up. BUT tou must wait in a line to get to the very top 250m. And when you do get right back in line foe the elevator to go down as that is another LONG wait. So divide and conquer if you can. My wofe got right into line while I checked out the view. Then we switched. Not very relaxing or fun. I would pass on the 250m and just stay at 150m.
Go, If you have time. Its worth a visit, especially at night to see the glittering Tokyo skyline. The normal ticket allows only the observation deck - it seemed a bit too costly for just one deck.

Was probably nice once. This place reminds me of my local shopping centre or a flea-bitten travelling circus, and that isn't a compliment. It's both cheap and run down.The trip to the top is longer than it should be and more expensive than it should be. The view can be nice depending on the weather and time.The thing I likes best were the artists drawing portraits.

Nice place to visit. The Tokyo Tower is a very interesting place to be. There are street performers at the base of the tower. The monkey performs extra ordinary feat! At the top Level 1, you can see the bird eye view of Tokyo and Mount Fuji is seen at a spot (NICE...!). If you are tired you can have a sip at the cafe. A lot of interesting snacks are available at the snack shops below.

Well worth a visit. It took us a while to find the tower with Tokyo being such a huge city and a few misleading maps but was well worth it once we got there. Great views over Tokyo made even more lovely by all the Christmas lights. Highly recommended for everybody.

Tokyo Tower Visit Nov 2013. Lucky to visit Tokyo Tower during November last year where Christmas decoration had already been put up. There are photo booth when I went there so you can take a picture with the staff or yourself when you are in Tokyo Tower. Too bad the view from 250m was closed, therefore could only visit the tower at 150m high. Recommended to visit there alone or with your partner.
Everything thing is Tokyo. It's well lit happy view with kind and helpful staff bit like Eiffel Tower that let's it d bit of a shame will vist again highly recommend o w n get it!?

A tourist staple but not the best observation deck.. We visited Tokyo Tower on a city orientation tour. The tour group stopped there for around 30-40 minutes if that and that was enough for us. We only went half way up, though there is a higher observation deck because that was what the tour company had purchased. The tower was quite crowded inside when we were there (around 9am). The view is good but not as good as the view from Tokyo City View in Roppongi, we visited there later and I would definitely recommend there as an observation deck over Tokyo Tower. The tower is a staple tourist attraction and good to see up close if you have time, but if you're looking for picturesque views of the city then Tokyo City View is better - probably also because Tokyo Tower is a part of the cityscape when viewing from Roppongi.
Awesome. Great views. Love the Floor window where you can look down! Sky tree is good but further away from all the high rise buildings. This is much more central

The Eiffel Tower of Tokyo (& Nearby Temple Zoji-ji). Tokyo Tower is one of the true tourist staples of Tokyo. While only half the size of the Tokyo SkyTree, if you are in the area, it is well worth the price (~ $20 USD) to go up to the Special Observatory [at the very top]. From there, you are well above most structures of Tokyo and can truly take in and appreciate the amazing city. On a clear day, you can easily see Mount Fuji - even though the volcano is 97 km away, it is an impressive backdrop to the city. I would recommend going up shortly before sunset, as you can then enjoy the city by day and night.The central section of the tower includes a cafe, and is worth stopping for a coffee or snack. Near the bottom of the tower is an entire shopping level and you can find some great gifts and keepsakes of Japan that are very reasonably priced.If you have time, near the base of the tower is the impressive Buddhist temple and temple grounds of Zoji-ji. I would recommend going here before Tokyo Tower, as you can best appreciate this area during the day, and can snap some great photos of the tower as well. If you time it right, you can even watch one of the Buddhist ceremonies, complete with chanting, singing, and incense burning.

Ok but not as good as expected. We visited this attraction in Oct 2013 and unfortunately were running short of cash and could not use credit card to pay and there were no ATM's on site or nearby that were working. This impacted on our ability to acquire food and souvenirs during our visit (with 4 children between 10 & 15).The views were interesting and the Tower's history good to know and was/is a compelling attraction to visit but the related facilities could do with improvement.

Awesome views and fantastic around Christmas time. Talk about adding the new with the old - beautiful, interesting shops and food. A must see if near Tokyo - views awesome during night or day. Just do not go during bad weather - views will be bad.

Glittering Tokyo. you cannot miss the walk and the view of the tower especially during the cherry blossom. We took a train to the nearest station and walked upto the tower. Passing by the mesmerizing view of the cherry blossom in the night. The view of the tower from outside has to be one of the most beautiful things i saw amongst so many places that i travelled. The tower has a museum as well. There is a fee that you need to pay to go upto the tower, there are two stops within the tower, you need to pay extra again to see the top view. But i would suggest the first stop view is as good as the top. The outer design looks so much like Eiffel tower. Its a good attraction to see the city at night especially, its very beautiful and see a city lit up

Great Views. This was a 5 minute walk from where we stayed, so we had to see it. The tower provided great views and was decorated very cute around Christmas time. There was also a live band playing when we visited - which was neat. You can find a spot to sit and get a beer for about 500Y which is pretty reasonable and relax with the view. Only thing I can say is if you are only going to do this OR the sky tree - the sky tree is 100% more worth your time.
Fun holiday night trip. Near Christmas, the lights and festive spirit were fun when we went to the Tower. I do not think it is worth the extra money to go to the top most level though

Good view of the city. I visited this attraction during a recent trip to Tokyo. This was our first stop as part of a day long tour of Tokyo. I would suggest taking a 1/2 day or full day tour, in which case all the entrance fees and transport are covered as part of the package.The telecommunication tower also doubles as a vantage point to see the city. The lower floors close to ground level have some restaurants, souvenir shops and toilets. To get to the top viewing level one has to take an elevator from the ground level and it is a well organised attraction. There are guides that direct visitors into the elevators and get you the viewing deck. One can get a 360 degree view of Tokyo and in our case as we had a tour guide he explained the buildings we saw in each direction including some which we would visit later that day as part of our tour like the Imperial Palace. As long as it is a clear day one can see quite far into the horizon. Plenty of photo taking opportunities including a glass bottom floor at some parts. Worth a visit if its your first visit to Tokyo.

Tokyo's Iconic Tower. I've been here twice. The first time it was early evening around 6 pm and the place was so crowded. The line was very long and it took 30-40 minutes to get our turn to the elevator. On top of that they crammed us tight to get more people in. The second time was last week, we arrived there at around 3 pm and this time there was no crowd. We didn't wait, the top of the observatory deck wasn't crowded too.I definitely recommend to come early and stay until close to sunset. On a clear day you get to see Mt. Fuji from afar. Tokyo was pretty to look at too during sunset.
Gliterring at dusk. Located at Akabanebashi station; These old red color TV/radio broadcasting tower still charming and shining at night!!

A cool view. Buy your tickets for both the towers. It is amazing that the view does change when you go up to the upper viewing deck. Lower deck you can barely see some of the trees near the imperial palace...once you go up you get a better vantage point. On a clear day, one can see Fuji-san. I sadly only was able to get a glimpse of an outline of sorts. My only regret, not having done this in the evening too as I suspect that the city light show would have been so beautiful. So perhaps someone should consider doing the Tokyo Sky Tree too....one during the day and one in the evening.

Sunset view at its best. I recommend you to visit on weekdays and around 4pm. You should stay a bit longer until the sun sets because the changing view was beautiful. I just kneeled down and watched the Tokyo night skyline just to enjoy the moment. I also bought the special observation deck ticket which was a bit pricey. I didn't regret it though because I thought I wouldn't be back in Tokyo for a long time so I had to use this chance. I think the main observation deck is not bad either, just more crowded that's why I suggest to visit during weekdays.

Inconic. Great to go to the top. Nice neighborhood. Not so expensive option to see Tokyo from the sky. Try to go so you can see the sunset and both views of the city. Highly recommended, a must in Tokyo.

Eiffel twin Tower in Tokyo... When I visited Japan one of list to visit is Tokyo Tower...I heard it's look like Eiffel Tower...as inform Tokyo Tower has 333 meters, 13 meters taller thth its model Eiffel Tower of Paris (it's twin he...he..). ..from the entrance a lot of shop stores in there, sell the traditional souvenir of Japan put in Tokyo Tower symbol, such as : key chains, plates, pens, t shirts, necklaces and so on...nice gifts for friend and family.....

Eiffel Tower in Tokyo. Went to see the tower in 2007It's not as big as Eiffel and I was curious to see what it's likeStill worth the trip to check Tokyo sight by day or night You even have a Macdonald inside .

Impressive and interesting. A very good place to visit, especially when Tokyo have a good weather. You can see Mt Fuji from here. Staff here very welcome and helpful and sure you won't loose your way. On the way back from the top of the tower choices of shops waiting for you.

Beautiful Views. I highly recommend going to this or the other lookout tower. What amazing views. We went during the evening and it was spectacular. What's interesting is that we visited Tokyo between trips to Shanghai and Beijing--you couldn't see hardly anything in those cities because the air is so polluted. In Tokyo is crystal clear. During the day I don't think the Tokyo Tower is that pretty. It's orange and white, which makes it appear very industrial in my opinion. However, all lit up at night, it's gorgeous. Enjoy!

Good view but.... I think the best is to have a night picnic in shiba park and see the lights on the tower. You get a great view of the tower and avoid the crowds. They light the tower up with different colors for different holidays or events throughout the year

Great view. Go on a Sunday or a public holiday and you just might be lucky enough to get a glimpse of Mt. Fuji but the disadvantage is its crowded on those days! Now with the skytree, competing for tourists it is less crowded than when it held a monopoly. Night view is great on anyday!

Beautiful Tokyo Tower. Which one is mire impressive, Eiffel or Tokyo Tower? It lies in the eyes of the observer. I like them both a lot. Like in Paris, Tokyo Tower is illuminated in different colours at night. We could see it every night from our hotel room at the Grand Hyatt Roppongi. Worth staying there.

Beautiful view of the city. We started our exploration of Tokyo with a trip up the Tokyo Tower, and were not disappointed. A spectacular view of this amazing city, with the majestic Mt. Fuji visible on the horizon. A must see for any first time visitor to this historic city. Make sure you check out the lower level of the bottom viewing floor for a really cool look through the glass floor.

See Tokyo above. For 900 Yen you can already go up on the 1st observatory of this popular tower at 150 m. The view of Tokyo from above was amazing, and make sure to consider the weather when planning your trip here. Several snack and coffee shop is available in the first deck which has 2 levels. You can go to the special observatory at 250 m for additional 700 yen. Also souvenir shops available at 3rd floor of the foot town.

really enjoyed the view. If you are there and have only a couple days, hit the Tokyo tower early on so you can get your bearings easily and help plan your day trips through out the city. Clean and organized but a little too much merchandise and gift shops. On a clear day you can see Mt. Fuji as well. The entire tour can be as fast as 30 minutes if you are in a hurry as I was, or you can make it 2 hours if you poke around there. Check it out - it's easy to get to using the subway or taxis.Travel Safe!

Eiffel ala Japan. This is actually an old trip in October 2000 when I was sent to Utsunomiya for 2.5 months as Interpretor/Translator. One of the weekend, we went to Tokyo to give the trainees break and knowledge about some bits of Japan. Of course Tokyo was the one. We went with bus for about 3-4 hours (more and less) from Utsunomiya. Visited Tokyo Tower, Akihabara, Asakusa and one of famous temple (I forgot the name). My mind was wondering that Eiffel would more and less shape like this. We can see Tokyo from high view. Well when you touched down Tokyo of course one of the landmark is Tokyo Tower and it was nice to be there.

Good. Visited the Tokyo tower in October 2014, best time is early at 9.00am, can become very crowded & has a long queue. But the view from top is good. But unfortunately its overshadowed by the Tokyo one tower. But still worth it.

It is a must to see!!. A must see place while you are staying in Tokyo. No doubt that I choose to visited it while arguing to go to Harajuku or to go to Tokyo Tower on our last night in Tokyo. Well, it was worth it of course to visit. The scenery was beautiful (FYI, you can't climb up to the top if you come at around 10 PM, they were already closed).Tokyo Tower was easy to reach. Just take out a map that you found out (make sure to take the map which is wrote in english if you didn't understand Japanese language) on the train stations and if you still didn't get where is the right directions to go, don't hesitate to ask to the staff or people around you because they were warm, kind and friendly to show you the right directions.

Charming tower. A charming tower with views across the city. What makes this unusual is it is not that notably tall but it still offers a great view across the city... it isn't as impressive as Skytree but we wanted to view in the day time and this worked perfectly for us.The market at the base was a real asset with performances and food and drink, a tourist trap I'm sure but enjoyable...In contrast give the cafe a miss.

Beautiful and breathtaking. went there to visit the tower at night. it was magnificent and grand. Looks much better than in pictures. If u ask me to choose between this and Skytree tower, i will definitely choose this. Skitter tower looks ugly. Tokyo Tower, though is not as tall, and it doesn't have as much shops, the tower itself is indeed grand and worth my trip.

Great View from the tower. Nice experience. I went there during sunset, so I got the best of both worlds. The view was great and the city was lit up for the night by the time I got down. I was staying very lose to the tower so I walked from my hotel. All I had to do was walk towards the tower. We can get down in any bus stop or subway in Shibakoen and walk to the tower. Taxi from Tokyo station will cost around 2000 yen, From Ginza it is 1000 JPY.

beautiful and fun!. We went at the end of November so in the observation desk they had beautiful fairy lights!! The view was amazing and even better on the second floor they had a 'souvenir town' with heaps of cool stalls with reasonable prices

Average. Inevitably this will be compared with the SkyTree and it loses quite easily.It's quite expensive (you have to pay extra to go up to the extra lookout (250m) which is still considerably less than the Sky Tree and it's quite small and pokey up there.There's a cafe there that only sells very basic food (cake and simple rolls) so that wreaked my plans of having lunch up there.The glass floor is a novelty, but having just been up Sky Tree two days ago, the 150m drop below isn't huge.If you've got spare time and are in the area then it's worth looking at (even if you don't go up it) but otherwise I'd prioritise elsewhere, especially Sky Tree.
Go all the way up. Tourist trap but one I still go back to. The view from the very top is worth the kitschy shops down below.
Tourist trap but nice views. Way too expensive for the experience. Cheesy souvenirs and meh food court. Nice views of the city. Skip the aquarium in the basement. It's like going to a pet store.

A must. A fantastic venue at night. You can see it from far away, as you walk towards it.It's not as high as the Skytree or other towers from other cities, but it's a lovely place to visit.The queues were very short, as it was near closing time.The weather was clear, so we could see perfectly in every direction.Worth visiting.

Tokyo landmark. Tokyo Tower is the landmark of Tokyo, so must visit. As usual, I will visit at the late afternoon, stay till night fall, to catch both the day and night scene of the Tokyo Tower and surroundings.

A great landmark to visit. I had the opportunity to visit the Tokyo Tower on a November evening. The Tower was relatively easy to get to (as most things seem to be using the transit systme in Tokyo), and was a fantastic venue at night.Tokyo Tower has two observation decks; one in the middle of the tower, and one towards the top. There is a separate fee for each observation deck; I purchased admission to both decks, but, with my inherent fear of heights, I never made it up to the second deck. The staff graciously offered to refund my admission to the higher deck, but I declined, since it wasn't their fault that I "chickened out". The views even from the lower deck were fantastic. I was fortunate enough to be there on a clear night, and had fantastic views of hte city. The middle observation deck has two levels. One of the levels has a cafe, which I proceeded to oder a drink and dessert, while looking outside over the city...and listening to a fantastic acoustic band that was playing there! There is a small gift shop on the observation deck, but a much larger souveneir shopping area and dining area on the second floor as you exit the tower.All in all, it was a good stop, and definitely not a bad place to check out.

Love this place. Really awesome place especially at night! Great games, crepes, sights and sounds! This was the first place I ever visited once I arrived in Yokohama and had been a favorite place off mine ever since then. The Ferris wheel is pretty awesome as well especially at night but a day tine work has its advantages as well.
perfect landscape. tokyo tower shine all kinds of color at night, accompany with the night view should be the must go place in Tokyo.

Underwhelming on an overcast day. Unless the day is particularly clear for viewing from high up this attraction is likely to be a disappointment. It may even be more interesting from a distance than close up.To provide some perspective, we've been up the Tour Montparnasse, the tower in the center of Indianapolis, The Empire State building, the Sears Tower etc. and this is just another tower with a 360 degree cityscape view - if you can actually see it. I don't regret going but as a photo opportunity on the day we went it was quite a letdown.

Great view and special, especially at night.. A quick visit. Quite a beautiful view at the top but there are many other view points that are much better. This place is special and iconic so it should not be missed!

Such a great night view. We went up around 1 hour before they closed, the queues were quite short, I think we had to wait a total of 10mins for the second elevator. The views were spectacular at night. Its not as high as the sky tree, but its still a must.
Great views. A Tokyo 'must' to see the city from above. Fab views as long as it's not misty! There are a few shops and cafes up there and it's quite touristy, but worth a visit.

Staff at Tokyo Tower make it Handicap Friendly😊. Touring Tokyo with a broken leg is not easy. Upon arrival at Tokyo Tower on my crutches, I was immediately approached by staff and offered a wheelchair. I was then immediately taken to the front of the que with only a short wait to go up to first level. Not sure about accessibility to top level. Didn't try as it started to get very busy (long weekend and going into evening, tower seems to be busier at night). Would like to extend a big thank you to all the staff for their kind and friendly assistance.

Worth to visit once. It is great to see the surroundings and Tokyo from higher elevation. Depends on the time, wait to take elevators could be long. I was lucky at the time of the visit, there was no line. The top has basic food, drinks, ice-cream. Need to pay extra to reach to second stage. It is touristy, clean. Worth to see at least once.

Real view. It's a great opportunity to get on the Tokyo tower! The fee isn't that much and it worth to spend it because from the top you can enjoy the greatest view in Tokyo. If you have a good camera then you are on the right spot!

feel like viewing form sky.. Good place to visit when you are in Tokyo. Night view with lights form the tower is preferred. You can also take photographs form different views. It would be batter if you have high performance camera.

A view similair to metropolitan building but have to pay. Costs a little to get to the top but has a good view. Interesting shops underneath it. Can go up down and have a look around in an hour and a half. Good temple right near it

Incredible view from above. Get a clear sky view from the top of Tokyo. Be sure to give yourself time to explore the different floors and have a seat at the café, relax, then go back out and watch. It is fun to see if you can make out what is going happening on the huge plasma screens down on the ground. The elevator ride is a thrill.
Not that impressive and expensive. If it is free then it is worth to see. The tower is not that tall, basically you will get the same view if you get to other high rise building.

Bit over rated for us. This is a tower also used as a radio antenna , they say it's resembles the Eiffel Tower !!!!! not sure about that .Well, you can be shot up goodness knows how many floors in seconds and be greeted by the most delightful bowing Jananese girls .If I am very honest , the view which was " interesting " could have been any big city in the world , we only went there from an organised ship cruise tour , but for that I would not have gone , sort of interesting !! would I make the effort a second time , no !!

Rather go to the free buildings Not great for night photos. I basically went there at night to get some photos of the skyscrapers, unfortunately they have so many lights inside most of them commercial stands with ridiculous blue lights that gives a huge glass reflection. So you need to go to little corners behind the columns which in my case were unfortunately busy with photographers and their huge cameras for about 30 minutes... in such a little space I couldn't stay longer. End up getting some great photos from the Metropolitan Gov Building

２番目の高さになったが、楽しめる　Well attractive though not No.1 in height. 久しぶりに訪問、高さで２番目になったから落ち込んでいるかと思ったらなかなかどうして。色々工夫がされていて、十分楽しめた。The height of this tower step down to No.2 in Japan after completion of Sky Tree but it still well kept its charm. Something new attractions were added/

Tokyo Tower. Its a steely beautiful communications/observation tower in the heart of Tokyo, took my foreigner friends and loved ones to see this majestic building. Of course now there is the rival Tokyo Sky Tree but this Tokyo Tower have all the necessary historical trivia combined with nostalgic feelings in and around its base. Great to visit it at night for the added romantic feeling while sizing up Tokyo and its environs, the never ending nightlights all around the city. There are 4 silent elevator with 32 person capacity, it is repainted every 5 years with its trademark orange color, entrance fee of JPY1600 (about 13USD) for adults (main & special observatory) of course group admissions will have discounts.
Felt like Paris. If you're in Tokyo this tower is worth a visit. Not only it gives a feel of Paris when lit but you can see the entire Tokyo, another alternative is the Sky Tree. Also very beautiful.

Where's all tacky shops gone ?. Good old Tokyo Tower, I love their tacky/fab gift shops ! I'm not sure if there's Frank Zappa figure in its Wax museum, but there is, I think that is the only one place on the earth you can see Zappa's wax figure !

Excellent view,. The view from the top is great, and the "look down" windows provide and unique view and experience. I enjoyed my time there since there wasn't much waiting time for the elevators,The tower has a restaurant bar where you can kill some time or recharge energy or fight the jet lag from the trip
Paris in Tokyo. Tokyo tower is a little copy of Eiffel tower. View to Tokyo is the best, and you should visit it during night time so that you can see the true size of Tokyo

Iconic and stunning at night. It was easy to get here from Hamamatsucho station as the height was prominent and easy to be seen from a far. You don't need to go up there to embrace the view of the city, just the view from the city to the tower was enough. I love the fact that the tower is lit at night so it was bathed in golden lights and as beautiful as la Tour Eiffel. The most iconic landmark in Tokyo from time to time.
It is a symbol of Tokyo!. It is a symbol of Tokyo!If anyone comes to Tokyo, They climb all this tower.his tower reaches the 60th anniversary soon.
Top of Tokyo. I think it is nice to see Tokyo from high above although there are other alternatives like Roppongi Hills and Skytree now.
awe inspiring, yet humble structure, a must see. old, yet still out of the class of ordinary buildings. tall tower with less hussle and crowds around.
Sundown view of Mt. Fuji. This was a wonderful way to see the city and when you go at sunset on a clear day you can see famous Mt. Fuji!

Gorgeous views of the city!. It might look like a garish Eiffel Tower rip-off but it's so so so so pretty and provides a gorgeous view of the city. Be sure to be there earlier to make it in time for the special deck (at 250m) that closes at 9pm. More thorough review with pictures here on my blog http://floraisabelle.com/tokyo-tower/

In my opinion.. a single visit is enough!. Not much of a wait to buy your tickets and board the elevator. Getting to level 1 (main observatory) was 900yen, level 2 (special observatory) was 700yen. Found nothing "special" about level 2 though. Was fun standing over the clear glass floor section (i believe it was on level1). Felt this whole Tokyo tower experience was more impressive looking up from below than actually inside it. The lights are beautiful indeed at night.

On a sunny day, the Tokyo Tower gives a great view of Mt. Fuji. This attraction is a ten-minute walk from the subway station. It is worth the price to go to the very top. Mount Fuji was visible in the distance. Lots of souvenir shops. I had a very pleasant day. After, I walked for about 20 minutes to Hibiya Park, a lovely large green space in the centre of concrete! From there, I walked about another 15 minutes to the Imperial Palace. Beyond the far limits of the Imperial Palace grounds, I crossed the boulevard and found a subway station with trains to take me back to the Marunouchi Line. Lovely day!
Nice views. this is worth the few yen it costs to get in - especially on a clear day. There are two levels: the top is overrated in my opinion: stick to the first level.

Beautiful views of Tokyo.. We enjoyed checking out the beautiful views of Tokyo. I especially liked the glass cutouts in the floor where you could see through to the bottom. The food court in the bottom of the tower had a good variety. I wouldn't say it's a "must see" but we enjoyed it.

Skytree is nicer. But is is not bad at all, but there another one more exciting. If you like to climb towers, Tokyo Skytree its higher and more modern. Besides you can also visit the beautiful aquarium at the ground floor.

Beautiful View. We visited on a Friday. We walked from Hamamatsucho station (JR Yamanote green line). It took us about 20 minutes to walk there. Along the way we stopped briefly at Shiba Park and Zojoji Temple. Entrance fee to the main observatory was 900 yen. The Special Observatory is closed during the weekday. Nonetheless, views are still spectacular from the 360 degree main observatory. They also offer multiple gift shops and souvenir shops. There is a very organized system to ride up the elevator; the elevator attendant is sharing background but only in Japanese language. They do have a brochure written in English to read.

Great views, long lines. The Tokyo Skytree tower is amazing! The first elevator stop is at 350 meters. From there you can go on another one to 450 meters above Tokyo. It was a fun way to start out our sightseeing in Tokyo, but we chose the wrong day to go there. It was a national holiday (the first day of Fall) so every local family was in line with us!!!
Very nice view of Tokyo Buildings.. Once you go up you could see the view of tokyo. Souvenir items are pricey though. Make sure you bring ¥ with you. Bring camera
Not a big deal. I think that locals are proud of this, but it's not a huge deal. Go if it's part of a tour but it's not incredibly amazing solo.

Nice but not the best. If you want to enjoy a good view from the entire city of Tokyo this is a good place. Maybe it's not as bigger as Tokyo Sky three but It's good enough to see some far places like Odaiba.For the price i think It's good enough. during the summer you have to wait some minutes but not so much to go up by the elevator. The second level, definitely is better than the first level. There is also a shop there where you can buy some expensive souvenirs.It's a nice and cheap place to see the sunset. And it's also a symbol of Tokyo city
Excellent views even in a cloudy day !!. Great ! Even in a cloudy day we did manage to have great iews of Tokyo all around the viewing platform . Efficient service as it is the norm in Japan
Great views . Great views over the city from 150 meters. Some glass windows on the floor brings a unique feeling. Lots of people, but all organized extremely well.

Modern Tokyo Icon. Not so impressive but worth for visiting it . Couple restaurant and souvenir shops are there , have to pay to going up which i don't recommend it , there is beautiful temple just close to Tokyo tower .

A must see. Tokyo Tower is the second highest observation tower in Tokyo with 333 meters. It is inspired by The Eiffel Tower but it is orange. Upstairs you have a very nice view from Tokyo and to go up there you take a elevador with glass windows. A little bit scary but total worthy it.

consider visiting. If you do not have any idea of the place to visit in tokyo, or, fail to get the ticket to sky-tree, why don't you start from Tokyo tower. The location is about 15 minutes walk from the JR Hamamatsucho-station, which is also the terminal of tokyo monorail, providing the ride between the Haneda airport. While on your way, you can also pass the one of the famous Zohjoji temple. If you get tired in walking, you can also take a rest at shiba-park.The height of the tower is not as high as sky-tree, but most importantly, you can enjoy the most of the view of Tokyo (the Imperial palace, shinjyuku, and so on): visting during the night-time is highly recommended.

Has to be done. For 900 yen you have to go up the Tokyo Tower. Not as high as the Sky Tree, but well worth a trip. I would not bother with extra yen to go up a level. Also visit at night for a super view of Tokyo skyscape
Great Views. Wait till dark, to get the best view its nice to walk through the temple area befor eggoing up the tower
Well worth a visit. Not hard to find or get to, whether you take a tour or not. Great views, safe and enjoyable.We took lots of photos and you should make this a definite place for your shortlist
You realise how big Tokyo really is. the view was astounding and for the price worth the trip to the top. I would suggest the night time on a clear night

Mini Eiffel Tower. A great place to visit in the evening!! It is open until 10 in the evening. It is all lit up and has an observation floor you can visit for a fee. Once on the observation floor you have a 360 view of Tokyo - just beautiful!!

Lovely Views at Night. Earlier in the day we spent over 1.5 hours inline to get tickets for the Skytree, so to be able to walk up and instantly get tickets to the Tokyo Tower was a relief. We went in the evening and there were no lines and the observation deck was not very crowded either. Go in the evening for a different prospective of Tokyo... Loved it!
still a good place to visit. Great views from the view deck... pretty at night, very accessible, not to be missed...not as crowded in the early evenings...

Symbol of Tokyo. Sky Tree and the Metropolitan Government Building both offer similar views, but neither is as iconic as the Tokyo Tower. We went on a Saturday night, so the observation deck was quite packed. There are actually two levels: Main and Special Observatory. However, you can't go to the Special Observatory (higher level, additional cost) directly without visiting the Main Observatory first. The line for it was really long when we went, so we opted not to go. The view was spectacular! It offers a 360 panoramic of the entire Tokyo cityscape. Oddly, the buildings were not as tall and expansive as I thought it would be but this is probably due to the fact that land use and resource allocation in Tokyo is just so efficient! If you are going at night, don't bother taking long exposures shots since the reflection from the glass and indoor lighting kind of ruins that. Nonetheless, I would highly recommend visiting at least once no matter how touristy it may seem.

Paris of Asia. This has been the symbolic infrastructure of Japan for the past years up to now. Truly that it has aged beautifully through the centuries and has continually amaze every tourist that visits it, even me included. You only have to see it for yourself and feel in love as you stare at it.
Don't go on a weekend. Beautiful to look at from the bottom. Didn't get to go up to the top because the line was crazy long.
Nice View of Tokyo.. This view spot is really nice, but I preferred a couple of others like Mori Tower and Sky Tree. But the Red and White color of the tower was nice and it was PINK light!!!

The Symbol of Tokyo. Although the highest tower in Tokyo is now the Sky tree tower, but the Tokyo Tower still symbolizes Tokyo as Eifel Tower to Paris. Its white and Orange paint can be seen even far away. It houses communication tower, 4 story building and a 2 floor observation floor. The elevators leading to the top floor is slow as compared to more modern elevator, but it is reliable. The observation floor is nice and we even had our photo taken with haloween theme. All in all, a very memorable trip like many tower around the world. By the way, they have a clear floor so you can take picture that shows all the way down like CN tower. Fee to this observation deck is 900yen to lower floor vs 2100 yen for sky tree tower.

Good if you enjoy tall buildings. If you enjoy going up tall buildings, then Tokyo Tower is a good place to visit. Pay extra (at the ticket booth at the bottom) and go all the way to the top; best part is to look down through the "holes" in the floor to get a real perspective of how far up you are. The views are awesome, but that's all there is to do. I found it cooler to see Tokyo Tower from a distance, all lit up. Go once and spend a half-hour or so seeing the view.

Go on a clear day. Don't bother on a cloudy day.Sure it's nothing but a tourist trap, and there's really not a lot of Tokyo skyline to look at, but still, it's one of the things to do in Tokyo. And for us, it was the only view of Mt. Fuji we got.Tip - the lower level is actually 2 levels with the lower one being significantly less crowded. Grab a cup of coffee there and take your time.

Good views, especially of Rainbow Bridge. The views were very nice, especially of the Rainbow bridge. The wait was not long on a Sunday. The main drawback is that you first pay to go to the Observation Deck at 150m, then if you want to go to the "Special Observation Deck" at 250m, you have to stand in another line and pay for another ticket. I don't see why they can't just let you buy both on the ground level.

Nice view of the city. I got to the Tokyo Tower as part of a half-day tour, on a free day during a business trip to Tokyo. it provides quite a nice panoramic view of the city, and an old Japanese lady from Osaka that joined the tour to improve her English told me that when she was a kid they used to have field trips to the place.It's quite a nice stop, and provides a good angle on the extent of Tokyo and its main attractions.

A significant Tokyo landmark, most beautiful by night in my opinion.. I saw the "Tokyo Tower" both by day and by night whilst staying in the Minato area of Tokyo and in my opinion it is impressive by day but most beautiful by night when illuminated. I did not bother going up the tower as during the day when I visited the weather was wet and cloudy and so I'd have had no view. But even without a trip up the tower it is well worth a walk in the area to take in the vista and witness this iconic 'Eiffel Tower' clone, (built in 1958), that was once Tokyo's tallest building.
Very nice view over city. Great view over the city and the rainbow bridge!Very worth the visit and the money for which it is...better on a clear day

Go there for a couple of hours.. To see the size of Tokyo visit this tower.. The tower is located adjacent to Shiba park close to central Tokyo. The tower is brightly painted so it is almost impossible to miss. Looking up at the structure is just awe inspiring and provides plenty of photo opportunities.

Amazing view of Tokyo, and I only went to the first stop. We got there by subway and walked. You can choose to go to the first (lower) or second (higher) floors. They have different fees, of course, we went to the first and it was great. People were ok, not too crowded. It was night, so the views were amazing. It's a short visit, like something you can do before dinner. I recommend it.

Overtaken but still worth a look. We visited Tokyo tower on an evening. We had already visited the Sky-Tree that has overtaken it as Tokyo's tallest building. The tower is still impressive at night; the whole structure is illuminated and certainly stands out. There was no queue for the tower and we were able to wander around the near empty observation deck enjoying excellent views of night-time Tokyo. It may not be as tall as the Sky-Tree but it is certainly cheaper and less crowded!
Good views. You have to visit this tower but don,t go on weekend, japanese people is fan of this tower and you are going to be queue. Anyway, it's worth!

Not the tallest anymore but still worth it. We really enjoyed the Tokyo Tower even though it’s no longer the tallest. But it is the least crowded and least expensive. I lived in Tokyo when it opened so I had a soft spot in my heart for the tower. We were certainly not disappointed. The views are still magnificent.
Tokyo tower. If you go pay for the special observatory the views are crazy nice. I would go againour four yr old has been asking to go back since.

Reputedly Built from Sherman Tanks!. I could see the Tokyo Tower from my hotel (Andaz), an Eiffel Tower look-a-like, impressively-illuminated in red and white and only a stone's throw away. I visited early in the morning and found some pleasant eateries and traditional gardens around the base. The tower is accessed via glass elevators. It is much less spectacular than the Tokyo Sky Tree but Tokyo Tower has a sort of old-style quirkiness even if a bit of a tourist trap. A local told me that the tower was constructed from old Sherman tanks.....it was such a good story I believed it.

A good way to see tokyo. From Tokyo Tower you are really able to see what a massive city tokyo really is. We also saw places up there that we didn't know about and ended up going to a little forest and shrine we would have missed otherwise. Admission was not very expensive so it was worth the money to go up.

TOKYO SKYTREE. Opened in 2012, the Tokyo Skytree is Japan's tallest tower. It measure 634 meters and was the second tallest building in the world at the time of its completion. The Skytree has the two highest observation decks in Japan. The spacious, 350 meter high lower deck features wide windows, a restaurant, cafe and shops. The 450 meter high upper deck is notable for a glass and steel enclosed ramp that spirals around the building. Spectacular views of Tokyo can be seen from here.
What A Sight. Beautiful building. I love looking at cities at night. Very nice view of the city. A bit of construction going on.

Nice place to visit. Gives a good panoramic view of Tokyo and is better visited on a working day to avoid crowds.The maps and indicators placed for viewing on the observation deck are quite accurate and on a clear day one manages to see majority of the locations.Souvenir photography as well as their shop is expensive as expected. Take your own photos and buy souvenir somewhere else! The robot walking around is a cute thing and is "friendly".Shop for eatables and souvenir at their ground floor.All in all ,a good experience
Tokyo Landmark. If the Eiffel Tower is for Paris, then the Tokyo Tower is definitely Tokyo's premier landmark. It's awesome to see during daytime & stunning in the evening with its glittering lights!

Great place to grasp the dimensions. Tokyo Towers second (the higher one) observatory provides a Nice views, on a good day you can spot Mt Fuji. The glass elevator up through the red metallic structure of the tower is a bit of a thrill. Also, there is a Shinto Shrine close by, very calm and you can look at the little Jizo sculpures wearing cute red hats.

Great 360 View of Tokyo. Tokyo Tower is just about 10 minute walk from Zojoji Temple. The observation deck offers a 360 degree view of the great city. Going up to the deck was only about $10 which is kinda rare in the age of commercialization. On a clear day, you can apparently view mount Fuji from this place. Go there during the normal work day in the afternoon. It was barely full when I was there.Recommended to visit!
Nice place to be. In the city center and just behind the Zojoji temple. View from the top is just ok in comparison to other places in the world (also Tokyo Skytree). But its a nice place to go
Very much commercialised. I didnt like the place. Very crowed and almost every 5 meter a souvenir shop a fotographer etc. Very loud pop music all over the place. Save your money.

Tokyo Tower. it was very nice going up there and having a panoramic view of the city of Tokyo. it is an engineering feat. our guide, a miss asao, from JICA was very kind, patient and helpful. we had travelled from Osaka by train, the bullet train (or shinkansen in Japanese). we passed through the city of yokohama. the train was going at speeds of over 260 km/h. it is another masterpiece of engineering. trains in japan are never late ! always on time ! yes, you got that right. always on time.

Tokyo's icon. Before heading to Tokyo Tower, our first destination was Roponggi Hills. Reason being because we want the Tokyo Tower to be in sight of our city view picture. Especially in the night, where the structure will be lighted up - like a Tokyo's effiel tower. We still went ahead to check out Tokyo tower after and oh my it's such a beauty. A wide range of Tokyo bananas and Japanese snacks can be found here at the ground of the tower. trip here, http://jacqsowhat.blogspot.sg/2014/10/tokyo-japan-day-4-imperial-palace.html

Beatiful - Day or Night. Tokyo Tower is more than just a transmission tower - it is a symbol of Japan's resiliency. Seeing the tower is quite a surreal moment for me, having seen a few 1960's documentaries about how important the Tokyo Tower is to Japanese culture. Up to this date, the tower remains beautiful - day or night.
ageless. Went on a clear day, overwhelmed by what I saw. Even at 55+ years, tower offers super views .Gave me some idea (could see Disneyland, Mount Fujii)how far spread out Tokyo is.

Tokyo tower still towers amongst the giants.. The role of Tokyo Tower as a communication platform has now been largely taken over by the Tokyo Skytree. However as a structure, it is still very impressive being the Eiffel Tower of the east. The tower is located adjacent to Shiba park close to central Tokyo. The tower is brightly painted so it is almost impossible to miss. Looking up at the structure is just awe inspiring and provides plenty of photo opportunities. There are two observation levels at Tokyo tower with the first and lower located just 150 metres above ground level and the second located 250 metres above ground level. In comparison, the observation levels at Skytree are 350 and 450 metres above ground level. Both towers have their appeal however Tokyo tower is perhaps easier to get to and is the historic of the two towers in Tokyo. Do try and go on a clear day. Worth doing for sure.

Tokyo's Eiffel Tower. We visited the Tokyo Tower and paid for the ride up to the Highest Level Observation Platform. We were not dissapointed the view from here is quite amazing and well worth the cost.
