dissappointing. arrived at tokyo tower at night to see a city view... was disappointed...waited 25 mins at the information desk while the lady had a chat with someone whilst watching us waitingeventually she told us the entrance was the other side and down stairs - but there were no signs that could have told us that 25 mins beforegot to the ticket office to be told that the top floor viewing platform was closed so we could only go up a third of the way - so didnt bother

A great view. A little pricey as the view as the top most viewing platform was unavailable it is still a great way to see how vast Tokyo is as the building stretch in every direction. Kind of touristy, there are many different places to eat or shop. The museum that shows the construction is completely in Japanese but interesting to see and follow the timeline through the pictures.
Tokyo. Views were very good but a bit too many shops for you to spend your money in down on the lower levels
A feature on the skyline!. Great view and great walk if you want to take the stairs!!! Worth seeing from Roppongi area at night as it is stunning when lit up!!
Nice and old especially illumination. Nice and old especially illumination. I love the style and color of illumination, feel warm.Better go there on fie weather. You can see all Tokyo city.

It was nice... 40 years ago.. Tokyo Tower is an iconic Eiffel Tower knock-off. It has beautiful views of the city on a clear day or night, but it is old and dilapidated. At least it was when I visited it 35 years ago. Now that we have the shiny new Sky Tree - leave Tokyo Tower to Godzilla and Mothra.

The Tower Loved by Most Tokyoite. As a person born and bred in Tokyo, Tokyo Tower is more than a symbol of the Captal. It is our pride. I am lucky enough to work in an office, where I can see Tokyo Tower from my window. It is always there and, in the evening it is lit up, usually orange, sometimes blue or pink. You can enjoy looking at it, or go up and enjoy looking down the city from there. You can see Sky-Tree from there, and in the winter time, you may have a view of Mt Fuji, now a World Treasure. It is a starting point for visitors to get to know Tokyo.
A must as a tourist. Landmark of Tokyo city. With 800yen you can have a stunning city view of tokyo to the main observatory deck. Alot souvenir stores and restaurant available here.

Tokyo Tower Still Good Value. With the opening of the much higher Sky Tree, Tokyo Tower is losing popularity, but it is still a great way to see a large art of the city, especially near sunset, when Mt. Fuji is is silhouette and the city starts to light up. Easily accessible from anywhere in the city, it is a nice way to get a feel for Tokyo. But be sure to go on a clear day when the visibility is high. On such a day you can even see Mt. uji looming on the distance.

A must be... definitely a nice spot particularly during the evening. changes of colours are regular and on special days there are additional lights and signs; e.g. when Tokyo won the 2020 Olympia games bid, a huge "2020" LED sign was attached.

Nice. It's interesting to see a Japanese version of the Eiffel Tower. I went there around noon, & it was nice to see a landscape of Tokyo by day, & the shadow of the tower on other surrounding buildings. It wasn't impressive though after visiting tokyo skyTree & the suspended gardens.

The colour version of the Eiffel Tower!. Standing tall & proud over the Zojo-ji Temple, this was based upon Paris's tower, although it was built for TV transmission purposes. Great to see - looks great with a deep blue sky behind it too!
amazing 360 city views of tokyo. its a great way to see the whole city amazing views 360 if you are on a bus tour its not long to look around a bit hurried but worth a look
Nice view. Nice view of Tokyo. We went at sunset. I imagine it would be better after dark with the city lighting up.

Cool. This the second tallest tower u can climb in Tokyo after skytree...But for foreign like me its very cool go to Tokyo and see Tokyo icon, i went there on night , still recommend for woman alone travellers...Awesome..
you have to go. Having been both to the Eiffel Tower and to the Tokyo tower you have to go. Great views. Much better organized and cleaner the the Eiffel tower.
Under construction. Tokyo tower was under construction and is literally not that tall. Due to construction, I was allowed to the first deck only which was 1/3rd the total height.

nice feature to see at night. went up to see the tokyo tower at night when it was illuminated and it looked great.i would recommend u take a taxi or bus to the tower rather than walk as i did as the tower is close to the zojoji temple which at night the pathways and roads from in and around the temple are not well lit and cant be a little scary.nevertheless the tower iitself was great, i actually think it was better than the eiffel tower which i have been to as well. i was able to take pictures outside and whilst on the tower. top of the tower gives u a good view of the shiodome, shimbashi areas.

You've got to go up there!!!. If you are in Tokyo and have an hour to spare then this is a must. Great views on top of the original Tower. The Sky Tree is the other side of Town an requires a lot more planning and queuing. I've done both, but to be honest, this is high enough and will give your camera and eyes more than enough to be amazed at. Go in the late afternoon/evening so you can experience daytime then dusk when the city lights up. In the daytime you get an amazing view of Mt Fuji and the Rainbow Bridge. Reasonable price as well at ¥2,000

Eiffel Towers Little Brother. We went to the Tower during the day and at night with different tours. Whilst the view is OK we didn't think it was "spectacular" and the presence of the painting scaffolding and netting didn't help.

Great View of Tokyp. We had been to Tokyo several times before but either on business or when on holiday it was not a clear day. This Sunday we were aboard a cruise ship and it was a beautiful day so we decided to go to the Tower and we are glad we did. It was a wonderful experience and a beautiful view of Tokyo. We were glad that we arrived early since when we were leaving at about 11:00 AM there were long lines waiting for tickets and to go up. It was worthwhile visiting especially on a clear day.

Good, but not special. We were here with a guided tour, and it was a good place to see.Anyway, I think that if you have to spend money and time to go in one tower in Tokyo, you should go to the skytree tower!!

Good but better option skytree. Tokyo tower is good,But at present can't go to top level.skytree is open and it's much higher and much more beautiful,It's near to sensoji temple just 1 stop so easily u can accommodate in ur itinerary

A Must to visit. Took the brave step of visiting both levels of this tower, going on up to the 1st viewing platform, the views were amazing, full 360 degree views of the surrounding area for miles and miles.We then went up the extra distance to the top viewing platform, WOW, not really scared of heights, but this seemed to be so much higher and views so much better.So glad we went the whole way and would totally recommend it to anybody, get the courage to go to both platforms and you will not regret it, a not to be missed experience.

Go Up...Don't be disuaded by the current painting project. Upon approaching the ticket window we were shown a picture of the view platform netted and understood, incorrectly, that we would only be able to walk around one quarter of the platform. Our mistake, the agent did not speak English well. We were actually able to walk all the way around the platform and approximately 1/4 of the view is somewhat obscured by the netting. The tower is easily found by walking toward it from the subway station. It is a cash only attraction, I believe 860Y. We went as sunset approached on our first day visiting Tokyo..a superb way to end our first day our touring. There is also a food court including McDonalds and some souvenir shopping in the base of the tower.

Memorable!. This is one of the places you shouldn't miss in Tokyo. The view from the top was exhilarating! :) it was so high, those with fear with heights wouldn't want to look thru the windows. The view of tokyo from above was fantastic. Definitely, one of a kind experience.
Stunning views. even on a cloudy day, our patience paid off. we were rewarded with amazing views. the gift shop has some great panoramic photos that you can purchase. go up and soak in the view.

Disappointing!. I guess the views from the top observatory are amazing unfortunately we could not experience that as it was closed and could only access the first level - which was fine because we were advised about it when purchasing tickets. However, we were not told that half of the tower - basically the side towards the harbor is covered in nets and scaffolding work is taking place. This really ruined the view and we felt that it was not work paying to see the amazing skyline of Tokyo through nets!Make sure you ask before entering! If there are nets, do go up, there are other places in Tokyo where you can see the skyline!

cash only. I wanted to climb the Tokyo Tower as the last attraction of my unique free day of Tokyo. I was running out of cash but still had 2 credit cards. Unfortunately, no credit card is accepted at the ticketing... I'm still wondering how is that possible for such a popular touristic place...

Go on a clear day to see Mt Fuji. Liked the views and guide to some of the areas/ building in the area. More of that would be good as we were interested and the Tower is being renovated at the moment so viewing is not 100% but still great.
Tokyo Tower visit. The tower visit was good to see the enormity of Tokyo especially for my husband for his first time visit. Very efficient and lots of little souvenirs in the bottom of tower.

Great Views. This is one of those tourist must do activities if you are visiting Tokyo for the first time. The views are pretty spectacular and it wasn't too crowded when we went.... I think they did a good job with crowd control and making sure it didn't get too busy.

What did I expect?. I apologise for the negative slant. Too be honest, the Tokyo tower is just a big telegraph pole in the middle of a city! It looks down on a city which is neither exciting or pretty!Maybe if I had gone up in the night and looked at all the lights shining across this vibrant city it would have been more impressive! Maybe if they weren't refurbishing the top tier and had netting all over the lower tier I may have got a few good photos! And maybe if there wasn't scaffolding underneath the viewing platform it would have been scary! Not sure what the drama group were doing on the middle level observatory but it was quite bizarre! Not impressed!

Go here at night!. I've been there for my honeymoon, quite a rare destination we've chosen I know. Very close resemblance to Eiffel Tower. We went there at night and spent almost 2 hours. I must say the pathway leading to this tower is quite unique with a shrine and some miniature (I believe got to do with religion belief). A must go place if you were to visit Japan.

Great views of Tokyo. Much quieter now that Tokyo Sky Tree has opened, but located very centrally and still provides great views of Tokyo and the surrounding areas. Best visited in winter when the skies are clear and not hazy during the hot summer months, if you are making the trip there then you should definitely take the second elevator up to the higher observation deck, the elevator bounces a bit on the way up but apparently this is by design!
Old but worthwhile. A great view of the city from the top, certainly worth a visit. The new Sky Tree is a great addition but the Tokyo Tower retains its charm

TOKYO TOWER. Visiting on a clear day is worth both the time and the money. The entrance is a tad amusing being a floor below the entrance from the street and the information girl was NOT helpful in obtaining access info or anything else...could NOT speak nor understand English! This is the INFORMATION DESK. That being aside, the view from the observation desk worthwhile, even though the workmen had the nets up, covering the view on a couple sides ... access to higher platform also closed at this time.Much cleaner than Empire State Building or the EIFFEL Tower by comparison.Be sure to stop in at Baskins and Robbins on the main floor for refreshments and a scoop or two.

Very Kitsch!. Modeled after the Eiffel Tower in Paris, the Tokyo Tower no longer draws the crowds it once did because of the newly built Sky Tree. We showed up on a Saturday morning, paid for our ticket and climbed on the elevator. The tower has two observation decks...one at 489 ft. and one at 814 ft. We paid for the lower one and it was more than adequate. Unfortunately, the place is loaded with tacky souvenir shops and lots of small-time attractions that appeal mainly to children.
Great view. Great views of Tokyo, and short wait to get to top. Well worth a visit, and a good price for the ticket
Awsome place. Tokyo looks really betr place from this tower. Every single penny is worth to go on top.. I u wanna shop something Japanese its a good place too.....

Tokyo view. Tokyo Tower is a prominent landmark. When we got there, we were greeted by thousands of faces lined up. After one member of our group went to investigate, we found that they were lining up for a festival at the base of the tower, but there was no signage advising of this. Fortunately we were able to scoot past them and up into the Tokyo sky. Unfortunately it was a cloudy day and we couldn’t see Mt Fuji, but we saw many other landmarks on the skyline. Seeing as Tokyo Tower only functions as a landmark now that the Tokyo Skytree has come online, it will need to add some extras to keep people coming here.
Older attraction. It is good for a visit, typical tourist trap with gift shops everywhere. The view is great once you get to the top floor, dont stop on the lower level, go to the top

Tokyo tower observation. Whoever was in Paris and visited the Eiffel Tower, can visit Tokyo tower and understand the meaning of " who said size doesn't count" Tokyo tower is taller by 12 meters, hurrah!, Tokyo Tower has beautiful landscape view, excellent, surrounding and nice skyline. The view is much better then that of the tallest Sky Tree.And at Tokyo Tower you have to wait in line much ,much less than in Paris
Great!. Fantastic view! Worth a visit. We found very little queuing which was great.The gift shop was a little bit dowdy and the products cheap.

Entertaining but not that special. I did the Tokyo Tower as part of a day-tour and it was enjoyable to see the sights in 360 degrees from the tower, even with clouds and not great visibility. The gift shop at the base and at the top were kitschy and cheapened it for me a bit.

Early. The earlier you get there the better we arrived at 10am to receive a ticket enabling us to buy a ticket between 11 & 11.30 we were up top around 12.30 when we came down round 1 people were receiving tickets to purchase their tickets at 4. So if you don't wish to wait make it your first stop

Wow, what a view!. Extremely well-organised with very little queuing. The views on a clear day are amazing.
Coffee shop on the tower though, needs a thorough revamp and taking upmarket somewhat. With a "captive" audience this should be far better quality.

its impressive at night !. Cant really say I was wowed by this structure as it just looks like a tall mobile mast. it was nice at night to look out at from our hotel that was close by and when it has the 2020 Olympic logo on it but other than that I didnt really have any desire to go up on it as our hotel was just as high as we were on the 31st floor and the view was free from there aparently the SKy Tower is the place to go for a view.. but only on a clear day !
Skytree's slightly better. Good view from the observation deck, but rather old. A Tokyo landmark, but SkyTree is newer and has a shopping centre just beneath it so it takes the edge.
Magnificent view. Went there on my first holidays to Japan in July 2009 with friends. I like the night view that you can see far far away Tokyo area. Must go attraction.

I visited out of obligation.. I felt that I couldn't spend time in Tokyo without seeing it up close.It's a bit of a walk from the closest JR station but there are some parks and temples on the way.Unfortunately I didn't have time to go inside it as this wasn't a scheduled activity but more of a spur of the moment,might as well get this over with, kind of thing. However it was still kind of awe inspiring up close. Next time I'm in Tokyo I will definitely make time to go up to the top. I regret taking it so lightly this trip.

Not the best. If time is limited , miss this out and go instead to Mori tower where you can see both other towers and there,s lots more to do, however it is on Gray Line Tokyo tour itinerary so you,ll probably go there anyway

Tokyo Tower. If you are in Japan and visiting Tokyo you should visit Tokyo tower, a very attractive enjoyable scenery of TOKYO from the top of the Tokyo tower. very easy to get their from any place in Tokyo as you know so many subway lines are covering the most area of Tokyo city.

I loved it!. I went on a tour with my husbands family, including the Tokyo Tower! I just loved it and the view over the city was amazing! I also liked the shops and attractions they offer in the tower. You really can spend much enjoyable time on this wonderful tower!

The fabulous experience!. Tokyo tower, this was my aim when I booked this Japanese tour with my girlfriend. It didn’t made me disappointed. You could see overview of Tokyo, even Fuji mountain. That was so romantic and twinkle at night.I guarantee it won’t be a Japanese tour if you don’t visit Tokyo tower - the representatition of Japan.
Magnificent views. We were very lucky with the weather and we could actually see Mt Fuji from the observation deck. There is a glass plate where you can stand and take a picture looking dwn.

Best at night. This time I went to Tokyo tower during the day. It's definitely better at night and feels more intimate and romantic, so pretty awesome for a date too!! The night view is also more breathtaking at night but if you wanna know what places you're actually looking at then I suggest going during the day.

Interesting, but overrated. We visited the Tokyo Tower with a friend who is living in Tokyo, as it is one of his favorite places and where he proposed to his wife. While it is a great view of the city, and is an interesting experience, I felt that it didn't quite live up to the hype or warrant going out of our way (and the cost). I much prefer the view from the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building in Shinjuku which is free and is at a convenient location. However, other of my friends prefer Tokyo Tower. I found it just okay, but obviously it's highly subjective. If you're in the area and have the spare cash, go and make your own decision.

A nice view from the top. Tokyo Tower is a nice little place to visit during the beginning of your trip to Tokyo. It offers a 360 degrees view of the city and you can spot all sorts of other famous landmarks housed in the city. However, it is no longer the prime location for viewing the city as other buildings, especially the Tokyo SkyTree offers much higher decks for viewing. Nonetheless, the place was nicely maintained and the staff was extremely helpful and courteous. As mentioned earlier, it's a good place to start your trip by seeing the Tower and the working your way towards SkyTree. There are these interesting computer monitors that are placed at various areas of the deck that provide information about the buildings you can see and that was good for helping to plan out other places we could visit. There's an aquarium inside the tower (for an extra cost) and all sorts of stores to purchase tower related souvenirs. I do recommend this, especially to first time visitors and I'm sure they will have fun atop the tower.

Interesting as expected. If someone tellyou there's a best view place in Tokyo, do not believe it!. Each tower or high building has it's own unique and beautiful view and offers a different experience.So even if you have been in Mori Tower or Skytower do not hesitate and visit Tokyo Tower.Higher than Eiffel Tower!:)

Its not the Skytree but still worth a visit. Visited Tokyo Tower the day after the Skytree. It is undeniably older. The food court was limited in its choices, none of which appealed to me. The shopping was either food or plastic souvenir tat.Again I skipped the Aquarium as have done such things many times before.Things I loved. It is an iconic part of the Tokyo Skyline I did not feel I could leave it out. It was easy to get to on the Subway. Its cafe had a lovely view with actual comfy seats which was an issue at the skytree. The staff were friendly and helpful. Everywhere was spotlessly clean and it was a fun way to spend a couple of hours.Plus seeing the "Eiffel Tower" was a nice counterpoint to the "Statue of Liberty"

A must see tourist attraction, but doesn't wow. Tokyo Tower is pretty famous... that's what I thought at least. However, there are other observation decks with better views, some even higher than Tokyo Tower. There's the Mori Tower Sky Deck, Tokyo Skytree, and even the Ferris Wheel at Odaiba is pretty sweet at the top.I also was unaware than Tokyo Tower was a kids zone during the day time...

It's a good view... but. This is one of those attractions, very much like the eiffel tower where you go up to see the Tokyo skyline, but of course you're on one of the most important features of that skyline... so you're better off going to Roppongi Hills and getting the view from there which includes the tower... get my drift? But the views are very good and you can see an awful lot of Tokyo.

Mini Eiffel Tower. A white and orange painted structure like Eiffel tower is used for broadcasting. Day time it just like an ordinary tower with extraordinary structure, however when viewd from skytree observatory its stunning when lit at night.

Observation deck now to low. With all the other buildings around the Tokyo Tower the observation deck is to low to get a good view, you can see a bit up close and between the buildings is good. We also visited the Sky Tree which we found much better

Seeing Tokyo's Skyline. It was so nice to be up there to see all the skycrapers and have some pictures taken with the various buildings as your backdrop.There are souvenier shops where you can buy different items.

Plainly disappointed. Maybe i have too much of a high expectations when i visit Tokyo Tower.But i realize that there isnt much to do, shopping was a few similar shops gather together.Totally nothing much.I guess my view of the tokyo tower from rongponggi was much more beautiful and mesmerizing from the place itself. Sad to say, as much i love the tokyo tower, i am disappointed from my trip there which took a lot of time and walking.
Enjoy the vew. Amazing views of the city. Enjoy Tokyo from above, prefer the sunset hours to vew the change from day to night with lights.

Nice views of Tokyo. Be prepared for a crowd. There are 2 observation decks. Recommend to get to the highest one. Impressed by the honesty of their staff: I missed getting my change back at the ticket counters, so the cashier literally looked for me all over the place until she found me 1hr after in the top deck.
Amazing!. I like to see the city around,the restaurant the souvenir shops. the elevators was too slow ,many people on the lines.

A must see in Tokyo!. This has to be a number one landmark of Tokyo.It was on a hill and it was built long time ago. However, it is a very nice tower from every angle. I took about 30 pictures from the base. I recommend to visit in the evening to get both twilight and night pictures. View of Tokyo tower is very nice from Mori Tower by the way.

Nice to see but extremely crowded. The Tokyo Tower is located in the Minato ward of Tokyo and close to the subway stations "Akabanebashi", "Shibakoen" and "Onarimon" on the Oedo and Mita line respecitvely. The design of the Tokyo Tower is inspired by the design of the Eiffell Tower in Paris, France. The tower is nice to see and features two observatories which could be entered for a fee. We didn't access the observatories since we preferred to access the Tokyo Skytree. We experienced this place as extremely crowded. There were lots of Japanese people especially in the shopping area (mainly souvenirs) and food court at the base of the tower which made it feel extremely crowded. It is, however, nice to have visited this Tokyo landmark. Especially the parks and temple around it are worth a visit.

An incredible view!. An incredible view of Tokyo, particularly beautiful as the sun went down. The tower was built in the fifties, and is essentially a television tower. You must expect some waiting time, as there are many who want up. it closes at 2200, recommended if you want a little overview. There are many towers in Japan, so if you want, you can get a stamp, something you can get in all towers in the country.

Panoramic Views. We visited the Tokyo Tower in the morning and were able to see lots of landmarks from Tokyo Tower. Our tour guide walked around with us and pointed out/explained various landmarks to us. We are glad we posed/paid for a picture here because it came out better than the ones we took on our cell phone!

fun stop for the kids, cute and kitchy. Nice little stop. I may be jaded by the fact that our hotel had a great view, so this wasn't really improving on it--though it gives you info about what you are looking at.

Great view, very romantic !. I love the shape and location of this tower. The top floor was under renovation, so we didn't go to the top floor. Not crowded and very clean...like many places in this amazing city !!!

Stunning Architecture. It isn't that special when I looked at it far from other areas in Tokyo. But I visited the place and got close to the tower, it looks beautiful. And so it's worth the trip to have a close look at this icon.

Good views. The views from Tokyo tower are fabulous - the scope of Tokyo is incredible. However the views at the Skytree are twice as good. Inside the tower you can go to the wax museum which is pretty awesome and there's a souvenir shop. We bought some fridge magnets and other small items. On the whole a good experience and would recommend this to other tourists.

pretty short but worth seeing!. There's lots of things to do inside the tower, shopping, eating, going into the aquarium and wax museum. I don't remember the shop's name, but the owners were very friendly. We spent almost three hours there. If you really want to explore the inside of the tower, you better visit it in the morning/ afternoon since most stores/museums close early.

Just average. Though it's an obvious place to visit when you come to Tokyo and it looks similar to Eiffel Tower but actually it's not that great. The view was nice but things were boring, maybe because I expected much more than that!

View of Tokyo & water front area. From this tower, you can see Tokyo bay and Imperial palace, Zojoji etc much better than Sky Tree and the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office in Shinjuku. You can try to come down outside stairs to show how brave you are. But be ready for you will certainly get muscular pain next day!

nothing compare to Eiffel Tower!. It is a nice tower but nothing to really fuss about. The area is also a bit remote from every intereting things except for the Ukai tofu restaurant at the foot of the tower, but with booking only.

A tower with a view!. This was an experience that had to be done... twice!Although the lower levels are nothing other than souvenir shops, don't let that detract you from the real reason you are here... To be a tourist!Seeing Tokyo from the tower was an experience that made it all worth the trip up in the elevator. But then going the extra distance to the upper level, really made the difference!The views are outstanding, and if you do the trip during Christmas or New Years (a bit before), the lights are magical.This is a worth while trip, especially with the family.

Nicer to look at from distance. This is one of those places where many locals have never been. I'd been there only once when I was four or five. If you'd like to enjoy the view from above, it's better to head to Roppongi Hills Mori Tower. That's cheaper and less crowded than Tokyo Sky Tree. Tokyo Tower has a much better shape that could be enjoyed from, say, Yamanote Line train.

Best at night. Tokyo tower is an old landmark but still magnificent, especially lately.Area surrounding the tower is beautiful, and facilities at the tower itself are quite sufficient.You can go to the lower levels for shopping and games, no entrance fee.However, you have to pay to go to the observation decks (two decks).Lower deck is quite sufficient for sightseeing.The view is great, especially recommended to go at night, as it is more beautiful.You can go by train to the nearest station, and walk to the tower. You can also go by car; there are parking areas on the tower and surrounding places.In my opinion, Tokyo tower is still better than Sky tree for sghtseeing.Enjoy your visit!
HAS SEEN BETTER DAYS ,. spending your time in bed would better than going to visit this ,if you are wanting views of Tokyo go to the sky tree,

Mostly OK. Probably expected too much from it. The first level at 150 meters is below the many other buildings in the area, so you do not get that wow factor. The second level offers better views though you will pay extra for it and wait for it too in line as the elevator is small and takes about 8 people or so at a time. Still, 250 meters is not high enough to get you a wow factor.

Good views but maybe not worth the money. You can visit several things here, the main observatory, the higher observatory, the wax museum and some other stuff. The views are good and nice to do if you want to get an overview of the city on your first time visit. However, not worth the 8$. If you want to go up the higher observatory, you need toy pay an extra charge. Good for a gettaway with kids, a lot of attractions for kids, foodcourt, etc

Nice view from observatory deck. I like panoramic view from observatory deck, I can see the sky scrapper in Tokyo City and rainbow bridge as well. If you love photography, this place is good to snap pictures.In ground floor you also can find any souvenirs, Japanese snacks such as Tokyo Banana etc.

Up Up Up Up and Up. It looks like the Eiffel Tower and the lifts within reminded me of the Eiffel Tower and I enjoyed Tokyo Tower as much as my tower visit in Paris. Tokyo Tower has two viewing platforms, one at 150m and the other at 250m. Whilst the view is pretty much the same I think it is worth the extra cost to travel to the highest platform. The lift ride between the two platforms is an experience in itself. After enjoying the view of Tokyo which is so expansive, rest your feet and enjoy some ice-creams in the cafe situated at the high levels. An enjoyable attraction in Tokyo which really does give you a good sense of the size of the city. On a clear day you light even see Mt Fuji.
Good views. Included in our tour package and there are great views of the city. We went early in the day so it was not too crowded.

Incredible view. We only went up to the 150 meter observatory level. There is another level that was higher but many advised there was not worth the extra time along with the money. Having been to both levels of the Eiffel tower, I agree that the lower level was fine.The day that we went up was perfectly clear. The 360 view was absolutely beautiful. It was not overly crowded so getting around was not bad. there were a couple of openings on the floor where you could look at the way to the ground level. It was funny to see the kids and adults warily look down and then quickly back up. There were many shops to buy souvenirs both at the 150 meter level along with the ground level. The SkyTree Tower is much higher but the waits can be as long as 2 hours. I recommend making the time for this. Should not take too much time

Just do the main observatory, don't spend extra for the "special". The views are almost exactly the same, even though you are an extra 100m higher or so. It's a good vantage point and if you are walking around the Ginza area it's worth a look, but if you are closer to Shinjuku, the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building's towers are free of charge and also have great views of the city.

Tokyo Tower at night. Try to go up just in time for sunset. That way youʻll see Tokyo by daylight and Tokyo by night! Itʻs not as high as the SkyTree Tower, but itʻs also not as crowded! I donʻt like crowds. When we were up there, there was a live band that played music starting at sunset. The lights within were beautiful blue lights. And we enjoyed a little bite to eat as we enjoyed all the night lights. On the way down, we had dinner in one of their restaurants on the 2nd floor. People were very helpful when we asked directions to the train station. The walk to the train station offered some awesome angles to see the tower!
Great Views. I loved the views and the history involved with tower. Not to mention the elevator was really cool too!

Fond memories at a classic tower.. I had been here once before at night time and not gone up, just around the base. That was during christmas time, and we had just gone to take some photos, and found a nice christmas market. This time we went during the day, with the purpose to go up. It looked great as we left the nearby subway station and took some photos. It was easy to navigate to. Tickets to the main observation deck were 820, much more reasonable than the Skytree, and with NO line.No worries about trying to get a view out the window, they were lovely and clean and without ten other people in front of you. It is in a far better location than the Skytree, and its high enough to have a great view, but not so high as you need binoculars to see anything. Just perfect. You can see Odaiba, Shinjuku and Roppongi Hills. We picked out the fuji tv building, the TMGO, Mori Tower, Rainbow Bridge, Takeshimiya Times Square. So many familiar sights. All we saw from Skytree was Sensoji temple and masses and masses of ugly urban sprawl.There is a small cafe, and gift store on this level. You can also pay 600 more yen to go up to the 'special observatory' but I dont think the view would be that much different from there, and we had accomplished the objecting of going up Tokyo Tower.The glass bottom floor areas seemed larger than Skytree, and as it was a lot less busy it was actually possible to take some photos down them etc. Tokyo Tower also has a cute little mascot which is themed in the merchandise.Having done FOUR observation decks in Tokyo, this is my favourite. I would rank this the best (820 yen), the TMGO offices as second (and they are totally free!), Mori tower at Roppongi third (1500 yen) and the Skytree as least favourite (3000 yen..).There is something about finally being at SUCH an iconic and famous landmark, and getting to go up. Dont miss out!

nothing much, some good views though. you will not spend more than 30 mins. I found no difference between the normal height and the higher deck of the tower (difference around 7USD). . but you still need to go there, a good symbol of Tokyo .

A bit unexpected .... By looking at the pictures I was expecting something like Eiffel Tower with the views of Manhattan ... Well, I was quite surprised to find out that it's a very different experience.It is comparable in height with Eiffel tower (around 300m), but it was build in late 1950s and it seems to be frozen in that time. The aesthetics is reminiscent of popular american cartoons Jetsons (they started in 1962), including the bring colors, clean and simple lines and overall retro spirit. There were a lot of cosplayers (mostly teenagers dressed as popular Japanese comics characters), which was adding some Japanese flavor.The view was also quite unexpected. The building around a quite low with a lot of cemeteries around, so it didn't feel like you're in the middle of a big city.Just as Eiffel Tower, it has two observation decks, the top one is available for an extra charge, however, I don't think the view from there is dramatically different since there was no tall landmarks around which would look different from the higher level.Overall, there is nothing wrong about going there as a tourist, it's easily accessible, located in a quite green area, the tower itself has an unusual retro feel and the tickets are affordable. However, because of it's location, you don't really get a view of the heart of the city, so I'd say it's a second tier attraction, if you have limited time, check some more interesting places first.

Tokyo Tower!! Definitely the best landmark in Tokyo. I kept waiting to go to Tokyo tower till my wife finally arrived in Tokyo. Definitely worth watching. A must go place with your love. An old landmark, which is a few minutes’ walk from the metro station. There are two observatory decks in the tower. The main observatory and the special observatory. We went in after noon and it was a clear day. Enjoyed a clear view of beautiful Tokyo. The crowed keeps increasing as the day progresses. The view definitely becomes better as you go to the upper deck. You have to buy another ticket to reach the special observatory. It gives an amazing view of the Chiba Prefecture with Tokyo Disneyland, Disney Sea, Rainbow Bride and Haneda Airport. If you are lucky you can also get a view of Fuji-san. If possible spend some time at the Club 333 for a good cup of Cafe late and breathtaking view of Tokyo
Tokyo Tower. Skytree is better. But Tokyo Tower was pretty cool to see! Was pretty cloudy the day I went, but you can see a lot more from Skytree

One of the conventional attractions in Tokyo. Nice location, good view. It houses some decent souvenir shops. Didn't think the 800+ yen fee to go up the tower was worth it though. You can get a far better view of Tokyo for free by going up the Bunkyo Civic Centre building, located 10 meters from the Kasuga Railway Station (also walking distance from Korakuen station on Marunochi Line).
Nice to go at Dust. Loved the location and the views. It's a good idea to go before it gets dark so you can see the city lights tuning on...

Best viewed at night. My journey to the top of Tokyo Tower cured me of my fear of heights.My work colleagues urged me to conquer my fears and make the ascent.I did and wasn't it worth it.The view over Tokyo is spectacular but my advice would be to do it at night time.

Beautiful view.. I thought this was a great view of tokyo and a great location. The price i hear is much lowere than the sky tree. If you want to go at night make sure u go before dark if u want to go all the way to the top. We went after dinner and the top deck was sold out for the night. It was still great to look out from the observation deck though. Very busy.

Tokyo Tower. Was a fun experience, not too expensive. Went all the way to the top deck (one lower price at 150 meters, another slightly more expensive at 250 meters). Sort of an Eiffel Tower replica. Great views. If cloudy, can't see Mt.Fuji, but went up on a rainy day, and still great views of bay and Tokyo skyline.
A must see in Tokyo. Very beautiful structure, a must see if you are in tokyo. Nice places to wonder around near the structure as well.

Lanmark Indeed but doesnt give the same feeling as eiffel tower. Located conveniently with easy access from metro station. Tokyo tower has got entrance ticket to get on to the tower in the high speed elevator. It has got 2 observation decks (top one is worth visiting) with the transparent glass areas to stand on and to get the feel of standing in air.We have some sovereigns shop worth paying a visit.Avoid the wax museum you got better ones to see in tokyo.
Average view. Yes, Tokyo is an extensive city, but the view on an overcast day is pretty disappointing. Check the weather before you go.
taller than the eiffel tower. it's now to visit but i would really recommend the new sky tree! even higher and really amazing construction

Must visit.. A Tokyo icon that must be visited while in Tokyo. There are gift shops in the ground floor, and good restaurants. We ate in one, but given the Japanese fast-moving style, I barely had the time to enjoy my meal with my slow dining pace. I got quite some souvenirs from the gift shop, some of them very interesting to give as gifts back home. I didn't get to visit the view deck, no time.

No Eifel tower but still nice!. I liked the efficiency! Great, no cues. Nice view of course. Not very handy if you want to commit suicide since everything is closed. If you want that you better go to the Hilton in Amsterdam. Will write a review for the Hilton soon.

Nice view but not much else to say. We were part of a tour but if we hadn't been, there was no place to sit and have coffee or eat like other structures do have eg. Centrepoint in Sydney, Eiffel Tower in Paris. Tokyo has a new tower called the Skytree which looks nice but not sure its open to the public. The view was nice from the platforms and there was a window panel in the floor on the lower level which was interesting.

High Above The Tokyo Skies. Standing 333 meters above the Tokyo skyline is this architectural beauty that overlooks the Shiba Park and Minato, Tokyo area. The elevator ride to the observational area is quick and can surprise your ears as to rise in elevation. There are gift shops on the regular observation level that can provide the opportunity for tourists to send postcards with the Tokyo Tower stamp. There is an opportunity to take a trip to the higher observation posts for an additional fare, but I was content looking through the glass floor right where I was. Great experience, great shopping, and a great beer garden on the ground floor just outside the front doors.
Night time!. Check the hours before hand. They closed at 10 PM the day I went, but they take their last batch of customers at 9:45. They DON'T accept credit cards, cash only.

Eiffel Tower Asian sibling.... We went to the tower hoping to get a clear view of Tokyo and Mt. Fuji. Unfortunately, the latter wasn't possible. Otherwise, the view is good. We didn't go up to the special observation deck. We stayed at the main deck and the view was good. You will need to pay two different fees to access both decks. It is considered an iconic tower in Tokyo. However, the newest Skytree tower is taller and modern looking. The Tokyo tower is a good place to take pictures of Tokyo on a clear day. There are the usual souvenirs shops inside and outside the tower. It looks nice at dusk when the lights come on. The orange paint gives it a unique appearance. If you have the time in Tokyo, stop by and enjoy the view. Enjoy!
Great views of the city.. Great photo ops and experience. The higher floor was under renovation so couldnt go. Very surreal to see Tokyo amd how big it is.

A must see in Tokyo. I went up alone at night (as my friend was ill in the hotel room) and again the next day when he'd recovered, so I got to see the view at night and in daylight and it's hard to decide which was best.I recommend doing both if you can, or at least doing one at Tokyo Tower and the other at the Skytree.The queue on both occasions was quite large, bigger at night. But it didn't take long to get the top. The view is fantastic, there are some great interactive touch screens which show you information on the buildings in your view, you have a full 360 view of Tokyo from here.I'm not sure how true it is but I heard on a really clear day you can see Mt Fuji from the tower.

Great evening views and good value. We went up the tower on our first evening in Tokyo and it is a great introduction to the city. I would recommend going up at night as the views are incredible - it does feel like you are in the centre of the city.

Tokyo Tower on a foggy day. Interesting architectural art work. May not have the originality in concept as it is inspired by the Eiffel Tower in France.Still worth visiting since you can have a great view of Tokyo.On a clear day you can see Mt. Fuji, the tour guide said. But we went on a rainy day and it was foggy.
Interesting!. Interesting to see the skyscrapers.Great for kids to view the "looking window". Clean, efficient and the staff are friendly. Toilets were clean too.

Sparkles like a Jewel at night. You can see the Tokyo Tower for miles before you get to Minato. I visited the Tokyo Tower during the day, and at night. The night views are beautiful. The tower is lit, and it changes colors through the night. It is very easy to get to the Tower since there are three train stations close to it. You can see beautiful panoramic views of Tokyo from the observation deck. There is also a beautiful park near the Tower, and you can also visit the Zojoji Temple that is near the Tower.
Very cool!. I've always wanted to visit the Tokyo Tower. It was very cool to see the city from the observation level and I liked the glass inserts in floor!

Nice place to shop and stunning views from above. This orange and white tower is Tokyo's landmark, from above you can view Tokyo skyline and buildings.....and if lucky Mount Fuji can bee seen in the distance. On the second floor there are a lots of souvenir shops inside with fair price....food court also available with variety of foods....If you want to take a picture with the tower i suggest you bring wide lenses...or not you can take a photo with tokyo tower backdrop on the first floor.
organized tour. we went hear as part of the Tokyo morning tour booked through Expedia.It is very helpful and offers a concise perspective of the city.

Free ticket and cake for birthday visitor!. If you visit Tokyo Tower on your birthday, go to ticket counter and tell them it's your birthday and show them your passport, they will give you a free entry ticket and to enter and redeem a slice of free cake in the cafe at the middle of Tokyo Tower.

Stunning night time views. A good few things in the tower to amuse most people. Stunning views for a start, and on a clear day Mount Fuji can be seen. My favourite time was night when the city was all lit up. An aquarium, but I did not feel this was up to much. Felt that the fish were in quite cramped conditions.Wax work museum which we did not visit. Also a lot of eating places and some souvenier shops too. Beware of buying a Heinekin beer outside - £15 per stein.

Fun for the Family. My kids love this place. Every time they see any tower or pole colored orange and white, they yell, "There's Tokyo Tower!" Tokyo Tower is a valued icon in a country full of icons. The tower is easy to get to by train or taxi and there is also ample parking available. There are often sideshows and other exhibits that attract visitors in addition to the tower. The tower is used for broadcasting which doesn't help its aesthetic but it is a site to see, especially when lit. There are two observation decks which are accessed by an elevator for a fee. The fee could be a few hundred yet lower but it is still worth the trip. I highly suggest paying the fee that covers both the lower deck and the upper deck. Be sure to visit on a clear day so that you can view the vastness of Tokyo and see Mt. Fuji as well. The observation deck also has a section of glass floor that allows visitors to see straight down several hundred feet; a favorite of my kids. The lower four floors have souvenir shops and a few restaurants that are of average quality but not expensive at all.

Eiffel clone. Nothing to rave about. Two viewing galleries, one at 150 metres and other at 250 metres. You have to pay extra for a visit to 250 m observation deck. Both have a glass look down window which is really awesome. You get a bird's eye view of Tokyo from up there. Many people find it difficult to stand on this glass window looking down !! Overall a good experience if you have never been to a high tower like Eiffel, Shanghai TV tower or the like.

A must - well worth it. Good value way to kill 1-2 hours in Tokyo. Costs 20000 yen to get to 350 level and then another 10000 to get to level 450 the highest you can go. Total around 430 which is good value in Japan.Well organised and efficenet as you would expect.

OK, but not that great. If you have never seen the vast expanse of Tokyo from above, you must see it. But, you can do it from elsewhere for free. There is a free viewing deck in the government building in Shinjuku or you could have a drink in the luxurious bar at the top of the Park Hyatt. Other hotels also have lobbies on high floors, so you could stop into one of those. The Tokyo Tower is good for about half an hour, but not much more.

Awesome view ..... Although I'm afraid of heights, I had to make the trip to the top of the Tokyo tower. What a wonderful experience. To get away and have a piece of quiet and tranquility in a city of chaos, this was a welcomed moment.

A tourist must see!. Tokyo Tower is one of those things that you just have to visit when you come to Japan. Although the new Skytree is getting a lot of press and visitors, the warmth and old fashioned charm of this tower is well worth enjoying. Great views of Tokyo and a nice area for shopping too.
A Beautiful view. A nice experience to see Tokyo from above. No queues and and excellent view on a clear day. A Beautiful view
Stunning views. We were here on a clear sunny day and the views were stunning from the top floor. Takes a while to get in and up as it is busy but be patient!

Billed as Tokyo's Answer to the Eiffel Tower!. We didn't bother taking a trip up to the top, it was essentially a dressed-up telephone mast. Off a relatively quiet road in the business district, there was no attempt at all to make the surrounding area attractive. I don't think we'll be going back!

Nothing like the real thing. From the Tokyo Tower you can get a very good idea of the size of the city. It is a great view during the day or at night. No lines to buy a ticket which can be to the upper level or one level prior. There are tow differnts prices, my advise is dor no pay the extra price, its not worth it. You can take very nice panoramic pictures of the city 360 degrees. Easy access via Metro
Really nothing much. It's beautiful from afar but there's not a lot to see up there. It does give a good view if the day isn't foggy which hardly happens. Better admired afar. I'll give this a miss.
Worth a Look. The Eiffel Tower it isn't but you did come to see Tokyo (not Paris). A good view of the city can be had from the observation deck which will help you get your bearings.
Tokyo Tower. new tower in Tokyo , very high 457 meter , you must see in two levels , one problem is the line to get tickts ..

Spectacular. Compared to the big attractions in Europe, this tower has the advantage of being much cheaper, and with way smaller crowds, than big-ticket sights I have visited in Paris, Rome, London etc. It cost 1400yen to go all the way up, about US$14. There were no queues at all.Tokyo is so high, so spectacular, that to visit and not view the city from above is a tragic mistake. Certainly visit the skybar in your hotel, and if that is not available to you, the tower is a must. The elevator takes you to a dizzying height, and the view by day and by night is amazing. Go at sunset for the best colours, and to watch the city light up.

Great View!. From the top of the tower, one gets a good idea of how spread-out Tokyo is. The views are fantastic, there is a nice, affordable coffee shop and it is just as interesting to watch the other people, for example the numerous school students, as to look at the great views.

Beautiful view of Tokyo at night. As our stay in Tokyo was very short, visiting the tower at night was a perfect way to enjoy a sense of the huge metropolitan area of Tokyo. In every direction, the lights of the city stretched to the horizon, and beyond....We went about two hours before closing time so it was not too crowded. We only went to the first level which is 150M above the city. You have to buy another ticket to go to the top level. There is plenty of entertainment for youngsters too.

Iconic landmark with great views of city. On a two day business trip to Tokyo I was lucky enough to have a short break between meeting so headed to the Tokyo Tower. Entry to the main observation deck (150m) is ¥820 for an adult. You have to pay a further ¥600 to get to the "Special Observatory" (250m). Confusingly you pay to get to the second platform when you get to the mid point in the Tower rather than buying both tickets in one go at the bottom.Phenomenal views right across Tokyo. Perfect for a first time visitor to assimilate themselves with the city.
Beautiful View - But ALOT of People. It's to be expected that this place would be packed. But many of the people here were rude.We didn't stay for long but the time we did the view was lovely.

A more affordable option to see the Tokyo skyline. As most observation towers do, the Tokyo Tower offers fantastic views of the entire metro area. There are two decks. The first is just above the center of the tower and the second is much higher. At the ticket office, you can choose if you want to pay for the higher level. In my opinion it was worth it.The elevator takes you to the first observation level. There, your number will be displayed on overhead screens when it is your turn to take the elevator to the top level. Be aware there are a couple levels of stairs between the two. While waiting, you can enjoy the view on the first level. Both decks have plenty of room to move about freely. On the first deck are two sections of glass floor, which offer nice vertical views to the street below!At the bottom are shops and restaurants.The tower is directly behind the Zozoji Temple. Though older and not as tall, the Tokyo Tower is a much more affordable and less crowded option compared to Tokyo Skytree, which is an expensive, crowded mess.

Pity it is overshadowed by Skytree!. We had already been to Skytree and when we got our first glimpse of Tokyo Tower as we emerged from Akebanebashi subway I thought "What a puny little thing, there is no way that is taller than the Eiffel Tower" But ... when you get up there the view is sensational, and even better, although it was holiday week we walked straight in and went up, unlike Skytree where we had to get tickets and come back hours later. Perhaps the iconic Tokyo Tower is overshadowed by its replacement? Good shops and cafes at the bottom but we did not visit the waxworks.

Just another high steel tower. To me a steel tower is a steel tower including Eiffel Tower , Paris , unless ofcourse you appreciate ' its construction n heritage value ' It a rainy day when I visited , so........ did not go up to the observatory level. Its red color makes it looks stricking .Below the building is the normal gift shops selling sorveniers n stuff n several restaurants. A normal fridge magnet will cost you yen350 to yen400 (usd 5 ) The toilets are very clean , though !

A spectacular view to see. Tokyo Tower is a must see sight if you are ever in Tokyo. It is taller and lighter that the Eiffel Tower in Paris. It was built in 1958 and has two observation decks. The first observation deck is at 490 feet from the ground and the smaller observation deck is located at 820 feet. The views from the highest deck is spectacular on a clear day. The lower observation deck provides entertainment during the evenings. The best time to go and visit the tower is during the day and before 5:00 PM. At nights the crowd come out and it gets very crowded. The tower is currently being used to house several TV channels and radio antennas.Directly below the tower is a four story building called Foot Town, which house a museum, gift shops and a restaurants. It is a fun place to go if you are in Tokyo.

My favourite!. My favourite sight to see in all of Tokyo! Much more iconic than the skytree and has easier access. We went to both viewing platforms during our visit and had a drink in the cafe. Lots of souvenir shops at the bottom of the tower as well.
Most popular landmark in Tokyo. The view from Tokyo Tower is superb! all sides North , East, West And South have attractive views of the great Tokyo metropolis.

Beautiful Views. I loved the Tokyo Tower. It was absolutely stunning to see the city view at night time with all the lights putting on a show. Got some beautiful snaps of the tower itself. Would recommend to anyone traveling.
Great sight to experience.. The Tokyo Tower allows you to see all over the city. It is well worth the visit. I suggest going during the day for great views and at night for great lights of the city.
Great views. I was lucky! I went on a day excursion to visit this tower. Great panoramic views of Tokyo. On a clear day, you can see Mount Fuji.

Old charm. Tokyo Tower has been around a while and if you like me enjoy tall structures with observation areas then Tokyo Tower is a must visit.The view on a fine day is really great and it is also near by a few other attractions so a morning sighteeing in the area is worth the effort.For me morning is the best time to visit as it is less crowded if you are early enough

View from the top. This is the older tower since there is another newer and taller tower just opened in May 2012. However, this place is still attractive and the view from the top is very good on a clear day.

Great view of Tokyo. I went there over the weekend on a Saturday just after sun down, and I've to say, there wasn't much of a queue. Maybe I was late, but doesn't matter. There are apparently a mid-way and the utter most top. Your first ticket would let you go mid way, that is where I spent all my time at. The view was just spectacular! A 360 view of Tokyo! And in order to go to the utter most top, a second fee is needed and waiting time even at a non peak time was a min 45 min wait. Which was a real shock. I didn't bother with it as I was rushing for a dinner reservation. But What a view I must say..

Tokyo Tower at sunset. If possible, try to get here in time to up in the tower for sunset. The contrast between daytime Tokyo and nighttime Tokyo is interesting. Personally I find nighttime to be more intriguing, but if you have time to spare, you can stay all day until closing if you like - they will not kick you out otherwise.However, I recommend that you get back down to the ground before they shut off the orange/yellow floodlights at 20:00. They turn on dimmer purple bulbs after that but they are not as pretty, in my opinion.Most sights in Tokyo close before sunset so Tokyo Tower is a great way to cap a day of sightseeing before dinner. It's also easily accessed by subway or bus.

A Tokyo Classic. I thought of going up in the Tokyo Sky Needle, but it was super expensive, so decided on Tokyo Tower which is more historic and iconic. I'm glad I did. I visited towards the end of my vacation, so I was more familiar with the Tokyo skyline. And then, the rain clouds parted and I was treated to a tremendous view of Mt. Fuji, 40 miles in the distance. I decided to stay a while and go up to the top to catch the sunset. When I departed, the tower was all lit up in lights, making it quite the scene.
Nice views. Only 333 metres high but nice views over the surrounding area. There is an interesting temple near rthe base.

Height of Beauty. Looks a little like the Eiffel Tower ~ once you are standing next to it you are able to appreciate it's full beauty. It's gorgeous at night when it's all lit up. Inside the tower you are transported with elevators that stop at different heights making it possible for you to enjoy every inch on it. There's a nice cafe at the top if you want to brag to people about drinking coffee in the air. From the tower you are able to enjoy the stunning view of Tokyo in all it's glory. On your way down be sure to stop at the curio shops to pick up a replica tower. Definitely a must see!

a nice one. a classic tower, not the long lines as for the sky tree elsewhere in Tokyo, the trip to the top costs a little extra but you do get your own time slot so it won't be too busy up there, nice views over the city offers a cafeteria halfway up and has shops on the way down. it was worth the trip down

Tokyo Tower by night with an outstanding view, live musics and a glass of wine!. Tokyo Tower by night is an amazing place to be. It is, apparently, modelled on the Eiffel Tower. Lit up it is spectacular and you just can't go there and not go up to the Observatory. At present it is Yen820 which is not much for getting the elevator up to an outstanding view of the Tokyo skyline at night. Also, on certain days, there is live music (usually very easy to listen to) in the Cafe and this is one floor lower down that the actual observation floor. A great way to end a sightseeing day in Tokyo.

One of the landmarks.. but nothing too great. Tokyo tower is effectively a radio mast that's visible from various points in the city. We could view from our hotel (Toyko Prince) but one of the better views was from the Tokyo Prince Tower bar. there didnt seem to be too much worthwhile on the tower complex itself.

Great views. Get there early to avoid the queues and it will be a fun hour or so. There are two levels, tickets to the second level being purchase once you are up to the first. There is a bit of a wait at every stage and if it looks busy on the way in give it a miss, it will be awful inside. Otherwise it is worth a go.

Great place. Really cool place to be. Got there just before the sun had completely gone down so got to see some daylight as well as the night. The main observatory is a beautiful place to be at night, well decorated. The Special observatory is pretty small, as expected, and a bit cramped, but an awesome view nonetheless. Recommend it.
Hang out at night. Definitely a place to visit at night :)Occasionally, Tokyo Tower's lighting is changed to specific, unique arrangements for special events.

just another tower?.... I've been to a lot of towers, from different countries, basically the view depends on the city itself, if the city blocks are made symmetrically / aligned properly, then it would likely be a great view, or if the city buildings around the tower are tall, ingeniously made or architecturally unique. we got to the tower a little late already, thus to we got to see the city's night view, since tokyo at night is well lighted thus the view was very good. but then again, knowing your NOT on the tallest tower in the city or country, does not quite make one's day. I think the tour operators should switch to the sky towe instead, since it is the tallest structure in the city/country.

Never leave tokyo without visiting this tower. Researching about places to visit in Tokyo, this tower always comes up - More than Sky tower, maybe because Tokyo tower is older or because it go the "Tokyo" in it's name making it one of the iconic places in the city. For me, the best time to visit is at night. Aside from it being lit up, it is one of those places you can visit later in the evening, after all the other places you may only visit at daytime. Note that temples, shrines and a lot of other cultural places here closes pretty early, around 4 to 6pm. Also, it can be be pretty cheap. If you will not be entering the viewing deck, then it is free. Just enjoy the view from the outside and take some photos. Then go in and you can have access to the souvenir shops and food court (they got McDonalds, Baskin and Robins, coffee shop and other Japanese food stores). This is walking distance from Akabanebashi Station on the Oedo Subway Line.

On top of Tokyo. We made the trip from our hotel in Hiroo by foot/metro/subway. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Tokyo, amongst the many other sight/places. The 360-degree view gave us a great perspective of Tokyo and its surroundings besides what you see on maps. The journey there from Hiroo made it just that much better, since we were able to see a slice of the plethora of neighborhoods. We were there around mid-day so the crowds made it a little maddening but it was well worth it to do and see.
Good birdeye view of Tokyo city. My half day tour took me to Tokyo Tower as the 1st stop. I had a fanstatic view of Tokyo city. My mum likes it alot too!

Great views. Went up the tower at opening in the morning. Beautiful views of Mt Fuji and over the city. Cheap entrance fee. Though if your not afraid f heights I would try the Sky Tree Tower as it is much higher!
Old Tower. It is located in downtown Tokyo and can be reach by public buses or the subway, no entrance fee if you don't go up the tower ...

Good alternative to Tokyo Sky Tree - and much cheaper. Tokyo Tower is a replica of the Eiffel Tower (only 13 meters higher) and has great views of Tokyo. The price of admission is relatively cheap and chances are you won't be able to go to the newer, busier and more expensive Tokyo Sky Tree unless you book far in advance (which I haven't!).Apart from the great views which encompass the lovely Rainbow Bridge and Tokyo Bay, there are several shops and restaurants at the lower level if you decide to combine sightseeing and shopping at the same time.And don't forget to visit the amazing Zojo-ji temple, right next to the Tower.
Great views. Popular place to visit. We did both of the floors - although you get the same view except higher up.

Late afternoon of a clear day needed.. Visited in early March, went late in the afternoon of a gloriously sunny day to see the sunset & Mt Fuji. That view alone was worth the trip, the other views of Tokyo are ok, but in my view Tokyo has more to offer at Street level than 200m above. I didn't queue, it was an easy comfortable experience, worth the money, beware you'll need to pay extra to go to the 'Upper Viewing level' but probably worth it. Strange exit arrangements through some rather tacky souvenirs which are worth a miss. My advice - it's worth doing, weather & time of day are critical.

Crowded but worth it, especially at night.. I went by myself at the end of november so Christmas decorations were everywhere, especially since it was night and everything was lit up. I would definitely recommend going at night where everything is lit up and easy to see. It's also easy to find the tower as it is like a beacon. It has long lines which probably vary every day but it didn't seem like it took forever. Everything is like a normal Japanese attraction, easy to understand if you don't speak Japanese and organised. There are 2 levels and I recommend going on both, not for the views but because not everyone pays to go to the higher level so it is less crowded. I managed to get good camera shooting positions at every angle I wanted but I was alone so was able to move through the crowds very easily. I gave it 4/5 because of where it is, I planned a long day of walking and it was on the way back to the hotel so it was no problem for me, but to get there specifically I'm not sure if it is easy. Still great views and the Christmas decorations and activities on the bottom were amazing.

Nice view of Tokyo. Not a first priority place to visit in Tokyo but nevertheless worth to see. It used to be highest steel construction in the world. Not as crowdy since Sky Tree opened last year ;)
Better go there in golden hour - Mount Fuji view will add to experience.

Great Views but very crowded. Special Observation deck has great views but probably not worth the extra cost. Food court and shops in the building are pretty boring and very crowded.
Definitely worth a trip to main desk, but Id probably skip the shops/for/museum as all pretty average

Worth a visit. Very well run as expected of all things Japanese. The view of Tokyo is okay....I like Tokyo very much but in terms of visual, it's not exactly a pretty to look at city. Overall, its worth the experience.

Best views of Tokyo for JPY 820. It is very nice thing to do in Tokyo, but only on a clear day. Try to go at the end of the afternoon in winter which will allow you to see the sun go down next to Mount Fuji with Tokyo in front of it... Superb!

Feb 2013 - it was ok.. If you're short on time, you can skip this tower and not have missed a thing. We came to this tower after a day at the Skytree.... this was nothing like the skytree. Whereas the crowd and atmosphere at the Skytree Tower was bustling, interesting and lively when we arrived at the Tokyo Tower by subway - I saw an orange-lit tower that didn't impress me at all. Non-deterred, a couple of friends and I maneuvered our way through the streets and came through the back way to the tower. While you wait to purchase your tickets to ascend the tower, you can walk through the different floors at the base and see souvenir shops, an old shop selling 80s-type rock memorabilia, a wax museum and trick art... At this point is where I started getting the feeling I was in a horror movie waiting for something bad to happen. The place was practically empty at 7pm on a Friday night...normally one would expect more tourists at a "major" attraction such as this. In between the floors there was a lot of wide empty space that made the location look like it was under construction. For instance, we got off on the wax/trick art floor and instead of seeing an immediate attraction I felt I walked into office space under construction. We then turned the corner and got jumped by a Japanese man holding a trick art advertisement trying to drag us in to the counter. Let me tell you... it was creepy. There was no one around but me and 3 other buddies on a large empty floor.The tower itself was small...I've been to several other towers such as the Shanghai tower with lookdown windows and the one at the Tokyo Tower was literally a 1'x1' foot window. Not impressed. There was a radio host on the first observatory deck that no one would allow us to take pictures of so I felt it was more of a ... try hard attraction.Wouldn't recommend anyone to make a stop here unless you had some extra time in your itinerary.
Great View at Night. We did the tower at night and you were able to see all the districts of Tokyo from the top. Went an hour before closing and had the place to ourselves.

Views over tokyo. Advance tickets can only be booked with a Japanese credit cards but we just got there early and queued for 30 mins. The tower gives a good view of tokyo but if you have been up other towers globally not a must see. You pay to get up to one level and then pay again to another - it gets busy so would skip the highest level if you want to save time and effort in getting out.

Japan Trip 2013. A must for those visiting the Tokyo area. It was one of the last places we went on our trip, but I'm so glad we made time for it. Historic. An awesome wonder. Perhaps not recommended to those that are afraid of heights. But may not be too bad as long as you aren't looking at the floor window...

Great views for a mere one-hour commitment. Tokyo Tower was a relatively inexpensive and fun way to get a great view of Tokyo. Especially with school-age children, this is an easy must-do while in Tokyo. The Tower itself is a great landmark as you walk around the city (and it's even a bit pretty at night). You see it every day as you wander around Tokyo so it's kind of fun to get up close and personal. I recommend just the Tower visit -- avoid the add-ons like the wax museum, which seemed a bit and gratuitous to me and not worth the extra yen, even with kids.When we visited there was live music outside which added to t he crowd but also to the fun of people-watching. Most of that crowd stayed outside.All-in, we went to the very top (I say the extra 100m is worth the extra yen) and stopped in one store and were done in about an hour.

Dated but a must. How can you not? It's a must and the faded glamour of yesteryear deserves an hour of your time. You step back in time when you go up and walk around but the view is amazing and the new Sky Tree is great to see for this grand dame of towers

View of Tokyo!. The Tokyo tower is definitely something you should see. This was one of my last stops in Tokyo, and having gone up to the main observatory (150m), you can see the whole city perfectly! The tower provides signs as to which pat of the city you're viewing. Definitely check this out, but there is not much else to do in this area, unless you also take a side trip to the island.

Great place to visit. Historical site that is really worth visiting. Not crowded, great views, well labeled vistas. Staff is very helpful. Best thing - elevator with a view and glass floors that let you look down

Very crowded in the viewing area. The view was good and it's worth a trip, but the viewing area was very crowded which made getting a spot at the window quite difficult. The viewing area is also completely enclosed so if you visit at night it's difficult to get photos without the reflections on the windows appearing on the snaps.

Nothing Much to see. Well there's really nothing much to see Aside from the view is great from the top and taking pictures outside the TowerThere are variety of shops from the inside and restos/food stall to eat fromBathrooms are clean The Famous Wax Museum is also here but you have to pay to go up there and again pay for the entrance fee of the museum itself Going up inside the tower is already pricey And once you go up and then decide to go down a floor ,you can't go up again.If you're a first timer you'll be amazed of the tower itself but other than that there's nothing really interesting to seeThe location itself is not really friendly you'd have to atleast walk for about 10 to 15 minutes from the station if you're going there by train or you can either take a cab or a busGoing by car is not recommended in. almost all buildings in Tokyo they don't have enough parking space even if they have it'll cost you Some charge per hour others per day

Great at Christmas. The Tokyo Tower has a nice little Christmas light display and village to get hot wine and German style foods. It has a Christmas light show on some night. It is a very nice view and the elevator to the top allows you to enjoy the view.

Not as expected. I went to the Tokyo Tower. Cant be compared to the Eiffel It is really not interesting and there is not much to see inside. Is good to say that you went there but there is nothing interesting to see. You have to go on a very clear day.

Very pretty tower, but its obvious that its emulating the Eiffel tower.. I think that the Tokyo tower is a fun tower to look at, the issue is that its trying to emulate the Eiffel too much with its similar base and geometry. The colors are different but thats it. I'd rather spend my money going to the Tokyo Skytree which is over 2200 ft tall.

Worth a visit. We went to the top level at night and got a great view of this amazing city. Although lacking the elegant form of the Eiffel tower the view out from Tokyo tower is impressive and you avoid the very, very (very) long queues for Skytree. Give it a go!

Fun Thing to Do!. My daughter really wanted to go here during our short stay in Tokyo, so I obliged and I was glad I did. We went at night and I was stunned at how far the Tokyo area was spread out. It was beautiful to see all the light from above that extended a far as the eye could see. Besides the beautiful view at night, the tower is also completely lit in a type of gold light which is amazing to see We did not go to the top level because there was a 45 min wait for it, but no wait for the mid-level. We were both very satisfied with the mid-level, which actually has two floors to it. There is a cafe and a gift shop up there. It was a very romantic spot, and there were a lot of cute couples there. On the bottom floors, there are many souvenir shops and some places to eat, too. My favorite thing there, though, was the "look down" windows that are in the floor of the mid-level. Scary (but safe)!! Definitely go here if you're visiting Tokyo!

Tokyo Tower. The view is more impressive from Roppongi Hills- I walked from Hiro-o one morning- took in some of the flea markets and antique shops in Roppongi. It's a walk but worth the look to see a very different Japan to The Hills. I found an old Japanese doll which I would never find in that area anywhere else!

Worth a Look. Cost is reasonable and you get great views all round Tokyo.We went up around lunchtime and despite what others say you can buy ticket at the entry for both levels and we waited about 5 minutes to go from mid level to top.Only disappointment was the coffee, weak and milky.Views thru floor to the ground are fun. We had no complaints.

Well that was a waste of time. Looks similar to the Eiffel Tower but there is nothing similar about it. A terrible waste of time and money. You get the same view from Tokyo midtown and its free and many more attractions nearby

Good value. Tokyo Tower has been upstaged in recent years by man taller buildings offering views of Tokyo and the region beyond. However, costing only 800 yen, Tokyo Tower is the best value, and is still the classic location to go to for some elevated sightseeing. Plus the views of the tower itself from the nearby neighborhood are worth the trip.

Great views with reasonable price. We went up to middle level of Tokyo Tower on 29th Dec. Weather was beautiful and Tokyo Tower gave a great view to huge city of Tokyo. No ques and hassle, easy with kids as well! I can recommend this as a one attraction to visit at Tokyo.

Tourist Trap, But if you are first timer. Go for it. It was my first time in tokyo, so of course tokyo tower is a must. Its surreal to see it, go into it, be on top and look at tokyo from there like I saw in Japanese dramas and shows in my teenage times... But the truth is, once that surreal feeling is over, its a tourist trap with cost at different levels. You pay an entrance fee at the bottom and to go to the top, another fee is incurred. But again, if you do not get to the top for once in your lifetime in tokyo, you can't rest in peace. So first timers, just go and that's it. no more tokyo tower.I don't like it due to the fact that it is enclosed like a aquarium and the double glass layer is kinda stained. It hard to take pictures through the glass with spotlights shining from below. Its takes too long to get down from the top with a long queue... There's better place to view tokyo such as Roppongi hills where you stand on a helipad and over look tokyo tower. But again, I have no regrets getting into this tourist trap for once in my life.

Tokyo Tower. Not too crowded because the Skytree is fairly new this year. Fantastic view of the city and you can even see Mt Fuji. Lots of stairs, but you get a certificate if you climb up the 150m. You can get a lift if you can't be bothered with the stairs!

It was bigger in my imagination. I liked the fact that it was so near the hotel. And it was so gorgeously lit at night. From afar, it is very picturesque against the sky. When we went inside to get a few of Tokyo in the morning, i was disappointed. Despite everything being clean and well maintained, the interior looked very 80s. Even the videos that promoted the Tokyo Tower played in every other corner were dated.
